title: Gore Vidal brings Myra back to depowell the world
description: Everybody in America read my nephew Myron's first book it was supposed to be a novel some novel he used my Recording Discs with my inmost thoughts and visits from the masseuse which I thought was pretty low considering he was my flesh and blood or what was left of it after he came back from Denmark and started calling himself Myra Breckinridge my lawyers Flagler and Flagler said I could sue but maybe Id better pretend it was a novel Charles Simmons is an editor of the Book Review and author ofPowdered Eggs and An Oldfashioned Darling. too or otherwise Id look pretty horny to the American public and to my students here at the Academy of Drama and Modeling its funny how things work out because after that first book the Academy expanded all over the place and even became a tourist attraction people wanted to see the dispensary where Myra did that terrible thing to Rusty Godowsky I bought a dildo two inches wide and a foot long and put it in plain sight on the examination table except I have a guard present at all times because you can imagine how many sightseers would like to take it home reviewers thought the book was soso although somebody in England called Brigid Brophy said it was a masterpiece Brigid Brophy sounds like a phony name shes probably a drag queen like Myron period paragraph it was a masterpiece all right but it wasnt a novel it was what really happened to Myron who grew up without a father and went to the movies all the time and like you might expect turned out to be a faggot except that he did something about it Ill say fooling his one and only uncle me Buck Lo ner period paragraph that first book took Myron up to his lucky hit and run accident that knocked the silicone stuffing out of him and started his male hormones working so that he could settle down with one of my former students pretty little MaryAnn in the San Fernando Valley period paragraph this new book isnt half as good its about how Myron was watching an old 1948 stinkeroo called Siren of Babylon with Maria Montez and Bruce Cabot and suddenly fell jumped was pushed or pulled through the TV screen like Alice and woke up in 1948 on the MGM lot where the picture was being shot Myron tries to return to 1973 and MaryAnn but he cant because inside his head is that terrible bitch Myra who pops out every few chapters and does things to embarrass Myron bunches of peoplehave fallen through the screen since Siren began showing on TV even Richard M Nixon looking for a hideout some other celebs like Norman Mailer and I think Truman Capote and James Baldwin cut up and camp around in disguise the story as you can see is kind of science fiction which I dont much like I did like the way Myron got over the dirty words by using names of famous enemies of smut he says things like the guys got a big rehnquist but no powells or that chick has wonderful father hills but not much of a whizzer white this is a good idea for family magazines and newspapers they certainly could get away with dont give me any of your shawn or blow it out your leonard period paragraph Ill say this for Myron he doesnt mind showing what a cruel rehnquist he is or at least Myra is she has a scheme in this new book to depowell ordinary fellas she claims she wants to, save the world from overpopulation but Myras not the sort of person to give a hot damn about hungry people in India and South America period paragraph this new book has a moral which I think books should have whenever possible Myra and Myron as I said struggle to see who will finally take charge and Myra wins theres a valuable moral in this which is that Myra better win if Myron knows whats good for him.

title: Selected Writings of William Goyen
description: It is hard to believe that these two books were written by same man. One, the Selected Writings, shows William Goyen to be an extraordinarily rewarding and exciting writer. The other, Come, the Restorer is an embarrassingly bad echo of course, Goyen's fiction technique is by its nature a failsafe gamble. He approaches the problem of fiction in such a way that he can only win or lose he cannot produce a middling good book.

Despite the facilities of a Broadway stage and enough musicians crowded on to it to please any union local, the program was familiar, firmly middle of the road and safe.

title: New Districting Held Likely
description: TRENTONThe anticipated Democratic victories in Tuesday's statewide Congressional elections are likely to result in the scrapping of a redistricting plan that was introduced here last spring. A new plan that would preserve Democratic gains is expected to replace it.

title: Poll Sho
description: The widely held view that voters are apathetic about the election because of the Watergate scandals seems to be a fiction, according to a survey of voter attitudes commissioned by The New York Times. cent felt ho did the right thing and 3 per cent gave no opinion.

title: MUSIC VIEW HAROLD C. SCHONBERG
description: MINNEAPOLIS, In the world of Italian opera, the cry immemorial has been Prima la musics! First the music. In Minneapolis the cry for the past 16 months has been, in effect, Primo it suono! First the sound. Minneapolis has been engaged in building a concert hall, the first permanent structure that the Minnesota Orchestra can claim as its own in its 71year history. There were esthetic considerations, of course. Nobody wants an ugly building. But primo it suono. Acoustics has been very much on the mind of Minneapolitans. A lot of money, after all  some $10million  went into the project, and a concert hall, no matter how beautiful, is no better than its sound. We in New York know.

title: East Brunswick's Hierarchy, Once All Male, Is Now a Woman's World
description: EAST BRUNSWICKThree years ago, the East Brunswick Women's Caucus convassed this town for four weeks, gathering 3,000 signatures on petitions urging female appointments to the major all  male township boards.

title: Flukes, Feathers and Fur
description: Must children's animal books almost always be about the male animal? And must he always be bigger, braver and more adventuresome than his sister? Since children tend to identify with leader animals it's somewhat dismaying to come upon five new, and in many ways excellent, books with strictly male leaderswhale, grizzly, owl, bear and coyotewho have most of the usual manly attributes, plus similar masculine ways with sex, which seem guaranteed to take a child's sex education far short of even the birds and the bears. Gladys Conklin, author of I Like Caterpillars and We Like Bugs, has taken on the leviathan in JOURNEY OF THE GRAY WHALES. (Holiday House, $5.50. Ages 8 to 12). It begins with the flukesfirst entry of a whopping 16 ft., 1,000 lb, baby whale. He is promptly escorted to the surface for lessons in keeping his blowholes tight, and then to teat, a few gallons per feed, sufficient for him to gain 230 lbs, a day. Mammoth statistics, but the reader is not told that this whale calf will ultimately amount to some 70,000 lbs.or that the adult cow grows even larger than the bull.

Shafer, chaplain of Bard College, performed the Episcopal ceremony.

title: Rome Strategy on Food is Dividing U.S. Officials
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 When Secretary of State singer steps before the World Food Conference in Rome on Tuesday, he will be addressing many who now believe that mankind's biggest challenge is not so much to avert a nuclear holocaust as to assure economis survival.

description: The organ shortage problem expressed by David Dempsey (Transplants are common; now it's the organs that have become rare, Oct. 13) can be solved very readily, if we couple it with a solution to our judicial problem.

title: Home Clinic
description: Q: I installed beaver board on the outside wall of my closet to help insulate it, then painted the closet with latex paint. After three months we still have a strong odor from the paint. Is there any way to remove this? H.L., New York City

title: Westfield Pins Loss On Nutley
description: Glen Kehler staged a brilliant offensive show yesterday, rushing for 173 yards and scoring 22 points, as undefeated Westfield handed Nutley its first loss, 28.0, in Westfield.

title: WATERGATE JURY LIVES IN ISOLATION
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2For the 12 men and women bundled into the jury box each morning iin the Watergate coverup trial, life would appear to be a miserable luxury.

title: Questions of war and peace
description: In The Drive for Power, psychiatrist Arnold A. Hutschnecker expresses his deep concern about questions of war and peace, and in particular his urgent sense that some arrangement must be made to determine the mental stability of leaders before they are in a position to push the button, wreak havoc and otherwise seek fulfillment of a death wish or compensation for innate feelings of inferiority. Dr. Hutschnecker is also distressed by the apparent inclination of the general population to occasionally, elect, select, or accept as leader someone whose mental stabilitynot to mention general overall competence to perform tasksis clearly in doubt.

title: As the Island Goes, So Goes
description: The gubernatorial election and other statewide contests in Tuesday's election will be won or lost between Bay Ridge, Brooklyn, and Montauk Point.

title: Lieut. G. G. Svanson Weds Ann Vollmer
description: The marriage of Ann Vollmer to Lieut. Gust G. Svanson, U.S.N.R., took place yesterday afternoon at the New Canaan, Conn., home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Arnold H. Vollmer.

title: NUMISMATICS
description: The annual Grand Central Coin Convention is one of the major events on the autumn calendar for collectors in the tristate New YorkNew Jersey  Connecticut area; the 10th anniversary convention opens for a fourday run next Thursday, Nov. 7, at 11 A.M., in the Albert Hall of the Americana Hotel, Seventh Avenue at 52d Street (the registration desk will open at 10:30 ). There is no admission charge.

title: Will the Next Van Cliburn Be a Fiddler Named Fodor?
description: Sixteen years ago a young, unknown concert pianist from Kilgore, Texas, named Van Cliburn astounded the world by triumphing in the Tchaikovsky Competition in Moscowpossibly the most prestigious musical contest in the world. As a result, Van Cliburn became something of a folk hero in his own time. Last July, it seemed as if history might be repeating itself. A young, unknown concert violinist from Turkey Creek, Colorado, named Eugene Fodor became the first American since Cliburn to top the field in that same contest. And now the question is: will Fodor, who is only 24, become a superstar like Cliburn? At least a partial answer to that question should be forthcoming this 3afternoon when Fodor makes his New York City debut as part of the Great Performers series at Avery Fisher Hall.

title: Carey Extends Shutout String
description: Carey allowed an opponent to put the ball over its goal line for the first time this season, but no one was holding on to it and Carey managed to come away with its sixth straight shutout, 60. at the expense of New Hyde Park in a Nassau Conference V game played yesterday.

title: JOSEPH LEAHEY, 78, NEGLIGENCE LAWER
description: Joseph M. Leahey, senior partner in the New York law firm of Leahey & Johnson, who was a Justice of the Municipal Court in 1962 under an interim appointment, died yesterday in St. Clare's Hospital. He was 78 years old and lived at 35 Emerson Avenue, Emerson Hill, S.I.

title: 2 Found Guilty in Murder Of a Country Music Singer
description: NASHVILLE, Nov. 2 (AP)Two men from Greenhriar, Tenn., were convicted today of the 1973 slayings of Grand Ole Opry star David (Stringbean) Akeman and his wife.

title: MEATLESS MENUS URGED BY BISHOP
description: Bishop Paul Moore Jr. will ask the 88,000 Episcopalians in the 10county Diocese of New York to observe meatless Wednesdays for the duration of the world hunger crisis.

title: Six Division Championships Decided in P.S.A.L.
description: The Public Schools Athletic League hai eight divisions, and six of them crowned champions this weekend, the final one of regularseason play. Kennedy wrapped up its division last week, and in Queens Division II three teams tied for the title: August Martin, Jackson and Springfield Gardens. The tie will be broken in a meeting today. In the Bronx, Clinton defeated Evander, 70, for its crown; Bayside, the defending P.S.A.L. champion, beat Adams, 30.6, for the Queens Division I title; Brooklyn Tech won the Brooklyn West Division, upsetting Lincoln, 1412; Tottenville stopped New Dorp, 60, on Staten. Island; Jefferson crushed Canarsie, 320, in Brooklyn East Division II, and Friday night Boys won the Brooklyn East Division I honors by halting Erasmus; 160. That meeting today will also decide playoff schedule and procedure. The playoffs begin next week.

title: COMFORTABLEWORK BY PIERIAN PLAYERSI
description: The Pierian Players, a chamber quartet that includes two former New York Pro Musica members, offered a concert on Friday night at Carnegie Recital Hall that sounded most comfortable in the classicalromantic German repertory.

title: Passaic Recycling Its Closed Factories
description: PASSAIC  For 80 years, Raybestos Manhattan, a major manufacturer of rubber products, was a prime employer in this industrial city of 57,000. But 15 months ago, it closed its doors, thus throwing about 1,200 men out of work.

title: Gottfried, Dibbs Gain Paris Final
description: PARIS, Nov. 2 (UPI)Brian Gottfried surprised Arthur Ashe, 97, 64, 61, today for his second upset of the French indoor tennis championships and gained the final against Eddie Dibbs.

title: Charter Plans Are Varied
description: PATERSON  Voters in eight of the state's 21 counties will decide Tuesday whether there should be changes in their Freeholder system of government. Charter  study commissions elected last November are supporting the reforms.

title: Results in British Football
description: Results in British Football

title: Donald Barthelme parodies and apologizes
description: Are you doing anything now, an affable fellowTexan once asked me with the friendliest interest, or are you still just writing? Donald Barthelme grew up down there too and no doubt learned to field that query in the land where the bluebonnets grow. I wonder how he feels when the same question turns up now in reviews of his work; how he felt, for instance, when one of his profoundest, funniest and most personal stories, Daumier it happens to take place on a Texas prairiewas generally dismissed by reviewers of his last book. Just writing is the main suspicion lodged against him. I sometimes mutter it myself, when I can't quite see what he's up to.

title: Lenders and Community Leaders Join to Help Mortgage Seekers in Jamaica
description: Lenders and Community Leaders Join to Help Mortgage Seekers in Jamaica

title: Canada's GasPricing Plan
description: OTTAWAThe Canadian Government is moving to take effective control for the first time of wellhead prices of crude oil, and, under new version of the pending Petroleum Administration Act, would have the same powers over natural gas.

title: Pacer Is Driven by Billy Haughton
description: WESTBURY, L. L, Nov. 2Billy Haughton exercised his right as a father tonighthe took the best horse to drive.

title: Philippines Offering Amnesty to Subversives'
description: MANILA, Nov. 3  President Ferdinand E. Marcos to day offered a sweeping amnesty to those persons the Government regards as ideo logical subversives.

title: Big 1972 G.O.P. Contributors Giving Less, While Wealthy Democrats Donate More
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 Many large contributors to Republican Congressional campaigns two years ago are giving nothing or relatively little to candidates this year.

title: Attica Defendant Seized On a Marijuana Charge
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 3 (AP)An Attica trials defendant, Frank Smith, pleaded not guilty today to charges of felony possession, of three and a half ounces of marijuana, the police said.

title: A U.N. Study Sees a Recession In Most NonCommunist Nations
description: GENEVA, Nov. 3United Nations economists see a recession ahead for most of the noncommunists industrialized countries, with their combined output of goods and services recording a growth of less than 1 per cent for 1974 as a whole.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3The House of Representatives, conceived by the Founding Fathers as the arm of government most responsive to the popular will, is expected to undergo a dramatic change in Tuesday's postWatergate, midinflation elections.

title: 2 PRIVACY CASES UPHELD BY COURT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3Two disputes involving the privacy of personal records have been resolved in favor of protesting citizens and against law enforcement authorities by the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia.

title: Speed Limit on Turnpike Reduced Because of Fog
description: Speed Limit on Turnpike Reduced Because of Fog

title: kgentine Leitist Is Killed As Violent Wave Continues
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 3 (Reuters)The police today announced another killing in Argentina's wave of political assassination the fourth since Friday.

title: Ballet: Baryshnikov and Kirkland a Blaze of Glory
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3American Ballet Theater's twoweek season at the Kennedy Center has, in effect, been a triumphant procession for Gelsey Kirkland and Mikhail Baryshnikov. This new partnership of an American and a Russian has turned out to be a knockout. They gave their final performance of the season last night in the Don Quixote pas de deux, and, like everything they have so far touched, it turned to gold.

title: Party Says Defeat of 5 in House Is Possible
description: As candidates across New Jersey brought their campaigns to a close this weekend, some of the state's more influential Republican leaders were increasingly fearful that the party faced the prospect tomorrow of its biggest Congressional defeat in recent history.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Secretary of State Kissinger announced that he would visit Egypt, Saudi Arabia, Jordan, Syria and Israel next week to explore the possible next steps toward a Middle East peace. He arrived in Bucharest, Rumania, yesterday from Iran and had a fourhour meeting with President Nicolae Ceausescu at which the Middle East was discussed. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: Fulbright, at Fulton, Gloomy on World
description: FULTON, Mo., Nov. 3Senator J. W. Fulbright stepped into one of the historic forums of the Englishspeaking nations here yesterday and delivered the last major statement on the world's condition that he is expected to make before leaving office next January.

title: COAL TALKS REACH IMPASSE ON COSTS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 Negotiations to avoid a national coal strike next week reached a new impasse tonight, and Arnold R. Miller, the president of the United Mine Workers, said he was ordering home his 38member bargaining council. The council's approval is needed for a settlement.

title: Goss Bows Abroad
description: EAST LONDON, South Africa, Nov. 2 (AP)Happy Boy Mgxaji of South Africa upset Sammy Goss of Trenton in a 10round junior lightweight fight last night.

title: Both Sides Woo Independents In Rockland County Contests
description: NEW CITY, N. Y., Nov. 3The question of how Rockland County's sizable bloc of independent voters will react to Watergate and to the problems of the economy has dominated the strategy sessins of party leaders in the county.

title: Bulletin On Nixon
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Nov. 3Following is the text of bulletin on the condition of former President Richard M. Nixon, issued at 9:30 A.M. today by Dr. John C. Lungren, Mr. Nixon's physician, at Memorial Hospital Medical Center:

title: Careless Smoker Is Being Sought in a Seoul Hotel Blaze That Killed
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 3 (AP)The police blamed careless smoker for a hotel fire early today that killed 88 persons most of them inside a discotheque.

title: French to Lift Ban On W.T.T. Players
description: PARIS, Nov. 3 (AP)The new Professional Tennis Council ruled today that all Grand Prix tournaments sanction by the International Lawn Tennis Federation should be open to all players, including members of World Team Tennis.

title: Higher Auto Prices Driving Customers Away
description: DETROIT, Nov. 3Dominick Barbaro was recently browsing in the showroom of Herbert Rosenstock, Inc., Oldsmobile dealer on the West Side of Manhattan, looking for a car for his son.

title: South Vietnam Villagers Say Police Killed Protester
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, monday, Nov. 4Combat policemen and militiamen were reported to have killed an antiGovernment demonstrator and gravely wounded two others during a clash Saturday in rural hamlet about 55 miles northeast of Saigon.

title: Sunday Outings, Despite the Young, Are Still Family Rituals for Germans
description: BONN, Nov. 3Sundays in Germany are a family affair, and the traditional ritualsthe Sunday roast and the afternoon walk, followed by coffee and cakesare still being observed with rigorous determination.

title: Tallahto Captures $100,000 Oak Tree
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Nov. 3 (AP)  Tallahto, a 4yearold filly, won the $100,000 Oak Tree Invitational today, beating Within Hail by a length in the sixth running of the race at Santa Anita.

title: Brazil Said to Continue Torture
description: RIO DE JANEIROAurelio, Perez, a Roman Catholic metal worker, recently underwent beatings, electric shocks and suspension on an iron bar for 14 hours in a torture known as the parrot's perch.

title: Niceties Of Spring Fashions
description: The style of presentation varies just as the clothes themselves do, but the aim is the same: to sell goods, On Seventh Avenue, spring fashion collections are being shown in an atmosphere made tense by spiraling costs and a fashion change that has unnerved both designers and store buyers.

title: Two Slayings Investigated In Police DrugTheft Case
description: The special grand jury looking into the theft of $70million worth of French connection drugs from police custody is investigating whether two ganglandstyle murders were carried out to silence potential witnesses, lawenforcement sources said yesterday.

description: PARIS, Nov. 3 (UPI) Brian Gottfried beat Eddie Dibbs, a countryman and fellow Floridian, 63, 57,. 8.6, 60, today in the final French indoor tennis championship and $9,000 in prize money.

title: Organist's Arrest Shocks Town; ORGANIST ARREST A SHOCK TO TOWN
description: SHARON, Conn., Nov. 3 The usually calm citizens of this old, patrician town recoiled from shock today and organized for the defense of one of their respected neighbors, a 26yearold church organist, whose arrest for arson and burglary has bewildered the people here.

title: Patience Is a Crime, Too
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 3 (AP) The police said a holdup man stood quietly in line behind a dozen patrons yesterday, waiting for his turn to deal with the teller at the Fidelity Bank branch office in the Bala Cynwyd Shopping Center. Then he pulled out a gun and gave the teller a note demanding money. A surprised teller handed over $4,500, and the thief escaped.

title: Bauxite Meeting May Spur Aluminum Industry Shifts
description: The extent of changes in the aluminium industry may be cided this week at Georgetown, Guyana the council of ministers of the International Bauxite Asociation is scheduled to begin today a weeklong meeting.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: TULIP TIME Tiny Tim is backyes, the effusive chap with the stringy hair, craggy profile, fluttery friendly gestures and cooing coloratura, and that uke. He has a new club act that works quite nicely for a brisk 45 minutes at Jimmy's (7578484), 33 West 52d Street. Both the show and Tim are best toward the end, when he picks up his ukulele and does a fine, sweet Tiptoe Through the Tulips, with the fourpiece band, the Timmies, and two limber chorus girls all joining for a softshoe thump. The star closes with I've Gotta Be Me and you'd better believe it.

title: ISRAEL ANALYZING ARAB CONFERENCE
description: TEL AVIV, No. 3Premier Yitzhak Rabin's Cabinet analyzed last week's Arab summit conference today, but there was no word on details of the discussion.

title: For Some People, Business Is Good If Times Are Bad
description: Business is booming these daysif you're in the right business.

title: WilkesBarre Paper Struck
description: WILKESBARRE, Pa., Nov. 3 (AP)Newspaper Guild employes at WilkesBarre's daily newspaper went on strike today when negotiations on a new contract failed to resolve a wage dispute. Picket lines were set up at The TimesLeader, Evening News, Record, an allday newspaper published by the WilkesBarre Publishing Company.

title: Panel Bids Art Museums Shun Politics and Pick Trustees From Community
description: HARRIMAN, N.Y., Nov. 3In a rare atmosphere of goodtempered harmony, conferees at the 46th American Assembly wound up their fourday examination of art museums today by producing 36 recommendations regarding their function and welfare.

title: KRISTOFFERSON PUTS GUESTS IN LIMELIGHT
description: Kris Kristofferson, one of the better singersong writers with leanings toward country music, can scarcely be accused of limelight hogging. For his concert Saturday at Avery Fisher Hall, he shared the proceedings with his wife, Rita Coolidge, introduced members of his band for solos and allowed the singer Bobby Neuwith and the jazz pianist Barbara Carroll to be his guests. Indeed, when Mr. Kristofferson publicly endorsed Ramsey Clark for Senator midway through, one halfexpected the candidate to stride onstage and strum a couple.

description: TOKYO, Nov. 3 (Reuters)All Japanese markets will be closed tomorrow because of Culture Day, to mark national unity.

description: Arthur D. Shaw, owner of Erlandsen, Crowell & Shaw, civil and land surveyors, Jamaica, Queens, died yesterday in North Shore Hospital, Manhasset, L.I. He was 68 years old and lived at 92.27 215th Place, Queens Village, Queens.

description: BOSTON, Nov. 3 (AP)Boston's calm continued over the weekend as a contingent of National Guardsmen, on alert for 20 days, was reduced by twothirds.

title: Truth or Trial?
description: NEW HAVENJudge John J. Sirica's recent statement in the Watergate trial that he is not trying to follow strict rules of evidence but is interested in the discovery of the truth (he spelled it out in court) raises two central questions of American law the function of the trial and the role of the judge.

title: St. Louis Drops First To the Cowboys,1714
description: The reign of the Louis Cardinals as the only undefeated team in the National Football League ended yesterday when the DallaS Cowboys snapped St. Louis's sevengame winning streak with a 1714 triumph at Irving, Tex. Efren Herrera kicked a 20yard field goal with four seconds remaining to delight a crowd of 64,146 at Texas Stadium.

title: RUMSFELD DOUBTS CABINET SHAKEUP
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3Donald Rumsfeld, the White House chief of staff, declared today that President Ford had made substantial change in the makeup of the Administration he inherited three months ago from Richard M. Nixon.

title: A Lone Doctor With Few Means Struggles to Help Thousands of Mauritanian Nomads; Without Precedent' Only an Occasional Bird How Do They Survive? The Main Lack: Animals
description: BOUTILIMIT, Mauritania, The doctor, stepping gingerly to avoid treading on the young woman stretched on a mat in front of his dispensary, buried in the crook of her elbow a needle dangling from an infusion bottle tied to a stick. He smiled reassuringly at four older women hovering over their relative.

title: 2 FAIRFIELD RACES PUT G.O.P. TO TEST
description: WESTON, Conn., Fairfield County Democrats, who now outnumber Republicans for the first time, are betting that a Democratic landslide throughout the state will help them unseat two popular young Republican Representatives in what was once solid G.O.P. territory.

description: Melvyn Poll, who sang first Faust with the New York City Opera yesterday afternoon, neither looks nor sounds like the tenor of one's dreams. But in this tenorweak world and at the tenorstarved City Opera, he should fill a real need.

description: Louis D. Buick, a real estate broker in Elizabeth, N. J., since 1922, died yesterday in St. Elizabeth Hospital there. He was 79 years old and lived at 801 North Broad Street, Elizabeth.

description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 3A disclosure that Egypt had asked the United Nations peacekeeping force in Sinai to vacate some buildings in the city of Ismailia caused a flurry of conflicting reports and rumors here and in the Middle East today.

title: Opposition to Thieu: It Began When 'Peace' Came
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam Nov. 3The opposition to President Nguyen Van Thieu Which has just begun to take to the streets, did not materialize overnight It has been building during the 21 months of disNews illusion, economic Analysis decline and war that have followed the Paris peace agreements. Though Mr. Thieu is being attacked for the corrup tion and repressiveness of his regime, he is, at bottom, being blamed for presiding over nonCommunist South Vietnam at a time when things have gone from bad to very bad.

title: DR. ERWIN F. SMITH, OBSTETRICIAN, DIES
description: Dr. Erwin Fletcher Smith, for many years director of obstetrics and gynecology in the City Hospital Center, Elmhurst, Queens, died Saturday at his home in Old Brookville, L. I. He maintained offices here and in Manhasset, L. I.

title: Decentralization Woes
description: Some of the basic questions raised when school decentralization was put into effect in 1970 are being revived today as a result of allegations of financial abuses and irregularities in several of the 32 community school districts. The current problems are causing a reassessment of how well the city prepared for decentralization and the extent to which officials monitored it and provided the necessary technical assistance.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (UPI) The Federal Trade Commi sion, despite continuing criticism lacks strong leadership and is not living up to its role as a consumer protector, a Congressional study raid today.

description: Amy Margaret Young, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Dennison Young of White Plains, was married yesterday to Lawrence Jeffrey Geiger, son of Mr. and Mrs. Philip Geiger of Harrison, N. Y.

description: Players in New York clubs will have two unusual opportunities this month. They will be able to take the first step on the long road to international honors and, more significantly for the great majority, they will be able to fight for the red points that are needed for life master rank.

title: New Brunswick Voter Interest Is in Local Elections
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Nov. 3 Voter interest Tuesday in this city of 45,000, the seat of Middlesex County, will be focused on the mayoral and City Council elections.

description: Dr. James F. Connell, a 53yearold surgeon who specializes in the treatment of burns at St. Vincent's Hospital, has been finding himself in some peculiar situations lately.

title: The Cafe de la Paix, A Paris Landmark, Is Closed Till Spring
description: PARIS, Nov. 3It was where General de Gaulle took his first meal after the liberation of Paris, where Gide and Valery wrote quatrains, Dali penciled mustaches on the tablecloths, an incognito Edward VII made dates, and where thousands of tourists simply sat and stared at thousands of other tourists.

title: Premier of Turkey Fails In Move to Form Coalition
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Nov. 3 (AP)The opposition Justice party refused today to cooperate to form a government along guidelines suggested by the caretaker Premier, Bulent Eceit.

description: Lately the publicity wheels have been grinding for Eugene Fodor, the 24yearold American violinist who shared second prize in this year's Tchaikovsky Competition in Moscow (no first prize was awarded). His debut at Fisher Hall yesterday afternoon attracted a huge audience, predominantly of young people. The handsome and talented Mr. Fodor is one of theirs.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (UPI) The Army plans a mass blackbird killing program in Kentucky and Tennessee this week.

description: SOFIA, Bulgaria, Oct. 30 Bulgaria, which has resisted the thaw in the cold war longer and more consistently than other members of the Soviet bloc, is showing signs of accepting the idea of coexistence with the United States.

title: Green and McLendon Take Team Golf
description: LAKE BUENA VISTA, Fla., Nov. 3A consistent winner and a consistent loser, bound by a 15year friendship, combined today to shoot a 64 and win the $250,000 Professional Golfers Association team championship.

title: OKLAHOMA FLOODS DRIVE OUT 10,000
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Nov. 31 (AP)Civil defense authorities said flooding in Oklahoma that has taken two lives since last week has also made 10,000 persons homeless and caused $10million in damage. They added today that the weather will; get worse before it gets better.@ Gov. David Hall asked President Ford to declare eight; counties major disaster areas to qualify residents for Federal: assistance.

title: Cavaliers Defeat Suns, Go Over .500 First Time
description: RICHFIELD, Ohio, Nov. 3 (UPI)Bobby Smith flipped in a 15footer with 58 seconds left and Jim Cleamons made a pair of foul shots with three seconds to go tonight to give the Cleveland Cavaliers a 104101 National Basketball Association victory over the Phoenix Suns.

title: Giants Upset Chiefs
description: The New York Giants, led by Craig Morton at quarterback, upset the Chiefs at Kansas City yesterday, 3327, for their second victory of the, season. The Jets lost to the Houston Oilers at Shea Stadium, 2722. Page 53.

title: TV: A TopFlight Upstairs, Downstairs Begins New Series
description: Upstairs, Downstairs returned to public television last night and, in familiar nononsense fashion, quickly established that the 13 new episodes are going to be every bit as delightful as the first batch. The cast of characters has been somewhat adjusted. Elizabeth, the Bellamy's daughter, has gone to live in America. Sarah, the saucy on again off  again maid, has disappeared into married life. And last night, Lady Marjorie left for a trip to Canada onboard a new ship named the Titanic.

title: Landlord and Son, Burned in a Blaze, Accused of Setting It
description: A landlord and his son were arrested yesterday on charges of setting a twoalarm blaze in their Lower East Side tenement in which they were burned badly, authorities said.

title: Oil Consumer Unity
description: A counter cartel of the major oilconsuming countries, to assure secure oil supplies on reasonable and equitable terms, is now a virtual certainty. With formal United States notification of acceptance deposited Brussels, the extraordinary oilsharing pact negotiated in the seven months following the Washington energy conference of last February will come into effect.

title: Lowly Bagel Transformed By an Artist
description: EASTCHESTER, N.Y.Judy Blau regarded the sea of bagels in the bathtub and allowed as how her family would be taking no baths for the next two days.

title: Haughton Shows Son Father Knows Best
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Nov. 3 Peter, have you forgotten? You've got to drive now, called out Billy Haughton to his 20yearold son, who was talking in the paddock.

title: Organist's Arrest Shocks Town; ORGANIST ARREST A SHOCK TO TOWN
description: SHARON, Conn., Nov. 3 The usually calm citizens of this old, patrician town recoiled from shock today and organized for the defense of one of their respected neighbors, a 26yearold church organist, whose arrest for arson and burglary has bewildered the people here. At the Congregational Church on the Village Green, where Gary Carr had for the last year been the fulltime organist, a meeting was held after services today as an expression of support for the man seized by state troopers on Thursday.

title: Music: Pears and Bream
description: As followers of opera are aware, Peter Pears, the English tenor, is in New York now for appearances with the Metropolitan Opera in Benjamin Britten's Death in Venice. The Met does not take up all of his time, however, and Lincoln Center engaged him for two recitals at Alice Tully Hall.

title: The Ultimate Reform
description: Although there has been much talk and some modest action on reforming the electoral system in the wake of Watergate, there is one ultimate reform without which all other efforts to strengthen the democratic process will have been in vain. That is a radical change in the abominable voting habits of American citizens.

title: Supplementary OverCounter Listings
description: The following, is a supplementary weekly list of mutual funds prepared by the National Association of Securities Dealers. The range shown reflects prices at which securities could have been sold (bid) or bought (asked) last Friday.

title: Killing of 2 Women On Moscow Streets Officially Reported
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 3 (UPI)Moscow's police chief an nounced on television today that two women were slain last month during a rash of muggings and the killer or killers were still at large.

title: 6 WILL BE HONORED BY INDIAU.S. GROUP
description: Senator Vance Hartke, Democrat of Indiana, will give the keynote address at the annual awards banquet of the Association of Indians in America at the Biltmore Hotel next Saturday night.

title: MRS. EDWARD CONDON
description: Emilie Honzik Condon, widow of Dr. Edward U. Condon, the physicist, who died last March 26, died Thursday in a nursing home In Boulder, Colo. She was 74 years old and lived in Boulder.

title: Scientists Challenge the Congo, the River That So Taxed Stanley
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, Nov. 3Just 100 years after Henry Morton Stanley led an illstarred expedition down the turbulent Congo River, an international group of scientists has set out to cover the full 2,718mile length of the river, something that has never been done before.

title: Woman Is Slain in Brooklyn
description: An unidentified woman believed to be in her 30's was stabbed to death early yesterday in a vacant lot on Grand Avenue between Pacific and Dean Streets in Brooklyn. Her body was found with her hands and arms tied behind her. It was discovered by a man who said he had heard screams from the lot. She was wearing white simulated fur coat, the police said, and was unclothed below the waist. She was pronounced dead on arrival at St. Marys Hospital.

title: Bulletin On Nixon
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Nov. 3Following is the text of bulletin on the condition of former President Richard M. Nixon, issued at 9:30 A.M. today by Dr. John C. Lungren, Mr. Nixon's physician, at Memorial Hospital Medical Center:

title: Saturday's College Football Scores
description: Saturday's College Football Scores

title: Islanders Lose, 31, To Flyers
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 3Taking no chances tonight against the aspiring New York Islanders, the Philadelphia Flyers brought out Kate Smith, kept their sticks and fists down and presented the sellout crowd of 17,007 with a 31 victory.

title: KISSINGER TO VISIT 5 MIDEAST LANDS ON PEACE MISSION
description: BUCHAREST, Nov. 3Secretary of State Kissinger announced today that he would visit Egypt, Saudi Arabia, Jordan, Syria and Israel next week to explore the possible next steps toward a Middle East peace.

title: Mounting the Tanta
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3On election night, the clich that most often sails through the television tube is tantamount to election. No commentator will ever say equivalent or as much as; only tantamount will do, and its certain reappearance every two years may light the way to other bromides we may expect to hear Tuesday night.

title: Nixon Off Critical List
description: Former President Richard M. Nixon was removed from the critical list yesterday as he spent his best morning since his phlebitis surgery last Tuesday. Page 16.

title: 2 FAIRFIELD RACES PUT G.O.P. TO TEST
description: WESTON, Conn., Fairfield County Democrats, who now outnumber Republicans for the first time, are betting that a Democratic landslide throughout the state will help them unseat two popular young Republican Representatives in what vas once solid G.O.P. territory.

title: BONDISSUE PASSAGE URGED BY GOVERNOR
description: TRENTON, Nov. 3 (UPI)Governor Byrne urged New Jersey residents yesterday to approve $590million worth of bond issues on the Tuesday batlot, saying that they would help revive the state's declining economy.

title: That Complex Watergate Trial: Spectators May Wonder, What's Going On Here?
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3It's surreal, said one of the lawyers in the Watergate coverup trial. I sit in court and I listen and I want to stand up and say, Hold it, stop this trial, what's going on here?

title: Underpayments to Workers Total 22.3Million in Quarter
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (UPI) The Labor Department said today that during July, August and September 85,341 workers, were underpaid about $22.3million.

title: Sabres Top Rangers On Martin's 2 Goals
description: Another of those old expansion teams served notice on the Rangers last night. Coming back from a deficit the fiveyearold Buffalo Sabres defeated New York, 43, on two thirdperiod goals by Richard Martin in the teams first meeting of the season.

title: Hispanic Affairs Office To Be Created by Byrne
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Nov. 3Governor Byrne will establish State Office for Hispanic Affairs within the next couple of weeks.

title: MORRIS ZELDITCH, GERIATRIST, DEAD
description: Morris Zelditch, director of community planning for the Council of Jewish Federations and Welfare Funds from 1946 to 1964, died Saturday at the Cabrini Health Care Center. He was 75 years old and lived at 235 East 22d Street.

title: British Football
description: By Reuter, RUGBY LEAGUE First Division Dewsbury 11, Warrington 10. Halifax 74, Wakefield Trinity 13, Neighles, 11, Leeds 28. Rochdala Hornets 15, York 10.

title: KISSINGER TO VISIT 5 MIDEAST LANDS ON PEACE MISSION
description: BUCHAREST, Nov. 3Secretary of State Kissinger announced today that he would visit Egypt, Saudi Arabia, Jon dan, Syria and Israel next Week to explore the possible next steps toward a Middle East peace.

title: Nixon Taken Off Critical List, Vital Signs Stable
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Nov. 3 Former President Richard M. Nixon was taken off the critical list today as he spent his best morning since he reentered a hospital here for treatment of phlebitis, his doctors reported.

title: 4 Die in Georgia Crash
description: THOMA SVILLE Ga., Nov. 3 (AP)Four teenagers were killed early today when their car struck a tree near this south Georgia town, the state patrol reported. The victims were identified as Ben Anthony Reichert and Jerry D. Council, both 19 years old; Glinda Faye Davis, 16, and her sister, Freda, 17,

title: COUPLE IN PLANE DIE IN COLORADO CRASH
description: SPRINGFIELD, Colo., Nov. 3 (UPI)A farmer found the bodies of a Texas couple today in the wreckage of their singleengine plane, which apparently crashed attempting a landing in a field during a severe snowstorm.

title: State Bond Issue Promising Rail Gains
description: At an annual cost of 62 cents a personthe price of a pack of cigarettesNew York State residents are promised a big package of railroad improve. ments if they vote for the $250million rail bond issue on next Tuesday's ballot.

title: Youthful Violence Grows And Accused Are Younger
description: An elderly man is followed into his apartment in Brooklyn, strangled and robbed of $37. Two boys, one 14 years old, the other 15, are arrested.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Charles A. Bell, president of the Newark Board Education, said yesterday that he would defer comment on criticism by the city's education task force of the publicschool system's administrative and remedialteaching procedures. Mr. Bell, who spent the weekend on a business trip, said he would have to read the report thoroughly today before he could respond to its recommendation. spokesman for Dr. Stanley Taylor, Newark's Superintendent of Schools, said the Superintendent also had been away from Newark on business and would be unavailable for comment until he had had time to read and discuss the report's finding.

title: Congress Urged to Renew RevenueSharing Program
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3  A twoyear study of Federal general revenue sharing has concluded that, despite some shortcomings, the $30.2billion program should be renewed as soon as possible, and on a longterm basis.

title: President Returns Home After Tour On Behalf of G.O.P.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (AP)  President Ford ended his 16,000  mile campaign effort through a score of states early today with undiminished hopes that Republicans can hold their own in Tuesday's Congressional elections.

title: Welfare Clients Want More Assistance With SelfHelp Problems, State Finds
description: A sampling by the state indicates that 85 per cent of welfare clients are interested getting help with problems in addition to getting cash grants, and, the survey found, The most interest was expressed for training and employment services.

title: A Reporter's Notebook: Rabat Summit Meeting Reflects a NewFound Arab Strength
description: RABAT, Morocco Except for the brief opening and closing sessions, which were broadcast live on television, the fourday meeting of Arab heads of state was a largely invisible summit.

title: GiantsChiefs Scoring
description: SECOND QUARTER

title: Senator and Clark Both Scored by Conservative
description: With polite restraint but a rather icy acknowledgment of each other's presence, the two leading candidates for United States Senator met in their final encounter of the campaign yesterday and traversed a terrain of charges and denials, assertions and nuances.

title: Tunisia Reelects Bourguiba
description: TUNIS, Nov. 3 (UPI)President Habib Bourguiba, running without opposition, was reelected for a fifth and probably last fiveyear term today by what Tunisian authorities described as a strong turnout at the polls. Mr. Bourguiba, 71 years old, ran with 112 National Assembly candidates of Tunisia's only political party, the Destourian Socialist party. All were unopposed.

title: U.S. and du Pont's Financings Awaited
description: Credit markets, riding the crest of higher prices, will key this week on a huge Treasury financing and on a du Pont offering that marks the chemical giant's first marketing of straight debt in more than half a century. The main action is concentrated in the final three days of the week, following Election Day on Tuesday. The corporate bond market was so strong last week that a pair of offerings totaling $300million moved as quick sellouts on Fridaya day when bond salesmen customarily relax bit.

title: Shah Will Visit Soviet
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 3 (AP)The Shah of Iran will pay a friendly business visit to the Soviet Union later this month, the Soviet press agency Tass said today.

title: Jets Lose Giants Upset Chiefs, 33 to 27; To Oilers Bills Top Patriots
description: The Jets played a nasty practical joke on their shrinking following yesterday. They threatened to win a game, but it all turned out to be just a variation on the theme the Jets have been playing all season. They wound up losing to the Houston Oilers, 2722.

title: ARAFAT FORESEES WAR IN 6 MONTHS
description: Yasir Arafat, leader of the Palestine Liberation Organization, has said in an interview that he foresees a high probability of war in the Middle East within six months and has predicted that if war comes it will start with an Israeli assault against Syria.

title: Stage: Battle of Angels
description: Battle of Angels, Tennessee Williams's first produced play, opened in Boston on Dec. 30, 1940 and closed in two weeks. Seventeen years later it finally came to New York in a vastly altered version, Orpheus Descending. It ran for only 68 performances, andin its third incarnation  became the Marlon BrandoAnna Magnani movie, The Fugitive Kind. The original play became Williams's most neglected piece of theater, a footnote in a great career.

title: JAVITS AND RIVALS HAVE FINAL CLASH
description: With polite restraint but a rather icy acknowledgement of each other's presence, the three candidates for United States Senator met in their final encounter of the campaign yesterday and traversed a terrain of charges and denials, assertions and nuances.

title: L.I. Still Echoes, Faintly, to the Cry of Tally Ho
description: SHOREHAM, L. I.It used to be easy to go on a fox hunt. All that was needed was the written permission of a few estateowners for the field of horses and hounds to gallop across the grounds.

title: Television
description: Television

title: Kansas City on New York I as Game Ends
description: KANSAS CITY, Nov. 3The clock ran out on the Kansas City Chiefs at the New York 1yard line today and the Giants snapped a fourgame losing streak with a thrilling 3327 victory.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Most of the superior officers in the Suffolk County Police Department were back on duty yesterday following the suspension of 93 sergeants and lieutenants who called in sick Thursday and Friday in a job action related to salary dispute. The job action was called after it was learned that there would be a delay in a decision by panel arbitrating the dispute.

title: Portugvese Leave Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 3 (AP)A Portuguese delegation headed by Alvaro Cunha!, a Minister Without Portfolio and a Communist, left for home today, pleased with the prospects of expanding relations with the Soviet Union, the Soviet press agency Tass reported.

title: Congress Urged to Renew RevenueSharing Program
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 A twoyear study of Federal genoral revenue sharing has concluded that, despite some shortcomings, the $30.2billion program should be renewed as soon as possible, and on a longterm basis.

title: Two Soviet Couriers Stranded in Australia
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Nov. 3 (Reuters)Two Soviet diplomatic couriers were stranded here today after three airline pilots refused them as passengers on Londonbound flights hecauset he couriers would not undergo routine security checks.

title: The Cafe de la Paix, A Paris Landmark, Is Closed Till Spring
description: PARIS, Nov. 3It was where General de Gaulle took his first meal after the liberation of Paris, where Gide and Valry wrote quatrains, Dali penciled mustaches on the tablecloths, an incognito Edward VII made dates, and where thousands of touristss imply sat and stared at thousands of other tourists.

title: Easing of U.S. Curbs on Rice Is Sought by Exporter
description: The United States, which produces less than 2 per cent of the worlds rice, is the world's largest rice exporter. The reason, says Grover Connell, is that in most rice producing nations the rice is eaten there by rising populations.

title: Research Body Elects Officers
description: The board of directors of the Advertising Research Foundation had a very busy session Friday electing a new, fulltime, paid presitlnt, a chairman, and for the first time in its 38year history an executive director. Later the membership passed on new bylaws that include increasing the dues for the first time in memory, and giving full voting membership to research organizations. Up till now only advertiser companies, ad agencies and media have been able to vote.

title: Mayors of Atlantic City and Newark Debate CasinoGambling Referendum
description: The debate about casino gambling in New Jersey went down to the wire yesterday with a lot of questions unansweredwho would run the casinos, who would profit from them, where would they be and how many of them, and how much good or harm would they do the state.

title: Haughton Shows Son Father Knows Best
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Nov. 3 Peter, have you forgotten? You've got to drive now, called out Billy Haughton to his 20yearold son, who was talking in the paddock.

title: MRS. WALTER E. POOR
description: Mary Brundage Poor, widow of Walter E. Poor, who was chairman of Sylvania Electric Products, Inc., died Saturday in Doctors Hospital. She was 73 years old and lived at 1150 Fifth Avenue.

title: Gubernatorial Candidates in Exchange of Charges on Inflation and Jobs
description: In their last two debates before tomorrow's election, Governor Wilson and Representative Hugh L. Carey traded charges of fiscal profligacy and responsibility for inflation.

title: Deaths
description: AMELIFlora (nee Maus), on Nov. 3, 1974, beloved wife of the late Howard Amela sisfor of the late Clara Kraeling and Anna Berge, aunt of Anna Widdowtield and Caraline Huntington of Greenport, N.Y., grandaunt of Charmian Farrell of Bethpage, N.Y. Religious service Wed., 10:30 A.M. at Henry McCaddin & Son Funeral dome 24 7th Ave., Brooklyn.

title: Bryant Holds Trump Card In Alabama's Bowl Choice
description: If the bowls picked teams today, a fair guess for the Orange and Sugar Bowls might be Alabama against Notre Dame in orre and Florida against Penn State in the other. But two weeks remain before the bowls announce their selections.

title: Bruins Wallop Stars, 101
description: BOSTON, Nov. 3 (UPI)Bobby Orr and Phil Esposito collected a goal and three assists each tonight as the Boston Bruins blitzed the Minnesota North Stars, 101. It was the worst defeat in Minnesota's history.

title: About New York
description: Mayor Beame was smiling. It was a small smile, the kind that doesn't give anything away, and the Mayor had it on while he talked about Hugh L. Carey. I think, Mr. Beame said judiciously, that the city will get a better, a more sympathetic, approach from a Democratic Governor, especially if it's Hugh Carey. The small smile widened, but not that much. The Mayor may be the most circumspect man in town.

title: French to Lift Ban On W.T.T. Players
description: PARIS, Nov. 3 (AP)The new Professional Tennis Council ruled today that all Grand Prix tournaments sanctioned by the International Lawn Tennis Federation should be open to all players, including members of World Team Tennis.

title: Music: Duo Zuckerman
description: Marriage may either be a failed institution or the newest, most chic thing imaginable, depending upon which popular magazine you happen to pick up. But as one way to foster the kind of intimacy that a firstrate chambermusic duo must have, marriage is still a valuable arrangement. Consider the case of Eugenia and Pinchas Zukerman, flutist and violinist, who gave a concert yesterday afternoon at the Kaufmann Hall of the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A.

title: New Corporate Bonds
description: New Corporate Bonds

title: State Moving to Upgrade Eye Care in Rural Areas
description: A program to improve eyesight care for the state's rural residents with a $223,000 threeyear Federal grant was announced yesterday by the State's University College of Optometry, 122 East 25th Street.

title: INFANT BOY IS SHOT ON LOWER EAST SIDE
description: A 10monthold boy was accidentally shot and wounded last night by a 23yearold man who was visiting the infant's mother in her apartment on the Lower East Side, the police reported.

title: NearBankrupt City
description: The clear implication of the latest figures on New York City's economy is that this city is sliding into bankruptcy with dismaying speed.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: London: Urgent Talk of Arts and Money
description: LONDON, Nov. 1Armies rarely close for lack of funds, but this doesn't stop generals from warning that the future of war will be at risk if their budgets are cut. The generals in the arts are also noted for crying wolf. Sometimes, it is true, from inside the wolf.

title: City Points With Pride To Humble Pants Buy
description: Mrs. Jennie Marino tightened the city's belt last week when she snapped up 17,100 pairs of men's twill work pants for the Department of Correction at $2 a pair, saving the taxpayers more than $70,000

title: Tentative Settlement Reached In Long Branch School Strike
description: LONG BRANCH, Nov. 3A tentative settlement was reached here today in efforts to end a two week strike by the city's teachers and school clerical and custodial Workers.

title: Oil Workers Vote Pact
description: TEXAS CITY, Tex. Nov. 31 (AP)  Members of the Oil Chemical and Atomic Workers Union approved an agreement today to end a 91day strike at the Amoco Oil Company plant here. The 1,128 members of the local will return to work Wedrtesday.

title: COAL TALKS REACH IMPASSE ON COSTS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3Negotiations to avoid a national coal strike next week reached a new impasse tonight, and Arnold R. Miller, the president of the United Mine Workers, said he was ordering home his 38member bargaining council. The council's approval is needed Nr a settlement.

title: Melchionni Helps Nets Sink Spurs
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Nov. 3 Billy Melchionni is alive and not about to be traded, sold or cut by the New York Nets. That was the story today after the Nets defeated the San Antonio Spurs, 120109, at Nassau Coliseum.

title: Player Golf Victor
description: PERTH, Australia, Nov. 3 (UPI)Gary Player of South Africa won his seventh Australian open golf title with a 73 for an 11under par fourround total of 277 today. Norman Wood of Scotland finished second, three shots back. Tom Kite of Houston fired a 71 for a 282 to tie for third with Brian Jones of Australia and Jim Wiechers of Tampa Valley, Calif., finished fifth at 283.

title: WATTS'S PLAYING YIELDS EXCITEMENT
description: Andr Watts gave a recital in the comparatively intimate surroundings of the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A.'s Kaufmann Hall on Saturday night, but there was nothing restrained or inhibited about either his highkey program or his electrically charged playing. The music contrasted Chopin's romantic virtuosity (three nocturnes, 10 etudes) with Liszt's (the Piano Sonata, Les jeux d'eau  la Villa d'Este, a transcendental etude), and Mr. Watts gave it everything he had.

title: Buffalo Wins On Blocked Kick, 2928
description: FOXBORO, Mass., Nov. 5 Joe Ferguson, the Bills quarterback, summed it up for most people who saw the. BuffaloNew England game here today when he said, That was the greatest game I've ever played in, and not because we won. It just was the greatest. I enjoyed every minute of it.

title: Getting West 77th Street Back
description: How did it happen here? How did our beautiful block, West 77th Street, become notorious as the scene of nine murders?

title: Farm Union and A.C.L .U. Fight Coast Judge's Curb on Lawsuits
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 3The United Farm Workers of America and the American Civil Liberties Union here are fighting a decision by a Superior Court judge that sharply restricts the union's ability to bring legal action against the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, its rival in organizing fieldworkers.

title: I.M.F. Lists Huge Increases for Oil Nations
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3The International Monetary Fund reported today huge increases in the foreignexchange reserves of oilexporting countries and continuing trade deficits for all major industrial countries except Sweden and West Germany.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The Federal Energy Administration's Project Independence study (news article Oct. 23) issues a welcome call for a strong conservation effort to achieve national energy selfsufficiency, but the dim view it takes of what it calls costly crash programs to tap new energy sources such as  solar heat can only result in formation of a policy of at best stopgap measures to cope with future energy needs.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A young woman and an absentwithoutleave sailor, both prisoners in the Suffolk County jail in Riverhead, L.I., hanged themselves with torn bedsheets Saturday in cells in the institution, the police said. The incident led Warden James F. Cleary to begin an investigation yesterday.

title: Firefighters Back at Work In Montreal After Strike
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 3 (AP)Montreal's firefighters returned to work today after a twoandahalfday strike during which about 20 fires were estimated to have caused $2million in damage, mostly to abandoned buildings. It was the largest number of fires in Montreal in a 60hour period.

title: Nixon Off Critical List
description: Former President Richard M. Nixon was removed from the critical list yesterday as he spent his best morning since his phlebitis surgery last Tuesday. Page 16.

title: Three Killed in Gun Battle In Thai Cafe in Hollywood
description: HOLLYWOOD, Calif., Nov. 3 (UPI)Three persons, including an 11yearold girl, were killed today in a gun battle in crowded Thai cafe. Two persons were injured.

title: Port Jefferson Teachers Reach an Agreement
description: A tentative settlement was reached last night between striking teachers and the school board of Port Jefferson, L.I., in a dispute that has disrupted classes for two weeks.

title: NEW JERSE
description: LONG BRANCH, Nov. 3A tentative settlement was reached here today in efforts to end a twoweek strike by the city's teachers and school clerical and custodial workers.

title: L.I. Still Echoes, Faintly, to the Cry of Tally Ho
description: SHOREHAM, L. LIt used to be easy to go on a fox hunt. All that was needed was the written permission of a few estateowners for the field of horses and hounds to gallop across the grounds.

title: Youthful Violence Grows And Accused A re Younger
description: An elderly man is followed into his apartment in Brooklyn, strangled and robbed of $37. Two boys, one 14 years old, the other 15, are arrested.

title: Warren to Be Retained As Deputy Press Aide
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (UPI)Gerald R. Warren, the deputy White House press secretary under President Nixon, will be retained on President Ford's press staff, a White House aide said today.

title: Green and McLendon Take Team Golf
description: LAKE BUENA VISTA, Fla., Nov. 3A consistent winner and a consistent loser, bound by a 15year friendship, combined today to shoot a 64 and win the $250,000 Professional Golfers Association team championship.

title: Stockbrokers Praise Longer Trading
description: Wall Street's monthold extension in trading hoursfrom the old 3:30 P.M. closing time to 4 P.M.is drawing praise from the industry.

title: Joseph Reap, Long a Spokesman For the State Department, Dies
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (AP) Joseph W. Reap, former State Department spokesman and a deputy press officer who served under eight Secretaries of State since World War II, died today at George Washington University Hospital. He was 60 years old.

title: On the State Of Man
description: BOSTON, Nov. 3In Western Europe, which many would consider a denselypopulated area, there are now about 85 people per square kilometer. South Asia, on the most cautious estimates of population growth, will add 140 people per square kilometer over the next 25 years.

title: Socialists Seek Injunction
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3 (UPI) The Socialist Workers party has gone to court seeking an end to what it considers harassment of its activities by the Government. The party is seeking an injunction to stop Federal Bureau of Investigation surveillance of its convention, scheduled for St. Louis in Dccember.

title: Fire Bombs Hurled At Offices in Rome Of 2 U.S. Concerns
description: ROME, Nov. 3Four gasoline bombs were hurled tonight into the offices here of two American companies, the International Business Machines Corporation and the Minnesota Mining and Manufacturing Company, causing light damage.

title: Quiet Voice Of the Past Stirs India
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 3A frail figure, he speaks quietly and wearily. At train stations, he is beseiged by students and peasants who place garlands of carnations around his neck. At swarming rallies, tens of thousands raise their fists and shriek: Loknaik Jayaprakash Zindabad. Long live Jayaprakash, the people's hero.

title: EQUITY FUNDING SEEN ONLY A PAPER GIANT
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 3 (AP) The once highflying but now bankrupt Equity Funding Corporation of America was only a paper giant, according to its courtappointed trustee.

title: Both Sides Woo Independents In Rockland County Contests
description: NEW CITY, N. Y., Nov. 3The question of how Rockland County's sizable bloc of independent voters will react to Watergate and to the problems of the economy has dominated the strategy sessions of party leaders in the county.

title: I. T. T. DISCLOSES LOSS OF 100 AIDES
description: About 100 middlemanagement and executive officials at the New York headquarters of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation have left the company recently, along with an undisclosed number of clerical personnel.

title: Jersey Consumer Notes
description: The Bergen County Office of Consumer Affairs and Protection has tallied up its case load for the first six months of this year and produced a cross section of the major complaints that seem to be bothering consumers everywhere.

title: 19 Guests Are Robbed At Coast Hotel Party
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif., Nov. 3 (UPI)At least 19 persons attending a brthday party at the Beverly Hilton Hoell last night and early today were systematically tied up and robbed as they entered the hotel suite.

title: White Delays Decision
description: NASHUA, N. H. Nov. 3 (AP) Boston's Democratic Mayor, Kevin H. White, said today that he would decide by mid 1975 if he would seek the Democratic Presidential nomination in 1976.

title: GARBAGE IS ISSUE IN MISSOURI TOWN
description: CALLAO, Mo., Nov. 3  A stranger to this small town in (northcentral Missouri might have thoughtthat its governiment had been hit by a scandal Isuch as those that occur from time to time in foreign countries.

title: Lois Harnik Actor's Bride
description: Lois Harnik, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Irving Harnik of the Bronx, was married yesterday afternoon to Peter Theodore Victor, a television and stage actor. The ceremony was performed by Rabbi Joseph H. Gelberman in the United Nations Chapel at the Church Center for the United Nations.

title: Books of The Times More Magic From John Fowles
description: The working title of this collection of stories was VariationsJohn Fowles interjects in A Personal Note about onethird of the way through his new book, The Ebony Towerby which I meant to suggest variations both on certain themes in previous books of mine and in methods of narrative presentation

title: Hermann Williams Jr., 66, Dies; Corcoran Gallery's ExDirector
description: Hermann W. Williams Jr., director emeritus of the Corcoran Gallery of Art in Washington, which he headed from 1947 to 1968, died yesterday of cancer at his home in Washington. He was 66 years old.

title: Beleaguered State Republicans Press Drive to Retain Control of the Legislature
description: The State Senate majority leader, Warren M. Anderson, has sent out a personal letter to 600 county committeemen in his district, jogging them to get out the Republican vote and prevent defeat in what politicians say is the toughest fight of his 20year legislative career.

title: NEW SIGNS FOUND OF SLOW ECONOMY
description: New evidence of the slowdown in the economy was reported by purchasing executives in the latest survey of the National Association of Purchasing management, Inc., released over the weekend:

title: Sports News Briefs
description: The Public Schools Athletic League settled its final football division title yesterday and set up the quarterfinal playoffs, to begin Saturday. The threeteam tie in Queens Division II was broken in favor of August Martin, which had allowed the fewest points in division games. Martin had allowed 12. The other contenders, Jackson and Springfield Gardens, had given up 14. Martin faces Bayside Memorial Field, Flushing. Bayside, the defender, has won 19 games in a row. The other pairings are Jefferson Boys; TottenvilleBrooklyn Tech at New Dorp, and Kennedy at Clinton.

title: BLACKS AND JEWS URGE COOPERATION
description: A black Harvard professor and a Jewish playwrightproducer agreed yesterday on the need for blacks and Jews to cooperate in fighting discrimination.

title: PUERTO RICO AIMS TO GUT BIRTH RATE
description: Puerto Rico's government is carrying on a vigorous program of offering freebut voluntarysterilization to cope with a population problem that it calls the most critical in the Americas The island has higher population density per square mile than Japan, India or China.

title: State Bond Issue Promising Rail Gains
description: At an annual cost of 62 cents a personthe price of a pack of cigarettesNew York State residents are promised a big package of railroad improvements if they vote for the $250million rail bond issue on next Tuesday's ballot.

title: Dave Anderson
description: Henry Aaron is going home to Milwaukee where his heart is. It isn't in Atlanta, not anymore.

title: Rutgers Plans Differential For Postgraduate Tuition
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Nov. 3Dr. Edward J. Bloustein, the president of Rutgers University, has recommended a tuition increase of $10 a credit for the university's outofstate graduate students.

title: Sports Today
description: Earnie Shavers vs. Bob Stallings, 10round heavyweig, fight, at Madison Square Garden's Felt Forum, Eighth Avenue and 33d Strbet; first bout8 P.M.

title: Eschenbach Staid In a Piano Recital As He Begins Tour
description: Earlier this year, Christoph Eschenbach, the young German pianist, said in an interview with The New York Times that hiS intent was to shock his audience with his interpretations. Well, Saturday night at the Hunter College Assembly Hall, Mr. Eschenbach began an American tour with a BeethovenSchubert recital that wasn't very shocking at all. In fact, if Mr. Eschenbach isn't careful, he may turn into an old master one of these years.

title: School Football
description: LONG ISLAND

title: New Jersey Sports
description: PISCATAWAY, Nov. 3  Amateur harness racing is alive and well in New Jersey, thanks largely to efforts by the Johnson Park Trotting Club, one of the larger and more active organizations of its kind in the nation.

title: North Carolina Has One Heated Race
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Nov. 3North Carolina's renascent Republican party appears unlikely to continue on Tuesday the inroads into Democratic power it has made in recent elections, but it also seems a little less vulnerable to loss of offices than do Republicans in some other parts of the nation.

title: Personal Finance: Savings and Stock Insurance
description: President Ford signed into law a week ago a measure doubling to $40,000 Federal insurance coverage at participating banks, savings and loan associations and credit unions. In addition, legislation has been recently proposed to broaden the insurance offered by an independent Washingtonbased agency to stockholders who keep cash and securities at many brokerage concerns.

title: 2 SENATORS SEEK STAY ON F.B.I. PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 3Two senior members of the Senate Subcommittee on Constitutional Rights have asked the Justice Department to delay action on a Federal Bureau of Investigation communications plan that critics have said might lead to Federal control of local police.

title: Jazz Company's 2d Season to Be Test
description: Despite a deficit of more than $40,000 in its first season, the New York Jazz Repertory Company is coming back for a second season of 15 concerts at Carnegie Hall, starting with two programs focused on Louis Armstrong on Friday and a week from Friday, Nov. 15. But, according to George Wein, executive director of the company, this season will be a doordie stand.

title: Greek Side in Cyprus Now Considers Federation as Only Feasible Solution
description: NICOSIA, Cypru, Nov. 3Most Greek and Greek Cypriote leaders agree that the only feasible solution 10 the Cyprus problem would be to divide the island into separate but federated regions, part administered by the ethnic Turks and the rest by the ethnic Greeks.

title: Bellwether Contests in Election Today; Other Indicators and Some Long Shots
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4For a quick clue to the outcome of tomorrow's elections, keep an eye on three men named Sarasin, Hudnut and Snyder.

title: MAGISTRATE SLAIN IN JERSEY COURT
description: A 70yearold magistrate was fatally shot as he presided over night court last evening in Wanaque, N. J.

title: Italian General Challenges Legality of Rome Arrest
description: ROME, Nov. 4An Italian general who was arrested here last Thursday on political conspiracy charges has challenged the legality of the action because the warrant was signed by an investigating magistrate in Padua.

title: High Tides Around New York
description: For high tide at Jones Inlet (Pt. Lookout), deduct 19 min. from Sandy Hook time. For high tide at Atlantic City (Steel Pier), deduct 26 min. from Sandy Hook time.

title: U.F.T. MAY SEEK FEWER DISTRICTS
description: Albert Shanker said yesterday that the United Federation of. Teachers was considering asking the Legislature to reduce the number of community school districts in this city from the current total of 32 to 10 or 15.

title: Blacks Celebr'ate 5th Solidarity Dray; Boycotts Are Few
description: The fifth annual Black Solidarity Day was celebrated quietly throughout the city yesterday without major disruptions in services or institutions.

title: Rev. Francis Brennan, 80, Of St. Jean Baptiste Church
description: The Rev. Francis T. Brennan, a former superior of the community of the Congregation of the Blessed Sacrament here and for more than 50 years priest at St. Jean Baptiste Roman Catholic Church, 184 East 76th Street, died Thursday in the rectory. He would have been 81 years old Saturday.

title: Latest Bulletin on Nixon
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Nov. 4Following is the text of a bulletin issued at 9:15 A.M. today by Dr. John Lungren, personal physician to former President Richard M. Nixon, at Memorial Hospital Medical Center, on his patient's condition:

title: FIBERS INDUSTRIES IS PLANNING LAYOFFS
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Nov. 4 (UPI)Fibers Industries, Inc., a subsidiary of the Celanese Corporation, announced today plans to lay off more than 900 workers at two plants effective Saturday.

title: 40 Schools Chosen By Anker to Provide Bilingual Teaching
description: School Chancellor Irving Anker designated 40 schools yesterday that will offer bilingual instruction in Spanish starting next February for students whose knowledge of English is insufficient to follow a regular course of instruction.

title: Food Repricing Is Fading, But Buyer May Not Save
description: Repricing by supermarketsthe practice of piling new and higher price stickers on top of old oneshas become an emotional flashpoint for consumers frustrated and frightened by inflation. Responding to this anger, many chains across the country have announced they are voluntarily ending the practice, and yesterday the Nassau Board of Supervisors made its county the first in the state with a law against it. [Details on page 17.]

title: World Food Crisis: Basic Ways of Life Face Upheaval
description: In the months since agricultural experts first forecast the famine that is now causing deaths in India, leaders in many fields have come to regard the present world food situation not merely as an acute crisis but as the beginfling of a chronic global condition that calls for fundamental changes in the way people live and governments cooperate.

title: Newcomers Alter Face of Exclusive Grosse Pointe
description: GROSSE POINTE, Mich., Nov. 4Jules Wendalt was a tough, spirited young workingclass Detroiter who lived, in Joyce Carol Oates's novel, Them, and loved a girl in Grosse Pointe, and to him, for while, that famous neighborhood was spellbound; everything there was hazy, as if under enchantment.

title: Radio
description: 6.7 A.M., WNYCFM: Sunrise Symphony. Harpsichord Concerto in B flat, Dittersdorf; Apotheose de Lully, Couperin.

title: A Confident Carey Says If Elected He Will Give First Priority to the Unemployed
description: Hours befbre New York voters went to the polls, an obviously confident Representative Hugh L. Carey said yesterday that if he was elected Governor today, he would make unemployment in the state the first order of business.

title: Business Records
description: Business Records

title: 100,000 Rally at the U.N. Against Palestinian Voice
description: More than 100,000 people filled the streets around the United. Nations yesterdayin one of the largest demonstrations in the city's historyto protest the invitation to the Palestine Liberation Organizetion to take part in the General Assembly's Middle East debate.

title: AMEX STOCKS OFF IN LIGHT TRADING
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market declined yesterday in light trading.

title: Physician Finds Nixon Is Well Enough To Try Walking With the Aid of Nurses
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Nov. Former President Richard M. Nixon's gradual improvement from postoperative complications reached the point today where his doctor allowed him to begin walking a few steps with nursing assistance around his bed in an intensive care unit at Memorial Hospital Medical Center here.

title: Deaths
description: EDELSTEINDavid. Beloved husband of the late Rose. Devoted brother of Oscar & cie voted uncle & granduncle. Services Wednesday, Nov. 6, 10:30 A.M., The Riverside, 76 St. & Amsterdam Ave. KESSLERPauline, on November 2 Re'svett wile of the late Louis Kessler. Cherishco mother of Harry, Leonard, Her.rietta Orlinsky and Esther Graynor. Adored grandmother and greatgrandmother. Funer al services were held Sunday, Nov. 3.

title: Payments Surplus for Bonn
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, Nov. 4 (Reuters)  West Germany's balanceofpayments current account showed a provisional surplus of $628million in September, compared with a revised deficit of $80million in August and a surplus of $621million in September, 1973, the Bundesbank said today.

title: Secret Recording Played At CarterTrial Hearing
description: JERSEY CITY, Nov. 9Question: In other words, in your mind it was definitely Rubin Carter and John Artis who came around the corner on that morning.

title: FOOD TALK The Hows and Whys Of ClayPot Cuisine
description: Unglazed, terracotta casseroles have been big sellers in housewares departments for several years, but after they're used a couple of times many have been relegated to the attic or the top shelf.

title: LIFE TERM GIVEN IN GIRL'S SLAYING
description: Joseph K. McGowan, a former science teacher, was sentenced to life imprisonment, yesterday for the slaying last year of Joan D'Allesandro, a 7yearold Hillsdale Brownie scout.

title: Prices for Violins Play the Inflation Tune
description: Not long ago this year, a young violinist looking for a good instrument went to Chicago to see two old violins offered for sale by a private owner at $27,000 and $28,000.  Several weeks later, when he returned for another look, the price was $30,000. After all, say James Buswell, who tells the story about one of his former students, sugar has gone from $1.76 to $2,06, so why not violiqs?

title: Riessen Scores 61, 64 Victory
