description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 4 (UPI) Marty Riessen led three Americans Into the second round of the $100,000 Stockholm open tennis championships today with a 61, 64 victory over Barry hillipsMoore of Australia.

title: Dial M for Mass Transit
description: OUR Government, designed to serve thirteen former Colonies in 1789, needs a twentiethcentury updating. Not new goals, but new methods are needed: methods by which government can be made more responsive to its citizens. For fifteen years, the percentage of voters casting ballots has been declining, a symptom of voter alienation from a Government that seems out of control.

title: S.E.C. ASKS SHIFT ON MUTUAL FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4The Securities and Exchange Cornmission announced today a comprehensive program to move the mutual fund industry, toward retail price competition.

title: Hockey, Basketball Standings
description: Hockey, Basketball Standings

title: Restoration of 17thCentury Structures Strengthens Gallic Flavor of Quebec
description: QUEBECIn a $36million restoration program, this picturesque Frenchspeaking city is reclaiming architectural treasures associated with the early settlement of North America and the founding of Canada as an outpost of France in the new world.

title: Coal Producer Lifts Its Revenues
description: The Pittston Company, which derives the bulk of earnings from production of metallurgical coal, achieved record sales and earnings in the third quarter. The company reported yesterday rret of $27.5million or $1.58 a share, up 787.1 per cent from $3.1millitin, or 18 cents a share, in the similar three months last year. Operating revenues were $274.6million against $127.8million.

title: 100,000 Rally at the U.N. Against Palestinian Voice
description: More than 100,000 people filled the streets around the United Nations yesterday in one of the largest demonstrations in the city's historyto protest, the invitation to the Palestine Liberation Organization to take part in the General Assembly debate on the Middle East.

title: Many Awards Won By U. S. Philatelists At Show in Mexico
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 4Collectors from the United States took the lion's share of awards as Exfilmex 74, the fifth InterAmerican Philatelic Exhibition, came to a close here.

title: SOVIET DEAL STIRS FUTURES IN SUGAR
description: News of a Soviet purchase of 400,000 tons of raw sugar from the Philippines sent world sugar futures prices here soaring the new 2centapound daily limit. In terms of the key March delivery the price was 48.97 cents a pound. The world spot price rose to 50 cents pound, a record.

title: EUGENE C. MERRILL
description: Eugene C. Merrill, a retired insurance executive, died Sunday night at his home, 1120 Park Avenue. He was 69 years old.

title: Newcomers Alter Face of Exclusive Grosse Pointe
description: GROSSE POINTE, Mich., Nov. 4Jules Wendall was a tough, spirited young workingclass Detroiter who lived in Joyce Carol Oates's novel, Them, and loved a girl in Grosse Pointe, and to him, for while, that famous neighborhood was spellbound; everything there was hazy, as if under enchantment.

title: MAGISTRATE SLAIN IN JERSEY COURT
description: The 71yearold magistrate of Wanaque, N.J., was shot in the back and slain by a sniper last night as he presided over a regular Monday night court session in the town's municipal building.

title: Roberts Rejects Deal on BribeTrial Sentence
description: Supreme Court Justice Burton B. Roberts yesterday refused to accept a Federal and state agreement to impose light sentence on a supermarket executive who has become a prosecution witness in pending Federal cases.

title: College, School Results SOCCER
description: Colleges

title: 7 Firemen Hurt in Blaze
description: Seven firemen were injured and 10 families were temporarily left homeless late Sunday night when a twoalarm fire broke out on the top floor of a fivestory Harlem tenement, fire officials reported. A department spokesman said none of the firemen had been injured seriously in the blaze at 2581 West 117th Street, which broke; out shortly before 11 P.M. The cause of the fire was undetermined.

title: Burmese Leader Resists Birth Control Programs
description: RANGOON, Burma, Nov. 1 Not because of any cultural taboo or ??? opposition, but ??? of the decision of one man, Burma is the only Asian nation offering outright ??? to family planning ??? aimed at population control.

title: jazz Company's 2d Season to Be Test
description: Despite a deficit of more than $40,000 in its first season, the New York Jazz Repertory Company is coming back for a second season of 15 concerts at Carnegie Hall, starting with two programs focused on Louis Armstrong on Friday and a week from Friday, Nov. 15. But, according to George Wein, executive director of the company, this season will be a doordie stand.

title: Detective and a Gunman Killed During Shootout in Union City
description: A Union City, N.J., narcotics; detective was slain and his partner was seriously wounded'in yesterday in a shootout with three, possibly four gunmen at a taxi stand. One of the gunmen was also killed, another was arrested and the others escaped following an exchange of about 10 shots, the police said.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Tale of a Pig Trained to Be a Pointer
description: One of the more delightful items in the tide of mail across this writer's desk recently was a clipping from Conservation News telling of a talented 19th century pig that learned to point and retrieve game birds.

title: 5 Canadian Companies Join In Oil Pipeline Venture
description: TORONTO, Nov. 4 (Reuters)  Five Canadian companies have joined to study the feasibility of building a new pipeline to carry oil from the Mackenzie Delta and Beauford Sea areas, Imperial Oil, Ltd., said today.

title: Buoyed Giants Now Seek To Bolster Pass Defense
description: Now that Craig Morton has pumped confidence, enthusiasm and points into the New York Giants offense, Coach Bill Arnsparger is shifting his attention to solving the last soft spot on the club, pass defense.

title: PROSECUTOR SAYS HIS WITNESS HID A KEY HUNT MEMO
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4The chief prosecutor in the Watergate coverup trial disclosed today that a government witness had withheld until last weekend a bombshell document that affected all five defendants.

title: Coal Talks Resume
description: Negotiators for coal producers and the United Mine Workers resumed bargaining last night after Federal mediation officials urged that they try to avert a nationwide coal strike next week. Details, Page 11.

title: Music: A Challenge Met
description: The Piedmont Chamber Orchestra is like one of those Chinese puzzles that consist of endless boxes within boxes. The orchestra, which appeared Sunday night at Alice Tully Hall, is affiliated with the North Carolina School of the Arts, which in turn is a constituent of the University of North Carolina. The orchestra's membership is built around three nucleus groups: the Clarion Wind Quartet and the Ciompi and the Razoumovsky string quartets.

title: ANTA SERIES OPENS AT DE LYS MONDAY
description: The 19th season of the ANTA matinee series at the Theater de Lys on Christopher Street) will get under way Monday with Fire and Ice, based on the works of Robert Frost, Lucille Lortel, artistic director of the series, has announced.

title: VALUE CLIMBS 4% ON CONSTRUCTION
description: The value of construction for which contracts were awarded in September rose 4 per cent from September, 1973, to a total of $8.35billion, the McGrawHill Information System reported yesterday. The recovery from August, when a summer low point was reached was attributed to a surge of large industrial, commercial and electrical utility projects that offset a 30 per cent loss in residential building in September.

title: A Mayor Convicted Of Threatening Life With Road Grader
description: MORRISTOWN, Nov. 4 (UPI)  Mayor Ralph Atkinson of Jefferson Township was convicted today of threatening to run over a housewife with road grader in 1973 when she attempted to stop a streetwidening project outside her home.

title: Text of Memorandum Hunt Wrote After BreakIn
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4Following is the text of a memorandum, written by E. Howard Hunt Jr. five months after the Watergate breakin, that was introduced today by the prosecution at the Watergate coverup trial:

title: FASHION TALK Pants: Alive and Well
description: For those of you who are beginning to wonder about the status of pants, relax. Sure, skirts are enjoying renaissance. But pants aren't being tossed into the dustbin of fashion. Yesterday, two prestigious designers endorsed them as spring openings on Seventh Avenue went into their second week.

title: GOING OUT Gude
description: PAST MASTERY One of the more modest, night spot delights in town is Catch 32, a nostalgic minimusical of vintage hits rendered by a small group of professionals in their 20's who double as bartenders, waitresses and waiters at the Tangerine (861.2521), 1051 Lexington Avenue (at 75th Street).

title: Casino Foes Ask Byrne to Repudiate Radio Commercials, but He Refuses
description: TRENTON, Nov. 4  In flurry of campaigning for tomorrow's voting in New Jersey, the chairman of the anticasino gambling forces called on Governor Byrne today to repudiate procasino radio commercials that seek to portray casinos as a panacea for New Jersey's fiscal crisis.

title: MRS. JEAN M'CHESNEY
description: Mrs. Jean Everly McChesney, wife of Ernest McChesney, former operatic tenor who teaches singing at the Manhattan School of Music, died Sunday in Roosevelt Hospital. She was 71 years old and lived at 260 West 72d Street.

title: A Confident Carey Makes Plans to Aid Unemployed
description: Hours before New York voters went to the polls, an obviously confident Representative Hugh L. Carey said yesterday that if he was elected Governor today, he would make unemployment in the state the first order of business.

title: R. W. Sarnoff to Marry Anna Moffo
description: Anna Moffo, soprano with the Metropolitan Opera, and Robert W. Sarnoff, board chairman and chief executive officer of the RCA Corporation, will be married here next week.

title: Harvey Fischtrom, Writer Of Children's Books, Dead
description: Harvey Fischtrom, a teacher of history and social science who under the name of Harve Zemach became a successful writer of stories for children, died Saturday in London, where he had been living since 1970. His age was 40.

title: Arab Emirates Seek OilPrice Meeting
description: ABU DHABI, Nov. 4 (AP)The United Arab Emirates has asked petroleum ministers from Persian Gulf oilproducting states to meet Saturday to discuss reducing the price of oil, industry sources said today.

title: CHEK SAM JON
description: Chek Sam Jon, president of Sam Yeung Company, 1 World Trade Center, importer and exporter, died Saturday in Englewood (N.J.) Hospital. He was 68 years old and lived at 200 Winston Drive, Cliffside Park, N.J.

title: Secret Recording Played At CarterTrial Hearing
description: JERSEY CITY, Nov. 4Question: In other words, in your mind it was definitely Rubin Carter and John Artis who came around the corner on that morning.

title: MORE BLACKS SEEK SEATS IN. CONGRESS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (Reuters)53 black are running for seats in the House of Representatives tomorrow and three are running for senate seats. The total is nine more than the number seeking congressional election two years ago.

title: A County Board of Ethics Is Approved for Westchester
description: The Westchester County Board of Legislators unanimously adopted a resolution yesterday forming a county Board of Ethics. The action followed a scheduled public hearing at which no one appeared.

title: Business Briefs
description: Texaco, Inc., expects to spend in this country this year approximately $1.1billion of its record worldwide capital and exploratory budget of $2.3billion, Maurice. F. Granville, chairman, told yesterday's luncheon meeting of the New York Society of Security Analysts.

title: Fans Bid Sooners Quit Big 8
description: There is a growing feeling in the State of Oklahoma that the University of Oklahoma should withdraw from the Big Eight Conference. However, a spokesman for the Sooners said yesterday that there is noth ing but unofficial talk, mostly by fans. Then he added: There might be more talk, though, because we have to split our revenue with all the other teams in the conference. It's financial, if anything, and not because of our probation.

title: A STEEP 8.3% GETS CITY $616MILLION
description: The city borrowed $615million yesterday at high interest rates in an atmosphere of fiscal gloom that failed to deter outoftown banks and institutions from making a $400million commitment to buy the shortterm notes.

title: Israelis Report Blowing Up. House in Raid on Lebanon
description: TEL AVIV, Tuesday, Nov. 5 (Reuters)Israeli forces raided a village in southern Lebanon during the night and blew up a house that they charged harbored Arab guerrillas, the military command announced. No casualties were reported.

title: Perelman's The Beauty Part Turns Up Again, Alas
description: THE BEAUTY PART, a play by S. J. Perelman. Directed by James Hammeerstein; setting by Fred Voelael; lighting by Roger Morgan; costumes by Pearl Somnor; Production stage manager, Gigi Casrio. Presented by the American Place Theater, Wynn Handman, director; associate director, Julia Miles. At III West 46th Street.

title: Connecticut Rivals Press Drives for Governorship
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 4Both major candidates for Governor campaigned vigorously today, despite public opinion polls and expert predictions that the contest was as good as over.

title: PROSECUTOR SAYS HIS WITNESS HID A KEY HUNT MEMO
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4The chief prosecutor in the Watergate coverup trial disclosed today that a government witness had withheld until last weekend a bombshell document that affected all five defendants.

title: Ervin Says Big Victory Could Hart Democrats
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (AP)Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr., Democrat of North Carolina, says an overwhelming victory by Democrats in tomorrow's elections would be bad for the party and also bad for the country.

title: New Ski Pros
description: Joining Bobby Cochran of Richmond, Vt., in skiing's professional troupe this year, will be such other newcomers from the amateur ranks as JeanNoel Augert and Patrick Russel of France.

title: Elmhurst Medical Board Limits Functions in Protest
description: The entire medical board at the City Hospital Center at Elmhurst, Queens, comprising the 25 chiefs of service, resigned their administrative responsibilities yesterday, protesting that the facility was receiving $1.5million less from the city than they felt it needed.

title: Smoliak Is Promoted
description: Rick Smoliak has been named athletic director at the State University of New York At Stony. Brook, retroactive to Sept. 1. Smoliak, 31 years old, had been acting athletic director since January and is also the head baseball coach.

title: Foreman Demands Inquiry on Fight
description: PARIS, Nov. 4 (UPI)George Foreman charged today that there were irregularities in the world title bout he lost to Muhammad Ali in Kinshasa, Zaire, last week. He said he was appealing for an inquiry by boxing authorities.

title: Briton Is Sentenced To 30 Years in Jail For 3 Bomb Attacks
description: LONDON, Nov. 4  Judith Ward a 25yearold sympathizer of the Irish Republican Army was jailed for 30 years today for her role in the planting of three bombs, including one that killed 12 bus passengers on a Yorkshire expressway. The bus bomb was the most deadly terrorist attack in Britain since the present wave of violence, begun in Northern Ireland five years ago, spread to England. The 50pound bomb, planted in the baggage compartment, blew the bus apart as it carried soldiers and their families back to Yorkshire from leave in Manchester nine months ago. The dead included two small children.

title: Playing Inflation Politics
description: WASHINGTONPresident Ford has attempted the difficult feat of turning the Congressional election into a referendum on his antiinflation program. Since local and state issues and personalities always create innumerable crosscurrents and since his own name is not on the ballot, it is hard for any President to structure the debate in a midterm election. Mr. Ford also started this campaign from a position of weakness because his party is identified with Watergate and the discredited Nixon Administration.

title: SISTER OF ALLENDE ARRESTED IN CHILE
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 41 (Reuters)The sister of the late President Salvador Allende Gossens has been arrested and charged with involvement with the outlawed Movement of the Revolutionary Left, an Interior Ministry communique said here today.

title: C.I.A. Protester Fined
description: FREDERICKSBURG, Va., Nov. 4 (AP)Kevin Flatt, one of two Mary Washington College students alleged to have thrown pig's blood on a Central Intelli gence Agency recruiter, was found guilty today and given a 10day suspended jail sentence and fined $100. Charges against Steven Galloway, 19 years old, the other youth charged in the incident, were dismissed. Mr. Flatt, 19, was convicted of assault and battery, willful destruction of property and disorderly conduct.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION OFF 1.3% IN WEEK
description: Steel production for the week ended Nov. 2 slipped by 1.3 per cent to 2,814,000 net tons, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday. This cut the production index to 115.3, its lowest point since the week ended Sept. 28 when it stood at 113.7 and production was only 2,774,000 tons. The industry poured 2,850,000 tons in the week ended Oct. 26 for an index of 116.8.This marked the second consecutive week in which production has declined after period of seven consecutive weeks of rising production as consumers sought to build up inventories against a possible coal strike this month.The weekly production figures follow:

title: JERRY DODGE, ACTOR IN MACK & MABEL, 37
description: Jerry Dodge, a comedian, singer, dancer and actor, who first found a place on Broadway in Bye, Bye Birdie and was currently in the musical Mack & Mabel, died Thursday of chemical poisoning in his home at 27 East 11th Street. He was 37 years old and had been undergoing medical treatment for a virus infection.

title: SHELFITEM RISES BANNED IN NASSAU
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Nov. 4The N assau County Board of Supervisors voted today to forbid retail food stores to increase the price of an item on the shelf once it had been labeled with a price.

title: GANADA STUDIES OTTAWA CHANGES
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 4A report commissioned by the Canadian Government recommended today that the predominantly Frenchspeaking city of Hull be merged with Ottawa into an expanded national capital and, that the capital be renamed. Hull, a city of 63,565 people in Quebec Province, is just across the Ottawa River from this capital. French is the Diother tongue of 89 per cant of the people of Hull.

title: Weekend Boxing
description: East London, South AfricaHappy Boy Mgxaji, South Africa, outpointed Sammy Goss, Trenton, N: J., 10 rounds, lightwelterweights.

title: Wilson Belies Staff Gloom on Last Day
description: It was 6:15 in the morning of the last day of the campaign, a day when many candidates take some wellearned extra rest on the theory that everything there is to say or write has long since been said or written. Governor Wilson was in Buffalo, holding a news conference.

title: Narcotics Detective Slain In Shootout in Union City
description: A Union City, N. J. narcotics detective was slain and his partner was seriously wounded yesterday in a shootout with three, possibly four gunmen at a taxi stand. One of the gunmen was also killed, another was arrested and the others estaped following an exchange of about 10 shots, the police said.

title: Levitt Move Pushed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4Two Government agencies announced today actions affecting the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation.

title: Wings Norris Recovers.
description: DETROIT, Nov: 4 (AP)Bruce A. Norris, owner of the Detroit Red Wings, will be released from a Fort Lauderdale, Fla., hospital tomorrow after recoveringfrom injuries suffered in a car accident Oct. 23.

title: Demonstration Forces U.N. to Close for Day
description: The United Nations building was closed to visitors yesterday because of the demonstration in nearby Dag Hammarsjold Plaza. There was one anonymous telephone call that a bomb would go off.

title: SCHOOL FOUGHT ON LEAFLET BAN
description: TRENTON, Nov. 4A lawyer challenging a North Jersey high school's regulation demanding prior approval for student distribution of leaflets that might induce violence argued today that it would be better to close, the school or call in the police in the event of violence rather than infringe on the students constitutional right of free expression with such prior approval.

title: Mets, Good Diplomats, Lose Again
description: TOKYO, Nov. 4The United States Ambassador to Japan gave a reception for the New York Mets tonight and showed a fine sense of diplomacy by declining to ask why they hadn't beaten the Tokyo Giants during the first two weeks of their tour of Japan.

title: People in Sports
description: Help may be on the way for the desperate Milwaukee Bucks, winners of one of nine National Basketball Association games this season. The main reason, of course, for their sorry start has been the absence of Kareem AbdulJabber, the 7foot2inch center.

title: SHELLFISH APPROVED ON LOWFAT DIETS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (UPI)A new government diet manual says that persons on low cholesterol diets may be better off eating shellfish than porterhouse steak.

title: News Summary and Index
description: King Hussein said in an interview in Amman that Jordan intends to redraft her Constitution, and reorganize her Cabinet and Parliament to remove Palestinian representatives living in the Israelioccupied West Bank. He said he would offer the 800,000 Palestinians living east of the Jordan River a choice between Jordanian and Palestinian citizenship in the near future. These steps were described by King Hussein as the minimum necessary to give meaning to the decision of the Rabat summit conference that named the Palestine Liberation Organization as the sole representative of the Palestinian people. [Page 1, Column 8.1

title: Skelly Oil Raising Wholesale Prices; NCR Costs Lifted
description: Increased prices to wholesale purchasers of gasoline and middle distillates, effective Nov, 1, were announced yesterday by the Skelly Oil Company, Tulsa, Okla. The move raised the price of wholesale gasoline by 1 cent a gallon and middle distillates by 2 cents a gallon, the company said. The action follows an increase of cents a gallon on all three grades of gasoline last Friday.

title: 50 Years as Society Decorator: Interiors WellBred, Not Trendy
description: Eleanor McMillen Brown began concentrating on decorating 50 years ago and she hasn't stopped.

title: Charitable Jets Doing Penance
description: While other teams have been playing football this season, the Jets have been playing humanitarian. It's one thing, though, to act like Dr. Albert Schweitzer; it's another to play like him.

title: TEAR GAS QUELLS PROTEST IN BIHAR
description: PATNA, India Nov. 4Waving sticks and tossing teargas grenades, the police dispersed thousands of chanting students today in a demonstration led by Jayaprakash Narayan, the 72yearold disciple of Gandhi who is seeking to force the ouster of the Bihar state government.

title: Pressman, Frolich & Frost Curbed on OTC by S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (Reuters)  The Securities and Exchange Commission said today it had suspended all overthecounter activities of Pressman, Frolich & Frost, Inc., of New York, for 30 business days, effective Oct. 26.

title: IRON PRODUCERS URGED TO UNITE
description: GENEVA, Nov. 4Creation of an organization of iron ore exporting countries to insure higher prices was urged today by India and Algeria at a meeting of producer nations.

title: Boston Busing Foes Fight Revision in School System
description: BOSTON, Nov. 4Attention in this city's school busing controversy has shifted to, a proposal tomorrow offering voters a choice of whether to abolish the Boston School Committee.

title: Many Public Services Are Suspended Today
description: While department stores are holding special Election Day sales today, many services will be suspended.

title: Australia Sees Little Prospect For Price Fixing Bauxite Cartel
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana, Nov. 4 (UPI)Australia behieves that the prospect of worldwide pricefixing cartel in aluminum ore is unrealistic but supports Jamaica's efforts to collect higher bauxite royalties, the Australian Deputy Prime Minister, Jim Cairns, said today, He said Australia wanted to see the developing countries in a stronger position, but a realistic view is one which is fair and reasonable to everybody, including the bauxiteconsumMg states.Mr. Cairns spoke to local newsmen just before the openMg of the first meeting of the International Bauxite Association, which includes the world's major bauxiteproducing nations. Australia, the world's largest producer of aluminum ore, is one of the founding members of the organization, along with Jamaica, Guyana, Surinam, Sierra Leone, Guinea and Yugoslavia. The charter of the organization, which calls for an exchange of technological and marketing information, is acceptable to Australia, Mr. Cairns said, but he expressed doubt that the organization would ever move into the area of controlling worldwide prices, I do not believe the associa??? ??? ??? ing policy for alumina and bauxite because it is doubtful if it is feasible, he added. Jamaica Example Cited Mr. Cairns said that the nations of the association however, might take a lead from Jamaica, which earlier this year imposed a 500 per cent increase in bauxiteexport royalties on the six United States and Canadian companies operating there. Jamaica supplies twothirds of the ore refined in the United States. The tax increase has been appealed by three of the conipanies to the International Center for the Settlement of Investment Disputes or the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development.

title: Election Day Closings
description: Major securities exchanges in the United States will remain open today, Election Day, although most commodities markets will be closed. Banks in New York and New Jersey will be closed but those in Connecticut will remain open.

title: Stars Suspend Lewis
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Nov. 4 (AP)The Utah Stars of the American Basketball Association have suspended a guard, Ray Lewis, until they can find out whether he still has a valid contract with the Philadelphia 76ers of the National Basketball Association, a club spokesman said today. Lewis was drafted last year by the 76ers, but did not play because of a contract dispute.

title: Prices for Violins Play the Inflation Tune
description: Not long ago this year, a young violinist looking for a good instrument went to Chicago to see two old violins offered for sale by a private owner, at $27,000 and $28,000. Several wersks later, when he returned for another look, the price was $30,000. After all, say James Buswell, who tells the story about one of his former students, sugar has gone from $1.78 to $2.06, so why not violins?

title: Forecasts of Low Turnout Cloud U.S. Voting Outlook
description: Predictions of an unusually low turnoutof possibly fewer than two in every five registered votershave added a final measure of uncertainty in the national elections today. And in a campaign year when much has gone wrong for the Republicans already, experts in both major parties estimated that a light vote of the sort Republicans often pray for would prove still another Watergate bonus for Democratic candidates.

title: Teacher Shot for Scolding
description: LITTLEROCK, Calif., Nov. 4 (UPI)A 13yearold boy shot and wounded his seventhgrade teacher today when she scolded him for poor homework, the Los Angeles County sheriff's deputies reported.

title: Election Day
description: Below is a recapitulation of The Times recommendations for today's elections in New York City and nearby areas of New York, New Jersey and Connecticut. Asterisks denote incumbents.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts
description: Aqueduct Race Charts

title: New Books
description: Country Coustns, by Michael Brownstein (Braziller, $7.95). Humorous story about a man who consorts with extraterrestrial visitors.

title: THE NEW YORK TIMES
description: The Soviet Union, in the annual rush to complete key construction projects in time for the Nov. 7 anniversary of the 1917 revolution, has inaugurated a 2,000mile pipeline from the vast Siberian nauralgas fields to Moscow.

title: Bridge: Nassau and Suffolk Begin Swiss Events This Month
description: Players in Nassau and Suffolk Counties, as well as those in New York City, will have the opportunity to win red points at club level this month by competing in the initial stage of the Grand National Team Championship. At least half the members of each team must be NassauSuffolk residents, and all Must belong to the Greater New York Bridge Association.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: N.B.A. to Vote On Black Aide
description: The National Basketball Association moves Thursday to within a step of electing the first black commissioner of a major league sport.

title: Jamaican Reggay Nearly Overlooked As Festival Starts
description: The annual Jamaican Reggay Festival may have arrived at the Felt Forum on Sunday, but the music, Jamaica's own translation of American rhythm n blues, had a hard time competing with other styles of music on parade.

title: Stallings Defeats Shavers at Forum
description: Bob Stallings of Freeport, L.L. scored the biggest victory of his 10year pro career last night when he scored on a unanimous decision over Earnie Shavers of Warren, Ohio in a 10round heavyweight fight at the Felt Forum.

title: CLOTHING MAKERS HIT MOVES ABROAD
description: The American Apparel Manufacturers Association, a large trade association representing manufacturers of men's, women's, and children's apparel, charged yesterday that at least nine foreign countries had adopted restrictive policies that were causing their members to lose millions of dollars.

title: Television
description: 5:57 (5)Friends

title: MORE CALVES KILLED
description: PILLAGER, Minn., Nov. 4 (UPI)  Farmers slaughtered their livestock and buried the carcasses today in a protest designed to persuade President Ford to aid farmers and to dismiss Secretary of Agriculture Earl L. Butz.

title: Food Repricing Is Fading, But Buyer May Not Save
description: Repricing by supermarketsthe practice of piling new and higher price stickers on top of old oneshas become an emotional flashpoint for consumers frustrated and frightened by inflation. Responding to this anger, many chains across the country have announced they are voluntarily ending the practice, and yesterday the Nassau Board of Supervisors made its county the first in the state with a law against it. IDetails on Page 17.]

title: Guard Heavy as Kissinger Arrives in Tense Rome for Food Talks
description: ROME, Nov. 4Delegates from more than 100 nations gathered here today for the opening tomorrow of the World Food Conference, under sponsorship of the United tions.

title: Israel Banishes 4 Palestinians for Activist Roles
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 4  Israel banished four Palestinian activists to Lebanon today as part of a crackdown on proguerrilla agitation in Israelioccupied territories.

title: Leilani Favored in Melbourne Cup
description: MELBOURNE, Nov. 4 (AP)Leilani, a 3yearold mare and the winner of the Caulfield Cup, is favored in the $200,430 Melbourne Cup horse race tomorrow. There are 22 starters listed for the twomile event, which is Australia's richest and most prestigious race. Bettors are expected wager more than $25million on the race.

title: British Soccer Standing
description: British Soccer Standing

title: CITY INQUIRY FINDS GRAFT IN BUILDING
description: Scores of bribery and conspiracy indictments against city officials, businessmen and union representatives will be sought over the next few months as a result of a city investigation of corruption in the construction industry.

title: Notes on People In 6 Words, Clawson Resigns
description: The letter from Ken W. Clawson, the White House Communications Director to President Ford, said simply: I resign effective Nov. 7, 1974. Observers with an arithmetical bent and a sense of history immediately speculated that the letter probably rivaled the record for brevity in Government communications.

title: Chess In a Quiet Ending, Korchnoi Finds a Chance for a Point
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 4After almost five hours of an evenly contested 19th game of his final Candidates Match for the world championship with Anatoly Karpov, Viktor Korchnoi suddenly obtained winchances at adjournament.

title: Peking Attacks Moscow at U.N. ForHypocrisy on Disarmainent
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 4China accused the Soviet Union today of seeking to, masquerade itself as the standard brearer of nuclear disarmawhile accelerating its atomic weapons development.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The entire medical board, comprising the 25 chiefs of service at City Hospital Center at Elmhurst, Queens, resigned their administrative responsibilities, protesting against what they said was a $1.5million city budget deficit at the hospital.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Nov. 4 (AP)Portland Storm players voted today to resume practice and play this week's game against the Florida Blazers at Orlando, officials of the World Football League club said. The players had voted Saturday to stop practicing and take part in no more games until their salaries had been brought up to date.

title: Canadiens Win, 61 From North Stars
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 4 (UPI) Serge Savard, a defenseman, scored a goal and assisted on two others and Steve Shutt had two goals tonight to lead the Montreal Canadiens to a 61 victory over the Minnesota North Stars.

title: Short Coal Strike Not Feared By Utilities
description: The nation's major coalburning utilities reported yesterday that their stockpiles of coal have improved in recent weeks and they indicated that a short coal strikethree weeks or less could be sustained with few problems. Steel producers, on the other hand, said they would encounter almost immediate difficulties.

title: Advertising
description: Frequently of late, TV networks have been turning down commercials that involve the discussion of an issue of public importance. They don't want to tangle with the fairness doctrine.

title: Starr Danias Adds To Dreamy Quality Of Arpino's Places
description: Busily preparing for its Washington season and imminent tour of the Soviet Union, the City Center Joffrey Ballet still found time to offer some felicitous cast changes on Sunday. It was the last day of its current season at the 55th Street Theater.

title: One Part of Construction Story: $20 Bill Hidden in a Handshake
description: Payoffs and bribes are believed to have been a way of life in the construction industry in New York for years.

title: Events Today
description: THE LAST DAYS OF BRITISH HONDURAS, a play by Ronald Tavel; directed by David Schweizer; presented by the New York Shakespeare Festival Public Theater, Joseph Papo, producer; at the Other Stage/Public, 42$ Lafayette Street, 7.

title: Special Dividend Is Voted by Directors
description: Special Dividend Is Voted by Directors

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: CROSSWORD PUZZLE

title: World Food Crisis: Basic Ways of Life Face Upheaval
description: This article sums up a series of special reports on the world food crisis that have appeared in The New York Times. Further special reports on the subject will appear from time to time.

title: At'the Race Tracks
description: When Joanne's. Fling captured the fourth race at Aqueduct yesterday, Frank (Pancho) Martin set a record for most winners in one year by a trainer in New York State. Joanne's Fling, owned by Sigmund Sommer, was the 113th winning entry for Martin, one more than Howard (Buddy) Jacobson saddled in 1963.

title: Telephones and Offices Set Up to Help Voters
description: Throughout New York State, the polls will be open today from 6 A.M. to 9 P.M.

title: Detente With India
description: Secretary of State Kissinger's visit to the Indian subcontinent has begun the longoverdue process of restoring American priorities in South Asia to their proper order.

title: Gold Up in London To SixMonth High; Dollar Off Widely
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 4 (UPI)Gold closed in London today at its highest rate for six months, gaining more than $2 over Friday's close. The dollar dropped on most world money markets, hitting a threemonth low in Amsterdam.

title: G.M. WILL DROP ADS ON AUTO HANDLING
description: WASHINGTON, Nov, 4 (UPI) General Motors has agreed to stop advertising that its cars handle well unless it has competent scientific evidence to back up such contentions, the Federal Trade Commission announced today.

title: Government Has Its Pick of 1975 Law Graduates
description: Government Has Its Pick of 1975 Law Graduates

title: U.S, QUAKERS GIVE AID TO PEET LAO
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Nov. 2A private group of American Quakers has begun to provide what is believed to be the first aid from the United States to the Communistled Pathet Lao.

title: COAL NEGOTIATIONS BREAK DOWN AGAIN
description: WASHINGTON, Tuesday, Nov. 5Negotiations to avert a national coal strike, which is expected to begin this weekend, broke down again early today.

title: LABOR PARTY LOSES BID TO DELAY VOTE
description: Judge Charles L. Brieant Jr. ruled in Federal Court here yesterday that there was reason to believe that the ballot New York City voters would use today was confusing, but he denied a motion by the Labor party to delay the election. He also said of the ballot that there is a serious question whether it provides equal protection under the law.

title: Dr. Armstrong Resigning From Middlebury College
description: MIDDLEBURY, Vt., Nov. 4James Armstrong, president of Middlebury College since 1963, submitted his resignation today, effective Sept. 1, 1975.

title: Forecasts of Low Turnout Cloud U.S. Voting Outlook
description: Predictions of an unusually low turnoutof possibly fewer than two in every five registered votershave added a final measure of uncertainty in the national elections today. And in a campaign year when much has gone wrong for the Republicans already, experts in both major parties estimated that a light vote of the sort Republicans often pray for would prove still another Watergate bonus for Democratic candidates.

title: GAIL MOULTON, AIDE WITH ROCKEFELLERS
description: Gail F. Moulton, who retired in 1963 as staff geologist for Rockefeller Brothers, Inc., died Saturday in Vero Beach, Fla. He was 76 years old and formerly lived in Mountain Lakes, N.J.

title: Miller's $353,030 Sets P.G.A. Mark
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (UPI)With the final tour event completed, it is now official that Johnny Miller set a Professional Golfers Association record for earnings with a total purse of $353,030 for 1974. This surpassed the previous mark of $308,362 set last year by Jack Nicklaus, who was the runnerup with $238,178.

title: Kissinger Will Visit Turkey Friday for Talks on Cyprus Crisis
description: ROME, Nov. 4  Secretary of State Kissinger, seeking to prevent a cutoff in American military aid to Turkey next month, announced today that he would wind up his current trip with two days of talks on the Cyprus crisis with Turkish officials in Ankara.

title: KENNEDY CRITICIZES SERIES ON ACCIDENT
description: BOSTON, Nov. 4 (AP)Senator Edward M. Kennedy says; that some articles published in The Boston Globe last week about his Chappaquiddick auto accident in 1969 contained charges that were ugly, untrue and grossly unfair.

title: U.S, OPENS TALKS ON SPANISH BASES
description: MADRID, Nov. 4The United States and Spain today began what are expected to be lengthy negotiations on the renewal or replacement of the controversial agreement of friendship and cooperation that expires next September.

title: Byrne Rejects Casino Foes On Plea to Repudiate Ads
description: TRENTON, Nov. 4In a flurry of campaigning for tomorrow's voting in New Jersey, the chairman of the anticasino gambling forces called on Gdvernor Byrne to repudiate procasino radio commercials that seek to portray casinos as a panacea for New Jersey's fiscal crisis.

title: A Cabal of RealEstate Deals Adds To NursingHome Profits, Stein Says;
description: The Temporary State Commission on Living Costs has made public the financial history of a single nursing home in Brooklyn that it said showed 30 sales, lease changes and mortgage transfers in 10 years.

title: Sugar and the Crocodile
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4Life is sweet these days in the sugar business. Prices have gone up 300 per cent in the last year and profits are rising apace.

title: White House Aides Refuse Comment on Sampson Shift
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4White House officials would neither confirm nor deny tonight reports that Arthur F. Sampson, head of the General Services Administration, would soon be replaced.

title: 2 Airlines Offer Free Drinks on Florida Runs
description: A freeliquor controversy erupted on the New YorkFloc ida airline run yesterday.

title: Delaware Gets Custody Of Boy Farmer Adopted
description: DOVER, Del., Nov. 4Delaware obtained custody today of Juan Guzman, a 14yearold Newark boy who came here five weeks ago with a chicken farmer.

title: Records of College Football Teams for This Season and Schedules of Their Remaining Games
description: Records of College Football Teams for This Season and Schedules of Their Remaining Games

title: Tonight's Entries at Roosevelt
description: Tonight's Entries at Roosevelt

title: Foreman Demands Inquiry on Fight
description: PARIS, Nov. 4 (UPI)George Foreman charged today that there were irregularities in the world title bout he lost to Muhammad Ali in Kinshasa, Zaire, last week. He said he was appealing for an inquiry by boxing authorities.

title: MIGHTY SOUND POURS FROM RECITAL HALL
description: Sometimes, when a rock band is playing at Carnegie Hall, a regular thumping from next door intrudes on the delicate scrapings and plunkings that normally fill Carnegie Recital Hall. But not Sunday night, when the blasting impact of Varese's Integrates in the Recital Hall must have come close to drowning out the Nitty Gritty Dirt Band in the big hall.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: On Oct. 14 you printed an extraordinary letter from Gregory A. Farrell, stating that, since this country does not need any more repressive taxes, he would propose an alternative [to President Ford's] method of tax reform that would also reduce gasoline consumption. He proposes allowing taxpayers to deduct the cost of commuting on public transportation from gross income on the Federal incometax return.

title: News Summary and Index
description: News Summary and Index

title: Rams Topple 49ers by 15 13
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 4Norm Snead's debut as a San Francisco 49er didn't keep the Los Angeles Rams from strengthening their already formidable grip on the Western Division lead, but it did add excitement and suspense to a National Football League game the Rams won, 1513, before 57,502 in Candlestick Park tonight.

title: Macmillan to Cut Trade Titles 50%, Citing Economics
description: The trade department of Macmillan, Inc., plans to publish only about half as many adult and juvenile titles of general interest in 1975 as in 1974, Raymond C. Hagel, chairman, said yesterday.

title: Proud, HighSpirited Demonstrators Attend protest
description: Adolph Zusman of Far Rockaway, Queens, who fought with the 77th Division in France in World War I, surveyed the huge crowd of his fellow protesters near the United Nations yesterday with wonder and satisfaction.

title: P.N. and Egypt Discuss Space for PeaceKeeping Force
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 4United Nations officials said today that efforts were under way to secure new accommodations in the Egyptian city of Ismailia for the headquarters of the international peacekeeping force in the Sinai Peninsula following an Egyptian request to vacate the buildings the force is now occupying.

title: DIETZ IS SUBJECT OF LYRICIST NIGHT
description: The Lyrics and Lyricists series at the 92d Street Y. M.Y.W.H.A. deviated from its usual format on Sunday evening when the lyricist was Howard Dietz. The series usually gives lyricists, primarily from the Broadway theater, an opportunity to expound on their methods, their philosophies and their musical and literary adventures, accompanied by illustrations of their songs sung by the lyricists themselves and other, more professional singers.

title: Insurer's Loss Cited
description: Loews Corporation has reduced its offer for 20 million shares of the CNA Financial Corporation, the holding, company for the Continental; Insurance Company, because ofl CNA losses. In a joint statement yesterday by Loews and CNA Financial, Loews announced that it would pay $5 a share for CNA common and $6.75 a share for CNA preferred. The original, offer was $6 a share for the common and $8 a share for the preferred. In addition Loews will purchase directly from CNA Financial $25million of a new series of convertible preferred stock at the $6.75 a share price.

title: CITY INQUIRY FINDS GRAFT IN BUILDING
description: Scores of bribery and conspiracy indictments against city officials, businessmen and union representatives will be sought over the next few months as a result of a city investigation of corruption in the construction industry.

title: HOUSING OFFICE TAKEN OVER BY 20
description: About 20 demonstrators pro testing a cutback in the city's Emergency Repair Program for slum housing were arrested yesterday evening after they had occupied for more than five hours the office of Roger Starr, the city's Housing and Development Administrator.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Joseph K. McGowan of Hillsdale, N.J., a former science teacher in the Tappan Zee, N.Y., school system, was sentenced to life imprisonment for the slaying last year Joan D'Allesandro, a 7yearold Brownie scout. Superior Court Judge Morris Malech handed down the sentence Hackensack after rejecting a 45minute argument by Mr. McGowan's attorney, Donald R. Conway, that his client should be punished for seconddegree rather than firstdegree murder.

title: Kanawha County Protesters Threaten Children on Bus
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Nov. 4 (UPI)Demonstrators opposing textbooks they consider irreligious and unpatriotic tried today to empty a school bus filled with children by blockading a highway and threatening to set off an explosion, the authorities reported.

title: Trainers Mark Set By Martin
description: When Joanne's Fling captured the fourth race at Aqueduct yesterday, Frank (Pancho) Martin set a record for most winners in one year by a trainer in New York State. Joanne's Fling, owned by Sigmund Sommer, was the 113th winning entry for Martin, one more than Howard (Buddy) Jacobson saddled in 1963.

title: Briefs On The Arts
description: LONDON, Nov. 4  Lord Olivier has accepted an invitation to direct Verdi's Macbeth during the Metropolitan Opera's 197778 season in New York, it was announced here today.

title: National Horse Show Opens 8Day Run at Garden Today
description: Post time at Madison Square Garden today is 10 A.M. when 19 hunters will be led into a ring and judged for conformation to signal the start of the eightday 91st National Horse Show.

title: Concert: Horace Victorieux of Suisse Romande
description: It is considered de rigueur for an orchestra from overseas to play some music by one of its native sons. Thus when L'Orchestre de la Suisse Romande opened its series last night in Carnegie Hall, it led off with Horace Victorieux by Arthur Honegger. Though he spent most of his creative life in Paris, Honegger was Swissborn.

title: 30 HURT AS LEFTISTS STORK LISBON RALLY
description: LISBON, Nov. 4 (Reuters)At least 30 persons were injured tonight when shooting broke out as policemen pushed back hundreds of leftwingers trying to storm a rally held by the Center Democrat party.

title: Oliphant Deeper in Red
description: Jas. H. Oliphant & Co., Inc., a brokerage firm specializing in research, said yesterday it lost $123,903 in the third quarter of 1974 on revenues of $1,3million, compared with a loss of $53,692 a year earlier on revenues of $1.5million. It reported a ninemonth loss of $229,960 on $4.4million in revenues in contrast to a profit the year before of $44,377 on $5.1million in revenues.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Shipping/Mails

title: Fire at Military Academy
description: PHILADELPHIA; Nov. 4 (AP) Damage estimated at $100.000 was caused to the bell tower of Hamilton Hall at Valley Forge Military Academy by a fire yesterday that the superintendent said was caused by electrical wiring, or some boy smoking cigarettes.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: State Attorney General William F. Hyland charged 28 car dealers from Pennsylvania and 13 from New York with violation of consumer protection laws regarding the sale of new and used vehicles, He said the dealers had failed to state in newspaper advertisements whether the price included or excluded the cost of dealer preparation for new cars, The complaint, filed with Judge Irwin I Kimmelrnan in Superior Court in Essex Sounty, also alleged that the dealers had failed to disclose the bona fide odometer reading of used cars.

title: Indicted ExJudge Is Disclosed to Be An Agent of Nadjari
description: Special State Prosecutor Maurice H. Nadjari disclosed yesterday that a former Civil Court judge, indicted while he was a law secretary for conspiring to fix a murder case, later agreed to become an undercover agent for Mr. Nadjari.

title: Indicted ExJudge Is Disclosed to Be An Agent of Nadjari
description: Special State Prosecutor Maurice H. Nadjari disclosed yesterday that a former Civil Court judge, indicted while he was a law secretary for conspiring to fix a murder case, later agreed to hecome an undercover agent for Mr. Nadjari.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: PAST MASTERY One of the more modest, night spot delights in town is Catch 32, a nostalgic minimusical of vintage hits rendered by a small group of professionals in their 20's who double as bartenders, waitresses and waiters at the Tangerine (8612521), 1051 Lexington Avenue (at 75th Street).

title: Stealing From Children
description: Allegations of fiscal irregularities in several of the city's 32 community school boards range from managerial laxity to outright misappropriation and fraud. Although the charges still have to be sifted, it is already clear that the central Board of Education has failed provide effective monitoring. Furthermore, it tolerated excessive delays in the necessary followup when questionable practices began to come to light.

title: FASHION ADVISER IS SLAIN IN FLORIDA
description: Frances Bemis, a retired department store public relations executive and fashion consultant who wrote and staged the World War II Fashions of The Times productions here, was, found slain yesterday morning near her home in St. Augustine, Fla.

title: ROBERT M. BERNSTEIN
description: Robert M. Bernstein, founder and president of the Pam Clock Company of New Rochelle, N.Y., died Saturday of a heart attack at the Quaker Ridge Golf Club, Scarsdale, N.Y. He was 61 years old and lived in Rye, N.Y.

title: Wilson Belies Staff Gloom on Last Day
description: It was 6:15 in the morning of the last day of the campaign, a day when many candidates take some wellearned extra rest on the theory that everything there is to say or write has long since been said or ??? Governor Wilson was in Buffalo, holding a news conference.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts Monday, Nov. 4. 19th day. Weather clear, tratk fast.
description: Aqueduct Race Charts Monday, Nov. 4. 19th day. Weather clear, tratk fast.

title: Nothing Goes Right in This Cold, Melancholy Autumn in France
description: PARIS, Nov. 4Nothing is going right in France.

title: Soviet Launches Cosmos 693
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 4 Reuters)The Soviet Union launched another earth satellite, Cosmos 60, to continue studies of outer space, Tass, the Soviet press agency, said today.

title: L.I. Builders Reassured Over Franklin
description: Klaus Jacobs, vice chairman of the EuropeanAmerican Bank and Trust Company, which took over the failed Franklin National Bank on Oct. 8, met yesterday with representatives of the Long Island Builders Institute to assure them that the bank would not go out of the real estate lending business in that area.

title: Vote Early And Often (And Pray)
description: Brooks Hays, the nonpareil storyteller who used to represent Arkansas in Congress  likes to recall the little old lady he once encountered near a polling place on Election Day.

title: Two Major Banks Reduce Prime Rate
description: Two major banks reduced; their prime rate to 10% per; cent from 11 per cent yesterday, matching Friday's move by First National City Bank, the biggest in New York. Reducing interest: charges to their toprated corporate clients were the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company of New York and the First National Bank of Chicago. Several other banks cut their prime rate to 11 per cent from 11 per cent.

title: FOOD STAMP RISE IS TRAILING COSTS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (AP)Spiraling grocery costs are rapidly bypassing higher food stamp allowances that the Government plans to put into effect Jan. 1 to help lowincome families, new figures by the Agriculture Department indicated today.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: 8 South Koreans Arrested In Hotel Fire That Killed 88
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 4 (AP)The police arrested eight persons and questioned two others last night in connection with a fire at a downtown hotel Sunday that killed 88 guests and employes.

title: ELLIOT B. PALEY
description: Elliot B. Paley, a senior partner in the New York law firm of Nemeroff, Jelline, Danzig, Paley & Kaufman, died Sunday at his home, 215 East 86th, Street. His age was 71.

title: Steve Cady Pennsylvania's New Land of Promise
description: CORNWELLS HEIGHTS, Pa., Nov. 4Smelling of fresh paint, cement and money, Keystone Race Track rises like huge creamcolored warehouse on oncewoodsy land only a furlong or two from the Pennsylvania Turnpike. Its stands are wrapped in a greenhouse cocoon of glass, its stillbare lawns surrounded by a concentrationcamp fence topped by three ugly strands of barbed wire. Yet most the 14,248 customers who found their way here today for the opening of thoroughbred racing's newest separation center either didn't notice the deficiencies, or didn't care. Half an hour before post time, horseplayers stood in line at the parimutuel windows with the confidence treasurehunters about to start digging where X marks the spot.

title: Long Branch Accord Ratified, Ending 2Week School Strike
description: LONG BRANCH, Nov. 4Striking teachers, custodians and secretarial personnel today approved a new twoyear contract with the Long Branch Board of Education, ending a twoweek strike.

title: General Motors Is Cutting Its Dividend By 64% to 85 Cents in Final Quarter
description: The General Motors Corporation, responding to a decline in profits and sales along with a surge in costs, announced yesterday that it was trimming its yearend dividend to 85 cents a sharea 64 per cent drop from the $2.35 a share total declared a year earlier.

title: CARLUCCI REPORTED CHOICE FOR LISBON
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4Frank C. Carlucci 3d, Under Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, will soon be appointed Ambassador to Portugal, State Department sources said today.

title: Unlikely Bill Joins Sunday's Heroes
description: There are 1,222 players in the National Football League and most are far from famous. On occasion, one of these anonymous athletes comes into focus and so it was Sunday with Dave V. Washington of the Buffalo Bills. Dave V. has been bouncing around the N.F.L. since 1970 and he is a reserve linebacker who earns most of his pay on the special kick teams.

title: Books of The Times
description: According to Alberto Moravia, the Africa sickness that seizes many whites who go there is a form of nostalgia for the world before history. He defines history as the name given by humanity to its own autonomy and victory over natural conditions. History weighs heavily on Western culture. It is intoxicated with history, and today this intoxication seems closer to that of a crying or paranoid drunk than to a happy one who is feeling no pain., was a complement to the powerless power of Western civilization, a hallucinatory alternative, an indispensable, irreplaceable source of antihistory. It was a refuge not yet overgrown with definition or choked by categories.

title: Man Gets 8 to 25 Years In Kidnapping of Boy, 14
description: MAYVILLE, N. Y., Nov. 4 (AP)Martin C. Whitmore was sentenced today to eight and a third to 25 years in the kidnapping of a 14yearol boy whose bludgeoned body was later found tied to a tree.

title: Une de Mai Loses Foal
description: WESTBURY, LI., Nov. 4 (AP)Une de Mai, retired French trotter lost, a foal by Nevele Pride that she was carrying. Jean Rene Gougeon, who trained and, drove the mare throughout a career in which she became harness racing's leading moneywinner, reported the incident today to Roosevelt Raceway officials.

title: Unions and Dairy Coops Gifts Report LastMinute Gifts
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (AP)Lastminute reports of big campaign donitions piled up in Government offices today, but voters must wait until next year to get the  full story Of 11thhour spending and borrowing in this election.

title: People and Business
description: The depressed housing industry may be in for something of a pickup next year at a time some other industries are encountering their own lean times. Oakley Hunter, chairman of the Federal National Mortgage Association, told security analysts in Boston yesterday that he expects housing starts to rise to 1.7 million from about 1.5 million this year.

title: Dow Average Off by 8.05; Late Buying Cuts Losses
description: The growing prospect of a nationwide coal strike unsettled the stock market yesterday and prices retreated across the board, although late buying reduced the losses.

title: Dean Visits White House To Check His Records
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (UPI)Former White House counsel John W. Dean 3d, key accuser of President Nixon in the Watergate scandal, returned to the White House today to review his files and records.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: Members of the Red Bank Regional football team make a minimum of noise in the fieldhouse Saturday mornings as they make final preparations for the afternoon game. They leave the noise to the stereo cassette player.

title: Coal Offer Rejected
description: Negotiations to avert a nationwide coal strike collapsed early today when the United Mine. Workers rejected an industry offer. Arnold R. Miller, the union president, said mine management has just declared a strike. Details, Page 11.

title: Islander Defense Battered
description: On the bus ride home after his team's 31 defeat in the Philadelphia Spectrum Sunday night, Denis Potvin of the New York Islander was overcome with muscle cramps and nausea. The Islanders bus rolled off the highway and an ambulance took Potvin to the nearest hospital. The 21yearold defenseman was treated for salt loss and exhaustion and released yesterday morning.

title: Maj. Gen. George Horkan Dies; Berlin Blockade Quartermaster
description: Maj. Gen. George A. Horkan, Quartermaster General of the Army from 1951 to his retirement in.1954, died Saturday in Walter Reed Army Medical Center. He was 80 years old.

title: Rivals in Connecticut Press Ahead.
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 4Both major candidates for Governor campaigned vigorously today, despite public opinion polls and expert predictions that the contest was as good as over.

title: HUSSEIN TO REVISE REGIME TO ERASE WEST BANK'S ROLE
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Nov. 4Jordan intends to rewrite her Constitution soon and to reorganize her Cabinet and Parliament to remove representatives of the Palestinians living in the Israeli  occupied West Bank from her Government, King Hussein said in an interview today.

title: HARRY A. KULJIAN, ENGINEER, IS DEAD
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 4 (UPI) Harry A. Kuljian, a prominent engineer who founded the Kuljian Corporation, an industrial construction company based here, died Saturday. He was 79 years old and lived in Gladwyne, Pa.

title: Mets, Good Diplomats, Lose Again
description: TOKYO, Nov. 4The United States Ambassador to Japan gave a reception for the New York Mets tonight and showed a fine sense of diplomacy by declining to ask why they hadn't beaten the Tokyo Giants during the first two weeks of their tour of Japan.

title: 3 City Center Employes Seized In BoxOffice Swindle of $1,500
description: Three boxoffice employes were arrested yesterday on indictments charging them with swindling the City Center of $1,500 by reporting as unsold tickets that had been purchased through reservations made at department stores.

title: Sports Today
description: Knicks vs. Rockets, at Houston. (TelevisionChannel 9, 9 P.M.)

title: Costs of Ford Campaign Being Tallied by Aides
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (AP) President Ford's 16,685mile campaign tours in 20 states cost the Republican National Committee uncounted thou sands of dollars, and his plane, Air Force One, consumed more than 77,000 gallons of jet fuel.

title: Red Bank Rail Line Is Expected to Return to Normal Service Today
description: NEWARK, Nov. 4Commuter service on the Central of New Jersey Railroad's Red Bank to New York run is expected to be near normal tomorrow following repairs to about 400 feet of track damaged by the derailment of a 10car freight train at a residential section of Hazlet in Monmouth County late yesterday.

title: HUSSEIN TO REVISE REGIME TO ERASE WEST BANK'S ROLE
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Nov. 4Jordan intends to rewrite her Constitution soon and to reorganize her Cabinet and Parliament to remove representatives of the Palestinians living in the Israeli  occupied West Bank from her Government, King Hussein said in an interview today.

title: Ford Fears 21% of Voters Will Elect New Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 President Ford warned the American people today against a light vote in tomorrow's election. He said that some surveys indicated that only 21 per cent of the voters would select the Congress with which he must work to control inflation, strengthen the economy and preserve peace in the world.

title: About New York A Visit With John Lindsay, Esq.
description: Dear John, I acknowledge your return to the world of reality, the note began, and it was signed Warren. Warren was Warren E. Burger, the Chief Justice of the United States, and John was John V. Lindsay. Mr. Burger had written to say that he thought the law was an honorable profession, and that he was glad Mr. Lindsay had gone back into it. Mr. Lindsay wrote a note back and said that he was glad, too.

title: No Charge Planned in Death
description: TUCKERTON, Nov. 5 (UPI) Tthe police here ??? charges will be brought against Charles Ross 3d, 15 years old, who they said accidentally killed his broker, Kmueth Lee, 11, Sunday right was a ??? that Charles thought was not loaded.

title: DEMOCRATS UPSET G.O.P. IN SUFFOLK
description: BLUE POINT, L. I., Wednesday, Nov. 6In a series of stunning upsets, Suffolk County Democrats yesterday captured the District Attorney's office and at least two and possibly all three of the Congressional seats being contested in this traditionally overwhelmingly Republican county.

title: Big Winner Who Changed Her Mind
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 5Ella Rosa Giovanna Oliva Tambussi Grasso once said she would not want to be Governor, that a woman could not be Governor and manage a family at the same time. She changed her mind.

title: A U.S. JUDGE SCORES TAILINGS DUMP SITE
description: MINNEAPOLIS Nov. 5 (AP) Judge Miles Lord of Federal District Court warned the Reserve MXining Company yesterday that its plan for onland taconite tailings disposal at the Lax Lake site may be as shabby and hollow as thep revious one.

title: Cahn Is Beaten by Dillon In a Major Nassau Upset
description: MINEOLA, L.1., Nov. 5Nassau County Democrats scored a major upset in today election with the triumph of Denis Dillon over William Cahn, the District Attorney for the last 12 years.

title: Hockey, Basketball Standings
description: Nat'l Hockey League Nat'l Basketball Ass'n Amer. Basketball Ass'n World Hockey Ass'n

title: Radio
description: 67 A.M., WNYCFM: Sunrise Symphony. Violin Concerto No. 2, Bach; Symphony No, 103, Haydn.

title: ShakeUp by Carey
description: Representative Hugh L. Carey's victory will have far, reaching ramifications in the government and politics of state that has been dominated by Nelson A. Rockefeller and the Republican party for News nearly a generation. Governmentally, there Analyses will be vast changes in state office personnel. There will be some new proposals but, because of the poor economy, undoubtedly less than promised. There will be the same struggle to keep the state budget under control. There will probably be new taxes, but they will fall more heavily on business and highincome New Yorkers.

title: Jackson to Decide Soon On Candidacy for 1976
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP)  Senator Henry M. Jackson said tonight that he may decide before early January whether to declare himself a candidate for the 1976 Democratic Presidential nomination.

title: Fugitive Cow Corralled By Police in Brooklyn
description: A Black Angus cow destined for a Brooklyn home freezer broke away from a trailer last night and led a posse of neighborhood youngsters and police radio cars on a mile chase.

title: Donor Gives and Gives
description: MOLINE, Ill. (AP)Joseph Kerkofsky, a 61yearold former guard, has donated 189 pints of blood since World War II at is veterans hospital and through Red Cross chapters.

title: High Tides Around New York
description: High Tides Around New York

title: Challenge for Ford By R. W. APPLE Jr.
description: In the end, it was a stampede.

title: Vorster Thanks 3 Nations For Veto of U.N. Expulsion
description: NIGEL, South Africa, Nov, 5 (Reuters)  Prime Minister John Vorster thanked the United States, Britain and France tonight for keeping his country in the United Nations.

title: Ashe Beats Gerulaitis,
Father Is Held in Halloween Poison Death of Son, 8
description: PASADENA, Tex., Nov. 5 (UPI)The police filed murder charges today against the father of an 8yearold boy who was poisoned on halloween by a candy strew filled with cyanide.

title: INCUMBENTS WIN IN COUNCIL RACES
description: All of the incumbent City Councilmen up for reelection won sweeping victories last night, including Angelo J. Arculeo, the Republican minority leader and the only one who had been deemed in a battle.

title: Flanigan Inquiry Pressed, Watergate Aides Report
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (UPI) Watergate special prosecutors are carrying out an extensive investigation of activities by former Nixon White House aide Peter Flanigan whom President Ford wants to install as Ambassador to Spain, according to sources in the prosecutor's office.

title: Democrat Wins Seat in Vermont Aiken Held 34 Years
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., Nov. 5A democratic Senator was eleced in Vermont today for first time since the Republican party was founded in 1854.

title: Saigon, in a Reversal, Confirms Villager's Death During Protest
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Nov. 6The Government reversed itself today and confirmed that a man was killed during an antiGovernment demonstration Saturday at a village 55 miles northeast of Saigon.

title: LAXITY CHARGED TO SCHOOL BOARD
description: The head of the organization that represents most of the city's community school boards yesterday blamed School Chancellor Irving Anker and the Central Board of Education for not acting sooner to correct reported irregularities in some local districts.

title: 5 Charged in Theft
description: 40 % of Old Coins Retrieved by F.B.I.

title: Loot Covered by Insurance Is All Robbers Will Taker
description: WHITE BEAR LAKE, Minn., Nov. 5 (AP)Two gunmen robbed a bar yesterday but took only money they believed was covered by insurance. The men, lone armed with a revolver and the other with a rifle, forced the bartender, Don Huber, to turn over $400 from the cash register at the Sherwood Lounge.

title: Two Testify Single Shot Preceded Kent State Volley
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 5 (UPI)Two photographers testified in the United States District Court here today that they heard a single shot before Ohio National Guardmen fired a 13second volley into a group of antiwar demonstrators at Kent State University on May 4, 1970. Four students were killed and nine wounded.

title: Commodity Price Index Fell 2.3 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuff and industrial materials fell to 228.6 last week from 230.9 the previous week.

title: Austria Indicates Interest In OilSharing Proposal
description: VIENNA, Nov. 5 (Reuters)Austria hopes to join the industrialized nations oilsharing Scheme if it does not violate her neutrality, Foreign Minister Erich BielkaKarltreu said today.

title: British Football
description: TEXACO CUP

title: 3 Shoot Girl, Terrorize 7 And Hold Up 5 in Rampage
description: A teenaged girl on her way home from church was critically wounded and seven companions were terrorized in Jamaica, Queens, Monday night by three men who, in a onehour rampage, also held up two watchmen and robbed three political campaign workers of their cash and valuables and their rented auto van.

title: Link to Drugs Is Sought In Jersey Police Killing
description: UNION CITY, N. J., Nov. 5Police Chief Herman H. Bolte said today his department had been unable to determine whether the killing of a narcotic detective in a streetcorner shootout yesterday was related to drug investigation.

title: Islanders Tie Flyers In Rough Game, 4 to 4
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., Nov. 5  Performing like Devil's Islanders rather than Long Islanders, New York's best hockey team fought back to tie the Philadelphia Flyers, 44, tonight as Billy Harris scored with 34 seconds left and the Islander goalie off the ice.

title: SaudiGerman Panels Set
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 5, (AP)Saudi Arabia and West, Germany has set up six working committees to explore industrial and economic cooperation between the two countries, the Saudi State radio reported today. The broadcast said the committees would concentrate on investment policy, automotive engineering plants, energy and chemical industries, iron and steel foundries, building construction and agriculture.

title: Breakout Attempted From Belfast Jail Used in Internment
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Wednesday, Nov. 6 (Reuters)seven prisoners at the Maze. Jail near here escaped early today and authorities in helicopters were searching for two men who remained at large, a British Army spokesman said.

title: Bridge: For Move to New Quarters Cavendish Club Shut for Day
description: For the first time for many years, the world's most famous bridge club is closed today. The Cavendish Club, as old as the game of contract and home of many of the game's greatest players during half a century, closed its premises at 23 Central Park South last night. It will reopen tomorrow in elegant new quarters at the Carlton House, 680 Madison Avenue.

title: U.S.SOVIET TALKS ON WEAPONS RECESS
description: GENEVA, Nov. 5The negotiations between the United States and the Soviet Union on a 10year pact to limit their offensive nuclear weapons were recessed today to permit the two delegations to return home for consultations.

title: It's Also Politics at Big A
description: The latearriving crowd that turned out in damp weather at Aqueduct yesterday might have been politically minded because of the election. If so, they could have favored such thoroughLobbyist and Tell Meno Lies.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: The Continental Telephone Corporation filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission yesterday in connection with a proposed sale, through underwriters headed by E. F. Hutton & Co., of 2.5 million common shares. Proceeds of the sale will be used to repay revolving credit bank loans.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts; 1974, by Triangle Publications, Inc. (The Daily Racing Form) Tuesday, Nov. 5. 20th day. Weather showery, track fast.
description: Aqueduct Race Charts; 1974, by Triangle Publications, Inc. (The Daily Racing Form) Tuesday, Nov. 5. 20th day. Weather showery, track fast.

title: HARRY FRANKEL
description: Harry Frankel, a governor of the Weizmann Institute of Science and a vice president of the American Committee for the Weizmann Institute of Science, died Monday in Rehovot, Israel. He was 78 years old and lived in recent years in Miami Beach.

title: LEVITT MARGIN BIG
description: Representative Hugh L. Carey was elected Governor of New York State yesterday in a sweeping victory that followed almost 16 years of Republican rule in Albany.

title: The Election at a Glance
description: The following table shows the winners in key contests yesterday ('denotes incumbent):

title: Traffic Death Toll Declines
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 5 (UPI)There were 8,440 fewer traffic fatalities during the first nine months of 1974 than in the same period last year, the National Safety Council said today. Vincent Tofany, president of the council, said that 33,730 deaths occurred during the first nine months of this year compared with 42,170 in 1973

title: LLISO GROUP PLAYS TWO OF HIS WORKS
description: The Pan American Symphony Orchestra, a threeyearold, 24piece ensemble founded and conducted by Joseph Lliso, deserves encouragement for its good intentions, but it should try to do less and do it better. In its long program in Town Hall on Monday night, it showed that it had many fine players, yet the performances were far from polished, and the string Section needed bolstering in strength and accuracy.

title: Mills Overcomes Arkansas Challenge
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Nov. 5 Representative Wilbur D. Mills, the Democratic chairman of the House Ways and Means, Committee, won reelection today but by a smaller margin, than he had expected.

title: Election and Economy.
description: Will the big Democratic gains in yesterday's election make any difference to the national economy or have any impact on the ness to accept a recession as Ford Administration's willingthe necessary cost for bringing inflation down? For the time being, the answer is no. In the period just before the election, Secretary of the Treasury William E. Simon serving as economic spokesman for the President, declared that the Administration would not change its economic proposals, including its call for a surtax on personal and corporate income, despite growing evidence that the economy is sliding deeper into recession.

title: LAXITY CHARGED TO SCHOOL BOARD
description: The head of the organization that represents most of the city's community school boards yesterday blamed School Chanceller Irving Anker and the Central Board of Education for not acting sooner to correct reported irregularities in some local districts.

title: Sweden Seeks Part Of Company Prof its For a Rainy Day
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 5The Social Democratic Government proposed legislation today to syphon high profits from Sweden's booming companies and place them into a rainy day fund that could be used in the event of a recession.

title: Candidate in Accident
description: ENGLEWOOD, Colo., Nov. 5 (AP)  Gary Hart, Democratic candidate for Senate, was a passenger in a car involved in a minor traffic, accident on election eve, but no one was seriously hurt, the police said. The driver of the car Mr. Hart was in, Bill L. Holen, a 28yearold campaign aide, was charged with careless driving.

title: Court Reinstates a Suit On Democrats Phone Debt
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 5 (UPI) The United States Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit yesterday reinstated a suit that demands that the American Telephone and Telegraph Company collect $1.5million for services at the Democratic convention in Chicago in 1968.

title: Senate and House Margins Are Substantially Enlarged
description: Democrats swept yesterday toward domination of the next Congress as voters across the nation apparently blamed Republicans for the Watergate scandal and for economic disruption.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: A festival of films edited by women, described as the first of its kind, titled, Moviescope: The Film Editor's Art, will be held at 7:30 P.M., Dec. 1 through Dec. 6 at the Women's Interart Center, 549 West 52d Street. The theatrical and television films to be shown will be followed by discussions by the editors who worked on them.

title: Advertising
description: Value House, the catalogue showrooms, and Rickel, the doityourself centers, which are both divisions of the Supermarkets General Corporation, have just begun new advertising campaigns.

title: Israel Affirms Stand on Palestinian Role
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 5Premier Yitzhak Rabin told Parliament today that Israel could not accept the decision of the Arab leaders last week to recognize the Palestine Liberation Organization as the sole legitimate representative of the Palestinian people.

title: Youth, 19, Ejected From a Jersey Court Arrested as Slayer of Presiding Judge
description: WANAQUE, N. J., Nov. 5A 19yearold laborer, reportedly angered when a municipal magistrate ordered him out of a courtroom here last night for causing a disturbance, was arrested today and charged with having killed the judge about half an hour later by firing a shot through a window of the Courtroom.

title: NEWS GROUPS FIGHT WIRE RATE CHANGES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP) National news wire services and broadcast spokesmen testified today that the Bell System's new rates for leased lines would mean that many newspapers and radio stations in many small towns would not be able to afford news wires.

title: Dr. Howard White Dies at 62; Former Dean at the New School
description: Dr. Howard B. White, professor of political science and former dean of the Graduate Faculty of Political and Social Sciences at the New School, died Monday. He was 62 years old and lived at 205 Waterside Road, Northport, L. I.

title: Kidnapping Suspect Is 15
description: IRVING, Tex., Nov. 5 (UPI)The police said today that 15year  old, perhaps working alone, had kidnapped a 5yearold and held him half a day while demanding a $10,000 ransom.
