The victim, Robert David Lacey, was unharmed. The suspect was on the telephone almost continually with the boy's parents, said police Lieut. G. B. Simon. That's how we traced the call.

title: UPSTATE UTILITY SET TO SELL COAL
description: Orange, and Rockland Utiltides Inc., has received permission from the New York public Service Commission to sell up to 35,000 tons of coal and more than 3,300 overhead distribution transformers.

title: C.I.A. Protest at Harvard
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 5 (UPI)About 250 persons, including Daniel Ellsberg, demontrated at Harvard University tonight to protest an appearance of William Colby, director if the Central Intelligence Agency. Mr. Colby was at the university for an address at the Harvard Faculty Club.

title: Kissinger Flies to Cairo To Assess Talk Outlook
description: CAIRO Nov. 5Secretary of State Kissinger arrived here tonight to find out whether further United States mediation efforts in the Middle East were still welcome.

title: Mills Holds Lead
description: Representative Wilbur D. Mills, the Democratic chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, held a small lead over his challenger in Arkansas, Judy Petty. Page 37.

title: Democrats Win Assembly, But G.O.P. Holds Senate
description: The Democrats won control of the Assembly last night, Sweeping the Republicans out under a challenge led by Stanley Steingut of Brooklyn, who ??? likely to be the next Speaker of the Assembly.

title: Money
description: Money

title: JULIUS JARCHO DIES; ZIONIST PUBLISHER, 69
description: Julius R. Jarcho, long active in Zionist affairs, died Monday at Gracie Square Hospital. He was 69 years old and lived at 124 West 79th Street.

title: UAL Increases Bid For Avis Common
description: UAL, Inc., parent of United Airlines, yesterday announced that it had increased its offer for shares of Avis, Inc., 52 per cent owned by the International Telephone & Telegraph Corporation, to $8.25 a share for outstanding common stock. The purchase will be payable in the form of UAL senior notes to I.T.T. and cash to public shareholders. Six million shares of Avis common, are outstanding, including 3.1 million shares owned by I.T.T.

title: MISS DEXTER TAKES NEW TACK AS SINGER
description: Baby Jane Dexter, a large woman whose early career as an entertainer focused on selfdeprecating jokes about her size, is trying to put that behind her and to win acceptance as a straightforward singer, She is making her first appearance in this new guise at Reno Sweeney with a program that draws on such varied sources as Nellie Lutcher, Cole Porter and Bob Dylan, although most of her material comes from Randy Newman.

title: A Plan to Reorganize Boston Schools Defeated
description: BOSTON, Nov. 5 (AP)  A proposed reorganization of the Boston school system was overwhelmingly rejected today.

title: Mills Defeats Rival
description: Representative Wilbur D. Mills, Democrat of Arkansas, the chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, turned back a strong challenge by his Republican rival, Judy Petty. Page 37.

title: Laxalt Is Leading for Senate in Nevada
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Nov. 5Paul Laxalt, a Republican former Governor who lost a bid for the Senate by 84 votes in 1964, built an early lead tonight in a second attempt to become Nevada's junior Senator.

title: The 116: a Club for Capital's In People
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 An inconspicuous row house tucked away in a oncenotorious alley on Capitol Hill has evolved into a headquarters of subterranean power, a place where Senators, Representatives and Federal officials do their lobbying.

title: Boston Gravediggers Strike
description: BOSTON, Nov. 5 (AP)A strike by 77 gravediggers has closed 20 Boston area cemeteries controlled by the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Boston. The dispute involves less than $1 per person per week, according to Herbert Bradley, president of the Greenhouse and Cemetery Workers Local 1285.

title: PRAVDA BIDS WEST RETURN TO GOLD
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 5 With gold prices rising on Western markets, the Communist party daily newspaper Pravda today advised Western nations to return to the gold standard to curb the currency chaos in the capitalist world.

title: Deaths
description: Deaths

title: Houston Murder Hearing Set
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 5 (AP)A hearing was set today for Nov. 13 to decide if the murder trial of David Owen Brooks, 19 years old, should be moved from Houston. Judge William Hatten of District Court set the hearing date and recognzied two new lawyers for Mr. Brooks, who is accused in four of 27 deaths of boys in Houston in three years. Elmer Wayne Henley, 18, was convicted in six of the deaths and is serving a 594year prison term.

title: Schlesinger Bids Europe Build Forces
description: MUNSTER, West Germany, Nov. 5Secretary of Defense James R. Schlesinger called on the European allies of the United States today to add to allied strength to match the increases in the military power of the Warsaw Pact countries.

title: Javits Wins a 4th Term, Defeating Ramsey Clark
description: Jacob K. Javits won his fourth terin as United States Senator from New York yesterday, overcoming the antiRepublican disaffection spawned by Watergate and the folksy challenge of Ramsey Clark, a Democrat who shaped his campaign to capitalize on the mood of antipolitics.

title: Suit Filed on Burning Blouse
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 5 (UPI)A $7million lawsuit was filed yesterday in San Francisco on behalf of a 10yearold girl, Billie Ann Moore, of Stockton, who was severely burned after the blouse she was wearing caught fire when she was playing with matches. The suit against AvonDale, Inc., a New York City clothing maker, charged that the blouse had been labeled 100 per cent cotton although, the suit contended, 90 per cent of it was composed of inflammable synthetic material.

title: Bach Collegium Displays Its Knowledge of Baroque
description: The Bach Collegium of New York presented a pleasant evening of music by the group's eponymous composer on Monday night in Carnegie Recital Hall. There were four arias and a duet from various cantatas sung by Judith Hubbell, soprano, and Jonathan Rigg, tenor, as well as an assortment of instrumental music for violin (Yuval Waldman), oboe (Virginia Brewer), cello (Ruth Glasser) and harpsichord (Edward Brewer).

title: 2 Orangutans Born at Zoo
description: MADISON, Wis., Nov. 5 (UPI) The Vilas Park Zoo has announced the birth of orangutan twins. The orangutans, born Halloween night, were at the University of Wisconsin Primate Center today. Officials said that perhaps no more than three other orangutans have been born in captivity.

title: OFFER BY SOVIET TO CHINA PRESSED
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 5  Mongolia, in a move believed to have been inspired by Moscow, called on China today to accept a Soviet offer of an agreement renouncing the use of force in SovietChinese relations.

title: Teachers Back in Classes After Long Branch Strike
description: LONG BRANCH, Nov. 5 (AP) Teacher's custodians and secretaries returned to work today in this Monmouth County community following settlement of a strike that began Oct. 22.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Representative Hugh L. Carey was elected Governor of New. York State in a sweeping victory that came after almost.16 years of Republican rule in Albany. His running mate on the Democratic slate, State Senator Mary Anne Krupsak, will become the first woman Lieutenant Governor of the state. Mr. Carey, the first Roman Catholic to be elected Governor since Alfred E. Smith, was instantly mentioned for the national ticket in 1974. [Page 1, Columns 18.]

title: Lithuanian Sailor Freed by Soviet Arrives in U.S.
description: A seaman from the Soviet Republic of Lithuania who tried to defect to the United States four years ago arrived here yesterday.

title: TV: Winning and Losing
description: Smartly seizing the Constitutionmade opportunity, the Daniel Wilson Production Company, in association with ABC News, has used yesterday's election for today's Afterschool Special, which can be seen on the ABC network at 4:30 P.M. Winning and Losing: Diary of a Campaign is an imaginative and effective rarity in programing for young people: a practical and comprehensible civics lesson.

title: Senator Packwood Reelected in Oregon
description: PORTLAND, Ore. Nov. 5 (AP)  Republican Senator Robert W. Packwood defeated his Democratic challenger, Betty Roberts, but Democrats claimed the Governship and won or held leads in all four Congressional races.

title: LINE C LEAD HELD BY CONSERVATIVES
description: The Conservative party, which took Line C, the third line on the ballot, away from the Liberals in 1966 and rele gated them to Line D, appeared on the basis of early unofficial returns in yesterday's contest for Governor to have a good chance to hold its superior position.

title: School Boycott Is Intensified By Whites in South Boston
description: BOSTON, Nov. 5 (AP)About 5 per cent of the projected number of white students enrolled at South Boston High School came to classes today, with 124 white students attending compared with 442 yesterday, according to school officials.

title: Market Place
description: Although state regulatory agencies are generally believed to be the court of last resort for utilities seeking higher rates, eight companies are instead asking the Federal Power Commission to intervene.

title: U.S. Proposes 3 New Groups on Hunger
description: ROME, Nov. 5  Secretary of State Kissinger proposed to the World Food Conference today the establishment of three new international bodies to coordinate efforts to avert spreading famine and renewed international tensions.

title: Dave Anderson Craig Morton Finally Has a Team
description: Until two weeks ago Craig Morton always had been a quarterback without a team. He was in his 10th season with the Dallas Cowboys, but the Cowboys had never been his. In recent years he stood on the sideline while Roger Staubach played. Before that, he had been the starter for two seasons, but Staubach was always hovering behind him. Earlier he had stood on the sideline for four years when the Cowboys were Don Meredith's team. But two weeks ago Craig Morton joined the New York Giants and for the first time in his National Football League career he was the only quarterback who really mattered. He finally had a team that was his. Some of his new teammates realized that a week ago Sunday night.

title: Democrats Score Gains In Contests for Governor
description: Broad victories in Governors races yesterday gave the Democratic party a variety of fresh executive faces to match its legislative majorities in Congress, and appeared to lay solid organizational base for national Democratic campaign in 1976.

title: Draft Resister Is Freed
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 5 (AP)Jon M. Bach, 27yearold draft resister who was arrested last week at a commune here that promotes nonviolent resistance, was released from the city jail yesterday by United States marshals. The marshals took custody of Mr. Bach, drove him outside the jail and told him he was free to leave the car.

title: Judge Gerry Is Grateful For U.S. Appointrivnt,
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Nov. 5 John Francis Gerry, a 47yearold South Jersey judge with two years experience on the Camden County and State Superior Court benches, said today he was very grateful to learn that he had been nominated by President Ford to a seat on the Federal District Court for New Jersey.

title: Market Averages
description: Tuesday, November 5, 1974

title: Youth, 19, Ejected From Wanaque Court Arrested in Slaying of Presiding Judge
description: WANAQUE, N.J., Nov. 5A 19yearold laborer, reportedly angered when a municipal magistrate ordered him out of a courtroom here last night for causing a disturbance, was arrested today and charged with having killed the judge about half an hour later by firing a shot through a window of the courtroom.

title: Jersey Republicans Lose 4 of 7 Seats in the House
description: Republicans in New Jersey suffered their worst election defeat in recent history yesterday, losing four of their seven Congressional seats to Democratic opponents.

title: Witness Wasn't Able to Identify Carter At First, Homicide Detective Testifies
description: JERSEY CITY, Nov. 5Less than two days after the triple murder of, which Rubin (Hurricane) Carter and a friend were later convicted, a vital witness was unable to identify either man as the killer, the detective in charge of the investigation testified today.

title: Guild to Seek Court Order Against Paper in Cleveland
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 5 (UPI)Members of the Newspaper Guild at the Cleveland Press voted unanimously last night to seek a court order prohibiting The Press, an evening newspaper, from halting publication during the guild strike against The Cleveland Plain Dealer.

title: A Listing of New Books
description: Feral, by Berton Roueche (Harper & Row, $5.95). Strange doings of some cats.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The count of ballots in the election of officers of the Taxi Drivers Union has been postponed until next week as a result of disputes over how the count should proceed. Supporters of one of the slates had asked for a separate ballot count for fleet drivers, owner drivers and pensioners. An arbitrator, Israel Ben Scheiber, set a hearing on the issues in dispute for next Monday.

title: Ribicoff Wins Third Term; Democrats Lead in House
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 5United States Senator Abraham A. Ribicoff won reelection to a third term today in an overwhelming victory over his Republican opponent, James H. Brannen 3d.

title: Fire Aboard Airliner
description: BOSTON, Nov. 5(UPI)Fire broke out in the cockpit of an Allegheny Airlines plane with 37 persons aboard as it approached Boston today, but the plane landed at Logan International Airport without serious incident. A spokesman for the Massachusetts Port Authority said no one was injured. The plane was en route to Boston from Chicago.

title: WESTCHESTER RACE IS WON BY PEYSER
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov 5Peter Peyser, a twoterm Republican who won his last election by only 1,400 votes, apparently resisted the Democratic ternd inearly returns tonight by winning reelection in Westchester's County's 23d Congressional District.

title: Fewer Jobless in Canada
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 5 (AP)Canada's unemployment rate dropped to 5.4 per cent last month from 5.8 per cent in September. Statistics Canada, which keeps figures for the Government said much of the improvement occurred among women workers over the age of 25.

title: Of Roots And Exile
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.Uri Eyed is an Israeli who was born and grew up in Haifa. Meeting Palestinians at home and abroad, Uri Eyed came to reject the false, stereotyped image of them he had acquired. Uri Eyed found that the dominant cliches used to characterize Palestinians were remote from his experience of them. And, if in the end, Uri Eyed came to share nothing else with Palestinians, or they with him, he came to share his humanity and fixation on Palestine to look into one another's eyes and see our own agony reflected.

title: 2 Brooklyn Areas Fight Prostitution, With Contrasting Results
description: The show starts on schedule just around midnight, sometimes earlier, every night in the Fort Greene section of Brooklyn along South Elliott Place. A lineup of prostitutes loiters outside two brownstones. There's a steady procession of cars (many with New Jersey plates), open soliciting, sudden temporary disappearances by the women minutes before marked or unmarked police cars cruise past.

title: Democrats Score Gains In Contests for Governor
description: Democrats were elected Governors yesterday in New York and Massachusetts, two bigstate prizes that have long eluded them. Democrats also won elections to succeed Republican governors in Connecticut, Tennessee and apparently in Colorado.

title: LIVESTOCK KILLED IN PRICE PROTEST
description: PILLAGER, Minn., Nov. 5 (AP)An estimated total of 150 central Minnesota farmers, angry at low livestock prices, killed more than 300 cattle, hogs and sheep yesterday and dumped them into an open trench.

title: JUSTICE AIDES SENT TO 3 STATES IN SOUTH
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (UPI) The Justice Department said today that it had sent ??? Federal voting observers into secCons of Alabama, Georgia and Mississippi to safeguard the rights of minority voters and candidates.

title: Dukakis, a Democrat, Ousts Sargent In Governor Race in Massachusetts
description: BOSTON, Nov. 5Michael S. Dukakis, a Democrat, won the Governorship of Massachusetts today from Francis W. Sargent, the Republican incumbent.

title: Merger Is Reported
description: The New York Stock Exchange reported yesterday that the merger of G. H. Walker, Laird, Inc., into White, Weld & Co., Inc., became effective Nov. I.

title: Bomb Kills Newspaper Carrier
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 5 (UPI) A 15yearold newspaper carrier was killed today in an explosion of a small bomb that the police say may have been planted as part of a feud between motorcycle gangs. The youth, Larry O. Anstett, was killed about 6:10 A.M. whenapparently out of curiosityhe touched a bomb on a car parked in front of a home on Milwaukee's North Side.

title: 1975 AUTO SALES AT DECADE'S LOW
description: DETROIT, Nov. 5Newcar sales in October were off nearly 27 per cent from yearearlier levels, the worst performance for new models in a decade, and Chrysler announced yesterday it was laying off another 10,100 workers indefinitely to keep production in line with lagging sales.

title: The winning New Jersey daily lottery slumber yesterday was:
description: Tickets matching the number Win $10,000. Tickets with the five numbers in reverse win $1,000 Tickets with the first or last four numbers in order Win $225. Tickets with the first, middle or last three numbers in sequence win $25. Losing tickets are eligible for a special prize drawn on Thursdays.

title: Elcock, Head, Healing Wounds in International Tennis
description: A big, heavy fellow with nonnonsense look, Walter Elcock may be the troubleshooter international tennis has needed so desperately. The 51yearold Bay Stater, who took over as head of the International Lawn Tennis Federation after serving as president of the United States Lawn Tennis Association, has broken one impasse (despite French and Italian grumblings) and is working to disolve others.

title: Soviet Rock Musical Taps Jesus Christ Superstar Tunes
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 5The music from Jesus Christ Superstar, long only a hot blackmarket item in the Soviet Union because of its questionable bourgeois origins and religious theme, has finally made it on the legitimate stage.

title: TWOTIER PRIME APPEARS TO FADE
description: An interest rate advantagesometimes amounting to more than two percentage pointsthat small business borrowers have enjoyed since April, 1973, appears to be disappearing. As a result, interest costs may rise for some, but not all, small borrowel's.

title: Colorado Pupils Immunized After Diphtheria Kills Girl
description: CORTEZ, Colo., Nov. 5 (UPI)  Officials of the State Health Department have set up three emergency clinics in this town of 6,000 persons to administer diphtheria immunizations and booster shots to children and adults because of the death of a 4yearold girl whose parents religious beliefs forbid her immunization.

title: 3 in Tight Race for 2 Seats On State Court of Appeals
description: Two Democrats, Jacob D. Fuchsberg and Justice Lawrence M. Cooke, were narrowly leading early this morning in the race for two openings on the State Court of Appeals.

title: Knicks Win By 10693; Bradley: 30
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 5 (AP)The New York Knicks, led by the secondhalf shooting of Earl Monroe, posted a 10693 National Basketball Association victory over Houston tonight, snapping the Rockets fourgame winning streak.

title: A Young Democrat Wins Oklahoma Governorship
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Nov. 5David Boren, the young Democratic reform candidate for governor, swept to victory tonight by a wide margin over Jim Inhofe, his Republican opponent.

title: Incinerator Ship Defended
description: NEW ORLANS, Nov. 5 (UPI)Last month's experimental burning of industrial wastes in the Gulf of Mexico by the incinerator ship Vulcanus caused no environmental damage, a Shell Oil Company spokesman said today. R. Gary Dillard, manager of Shell's manufacturing complex in Deer Park, Tex., told a news conference that Shell's tests showed no damage to water, air or wildlife.

title: Askew Is Reelected Governor in Florida
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Nov. 5 Richard Stone appeared today to have become the first Jew ever elected to the United States Senate from the South by popular vote.

title: RIBICOFF WINNER
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 5Unitec States Representative Ella T Grasso was elected Governor of Connecticut today. The 55 yearold Representative, whc has not lost an election in 22 years of political life, is the first woman to be elected Governor of any state in the Northeast.

title: Horowitz Tickets: Ire and a Mystery
description: The box office opened at noon yesterday for Vladimir Horowitz's Nov. 17 concert, and by midafternoon all of the 1,300 to 1,400 tickets on hand had been sold, leaving a number of people irate and wondering where other tickets to the 3,700seat Metropolitan Opera House had gone.

title: DEFERRAL GRANTED TO GREAT SOUTHWEST
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov, 5 (AP) The Great Southwest Corporation said today it had obtamed a further deferral to Nov. 15 of a $4.25million principal payments due its senior banks.

title: INCUMBENTS WIN IN MARYLAND RACE
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 5Gov. Marvin Mandel a Democrat, and Senator Charles McC. Mathias Jr., a Republican, won reelection tonight to second terms.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ANSWER TO PREVIOUS PUZZLE

title: Betts of Allmans Sticks to Familiar In Music Hall Bill
description: The Allman Brothers Band, one of rock's most popular groups, manages to get together for the giant summer stadium tours, but during the winter it fragments into its component parts. Last season Gregg Allman showed up at Carnegie Hall on his first solo tour, and is due back to New York next month, and Monday night Richard (Dicky) Betts, the band's lead guitarist, appeared in Radio City Music Hall.

title: Pleasure Replaces Protest For Bronx Science Youths
description: They're dressing up like Groucho Marx, smooching in the halls, and squirting one another with shaving cream these days at the Bronx High School of Science.

title: MILLARD GAMBLE, LED ESSO SHIPPING
description: Millard C. Gamble, who retired in 1959 as president of the Esso Shipping Company, died yesterday at Lankenau Hospital in Philadelphia. He was 80 years old and lived in Wynnewood, Pa., a Philadelphia suburb.

title: SECT SAYS REPORT BY STATE IS FALSE
description: The Children of God, an ultraconservative religious sect, has denied charges by Attorney General Lpuis J. Lefkowitz that it was t inged with fraud and that it subjected converts to involuntary confinement.

title: Textile Plants in Passaic Burn
description: The fire that leveled a group of abandoned textile buildings in Passaic on Monday spread so quickly that investigators think arson could have been the cause.

title: GLENN IS ELECTED NEW OHIO SENATOR
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Wednesday, Nov. 6The former astronaut John H. Glenn Jr. won a smashing victory in his race for the United States Senate yesterday defeating his Republican opponent, Mayor Ralph J. Perk of Cleveland, by a margin of better than 2 to 1.

title: Maine Independent Leads Two Rivals For Governorship
description: PORTLAND, Me., Nov. 5 (AP)An independent, James B. Longley took an early lead over the two other candidates for Governor tonight.

title: suspect Pleads Not Gulty In $4.3Million Burglary
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 5 (UPI)A suspect yesterday pleaded not guilty to Federal charges of theft even though the Federal Bureau of Investigation said he had admitted having taken part in the largest burglary in American history and had led investigators to other gang members.

title: Elmhurst Director Warns of Cutbacks
description: Unless the city comes up with at least $2 million by next Monday to finance operations at the City Hospital Center at Elmhurst, Queens, the center will dismiss 21 physicians and 65, nurses and other backup employes, according to its director of medicine. The director, Dr. Stanley G. Seckler, said this would effectively terminate many key medical programs.

title: Fate of Willard, Capital Landmark, Hinges on 3 Plans
description: WASHINGTON  In its heyday, prices at the Willard Hotel were so high that Vice President Thomas R. Marshall, a hotel resident, coined the phrase, What this country needs is a good 5cent cigar.

title: Michigan Orders the Slaughter of More Cattle
description: LANSING, Mich., Nov. 5 (AP) State agricultural officials have ordered the slaughter of up to 5,000 more beef and dairy cattle that consumed feed contaminated with a fire retardant.

title: People in Sports
description: The case of Bob Love, leading scorer, for the Chicago Bulls, goes to arbitration here before Peter Seitz, an impartial observer, at 10 A.M. today. Seitz's decision will be binding. The arbitration was set up yesterday after Walter Kennedy, National Basketball Association Commissioner, rejected Love's three  pronged complaint against the Bulls.

title: Gribetz Is Leading In Rockland County Prosecutor Contest
description: NEW CITY, N.Y., Nov. 5kenneth Gribetz, the Deinocratic candidate far District Attorney of Rockland County, apparently defeated his RepublicanConservative opponent, Frank P. Barone, tonight.

title: SEARCH TEAM SILENT ON FATE OF COUPLE
description: HONOLULU, Nov. 5 (UPI)A weary and unshaven Federal search team returned from a South Sea coral atoll late last night but refused to discuss its findings on the fate of a San Diego couple last heard from more than two months ago.

title: Petersen Quits as Assistant Attorney General
description: WASHINGTON, NOV. 5Special to The New York Times Henry E. Petersen, insisting that he had no regrets over his handling of the original Watergate investigation, resigned today as chief of the Justice Department's Criminal Division.

title: Bond Issue to Aid State Rail Service Approved by 2 to 1
description: A $250million borrowing program to put new life into the state's rail passenger and freight services won overwhelming approval from the voters yesterday.

title: Kravitz Departure a Line To ArtsAcademe Puzzle
description: The resignation of Herman Krawitz as director of the Leonard Davis Center for the Performing Arts at City College before the start of the fall term has pointed up some of the problems of trying to merge the worlds of the academic and the performer.

title: Election Day Blues
description: DENVER, Nov. 5 (AP)When Mike McKuen, a disk, jockey at radio station KLZ asked his morning radio listeners today to call in and request songs for Election Day, he got suggestions like these: Yakety Yak, It's Crying Time Again, What Kind of Fool Am I, You Are the Devil in Disguise, Fame and Fortune, Shaft, If I Ruled the World land Get a Job.

title: The New Lieutenant GOvernor.
description: There may have been people who doubted, as they watched her trying to run an underfinanced stateprimary campaign out of her husband's onebedroom apartment this summer, that Mary Anne Krupsak would ever be the Lieutenant Governor of New York State.

title: Fourth Term for Javits
description: The reelection of Jacob K. Javits, in the face of the powerful Democratic tide that rolled over most Republican candidates yesterday, represents recognition of the excellent service he has rendered in his eighteen years as United States Senator.

title: G.O.P. Incumbents in. State Struggle To Stave Off Worst Defeat in Decades
description: Republican members of the. House of Representatives from New York State were locked in uphill struggles last night in efforts to stave off their worst defeat in several decades.

title: Democrat to Be Tennessee Governor
description: NASHVILLE, Nov. 5Democratic hopes for a resurgence in this state were buoyed today with the return of the Governor's office to the party's hands after four years of Republican administration.

title: International Bauxite Group Seeks to Reassure Consumers
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana, Nov. 5 (UPI)  The Interntional Bauxite Association (I.B.A.), representing the world's largest producers of aluminum ore today discussed cooperative programs to increase returns from the ore without attempting to control its international price.

title: Dixville Notch Voters Shift From Midnight to Noon
description: DIXVILLE NOTCH, N.H., Nov. 5 (AP)The 18 registered voters in Dixville Notch pulled a surprise todaythey went to the polls at noon.

title: Traditional Ethnic Vote Returns to Democrats
description: Representative Hugh L. Carey's lopsided victory yesterday showed strength all across New York State, dramatically reversing voting patterns of previous years in districts populated by persons of Italian, Irish and Slavic descent.

title: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:
description: Tickets matching the number win $10,000. Tickets with the five numbers in reverse win $1,000. Tickets with the first or last four numbers in order win $225. Tickets with the first, middle or last three numbers in sequence win $25 Losing tickets are eligible for a Special prize drawn on Thursdays.

title: A Brooklynite Bound for Albany Hugh Leo Carey
description: Back in 1960, when Hibernian hearts were leaping with the Presidential candidacy of John F. Kennedy, Hugh Leo Carey received a flyer from his Congressman at his home in the Park Slope section of Brooklyn that brought him back to earth. That was Frank Dorn and he said the district would go 2 to 1 for Nixon, Mr. Carey recalled recently. The next day I went down to county headquarters. I told them I didn't know who was running against Dorn, but whoever it was, I wanted to work for him.

title: North Dakota Democrat Has Thin Lead
description: FARGO, N. D., Wednesday, Nov. 6Former Gov. William L. Guy, a Democrat, led the Republican incumbents Milton R. Young, in their Senate race early today as votecounting neared an end without a clearcut winner.

title: Kenyatta Warns Newsmen
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Nov. 5 (Agence FrancePress)  President Jomo Kenyatta today dismissed overseas press reports of corruption here and threatened to expel foreign newsmen who wrote such articles.

title: Saint Laurent Opens, in Person
description: The spirit of the French couture was transferred briefly to New York yesterday afternoon. It proved an offbeat divertissement for Election Day.

title: Defeat Places Wilson In Unaccustomed Role
description: In 1958, when they were New York's Republican gubernatorial ticket for the first time, the new politician, Nelson A. Rockefeller, and the veteran of 20 years of legislative infighting and compromise, Malcolm Wilson, toured the state in an unadorned limousine with the seasoned politician driving and talking, and the newcomer riding and listening.

title: U.S. Proposes 3 New Groups on Hunger
description: ROME, Nov. 5  Secretary of State Kissinger proposed to the World Food Conference today the establishment of three new international bodies to coordinate efforts to avert spreading famine and renewed international tensions.

title: ISRAELIS CAPTURE 2 ON RAID IN LEBANON
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 5 (Reuters)Israeli forces brought back the headman of a southern Lebanon village and his son for questioning after an overnight raid, an army spokesman said today.

title: MRS. FERRUCCIO VITALE
description: Mrs. Rosamond Flower Rothcry Vitale, widow of Ferruccia Vitale, a prominent landscape architect and member of the National Fine Arts Commission, died Sunday in a Tarrytown, N. Y., nursing home. She was 94 years old. Mrs, Vitale leaves two daughters, Lee Prenski and Nina Cohen, and three grandchildren.

title: Javits Victor Over Clark Despite Watergate Issue
description: Jacob K. Javits won his fourth tern as United States Senator from New York yesterday, overcoming the antiRepublican disaffection spawned by Watergate and the folksy challenge of Ramsey Clark, Democrat who shaped his campaign to capitalize on the mood of antipolitics.

title: Stage: Last Days of British Honduras
description: Ronald Tavel has written a mystic mystery play, The Last Days of British Honduras, which opened last night at the Other Stage of the New York Shakespeare Festival Public Theater complex on Lafayette Street.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Samuel Davidson of East Orange held in Tuscaloosa, Ala., after he allegedly made a bomb threat aboard a Southern Airways flight. Mr. Davidson was charged with drunk and disorderly conduct when his flight landed at Tuscaloosa on Monday. Mr. Davidson reportedly told a stewardess not to move his luggage because it would explode, the police said. No explosives were found during a Search of the aircraft.

title: The Carey Victory
description: In electing the Democratic challenger, Hugh L. Carey, to be their Governor, the people of this state have reversed a fouryear trend and voted decisively for a return to the positive and moderately progressive leadership that they had come to expect from a long line of distinguished Governors of New York from both parties.

title: Eagleton Reelected In Missouri, Beating Rep. Curtis Easily
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov, 5 (AP)Thomas F. Eagleton, the original Democratic VicePresidentiat nominee in 1972, was easily reelected today to a second term in the United States Senate over his Republican challenger, Representative Thomas B. Curtis.

title: In Bowl
description: The football bowl scene began taking shape yesterday when Nebraska's coach, Tom Osborne, announced that his Cornhuskers would meet Florida in the Sugar Bowl and the Penn State players voted to accept a bid from the Cotton Bowl if it was offered.

title: Bond Issue to Aid State Rail Service Draws Big Support
description: A $250million borrowing program to preserve and improve the state's, rail passenger and freight services was winning approval from the voters yesterday based on early returns.

title: M'GOVERN WINS 3D SENATE TERM
description: SIOUX FALLS, S. D., Nov. 5 Senator George McGovern, seeking vindication for his 1972 defeat in the state as the Democratic Presidential candidate, was reelected to a third term today. He defeated Leo K. Thorsness, his Republican challenger, a former Air Force lieutenant colonel and Vietnam prisoner of war.

title: COOK IS DEFEATED IN KENTUCKY RACE
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky. Nov. 5Gov. Wendell H. Ford, a Democrat, unseated Republican Senator Marlow W. Cook tonight, giving the Democrats both of Kentucky's two United States Senate seats for the first time since 1952.

title: Big GasDepot Fire Near Dublin Docks Causes Evacuation
description: DUBLIN, Wednesday, Nov. 6 (Reuters) Explosions tore through the dock area of Dublin early today as fire swept through a big gas storage depot.

title: Gov. Wallace Wins a 3d Term, Senator Allen Is Also Reelected,
description: BIRMINGHAM. Ala., Nov 5 (AP)George C. Wallace won reelection tonight to an unprecedented third term as Alabama's Governor.

title: HighProtein Beefalo Comes to Town
description: The beefalo came to town, yesterday.

title: Moderate Democrat Wins Governorship in Georgia
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 5Democratic candidates for Governor and United States Senator were elected today by overwhelmingman, margins.

title: KISSINGER MEETS HE ATHENS AIDE
description: CAIRO, Nov. 5Secretary of State Kissinger held a surprise breakfast meeting with the Greek Foreign Minister, Dmitri S. Bitsios in Rome today to discuss a possible Cyprus compromise that might begin to emerge from Mr. Kissinger's trip to Turkey later this week.

title: JERSEY REJECTS CASINO PROPOSAL
description: Casino gambling in New Jersey was rejected by the voters in yesterday's Election by an overwhelming margin.

title: Highs and Lows
description: NEW LOWS19

title: UnionInduced Delivery Ban Adds to Ills
description: LONDON, Nov. 5An acute shortage of sugar has spread through Britain, prompting panic buying in some areas and widespread hoarding.

title: GARWOOD. R. WOLFF
description: Garwood R. Wolff, copublisher of Architecture Plus magazine, died Sunday at his home. He was 52 years old and lived at 420 East 55th Street.

title: SOVIET ARMS DATA RAISE SUSPICIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5Defense Department officials say they believe that recent Soviet fictions raise questions whether Moscow is camouflaging some of its strategic weapons programs in violation of the 1972 agreement with the United States on offensive nuclear arms.

title: American Standard Raises ThirdQuarter Profits 11.9%
description: American Standard, Inc., realized an 11.9 per cent increase in thirdquarter earnings on a revenue gain of 10 per cent, bringing the ninemonth results to a record, according to a company report yesterday.

title: Man Held in Threat to Ford
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Nov. 5 (AP)John William Heffron, 54, years old, of Riverview, Fla., was held in $15,000 bond today on a charge that he had called the F.B.I. and threatened to kill President Ford, United States marshals said.

title: Concert
description: When it comes to translating theater music into the concert hall, there are drastically differing schools of thought among conductors. One school tries to evoke specific images and moods associated with the dramatic work itself; the other simply ignores the score's stage past and plays it as pure concert music.

title: MANOUG EXERJIAN
description: Manoug M. Exerjian, a Nassau County architect, died yesterday at Manhasset (L.I.) Hospital. He was 76 years old and lived at 18 Bonnie Heights Road, Manhasset.

title: MARTIN THURNAUER
description: Martin Thurnauer, retired vice chairman of Lightolier, Inc., and former chairman of the Associates Advisory Board of the New School for Social Research, died Monday in a nursing home in Riverdale, N.J. He was 80 years old.

title: 6Pound 3Ounce Reason For a Commuter Delay
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (Reuters)Commuters had a new excuse for being late today: the birth of a baby on a major highway during the morning rush hour.

title: Canucks Set Back Rangers
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Nov. 5 (AP)Leon Rochefort and Andre Boudrias scored goals as the Vancouver Canucks beat the New York Rangers, 21, in a National Hockey League game tonight.

title: Nixon, in Hospital, Casts Vote by Absentee Ballot
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Nov. 5. (AP) Former President Richard M. Nixon voted yesterday in his hospital room by absentee ballot, Ronald L. Ziegler, his former press secretary said today.

title: Football Ratings
description: COACHES' POLL WRITERS' POLL

title: Greece Officially Charges Leaders of the 1967 Coup
description: ATHENS, Nov. 5 (AP)The Athens chief prosecutor today officially charged the former Greek strongman, George Papadopoulos, and 49 other former officers with high treason and insurrection for their seizure of power in the coup of April, 1967.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Bake McBride of the St. Louis Cardinals and Greg Gross of the Houston Astros, both outfielders, and Mike Hargrove of the Texas Rangers, a first baseman, were the leading votegetters on the 1974 major league rookie allstar team, The team was announced yesterday in New York.

title: Shapp and Schweiker Win Contests in Pennsylvania.
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 5Gov. Milton J. Sliapp, a Democrat, and Senator Richard S. Schweiker, a Republican, won reelection today by comfortable margins.

title: Antiwar Fictions
description: CHICAGOThere is apparently a new movement astir in the land, a movement of concern over hunger and starvation all around theworld. This is fine, though it is interesting that those who used to tell us that we could not assume responsibility to police the whole world now think we can assume responsibility to feed it.

title: Bowater Unit Is Increasing Newsprint by $35 Per Ton
description: The Bowater Sales Company announced yesterday that it was increasing its price of 30pound newsprint by $35 a ton, to $270 a ton, effective Jan. 1. The action was considered surprising by many industry observers. A number of other newsprint producers in the United States and Canada have recently announced increases to $260 a ton, also effective Jan. 1.

title: Dow Climbs 17.52 As Trading Rises
description: The stock market made an impressive advance in accelerated trading yesterday, spurred by reports that the coal contract negotiations would resume shortly.

title: Notes on People Rusk Turns Down Offer to Be Ambassador to Britain
description: Two names now compose the list of those who have declined a Ford Administration offer to appoint them Ambassador to Britain. The more recent is Dean Rusk, the former Secretary of State, now a professor of law at the University of Georgia. Reached by telephone yesterday, Mr. Rusk said, I've said many times that under no circumstances would I accept another public office on any level or for any purpose.

title: Entries at Monmouth
description: Entries at Monmouth

title: Brazil Unenthused About IronOre Export Group
description: GENEVA, Nov. 5 Brazil showed little enthusiasm today at a meeting of ironore producing nations for the proposed creation of an organization of exporting nations.

title: Republican Apparently Defeats Rep. Owens in Utah Senate Race
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Nov. 5Jake Garn, the conservative Republican Mayor of Salt Lake City, was the apparent winner today in his Senate race against Representative Wayne Owens, a Democratic member of the House Judiciary Committee who supported impeachment of Richard M. Nixon.

title: Business Briefs
description: The Mobil Oil Corporation said yesterday that it had canceled plans for the expansion of its 100,000barreladay refinery in Paulsboro, N.J.

title: The World And Nixon
description: PARISThe Republican party, in the current United States elections, had to pay a large price because of Richard Nixon. He seemed to understand the world much better than his own country and his leadership talents were therefore more appreciated abroad than at home. Foreigners don't vote in the United States.

title: Jet Giant Rivalry Just Another Game
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Nov. 5 Suddenly the JetsGiants rivalry doesn't mean anything. The teams play Sunday for only the second time in regularseason competition, but it has no more significance than last week's game or the following week's. For all they care, the Jets could be playing the Shreveport Steamer, if a victory over a World Football League team would count the National League standings.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASKETBALL

title: Sex Bias Amendment Wins in Conneiticut
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 5Connecticut voters today overwhelthingly approved an amendment to the State Constitution barring sex discrimination.

title: Weaver Dropped As Villanova Pilot
description: VILLANOVA, Pa., Nov. 5 (UPI).Jim Weaver, serving in his first season as head football coach at Villanova, was discharged today because of a contractual conflict.

title: Casino Proposal Is Decisively Defeated
description: Continued From Page 1, Col. alty was Representative William B. Widnall, the ranking minority member of the House Banking Committee, who lost in the Seventh District, in Bergen County, to Andrew Maguire, a Democrat.

title: Jordan Amending Charter
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Nov. 5 (UPI)  King Hussein summoned both houses of Parliament to an amergency session Saturday to amend the Jordanian Constitution, the Government announced today. Political sources said the two houses would be dissolved after the Constitution was amended to remove from the Government representatives of Palestinians livine on the Israeliaccupied West Bank of the Jordan River.

title: BAYH BEATS LUGAR IN INDIANA RACE
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Wednesday, Nov. 6  Senator Birch Bayh won a third term in the United States Senate yesterday after a close and changing battle with Mayor Richard G. Lugar, of Indianapolis, the Republican challenger.

title: Industrial Users in the U.S. Cite PriceKiting
description: Feverish speculation in the inflated sugar market has given rise to pricekiting through agreements to buy and sell millions of tons of sugar crops around the world that may not exist.

title: Peru's Land Reform an Uneven Success
description: CASA GRANDE, PeruThe sweet smell from the nearby sugar refinery drifted in through the open window of La Tranca, once one of most famous private clubs in South America. Now it is the watering hole for workers and technicians of the Casa Grande agricultural cooperative, which was celebrating its fourth anniversary.

title: Contract Awards
description: United Aircraft Corporation received three Navy contracts worth $179,4million for aircraft engines and helicopters yesterday. The biggest contract, for $138.7million, went to United's Pratt and Whitney Aircraft division, of East Hartford, Conn.

title: Dividends Announced
description: Dividends Announced

title: RIBICOFF WINNER
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 5United States Representative Ella T. Grasso was elected Governor of Connecticut today. The 55yearold Representative, who has not lost an election in 22 years of political life, is the first woman to be elected Governor of any state in the Northeast.

title: Democrats Retain Ervin's Senate Seat
description: RALEIGH, N.C., Nov. 5 (AP)Robert B, Morgan easily won the United States Senate seat being vacated by Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr. today, leading strong Democratic showing in a state with recent Republican leanings.

title: SEOUL SEIZES 18 AS SPIES OF NORTH
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 5 The South Korean Army announced today that it had rounded up 18 persons suspected of involvement in a Communist espionage ring based in Japan.

title: G.O.P. Drive Fails
description: In the end, it was a stampede.

title: After the Cheering
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5Now that the election is over, President Ford and the new triumphant Democratic Congress may have time to reflect on their common and extraordinary responsibilities.

title: Books of The Times Oil on Troubled Waters
description: You get the idea pretty quicklyeven if you haven't read its serialization in The New Yorker, or heard the drumbeat of its advance publicity, or witnessed on the cocktail party circuit the lamentations over its messagethat Noel Mostert's Supership is going to deliver some very scary news; that it's going to explain in so many details how those enormous new tankers you see proudly displayed in the oilcompany advertisements are spilling their contents into the oceans at an appalling rate, how the oceans may be dying as a direct result, and how if the oceans die all life may be threatened. You can see it coming as you turn the first pages of Supership; another Silent Spring; more cause for despair; once again an invitation to give up on humanity. But, you wonderwatching the message loomdo you actually want to read it? There's so much cause for depression these days that your sensibilities have gotten into the habit of freezing at the slightest hint of, further gloom. Can you bear still more?

title: White House Weighing Options for Getting Advice on Science and Technology
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5The Administration is seriously considering at least two major options for providing continuing advice on science and technology to President Ford.

title: Shell Unit Well Test
description: The pecten Vietnam Company, a subsidiary of the Shell Oil Company, said yesterday that it had successfully completed the second test of wildcat well off the coast of South Vietnam that showed a daily flow of 715 barrels of oil and 11.8 million cubic feet of of gas.

title: Milliken Is Narrowly ReElected In Michigan Governor's Contest
description: DETROIT, Wednesday, 6Gov. William G. Milliken of Michigan, a Republican, survived a Democratic sweep yesterday to win reelection over Sander M. Levin, a former Democratic State Senator whom he defeated by a narrow margin four years ago.

title: College, School Results SOCCER Colleges
Defendants in the Watergate Trial Lose a Major Round Over Admissibility, of Tapes
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5The five defendants in the Watergate coverup trial lost a major preliminary battle today over the admissibility of White House tape recordings that the prosecution wants to offer as evidence.

title: 1st G.O.P. Governor in a Century, Wins Election in South Carolina
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., Nov 5State Senator James B. Edwards, a conservative Republican, bucked a strong Democratic tide today to become the first member of his party to capture the South Carolina governorship since Reconstruction.

title: Sentenced in Car Crash
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif., Nov. 5 (AP)  A 35yearold bond salesman was sentenced yesterday to one to five years in prison for the traffic accident that took the life of a woman, and cost an actor, James Stacey, his left arm and left leg. Superior Court Judge Edward Refeedie sentenced Carter B. Gordon of Woodland Hills after Mr. Gordon had pleaded no contest to manslaughter and drunken driving charges. Mr. Stacey, 36, and Clair Cox, 27, were riding a motorcycle on Sept. 28, 1973, when they collided with Mr. Gordon's car.

title: DuPont of Delaware Wins House Race Over Democrat
description: DOVER, Del., Nov. 5 (AP)Representative Pierre F. du Pont 4th, millionaire who rejected bigmoney campaign contributions, won reelection over James R. Soles, a Democrat, today.

title: Van Brocklin Dismissed by Falcons
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 5 (AP)Norm Van Brocklin was dismissed as general manager and coach of the Atlanta Falcons today and replaced as coach by Marion Campbell, the, team's defensive coordinator.

title: The 116: a Club for Capital's In People
description: WASHINGTON, Nov, 5An inconspicuous row house tucked away in a oncenotorious alley on Capitol Hill has evolved into a headquarters of subterranean power, a place where Senators, Representatives and Federal officials do their lobbying.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I read with dismay last week's report indicating that Mayor Beame has decided to phase out the Office of Neighborhood Government and replace it with a centralized complaint system.

title: Carey, in Victory, Pledges A People's Government

title: Lie Low and Twixt Win on Turf
description: The Cragwood Stable's Lie Low and Mrs. John Franklin's Twixt were the winners of the split ticket at Aqueduct yesterday. They took the respective divisions of the Firenze Handicap, a 1mile turf event for fillies and mares. Lie Low, ridden by Jorge Velasquez, prevailed by a length over Aglimmer, with D. O. Lady next, and Twixt followed by defeating Garland of Roses by half a length, with Fairway Flyer winding up third.

title: People and Business
description: The election of Representative Hugh L. Carey as Governor of New York may mean that Herbert S. Denenberg, the outspoken former Insurance Commissioner of Pennsylvania, has a strong chance of becoming New York Insurance Superintendentthe most prominent insuranceregulatory post in the country.

title: Oscar John Dorwin. Dies, Former Counsel at Texaco
description: Oscar John Dorwin, retired senior vice president and general counsel of Texaco, Inc., died Monday at Greenwich (Conn.) Hospital. He was 77 years old and lived in Greenwich.

title: Chess: Ends His NoVictory Streak Korchnoi, in 79Move Game,
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 5After going without a victory through 18 games, Viktor Korchnoi broke through today to take the 19th game of his final Candidates Match with Anatoly Karpov in the Central Chess Club. However, the Leningrad grandmaster still trails Karpov, 31, and, with only five games to be played, time is running out on him.

title: Eugene Bloch, Was Elected To Phi Beta Kappa at 69
description: Eugene W. Bloch, who retired in 1954 at the age of 65 and then went on to Queens College, graduating in 1958 with a B.A. cum laude and a Phi Beta Kappa Key, died yesterday of leukemia in Flushing (Queens) Hospital, He was 85 years old and lived at 3351 162d Street in Flushing.

title: About New York
description: Dear John, I acknowledge your return to the world of reality, the note began, and it was signed Warren. Warren was Warren E. Burger, the Chief Justice of the United States, and John was John V. Lindsay. Mr. Burger had written to say that he thought the law was an honorable profession, and that he was glad Mr. Lindsay had gone back into it. Mr. Lindsay wrote a note back and said that he was glad, too.

description: The first New Jersey Grand Prix for junior tennis players starts Sunday, and the chances are that it will be more of an ordeal for the parents than for the budding Chris Everts and Jimmy Connorses.

description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 5Edmund G. Brown Jr., a Democrat whose father lost the California governorship eight years ago to Gov. Ronald Reagan, held a substantial lead tonight in the race to succeed the conservative Republican, who did not seek a third term.

title: Inmate Pleads to Murder
description: ELMIRA, N. Y., Nov. 5 (AP) A 21yearold prison inmate pleaded guilty late yesterday to murdering a fellow inmate here last May. 8he plea by the deifendant, Nathaniel Poole of New York City, came in Chemung County Court as a jury was being selected to try the case. The victim was Sam Alston, 123, of Brooklyn.

title: ENVOY TO MOSCOW OFF TO GOOD START
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 5 When Secretary of State Kissinger began his recent talks here with Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet leader, seated with Mr. Kissinger at the negotiating table was the American Ambassador to Moscow, Walter J. Stoessel Jr.

description: Representative Hugh L. Carey was elected Governor of New York yesterday in a sweeping victory that also gave the Democrats control of the State Assembly.

title: Krawitz Departure a Clue To ArtsAcademe Puzzle
description: The resignation of Herman Krawitz as director of the Leonard Davis Center for the Performing Arts at City College before the start of the fall term has pointed up some of the problems of trying to merge the worlds of the academic and the performer.

title: Institutions Lining Up For du Pont's Offering
description: Terms will be set late today on the first public debt offering by E. I. duPont de Nemours & Co. in more than half a century and normally staid institutional investors are lining up like kids at a candy store. It's a museum piece, Wall Streeters kept repeating yestefday, indicating the rarity and collector appeal of the giant chemical company's $500million financing, the biggest ever for any manufacturing concern. Every institution wants this du Pont paper in its portfolio.

title: There's Plenty to Eat for Food Parley Delegates
description: ROME, Nov. 5  If beautiful speeches could cure hunger, we've got it made, said the Rev. Arthur McCormack, a Roman Catholic priest from Liverpool who has served for seven years on a Vatican commission for aid to poor countries. He was commenting on the opening of the World Food Conference.

title: FURNACES IN DISPUTE SHUT BY U.S. STEEL
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala:, Nov. 5 (UPI)The United States Steel Corporation, facing a court battle with health officials, announced yesterday that it had shut down three open hearth furnaces and resumed steel production with a new low pollution furnace.

title: DOLE EDGES ROY IN KANSAS CITY
description: TOPEKA, Kan., Nov. 5Senator Robert Dole, a former Republican National Chariman scored a narrow victory today over Representative William R. Roy, a Democrat.

title: Senate Seat in Iowa Is Won by Democrat

description: They're dressing up like Groucho Marx, smooching in the halls, and squirting one another with shaving cream these days at the Bronx High School of Science.

title: Unmanned Flight Record
description: EDWARIS AIR FORCE BASE, Calif., Nov. 5 (AP)A United States record of 24 consecutive hours for an unmanned aircraft, flight has been set over remote reaches of the California desert, th Air Force announced. A spokesman said yesterday that the groundcontrolled flight record was set Saturday by a YQM98A Compass Cope jet built by Teledyne Ryan. The previous record of 21 hours was set here in January, 1972, by a propellerdriven XQN93A, built by the same concern.

title: Paranormal Science
description: The scientific community has been put on notice that there is something worthy of their attention and scrutiny in the possibilities of extrasensory perception. With those words the respected British journal Nature called on scientists to join or refute  millions of nonscientists who believe human consciousness has more capabilities for real perception than the five senses.

title: ALEXANDER SCHWARZ
description: Alexander Schwarz, a retired advertising executive, died Monday. He was 72 years old and lived at 340 Riverside Drivel nere.

description: PARIS, Nov. 5Strikes disrupted key areas of activity in France today amid Government charges of Communist plotting and angry denials by union of ficials.

description: HARNESS RACING

title: Guide GOING OUT
description: ROBESON RETRO Screenings of rarely shown movies with Paul Robeson will make up a retrospective of the screen career of the great actor and singer now 76 years and a resident of Philadelphia. Today through Saturday, Emperor Jones, the 1933 filming of the Eugene O'Neill drama, with Mr. Robeson as the Pullman porter who became King of Haiti, is on a doublebill with the early German classic Maedchen in Uniform (1932), starring Dorothea Wieck, at Theater 80 St. Marks (2547400) in the East Village. The Robeson film, with Fredi Washington and Dudley Digges in supporting roles, was produced by John Krimsky, who also imported the sensitive German drama, with its delicate treatment of Lesbian love in a girls school. Admission is $2.50.

title: ECONOMIC ISSUES STRESSED BY FORD
description: WASHINGTON, Wednesday, Nov. 6President Ford said last night that the mandate of yesterday's election was to place on the next Congress, which will have a lopsided Democratic majority, responsibility for resolving inflation and the crippled economy.

title: State Changes Due
description: Representative Hugh L Carey's victory will have farreaching ramifications in the government and politics of a state that has been dominated by Nelson A, Rockefeller and the Republican party for nearly a generation.

title: Berlin: Still an Issue
description: While Chancellor Helmut Schmidt was striving in a Moscow visit last week to exact some concessions from Soviet leaders that would reinforce West Germany's vital links with free West Berlin, that city's Mayor Klaus Schutz was making a disturbing disclosure. He had cancelled a visit to Rome because Pope Paul VI had refused to receive him in company with West Germany's ambassador to the Holy See.

He was 61 years old, and had remained here for further discussions after attending meetings of the World Bank and the International Monetary Fund as alterHate delegate for Saudi Arabia.

title: Nixon Is Told to Increase Activity to Build Strength
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Nov. 5 A terribly physically weak Richard M. Nixon has been ordered to walk more, although each step he takes is painful, the former President's doctors said today.

title: France Sets Nuclear Tests

Jean Tardy, director of the French test program in the South Pacific, said today. The tests are expected to be on Fangataufa atoll, near Nururoa atoll, where France's controversial aboveground tests were

description: Clarence E. Olmstead, who retired in 1950 as a vice president of Texaco, Inc., died Sunday at his home in Pasadena, Calif. He was 84 years old.

description: ASINGAN, Philippines, Nov. 1 Though only six miles off the busy highway leading northward from Manila, the agricultural town of Asingan in the Luzon province of Pangasinan never felt the need for haste.

title: Speculative Buying In Europe Pushes Prices of Gold Up
description: LONDON, Nov. 5A surge of speculative buying in the European gold markets has sent prices up sharply toward record levels in anticipation of possibly heavy demand for bullion from American investors.

title: DEMOCRATS TAKE COLORADO RACES
description: DENVER, Nov. 5Gary Hart, Democrat, soundly defeated Senator Peter H. Dominick, his Republican opponent, tonight.

title: Yugoslays to Tour U.S.
description: BELGRADE, Nov. 5 (Reuters)A Yugoslav national soccer team will make a 15day tour of the United States and Mexico next February, the national press agency, Tanjug, reported today. The Yugoslays will play two matches against United States teams in California and two against Mexican teams in Mexico City.

title: Republicans Ahead in New Hampshire
description: CONCORD, N. H., Nov. 5New Hampshire's unpredictablel voters gave the Republicans mall consolation prize today; They reelected a Republican Governor and gave a Republican the lead for a Senate seat, an the lead for a Senate seat, out sent the state's first Demoorat to the House of Representatives in 10 year.

title: Lisbon Pledges to Prevent Further Extremist Attacks
description: LISBON, Nov, 5 (UPI)The Government today pledged adequate measures to avoid a repetition of such incidents as the ransacking of the offices of the Social Democratic Center by leftist extremists yesterday.

title: Stevenson Victory Leads Democrats To Ilinois Triumph
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 5 (AP)Senator Adlai E. Stevenson 3d led a Democratic party that capitalized on Watergate scandals and national economic woe to its biggest political gains in years in Illinois.

title: Plans Plans for Nixon Deposition In Carolina Case Dropped
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Nov. 5 (AP)Former President Richard M. Nixon will not have to give testimony about security arrangements for his Billy Graham Day visit to Charlotte in 1971.

title: Mrs. Ford Given Drug To Prevent a Relapse
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (UPI)  Betty Ford has started taking an oral anticancer drug described by medical specialists as something everyone is quite excited about, a White House spokesman said today.

title: Board of Education Called Loath to Move on Irregularities
description: The president of the City Board of Education said yesterday that because of ethnic considerations, the central school administration had been reluctant to move against some local districts that have figured in charges of fiscal irregularities and other abuses.

title: Horizons and Harmonica Arrive in Whitney Series
description: The American scene, which too often is a vagrant, passing vision, has been captured in arresting style by Larry Gottheim in his silent but decidedly colorful feature, Horizons, which began a week's stand yesterday at the Whitney Museum of American Art. If his compilation of vignettes tends to become redundant eventually, the overall documentation of seasonal changes is as varied and beautiful as nature itself.

title: SUGAR FUTURES UP DAILY LIMIT
description: For the seventh consecutive trading session, world sugar futures here jumped the daily limit, recently doubled to 2 cents a pound. The price here for nearby March delivery was about 51 cents a pound.

title: Con Edison Suit Challenges New U.S. Curb on Pollution
description: A Consolidated Edison Company suit yesterday challenged monthold Federal water pollutioncontrol regulations, and charged they could require cooling towers at four plants that would raise electric customers bills by $120million a year.

title: Reduced Diets in Affluent Lands Argued at Food Parley in Rome
description: ROME, Nov. 6Suggestions that people in rich countries eat less to free food for the third of the world struggling for existence have begun to emerge as one of the key issues at the World Food Conference here.

title: Aged in Bronx Attacked
description: Hundreds of old men and women in the Bronx have been brutally attacked and robbed this fall by children and teenagers, most of them 14 to 16 years old and operating in packs of two, three and four, the police say. At least four of the victims have died.

title: PUBLIC TV GAINS IN SUBSCRIPTIONS
description: In spite of the economic austerities adopted by many households in response to inflation, a number of bellwether stations in the public television system have set new fundraising records with their pledge weeks and auctions this fall.

title: Marge Mason, Golfer, Dies; Won Jersey Title 5 Times;
description: Marge Mason, a wellknown amateur golfer, died Tuesday at her home at 1274 Dickerson Road, West Englewood, N. J. She was 57 years old.

title: W. T. GRANT ADDS TWO CREDIT CARDS
description: Effective next Wednesday, the 1,178 stores operated by the W. T. Grant Company will honor both Master Charge and Bink Americard credit cards.

Carey, the Democrats in the Legislature started yesterday to confront the twin challenges of organizing an overwhelming majority in the Assembly and picking the leadership for a delicate minority role in the State Senate.

title: Canada Pledges More Food Aid at Rome Parley
description: ROME, Nov. 6In a move that was viewed as an effort to put pressure on other nations with food surpluses, Canada pledged at the World Food Conference today to increase her food aid to hungry nations by 20 per cent.

title: Brooklyn Group Urges Inquiry at Methadone Center
description: The Fort Greene Crisis Committee, an umbrella organization for 70 community organizations, called yesterday for immediate investigations of a Brooklyn methadone maintenance facility by the city's Controller and the Brooklyn District Attorney.

description: While the final returns were being counted yesterday, Republican and Democratic leaders, including Governorelect Carey, were holding meetings on the drastic changes that both parties are likely to undergo in the wake of the election.

title: Schwiker Voices Fear On Future of the G.O.P.
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 6 (UPI) Senator Richard S. Schweiker, Republican of Pennsylvania, warned today that the Republican party could become extinct unless we mend our ways and said he would work to reform the party.

description: Columbus Day should have a special meaning for popcorn lovers.

description: Today's Entries at Monmouth

title: College Textbooks Being Simplified To Meet the Needs of the Poor Reader
description: Publishers, responding to a changing market in college texts, are increasingly resorting to simplified language in their books to adjust to a new element in higher education  the college student who cannot read at traditional college levels.

title: Tanguy's Surrealist Art in a Rare Show
description: Among the masters of European surrealism Yves Tanguy is by a long way the least well known. There has never been a fulllength book on him.

title: Deceased Candidate Wins Justice Post in Arkansas
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Nov. (UPI)The late Florence Kayhill Watts has been elected Pulaski County Justice of the Peace by 15,495 votes to 74 for writein candidate Gladys M. Hammons.

description: News Summary and Index

title: Major State Changes Are on Way in Both Democratic and Republican Parties
description: Major Democratic and Republican leaders, including Governorelect Hugh L. Carey, began discussions yesterday on what are likely to be drastic changes in both parties after the Democratic sweep in Tuesday's elec, tion.

title: Up to the Democrats
description: The Democratic party has drawn handsome gains out of the difficulties of the incumbent Republicans. The brutal realities of inflation and recession, the fear of depression, and the memory of Watergate worked together to wreak heavy damage on the G.O.P. from New York to California.

title: Is It a Recession? Simon Says It Is
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 6 (Reuters) The Secretary of the Treasury today conceded that the United'States was in a recession.

title: Gas Thieves Strike Twice
description: BELVIDERE, Ill. (AP)Robert Wilde was a twotime loser recently. Mr. Wilde discovered someone had stolen 15gallons of gas from his car, Purchased an additional 10 gallons and put the car back in the garage. The following morning, Mr. Wilde found the tank empty again.

title: CONSUMER CREDIT UP IN SEPTEMBER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (AP) The growth in consumer credit slowed sharply in September, reflecting a slowdown in consumer buying, the government reported today.

title: For Mrs. Grasso, Democrats Power May Pose Some Political Headaches
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 6After a substantial victory in the gubernatorial election in Connecticut, United States Representative Ella T. Grasso faced the mixed blessing today of Democratic majorities in the General Assembly that she may have trouble coping with.

title: Carey Victory Percentage Is Highest in This Century
description: Representative Hugh L. Carey's winning percentage on Tuesday was the greatest of any candidate for Governor in this century, but the voter turnout was the lowest since the nineteenforties.

title: Ford Invites 23 Governors to Talks on Offshore Oil
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 President Ford has invited the; Governors of 23 coastal states to a White House meeting to persuade them that the national interest requires an early ex; pansion of offshore exploration', for oil and natural gas. Many; states fear the environmental consequences of such exploration and production.

title: Economic Unrest Cited in Moscow As Election Factor
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 6The first Soviet commentaries on the American election returns attributed major Democratic gains to popular discontent over economic problems but said that prodtente candidates had won.

title: TV: Liberallnput, Conservative Yield. Networks Go All Out in Race With Films
description: It's taken for granted in the television business that the reporting of national election results constitutes the equivalent of a World Series for electronic journalism. TV news departments take over the networks for an entire evening. Top anchor men and reporters are put on glossy display. The total cost to the networks is estimated at between $8million and $9million. TV critics are offered tours of elaborate headquarters sets. Hospitality suites are thrown open for onthespot coverage.

Laura Allende was arrested last Saturday by Chilean military authorities. The Mexican Embassy here made the offer to the Chilean Foreign Ministry.
