description: The International Salt Company, a unit of Akzona, Inc., said yesterday it would increase prices on certain rock and evaporated salt product lines by 8 per cent to 15 per pent, effective Jan. 1. 1975. Akzona is 65 percent owned by Akzo N.V. Anheim, the Netherlands.

title: California and Colorado Name Blacks as Lieutenant Governors
description: Two black candidates won races for Lieutenant Governor Tuesday night, capturing the highest state offices ever won by blacks.

title: Briton Scores Again in Garden Jump
description: For the second time in two days, the orchestra played the British national anthem as David Broome saluted and waited to receive the silverware for his victory in the international jumping at the National Horse Show last night in Madison Square Garden.

title: Expense of Moving a House Far Exceeds What It Cost
description: IRONDEQUOIT, N. Y. (AP)James Davison spent more than $30,000 recently to transport something he had bought for $1.

title: Democrats Pick Up Seat In House in Maryland
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 6 Despite the traditional trends of offyear elections, incumbents Of both parties fared well yesterday in Pennsylvania, Delaware, Maryland and West Virginia.

title: U.S. AND FLORIDA JOIN IN BLOCKADE
description: MIAMI, Nov. 6An 18hour naval and air blockade of the southeastern coast of Florida, aimed at intercepting smuggling of narcotics and aliens, ended shortly before noon today.

title: Pro Football Statistics
description: Pro Football Statistics

title: Nixon Has Pneumonia
description: Former President Richard M. Nixon's, condition showed some improvement, but he has developed a patch of pneumonia in one lung, his doctors say. Page 50.

title: State and Local Bond Issues Given Mixed Reception at Polls
description: An estimated $4.4billion of new state and local bond proposals throughout the country received a mixed reception at the polls on Tuesday.

title: Stockholdings Of Insiders
description: The New York and American Stock Exchanges yesterday issued their latest reports on changes in stockholdings by leading stockholders, directors and officers of their listed companies. The reports include the following:

title: Nevada Madam Trails In Race for Assembly
description: LAS VEGAS, Nov. 8Beverly Harrell, the brothel madam who ran for the Nevada State Assembly with the slogan I'll show them how to run an orderly house,N appeared to be losing her race in late returns today.

title: Wolfgang Wolf, Distributor Of Movies Abroad, Is Dead
description: Wolfgang Wolf, who had represented American motionpicture distributors abroad for many years, died Sunday, apparently of a heart attack, in Lagos, Nigeria. He was 60 years old and lived in London.

title: Saudi Again Assures Kissinger He Will Seek Stable Oil Prices
description: AMMAN Jordan, Nov. 6King Faisal pledged again tonight that Saudi Arabia would try to keep oil prices at the current level and if possible reduce them, at least symbolically.

title: A Newly Appointed Judge Gets Bunch of Marriages
description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) Newly appointed to the Muncipal Court bench, Judge Ollie MarieVictoire handled her firstday cases with poise, but the crisis of a sort arose in an unexpected corner.

title: Jailings Asked in Wine Trial
description: BORDEAUX, France, Nov. 6 (Reuters)  The public prosecutor today demanded jail sentences for the principal defendants in the winefraud trial here. Eighteen defendants are accused of having doctored or mislabeled three million quarts of cheap wine and of having sold it as highquality Bordeaux.

title: Price of Gold Jumps in Europe As Dollar Rallies After Slump
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 6 (UPI)The price of gold jumped on European markets today. The dollar rallied slightly on some markets following a slump that took it to its lowest point in months.

title: Bridge Swedish Team Takes Lead In European Title Event
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 6A talented and aggressive Swedish team is strongly placed to capture the European title here and earn the right to represent Europe in the world championship in Bermuda in January.

title: A Federal Solution Urged by Clerides To Greek Cypriotes
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Nov. 6 (AP)  President Glafkos Clerides of Cyprus said tonight that accepting federation with Turkish Cypriotes was the only realistic way of settling the island's political crisis.

title: Houston Course Chosen
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 6 (AP)Deane Beaman, commissioner of the Professional Golfers Association, announced today approval of the Woodlands Country Club golf course as the site for the Houston open next May 14.

title: TEACHER ACCUSED OF ABUSING 4 BOYS
description: A 33yearold drama teacher in an intermediate school in the Bronx was arrested yesterday on charges that he had sexually abused four boy pupils.

title: A Good Outside Shot Wins Suffolk House Seat at
description: WEST ISLIP, L. I., Nov. 6Everybody wanted to play ball with the new Congressman todayArtie with the driving layups, Tim with the little push shot, brother Jeffrey with the outside jumper.

title: DEMOCRATS GAIN 4 GOVERNORSHIPS
description: Democrats captured New York and California, giant anchors of national politics, in their party's net gain of four and possibily five governorships Tuesday.

title: Mark Set in Sale Of Standardbreds
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Nov. 6 (AP)The richest standardbred horse market in the nation's history was reached today when 604 trotters and pacers were sold for $7.2million, the United States Trotting Association announced.

title: John C. Farrar, Publisher, Editor and W riter, Is Dead
description: John C. Farrar, editor, writer and founder of two publishing companiesFarrar & Rinehart, Inc., and Farrar, Straus & Girouxdied Tuesday night at his home, 16 East 96th Street, after a long illness. He was 78 years old.

title: U.S. Hearing on Sugar Scheduled for Nov. 25
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (AP) The Government's Council on Wage and Price Stability will hold a public hearing Nov. 25 on the increase in sugar prices, director Albert Rees announced today.

title: Nets Rout Spirits, 126100
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 6The New York Nets launched a sevengame road trip tonight by walloping the St. Louis Spirits, 126100, at the St. Louis Arena.

title: Laxalt Only Republican to Win Senate Seat Held by Democrat
description: LASVEGAS, Nev., Nov. 6Paul Laxalt; a 52yearold former Governor trying for a political comeback, succeeded on the basis of almost complete returns here today and, thus, became the nation's only Republican to take a Senate seat held by a Democrat.

title: AN OUTSIDE AUDIT OF PORT AUTHORITY
description: Governor Byrne formally asked the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey yesterday to seek a complete, independent audit of its financial operations.

title: Pan Am and T.W.A. Urged by the C.A.B. To Redraft Plansl
description: Rejecting what it termed an all or nothing approach, the Civil Aeronautics Board urged the nation's two largest international airlines yesterday to redraft their sweeping routetransfer plan so the key elements could dealt with individuality.

title: OFFICER CONVICTED IN 1972 SHOOTING
description: A 31yearold police officer and two companions were found guilty of attempted murder here yesterday in the apparently random 1972 shooting of a man walking past a Harlem mosque where a policeman had been killed in a major confrontation five months before.

title: ChrisCraft Is Given 1.67Million in Suit; Company to Appeal
description: Judge Milton Pollack yesterday ordered the Bangor Punta Corporation, the First Boston Corporation and three members of the Piper family to pay $1.67million in damages, plus interest, to ChrisCraft Industries, Inc., the boat maker.

title: U.S JUDGE UPHELD ON YOUNG INMATES
description: The Second Circuit Court of Appeals upheld unanimously yesterday a Federal district judge who released 280 youthful offenders last June because they had been sentenced to four years in a reformatory for misdemeanors that would have brought adults only up to a year in prison.

title: U.N. Votes to Urge Chile to Release Political Prisoners
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 6The General Assembly adopted a resolution tonight calling on Chile to release political prisoners arrested after the overthrow of President Salvador Allende Gossens.

title: High Tides Around New York
description: High Tides Around New York

title: GENERAL ELECTRIC LAYS OFF 11,200
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 6 (UPI)General Electric Co. announced today additional laybffs at its huge Appliance Park industrial complex in suburban Buechel involving about 11,200 employes.

title: HERBERT G. EDWARDS
description: Herbert G. Edwards, founding partner of the investment lbanking firm of Edwards & Hanly, died yesterday at his home in Boca Raton, Fla. He was 78 years old.

title: TEXAS CASE PRESSED IN BOY'S POISONING
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 6 (UPI)A Texas prosecutor said today that the state would move quickly in its murder case against a farther charged with mixing cyanide in trickortreat candy that killed his 8yearold son on Halloween.

title: 8.45% YIELD SEEN ON DU PONT ISWE
description: The $500million debt offering of E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co., which has been the talk of the investment community recently, will be offered today to investors.

title: A PROU.S. VOICE ON GREECE'S RIGHT
description: ATHENS, Nov. 6At a time when United States policy in the Cyprus crisis had made out with the Americans a key slogan in Greece's campaign for parliamentary elections on Nov. 17, the proAmerican voice of Petros Garoufalias, leader of the extreme rightwing National Democratic Union, is a lone one.

title: Celtics Set Back Blazers
description: BOSTON, Nov. 6 (AP)John Ilavlicek scored 40 points and Jo Jo White had 21 tonight in carrying the defending National Basketball Association champion Boston Celtics to a 128110 victory over the Portland Trail Blazers.

title: TWO SOLDIERS DIE IN ULSTER ATTACK
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 6Two British soldiers were killed today in apparent retaliation for the death of a prisoner shot during a mass jail break last night.

title: Jersey Democrats Seek to Solidify Congressional Gains With New Districting
description: TRENTON, Nov. 6Emboldened by their biggest Congressional sweep in this century, New Jersey Democrats moved today to solidify their victories in yesterday's election with a new Congressional redistricting plan, calculated to make them as lasting as possible.

title: Maraziti Attributes Defeat to W atergate And Inflation Issues
description: DOVER, Nov. 6Representative Joseph J. Maraziti, who gained national attention as defender of President Richard M. Nixon during the televised impeachment hearings, today blamed Watergate and inflation for his resounding defeat at the polls yesterday. He lost to Helen S. Meyner in New Jersey's 13th Congressional District.

title: Houston Bus Line Struck
description: HOUSTON, Nov, 6 (AP) No major trafic problems were reported today as a strike by 800 bus drivers and mechanics shout down Houston's bus system for the first time in 24 years. The drivers and mechanics voted Sunday to strike but postponed the walkout until 8 P.M. yesterday to give about 70,000 daily passengers time to make other arrangements for transportation.

title: Forecast of 23% Drop in College Rolls In State by 1990 Stirs a Controversy
description: Twothirds of the private colleges in New York State face the possibility of going out of business in the next 15 years, according to figures issued by the New York State Education Department.

title: Kent State Trial Hears Statements By 2 Guardsmen
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 6 (AP)Two former Ohio National Guardsmen now on trial on charges stemming from the 1970 Kent State slaying, told F.B.I. agents that they had shot demonstrators advancing toward them, according to a statements read in court today.

title: Cookie Monster Turns Nutritionist
description: Cookie Monster made his debut yesterday as a volunteer Government spokesman (with a sense of humor) whose job it is to promote better nutrition among his constituents in the younger set.

title: Tally of the Votes Cast for Governor and Other Statewide and County Offices
description: Tally of the Votes Cast for Governor and Other Statewide and County Offices

title: Phillips's Relatives Heard On Tape Recordings at Home
description: Tape recordings of interviews with an uncle and aunt of William R. Phillips were played yesterday for an allmale jury that has been hearing evidence in the retrial of the suspended police officer on charges of killing a procurer and a prostitute.

title: DriverEducation Census
description: Approximately 2.3 million students completed driver education courses during the 197273 school year, The Associated Press reports. Close to 50,000 instructors are now certified to teach the subject, which is offered in most public high schools.

title: Catholic Teams Fight for Titles
description: In its own quiet way the Catholic Schools Football League will produce a champion this year. Iona Prep and St. Francis Prep play Sunday at St. John's University to decide who wins the city division title. Next weekend teams from the City Division will play teams in corresponding places in the Long Island Division. This is a new addition to the league. After No. 1 meets No. 1, the C.S.F.L. will have a champion.High School Sports

title: Flames Defeat Islanders, 21
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 6  The Atlanta Flames defeated the New York Islanders in the Omni tonight, 21, thereby evening by the same score a loss to the Islanders in Nassau Coliseum two weeks ago. The Flames had won only once in their previous seven outings.

title: Some Terriers Bordering on Greatness
description: The border terrier, which originated in the north of England's Cheviot Hills border country, was bred to hunt the fox. In America, it is the rarest of the 21 terrier breeds. In 1973, only 74 were registered by the American Kennel Club. Mrs. George H. Seeman of South Norwalk, Conn., has been one of the most successful with the border in this country. In the late forties we used them for woodchuck and fox hunting. she recalled.

title: Jackson to Decide Soon On Candidacy for 1976
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP) Senator Henry M. Jackson said tonight that he may decide before early January whether to declare himself a candidate for the 1976 Democratic Presidential nomination.

title: PARIS OFFICIAL SEES A THAW TOWARD U.S.
description: PARIS, Nov. 6 (AP)Foreign Minister Jean Sauvagnargues praised the recent improvement in FrenchAmerican relations today and said this improvement had helped end friction within the European community.

title: The Perennials
description: Governors may come and Governors may go, but that perennial bipartisan twosome on the statewide ballotRepublican Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz and Democratic Controller Arthur Levittjust keep rolling up the votes. Mr. Lefkowitz had a bit more trouble than usuala tribute to the quality of his dynamic young rival, Borough President Robert Abrams of the Bronx.

title: CULVER J. KENNEDY
description: Culver J. Kennedy, vice president of Sears, Roebuck & Co. for the Midwestern territory, died yesterday in Jasper, Ind., while on a trip inspecting the company's facilities. He was in his 60's and lived in Wilmette, a Chicago suburb.

title: Rockefeller Fund Last Year Awarded $1111 Million in Gifts
description: The Rockefeller Brothers Fund, a philanthropic arm of the Rockefeller family established in 1940, yesterday issued its annual report for 1973, listing 299 separate grants totaling $11,784,169.

title: Inquiry Is Set on Newark Disturbances
description: NEWARK, Nov. 67A special Essex County grand jury was impaneled today by Superior Court Assignment Judge Arthur Blake to investigate both criminal allegations and the underlying causes of four days of disturbances last September in the city's Hispanic community.

title: Law Change Urged
description: Dozens of community representatives from throughout New York City beseeched the central Board of Education at a hearing to seek a change in the decentralization law that now requires a minimum daily attendance of 15,000 pupils in each of the 32 community school districts.

title: Voter Discrimination
description: For the most part, voters in the metropolitan area demonstrated again that they know how to read the small type on the ballot. New Yorkers, who had twice turned down transportation bond issues in the past four years, overwhelmingly endorsed the State Railroad Preservation Act at the polls on Tuesday. A principal difference is that while earlier issues included funds for highways, this one was solely for the rehabilitation of the railroadslongdistance passenger trains, commuter lines and freight service. The $250million bond issue approved by the voters will release enough Federal matching funds to make possible an $811million rehabilitation program that should greatly benefit this state from Montauk to Buffalo.

title: Music: Conlon Conducts Philharmonic
description: James Conlon, a product of the Juilliard School, started his week of New York Philharmonic concerts list night in Fisher Hall. Was he the youngest conductor ever to face the orchestra at a subscription concert? No, said the Philharmonic. Seiji Ozawa and Thomas Schippels may have had a few months on Mr. Conlon. Anyway, Mr. Conlon, at 24, is one of the youngest.

title: 1.2 MILLION SHARES OF 3M WILL BE SOLD
description: William L. McKnight, a former board chairman of the Minnesota Mining and Manufacturing Company, and a member of his family plan to sell 1.2 million shares of 3M common stock before the end of the year. Mr. McKnight said he would retain 3.7 million shares of 3M common stock.

title: Chess: The 19th Game a Paradox In Its Play and Aftermath
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 6Viktor Korchnoi was granted a postponement of the 20th game of his final candidates match for the world championship today. The game, in which he was to play Black against Anatoly Karpov, had been scheduled for 5 o'clock this afternoon in the Writers Club; it has been reset for the same time Friday.

title: DEMOCRATS VIEW THEIR VICTORY AS SPUR TO LEGISLATIVE MOVES; FORD ASKS RESPONSIBLE ACTION,
description: Democratic leaders, savoring their most significant Congressional election victory in a decade, declared yesterday that they were prepared to construct their own legislative program to deal with the economy and other pressing issues.

title: GEN. LOUIS FORTIER, VETERAN OF 3 WARS
description: Brig. Gen. Louis J. Fortier, U.S.A., retired, who had served in three wars, died of a heart attack yesterday in New Orleans. He was 82 years old and lived in Arlington, Va.

title: A Plan to Reorganize Boston Schools Defeated
description: BOSTON, Nov. 6 (AP)  A proposed reorganization of the Boston school system was overwhelmingly rejected yesterday.

title: Trouble Over Oil Tie Seen For Ford Energy Nominee
description: A $1million separation agreement from an oiltransport concern is threatening to cause problems in winning Senate confirmation of President Ford's nominee for Federal Energy Administrator.

title: Books of The Times Through With Hats
description: Why are the protagonists of so many current novels nameless? Are the authors afraid that, in giving their characters a name, they might taint them with some faint resemblance to a living human being? They must be kept pure, like sacrificial virgins, reserved for a symbolic fate. These same characters are often denied employment, along with a name. They need all their time for existential pursuits. The density, the concerns, of ordinary life would encumber them, perhaps confuse the issue they are so intensely illustrating.

title: Ford's Impact Is Called Minimal
description: Election returns indicate that President Ford's impact on the campaign this fall was minimal, despite his grueling monthlong Republican rescue mission that took him 16,685 miles through 20 of the 50 states.

title: Radio
description: 67 A.M., WNYCFM: Sunrise Symphony. Organ Concerto No, 1 in G minor, Handel; Suite from Les Fetes Venetiennes, Campra. 9:0610, WQXR: Piano Personalities. Dimitri Bashkirov and Igor ihukov. Six Intermezzi, Schumann; Fantasia in A minor, Scriabin.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: All Prisoners of War Lose Congress Races
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (UPI)Former prisoners of war found that the Vietnam issue failed to stir voters in this year of inflation and Watergate. Four former prisoners of war running for Congress lost.

title: 2,000 CATHOLICS PROTEST IN SEOUL
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 6 More than 2,000 Korean Roman Catholics attended a defiant mass today demanding abrogation of the nation's restrictive Constitution, while antiGovernment protests continued to mount as the schedtiled visit by President Ford neared.

title: Grumman Corp. Reports A Decline in Net Income
description: The Grumman Corporation reported yesterday lower net income for the three and nine months ended Sept. 30 because of tax credits in the 1973 periods. Actual earnings, however, were up 18.9 per cent for the third quarter and 17.5 per cent for the nine months over last year, according to results reported from the company's headquarters in Bethpage, L.I.

title: Consumer Notes
description: Household products in aerosol canschiefly paints, solvents and degreasersusing vinyl chloride as the propellant have been banned by the Consumer Products Safety Commission because vinyl chloride has been proved to be a cancercausing agent.

title: Britain Tells Uganda To Cut Staff in London
description: LONDON, Nov. 6Britain ordered the Uguandan Government today to cut its diplomatic staff in London from 12 to 4 in quick reprisal against a similar edict by President Idi Amin yesterday expelling all but five of the British displomatic staff in Kampala by Sunday.

title: Portuguese Office Set Afire
description: LISBON, Nov. 6 (Reuters)About 60 demonstrators today set fire to the offices in Oporto of a centerright Portuguese party whose Lisbon headquarters were wrecked by leftwingers two days ago.

title: Runoff Set Next Month In Virgin Islands Race
description: CHARLOTTE AMALIE, Virgin Islands, Nov. 6 (AP)Virgin Islanders have voted out the Republican administration of Gov. Melvin Evans, but the election board declared today that a runoff would be required to decide his successor.

title: MIRAGE FOE STIRS A FRENCH DISPUTE
description: PARIS, Nov. 6Members of the National Assembly expressed anger today over the disclosure that Paul Stehlin, a former air force chief of staff who is an Assembly vice president, had opposed the acquisition of Frenchbuilt Mirage fighters by other members of the Atlantic alliance.

title: DEMOCRATS PLAN TO BEEP JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Nov. 6Emboldened by their biggest Congressional sweep in this century, New Jersey Democrats moved today to solidify their victories in yesterday's election with a new Congressional redistricting plan calculated to make them as lasting as possible.

title: The Midwest: Erosion of G.O.P. Quickens
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 6  The steady erosion of Republican strength: in the Middle West continued in yesterday's elections, except that this year its pace was much quicker.

title: Concert
description: Bach at St. Thomas, the title of a series of four concerts that opened Tuesday night, does double duty. The programs, of Bach's music, are being given at St. Thomas Church here, and the works being performed were all written by the composer in connection with hls years as cantor at St. Thomas's in Leipzig.

title: Those Simple Little Dresses Seen Up and Down the Avenue
description: She looks like a slightly decadent Italian film star, with her long, deliberately messy brown hair, the slashes of turquoise on her lower lids, and her expressive, pouty lips. She is sleek, she is chic, she is sensualand she is also very successful, to the tune of a $13million gross this year.

title: Dublin Gas Terminal Burns
description: DUBLIN, Nov. 6 (UPI)Gascylinder explosions started major fire in a storage terminal today and forced hundreds of residents to flee the city's port area.

title: British Football
description: British Football

title: SOUTH AFRICAN HEAD FORESEES CHANGES
description: CAPETOWN, Nov. 6Prime Minister John Vorster suggested last night that substantial changes will occur in South Africa in the next 6 to 12 months. In a speech to his constituents at Nigel, in the Transvaal, he called on what he called political commentators to give South Africa a chance of about six months.

title: Girls Get Best of It
description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP)An East Bay high school bulletin recently carried the following notice: Girls may try out for boys teams. However, boys may not try out for girls teams.

title: In Albany, It Was a Day Like All Days for Most
description: ALBANY, Nov. 6  The mood today in the government offices that fill the glacial stone towers around the Albany Mall was businessasIsual.

title: Dr. Robert L. Preston, 70, Orthopedic Surgeon, Dies
description: Dr. Robeht L. Preston, an orthopedic surgeon and a specialist on rheumatic arthritis, died Tuesday at New York Hospital. He was 70 years old and lived at 570 Park Avenue.

title: Sally Kellerman Performs
description: Sally XeHerman, the Hot Lips Houlihan of the film M.A.S.H., is, for no apparent reason, appealing at the Rainbow Grill. She is not a singer, although she tries to be. She is not amusing although, one assumes, she is trying to be. J.S.W.

title: New Faces in the Ranks Of 1974 Election Victors
description: Among the new faces and personalities that emerged from Tuesday's elections are a few who will attract more than casual interest.

title: Nixon Reportedly Gains, But Develops Pneumonia
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Nov. 6 Former President Richard M. Nixon's condition shows gradual improvement as he walks more, but he has developed a patch of pneumonia in his right lung, Mr. Nixon's doctors said here today.

title: Cleanup Time in Albany
description: Describing the New York State government as one of the most secretive, unresponsive and oligarchical in the nation, Common Cause, the national citizens lobby, announced recently that it was making this state its No. 1 target for 1975. Jack Conway, the organization's president, called for a tremendous housecleaning of New York's legislative procedures and campaign practices and other reforms in order to set an example which other states will follow.

title: Soviet Backs Separate Palestine State
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 6The Soviet Union today called for Palestinian statehood as part of a Middle East settlement.

title: Dita Beard, I.T.T. Figure, Is Hospitalized in Denver
description: DENVER, Nov. 6 (AP)Dita Beard, the lobbyist whose memorandum allegedly linked the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation's antitrust settlement to the concern's $400,000 pledge to the Republican party, has been hospitalized in Denver, her doctor said Wednesday.

title: A Nurse in West Virginia Operates Out of Wheelchair
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va. (AP) Stephanie Vankovich goes about Thomas Memorial Hospital here in a wheelchair but she is not the one who is being nursed. Miss Vankovich is a registered nurse on the hospital's staff.

title: PALESTINE DEBATE A STRAIN FR ILK
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 6 A United States spokesman here said today that special security measures were being discussed for the debate on the issue of Palestine in the United Nations General Assembly next week. But he declined to comment on the expected appearance here of Yasir Arafat, head of the Palestine Liberation Organization, the main grouping of guerrillas.

title: Police Gain Accord On Shooting Inquiry At Indians Camp
description: An agreement was reached yesterday between Indians encamped in Adirondack Park and the state police, under which police will begin a search of the area in which two whites were wounded by gunfire 10 days ago.

title: Parched State Democrats Enter A Promised Land of Patronage
description: In the waning days of his campaign, Governor Wilson could always get a laugh from partisan Republican audiences when he quoted to them a phrase he attributed to Joseph F. Crangle, the state Democratic chairman.

title: West: California and Colorado Pace the Democrats
description: SAN FRANCISCO. Nov. 6Across the West, the election yesterday was a Republican disaster, brightened only by race still in doubt, one seat saved and the capture of a previously Democratic Senate seat.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Pro Transactions
description: NEW PORK (NL)Placed Jack Aker, pitcher, on valvers.

title: Balloting in New York City and the Suburbs for Various State and Local Posts
description: Results of Balloting for Members of the Legislature

title: Forecast of 23% Drop in College Rolls In State by 1990 Stirs a Controversy
description: Twothirds of the private colleges in New York State face the possibility of going out of business in the next 15 years, according to figures issued by the New York State Education Department.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Theater
description: Gay Company, a new, intimate revue with 16 songs, four personable mat and one beautiful woman, is obviously not for everyone. For whom, then? Most probably, for intelligent adults with a sophisticated sense of humor who are fed up with sex exploitation and some crude, shabby counterparts to this show. The 80minute (with intermission) presentation is tasteful, stylishwith the trim snap and tone of those bygone Julius Monk revues at tha Plazaand witty as it comments on aspects of male homosexuality from an in but not insular viewpoint and lances social taboos with deadly irony.

title: Carole Katcher Wed to Dr. R. M. Chopin
description: Carole Katcher, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Henry E. Katcher of South Orange, N. J., was married yesterday afternoon to Dr. Richard M. Chopin, son of Dr, and Mrs. Irving Chopin of Elizabeth, N. J. The ceremony was performed in Temple B'nai Jeshurun in Short Hills, N. J., by Rabbi Ely E. Pilchik.

title: GROUP PLANS STUDY OF BREAST CANCER
description: Metropolitan area cancer specialists announced plans, yesterday to conduct an extensive study of various postoperative treatments for breast cancer.

title: LeMonde Says Election Shows Low Confidence
description: PARIS, Nov. 6 (Reuters)The independent newspaper Le Monde said today that the relatively low voter turnout in the United States Congressional elections reflected a waning confidence of Americans in their political institutions.

title: S. E. C. Reiterates Its Position on Fixed Fees
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6The Securities and Exchange Commission advised the New York Stock Exchange today that it would not object to an 8 per cent increase in fixed minimum commission rates for member firms on orders valued between $5,000 and $300,000.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Soviet Bank Seeks Eurocurrency Loan
description: LONDON, Nov. 6 (Reuters)The Soviet Union's Bank for, Foreign Trade is negotiating a syndicated bank loan in the international Eurocurrency markets of up to $100million, Eurocurrency bankers said today.

title: Lord Hailes, ExGovernor Of West Indies Federation
description: LONDON, Nov. 6 (AP)Lord Hailes, governorgeneral of the West Indies Federation from 1957 to 1962, died yesterday. He was 73 years old.

title: Japan Regains Oil From Waste
description: TOKYO, Nov. 6Japanese industry, which now imports all of its oil, is searching for new technology to regain oil from wasted commodities and materials or to turn out factory products from used articles. Eight major Japanese enterprises, including Mitsubishi Heavy Industries, are experimenting with recycling projects.

title: 20 Homeless in Bronx Fire
description: 20 Homeless in Bronx Fire A twoalarm fire that started last night in a topfloor vacant apartment of a sixstory build ing at 576 East 165th Street, in the Morrisania section of the Bronx displaced 20 tenants,; including nine children. No injuries were reported.

title: Community Leaders Act to Keep Boundaries of Districts Intact
description: A change in the decentralization law to permit the city's community school districts to minimum daily attendance drops below 15,000 pupils was urged yesterday by dozens of community leaders at a hearing held by the Board of Education.

title: White House Reports Changes of Officials
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (UPI)The White House announced today that President Ford had taken the following actions:

title: AN OUTSIDE AUDIT OF PORT AUTHORITY SOUGHT BY BYRNE
description: Governor Byrne formally asked the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey yesterday to seek a complete, independent audit of its financial operations.

title: Women Score Significant Gain At All Levels of Government
description: The voters have elected the first woman Mayor of a city of more than half a million population, the first woman Governor to be chosen in her own right, the first woman Chief Justice of a State Supreme Court and 17 or 18 women members of the House of Representatives.

title: Shipping/Mails All Hours Given in Eastern Standard Time
description: Today, Nov. 7

title: For a Truly Japanese Delicacy, Pickled Chrysan them um Petals
description: OSAKA, Japan  After nearly two decades of writing about the foods of the World it seems on several counts to be more difficult to interpret the foods and restaurants of Japan than any place on earth.

title: Defense's Bid for a CarterArtis Retrial Goes to Judge
description: JERSEY CITY, Nov. 6An appeal by Rubin (Hurricane) Carter for a new trial on triplemurder charges ended today with the presiding judge reserving decision.

title: Advertising
description: Those of you who were channelhopping during the election coverage already know that the First National City Bank pulled off a bit of a television advertising coup here Tuesday night.

title: S.E.C. Studies Foreign Role In Takeovers of Companies
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (UPI) The Securities and Exchange Commission scheduled today a hearing date on whether foreign interests are attempting secret takeover of United States companies.

title: HELGI JOHNSON
description: Helgi Johnson, former chairman of the geology department of Rutgers University, died on Sunday at Middlesex General Hospital in New Brunswick, N. J. He was 70 years old and lived in Franklin Township.

title: Recital: Baroque Violin
description: Since World War II, at least, the best harpsichordists and organists have worked hard to arrive at modern approximations of Baroque performance practices and sounds in their interpretatio'ns of works by Baroque composers.

title: Nixon's Last Election
description: BOSTON, Nov. 6It was more a ritual cleansing than an election: a way for voters who were taken in by a con artist to express their shame and their resentment. They washed their hands of Richard Nixon by voting against Charles Sandman, Joseph Maraziti, David Dennis, Wiley Mayne, Earl Landgrebe and Watergate.

title: Terms Are Listed For Copper Range And Amax Merger

Amax will will exchange 0.8 shares of its common stock for each of the 2,343,795 common shares of Copper Range outstanding. The value of the Amax stock to be exchanged is estimated at about $63.8million at yesterday's closing price of 35 on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Agnew Didn't Vote
description: ARNOLD, Md. Nov. 6 (AP)Former Vice President Spiro T. Agnew did not vote in yesterday's election and has not tried to register to vote in his new precinct here, according to election oficials. A secretary at his Crofton, Md., office said yesterday that Mr. Agnew, who pleaded no contest last October to charges of income tax evasion, would not vote. I believe if you will check you wil find that Mr. Agnew is not allowed to vote, the secretary said.

Careyl the Democrats in the Legislature yesterday started to confront the twin challenges of organizing an overwhelming majority in the Assembly and picking the leadership for a delicate minority role in the State Senate.

description: George Meany, president ofl the A.F.L.C.I.O., took a strong position yesterday in support of public employe militancy and strike action, if necessary. He spoke at a founding convention in Washington for a new Public Employes Department of the federation.

description: RALEIGH, N. C., Nov. 6 (AP)Wilmer (Vinegar Bend) Mizell, former major league pitcher, lost his bid for a fourth term in the House of Representatives yesterday. Mizell, the Republican incumbent in North Carolina's Fifth District, was beaten by a weekly newspaper publisher, Stephen L. Neal.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6John N. Mitchell, the fromer Attorney General, and Kenneth Wells Parkinson, a lawyer for the Nixon reelection campaign, asked today for a mistrial in the Watergate coverup case as a result of the prosecution's surprise disclosure Monday that a supposed Government witness had withheld and lied about crucial evidence.

title: Loss of 5 Seats in House Takes G.O.P. Back to 12
description: In their worst showing since Woodrow Wilson carried the state and nation in 1912, New York Republicans lost five seats in the House of Representatives on Tuesday, and will return only 12 members to the 94th Congress, compared with 27 Democrats.

title: Opium in Laos: It's Hard to Stop
description: KIO NYA, LaosThe tiny green leaves of the opium poppy are just beginning to poke through the rich earth of the steep hillside field tilled by Wa Cha Song.

title: WIDE VOTER SHIFT FROM G.O.P. SHOWN
description: Voters in every region, ethnic group and economic classification switched in about the same proportion to Democratic candidates for the House of Representatives in yesterday's election, according to analyses of the vote and major political polls.

title: REV. HOWARD LOWELL
description: The Rev. Howard Marshall Lowell, rector emeritus of the Protestant Episcopal Church of St. John's of Lattingtown in Cold Spring Harbor, L. I., died Tuesday. He was 65 years old and lived on Ash Street in Locust Valley, L. I.

title: No PACT REACHED BY ORE EXPORTERS
description: GENEVA, Nov. 5Iron ore exporting countries were unable to reach agreement at a threeday session here on the issue of forming an association to defend their interests.

title: Sargent Unsure of Future
description: BOSTON, Nov. 6 (AP)Gov. Francis W. Sargent said today that he planned to stay in public life after he is succeeded by Michael S. Dukakis in January But he said he was not sure what he would be able to do. Prior to being Governor, he had been in state government since 1947.

title: U.S. RENEWS BID TO BREAK UP I.B.M.
description: In its strongest plea yet for the breakup of the International Business Mgchines Corporation, the Justice Department filed a 337page pretrial brief yesterday in its almost sixyear  old antitrust action against the giant computer company.

title: Notes on People Joan Kennedy Pleads Guilty in Auto Mishap and Is Fined $200
description: Joan Kennedy was fined $200 and her driver's license suspended for six months yesterday after she pleaded guilty to charges of driving under the influence of alcohol. The wife or Senator Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massachusetts, was to have appeared today in court in Fairfax, Va., for a hearing on the charge which was entered Oct. 9 after her car bumped the rear of another stopped at a red light.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: NIIGATA, Japan, Nov. 6 (AP)Shigeo Nagashima had a double and a single off New York's starting pitcher, Randy Tate, pacing the Tokyo Yomiuri Giants to a 94 victory today and extending the Mets slump against the Tokyo team to seven games without a victory. The touring Mets have five losses and two ties against the Giants.

title: Sets Get Rights to Stan Smith
description: The New York Sets of World Team Tennis obtained the rights to Stan Smith yesterday.

title: Screen: Chabrol's 'The Nada Gang' Is at Playboy:The Cast
description: Why do anarchists in contemporary movies have to wear black broadbrimmed hats? Solving that minor mystery is essential to understanding the defects of Claude Chabrol's "The Nada Gang," a muddled yet sometimes rewarding movie, which opened yesterday at the Playboy Theater.In Paris, a group of youthful terrorists kidnap the United States Ambassador to France, and the French Government responds with a scenario of overkill. The movie condemns the state even more fiercely than it does the outlaws; when the authorities consider sacrificing the hostage's life so that the public will lose its sympathy for the Left, the film thoroughly fulfills Mr. Chabrol's own conviction that "the state prefers terrorism to revolution."There are many fine scenes throughout the movieeach enhanced by impeccable cameraworkas when the stolid Ambassador is seized at a posh brothel while watching a barely veiled prostitute ape Salome, or when a getaway car overturns in a field of rippling wheat. And there are several good performancesnotably, Maurice Garrel as an aging professional revolutionary, a rueful cynic who alternates between being vulnerable or ruthless, wistful or hardheaded.But the trouble with the movieand here comes that hat againis that the pivotal character, the anarchist, is a joke figure. Played by Fabio Testi, he's all burning glances, flaring nostrils, and operatic gestures. Whereas the murderous police officer (Michel Aumont) is thoroughly believable, the Nada gang is mainly ludicrous. To portray them, the director grasps at clichs: those on the Left simply have to oversleep, guzzle booze in the morning and keep untidy homes.Although Mr. Chabrol deplores the group's tactics, he has some sympathy for its intentions. Yet he makes its members into political idiots; for example, the ransom demanded for the Ambassador serves no revolutionary purpose, it's just for "the cause." Also, because the script is sloppy, the film seems to equate dissidence with terrorism.Meanwhile, Mariangela Melato plays a creature who's almost obligatory in a movie of this kind: a rebellious swinger who has joined the revolution for sex, not politics, and who dramatizes her own self-hate by boasting that she's a whore. The actress, who doesn't equal her performances in Lina Wertmuller's films, does salvage moments of this hackneyed role with the ironic, level-eyed gaze that she used in "The Seduction of Mimi."Mr. Chabrol has chosen a milieu that's just too alien for him, as the absurdity of the film's conclusion proves. While most of his terrorists are middle class, they're too far removed from the bourgeoisie that he understands so well. Still, he has achieved an elegant blast at corrupt authority, even though he has muffed the characterization of its enemies or critics.

title: Mrs. Peron Declares a State of Siege
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 6 (Reuters)  President Isabel Martinez de Peron declared Argentina under a state of siege today in an effort to combat a mounting wave of political violence.

title: Tuesday's Fight
description: Sacramento, Calif.Joe Guevara, 120 pounds, Sacramento, outpointed Serio Ayala, 124, Mexico, 10 rounds.

title: Minority Contractors Protest State's Rejection of Bid
description: Angered by the State Dormitory Authority's rejection of its bid to remodel Baskerville Hall and Wingate Gymnasium at City College, members of a minority contractors group said yesterday that they would use all necessary and legal steps, including going to court, if necessary to force the authority to award it the contract.

title: Busy With Marriages
description: BUCHAREST, Rumania (AP) Registrar Aureliu Milea of Bucharest's Sector I has married 43,000 couplesaveraging six a dayfrom 1952 to 1973. Mr. Milea says he is just warming up and his goal is 100,000.

title: Casino Defeat Ends Dreams of Prosperity in Atlantic City Realty
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Nov. 6The overwhelming rejection of casino gamblin: by New Jersey voters has ended dreams of instant prosperity in inflated realestate sales.

title: Business Briefs
description: GENEVA, Nov. 6  The Swiss Government decided today to join the new international energy agency that the Western nations are establishing to insure cooperation meeting an oil shortage.

title: Connecticut G.O.P. Leader Links Watergate to Losses
description: NORWICH, Conn., Nov. 6 (AP)  Republican State Chairman Vincent A. Laudone tonight blamed Watergate, inflation and general economic troubles for the severe beating Republicans took at the polls yesterday.

title: EDITH KOLLMORGEN
description: Edith Mountenay Kollmorgen, the widow of Frederick Kollmorgen, founder and former president of the Kollmorgen Optical Company, died Monday at her home in Onancock, Va. She was 84 years old and formerly lived in Mountain Lakes and Caldwell, N.J. Mrs. Kollmorgen leaves two sisters, Florence Nelson of Lebanon, N. J., and Ruth Muth of Chatham, N. J.

title: Delegation Asks Mrs. Gandhi for Emergency Food for Assam
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 6Prime Minister Indira Gandhi has been told of mass hunger and starvation in the northeastern state of Assam.

title: Events Today
description: THE BOY FRIEND, a musical comedy by Sandy Wilson, directed by Nancy Robin, choreographed by Joe Davis, presented by The Equity Library Theater, Riverside Drive and 103d Street, 8, through November 24.

title: Bells Are for the Birds
description: DEERFIELD BEACH, Fla. (AP)  The city commission passed an ordinance requiring cats to wear bells after a local Audubon Society member protested that cats were decimating the bird population of the city.

title: Market Basket Fell 60 Cents Last Week; Sugar Went Up by 7c
description: A 7cent rise in the average cost cf a fivepound sack of sugar featured price changes in last weeks i38tem Market Basket survey f the City Department of Consumer Affairs, which showed a slight decrease.

title: PRICES ARE MIXED ON AMEX AND OTC
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market closed mixed, yesterday in steppedup trading.

title: Marshall, Reliever, Is Voted Top Pitcher
description: Mike Marshall, the tireless relief pitcher who helped the Los Angeles Dodgers win their first pennant in eight years, was named the National League's Cy Young Award *inner yesterday.

title: D.C. VOTERS CHOOSE DEMOCRAT AS MAYOR
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (UPI); District of Columbia voters, choosing their first elected city government in more than a century, elected a former Presidential appointee, Walter Washington, a Democrat, as Mayor yesterday, along with a predominantly Democratic council.

title: Women Score Significant Gain At All Levels of Government
description: The voters have elected the first woman Mayor of a city of more than half a million population, the first woman Governor to be chosen in her own right, the first woman Chief Justice of a state Supreme Court and 17 or 18 women members of the House of Representatives.

title: State Rail Bond Issue Is Expected to First Help Commuter and Intercity Service
description: Intercity passenger service and commuter lines, are expected to be first in line to benefit from the new $250million rail borrowing program endorsed by New York State voters Tuesday:

title: AID TO CONSUMER BY CONGRESS SEEN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 Consumer advocates, stung by defeat in Congress this year, voiced confidence today that the new Congress would be more friendly to their cause.

title: Maraziti Attributes Def eat to Watergate And Inflation Issues
description: DOVER, Nov. 6Representative Joseph J. Maraziti, who gained national attention as a defender of President Richard M. Nixon during the televised impeachment hearings, today blamed Watergate and inflation for his resounding defeat at the polls yesterday. He lost to Helen S. Meyner in New Jersey's 13th Congressional District.

title: Joseph Durso
description: TOKYO, Nov. 3Eddie Maple, wearing an American flag for an armband over his Japanese riding silks, paused outside the jockeys room on the ground floor of the Tokyo Race Course and reviewed the pros and cons handling horses 6,000 miles from the big money at Aqueduct.

title: BONN SET TO ACT ON JOBLESSNESS
description: BONN, Nov. 6West Germany, which may have its highest unemployment rate this winter since the end of World War II, will probably drop its threeyear fight against inflation and try to prime its economy toward the end of this year, Chancellor Helmut Schmidt said in an interview released today.

title: Connecticut Bakers Protest Rising Cost of Sugar
description: WALLINGFORD, Conn., Nov. 6Connecticut bakers met here today to plan a fight against the rising cost of sugar and essential major ingredient in everything they make, from bagels to birthday cakes.

title: Hole Gets 4 Scores At Big A
description: Mike Hole won yesterday's riding honors at Aqueduct, bringing home four winners. The quartet comprised Elcaya in the fourth race ($5.80 for $2 straight), Be Gyo in the fifth (10.40), Ages Ago in the seventh ($11.20) and Twin Angle in the ninth ($25.60).

title: Lithuanian Seaman Freed by Soviet Ponders Future in U.S.
description: LOCUST, N. J., Nov. 6 (AP)Simus Kudirka spent his first day in the United States wondering what he was going to do now that he has been released from the Soviet Union and arrived in his new country.

title: College Freshman Guide Aims at 9thGrade Level
description: The Association of American Publishers recently brought out a pamphlet on How to Get the Most Out of Your Textbooks, designed for college freshmen, for example. After putting it through a readability test, however, the pamphlet was found to be written at a 12thgrade level, and it was rewritten to fit a ninthgrade level.

title: Rhodes Is Elected After He Concedes
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Nov. 6James A. Rhodes, a former Republican Governor of Ohio, was the unofficial winner of Ohio's race for the governorship. But Mr. Rhodes, who conceded defeat last night, refused to claim victory today.

title: COAL NEGOTIATORS BATTLE DEADLINE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6Negotiators for the coal industry and the United Mine Workers conducted today what spokesmen for both sides called their best day of bargaining in the two months they have been meeting in an effort to avert a miners strike this weekend. But both sides said it was too late to head off the walkout.

title: Personal Finance: While Motor Clubs Have Proliferated, So Has Criticism
description: As winter approaches, with its threat of car breakdowns, many drivers insure against the cost of road service by joining a motor club.

title: ExSanitationman, 28, Gets 15 Years for Cocaine Sale
description: Frank Valentine, a 28yearold former sanitationman of 535 Havemeyer Avenue, the Bronx, was sentenced yesterday to 15 years to life for selling two ounces of cocaine.

description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 6 (AP) United States Senator Lowell P. Weicker Jr., Connecticut Republican, said tonight that he was not surprised by the massive election defeat of Republican candidates because you could see the handwriting on the wall in 1972.

title: Eric Partridge Catches Phrases for New Book
description: LONDONDictionaries are usually prides of collective enterprise, but Eric Partridge prefers the solo fight, singlehandedly putting unruly words into ranks and orders. He makes his own discoveries and commits his own mistakes, and his dictionaries are there for all the world to consult: on slang, origins, Shakespeare's bawdy, soldiers language, proper names, Biblical words, underworld speech and downright cliches.

title: Wave of Attacks by Youths Besets Elderly in the Bronx
description: Hundreds of elderly men and women in the Bronx have been brutally attacked and robbed this fall by children and teenagers, most of them 14 to 16 years old and operating in packs of two, three and four, according to the police.

title: Tons of Cookies Taken As Driver Stops to Eat
description: YARDVILLE, N. J., (UPI) A tractor trailer carrying 15 tons of assorted Keebler cookies was hijacked today from a rest stop on the New Jersey Turnpike, the state police reported.

title: Members of the New Congress, Governors and the Winners in Connecticut
description: Asterisk (*) denotes incumbent. Dagger (t) indicates not a candidate this year and continues in office.

title: Theater
description: The adventures of Scapino have been formidable. This Young Vic production, devised by Frank Dunlop and Jim Dale, directed by Mr. Dunlop and starring Mr. Dale, has certainly done its share of traveling. It opened in a converted butcher's shop in London (which is the Young Vic's home), moved to a grand and empty space at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, went in the round at the CircleintheSquare and now has ended up, for the first time behind a proscenium arch, on Broadway in the Ambassador Theater.

title: Internes Picket City Hall In Drive for a Labor Pact
description: Fifty internes and resident physicians at municipal hospitals demonstrated at City Hall yesterday to support their requests in collective bargaining with the city's Health and HosIpitals Corporation.

title: Morgenthau Gives Action on Repeaters Top Priority
description: Robert M. Morgenthau, who was elected District Attorney of Manhattan on Tuesday in 1. ndslide victory, said yesterday that his major priority was to identify criminal repeaters, move them qu ckly to trial and seek stiff prison sentences.

title: Nixon Has Pneumonia
description: Former President Richard M. Nixon's condition showed some improvement, but he has developed a patch of pneumonia in one lung, his doctors say. Page 50.

title: Hearing on a CarterArtis Retrial Ends; Judge Weighing Issues and Testimony
description: JERSEY CITY Nov. 6An appeal by Rubin (Hurricane) Carter for a new trial on triplemurder charges ended today with the presiding judge reserving decision.

title: Giants Sing an Optimistic Tune
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N. Y., Nov. 6A new attitude of catilusiasin suddenly has embraced the New York Giants in the second half of their National Football League season. And today Bob Tucker, the tight end, said, It's like a rejuvenation.

title: Bearish Economic News Cuts Into Earlier Gains
description: The stock market finished mixed in the heaviest trading in almost a month yesterday as profit taking and bearish economic news eroded strong earlier gains.

title: Quick Impact Seen If Miners Strike
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6A Federal task force has concluded that the expected coal strike will start to cause production losses and labor layoffs immediately, and that there is nothing the Government can do about it.

title: National Vote Pattern: A Sweep If Not a G.O.P. Debacle
description: The American electorate vented its wrath on Republican; candidates across the nation on Tuesday, striking hardest at; state legislators and States Representativesthose theoretically most responsive to the News public will. The Analysis Democrats made marked gains in state legislatures, posting truimphs in states as diverse as New York, Tonnessee,. Illinois and Wisconsin. They did equally well in the House of Representatives, picking up two or more seats each in California, Illinois, Indiana. Iowa, Michigan, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina. Oregon, Tennessee, Virginia and Wisconsin.

title: Sadat and Faisal Support Kissinger's Mideast Aims
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Nov. 6Secretary of State Kissinger arrived in Jordan tonight after having received strong endorsements of his stepbystep negotiating approach in the Middle East from Egypt and Saudi Arabia.

title: Maine's Surprise Victor James B. Longley
description: LEWISTON, Me., Nov. 6It had all the makings of a sentimental television drama A modest cleancut American family of seven is suddenly thrust into the limelight. The father just an average guy, he calls himselfis elected Governor of a state as an independent pledged to purge the politicians on his very first try for political office. NBC, CBS and The New York Times all rush in seeking interviews. The phone in the white suburban ranch house jingles with calls from Governors and Senators all over the country.

title: Saigon Restricts Distribution of Printed Material
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Nov. 7 (AP)The Government of President Nguyen Van Thieu ordered new crackdowns today on opposition groups. He restricted the distribution of printed materials and issued a reminder that all meetings and demonstrations judged harmful to public order and security were prohibited.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: State Environmental Protection Commissioner David Bardin said in Trenton that a hearing scheduled by the United States Department of the Interior on proposed offshore oil drilling was inconsiderate and unrealistic. Mr. Bardin criticized the Interior Department for giving lack of adequate notice and insufficient lead time for the hearing in Trenton on Nov. 22 and 23. On another matter, Mr. Bardin said the cancellation of expansion plans at the Mobil Oil Corporation refinery in Paulsboro had been caused by inflation and a declining demand for oil. He repeated a call for the oil industry to prepare a master study of present and planned petroleum and liquid natural gas facilities in the Delaware River Basin.

title: College Freshman Guide Aims at 9thGrade Laid
description: The Association of Attleecan Publishers recently brought out a pamphlet on How to Get the Most Out of Your Textbooks, designed for college freshmen, for example. After putting it through a readability test, however, the pamphlet was found to be written at a 12thgrade level, and it was rewritten to fit a ninthgrade level.

title: Reduced Diets in Affluent Lands Argued at Food Parley in Rome
description: ROME, Nov. 6Suggestions that people in rich countries eat less to free food for the third of the world struggling for existence have begun to emerge as one of the key issues at the World Food Conference here.

description: Hockey, Basketball Standings

title: Court Rejects Catena Bid for Freedom
description: TRENTON, Nov. 6  The State Supreme Court today unanimously rejected a petition for release from prison by Gerardo Catena, the reputed New Jersey underworld leader who has been jailed on contempt charges since 1970 for refusing to testify before the State Commission of Investigation.

title: A Change in Translation
description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP)The popular 50s rock n roll musical Grease, which is enjoying, a successful run in San Francisco, was so named because of the hair preparations used by teenagers of that era.

title: Big Board Considers Precious Metals Market
description: The New York Stock Exchange is considering whether it will make a market in gold and other precious metals, James J. Needham, chairman, said yesterday.

title: Concert
description: Armin Schibler, the Swiss composer whose Metamorphoses ebrietatis was played at Carnegie Hall on Tuesday night by L'Orchestre de la Suisse Romande, is one of those confirmed eclectics who straddle the issues of contemporary music so skillfully that they can make modernity seem old hat. Mr. Schibler's splashily orchestrated piece has the kind of specific scenario that might have delighted Richard Strauss: It concerns a group Of partygoers who drink too much and gradually lose control. The music aims at representing various emotional states growing out of this promising situation.

title: Cox Says Nixon Erred In Court Plea on Tapes
description: LONDON, Nov. 6Former President Richard M. Nixon could have saved himself from the Watergate tapes scandal by a strong plea of executive privilege, Archibald Cox, the former special Watergate prosecutor, said at an address to the Castlereach Society in Cambridge last night.

title: Lord Harlech's Son, 33, Is Found Dead in London
description: LONDON, Nov. 6  Julian OrmsbyGore, son and heir of Lord Harlech, British Ambassador to Washington from 1961 to 1965, was found dead in his London apartment last night. The police said today that he had died from a bullet wound the brain and that suicide was indicated. Mr. OrmsbyGore, who was 33 years old, helped run the family estate in Shropshire. He also worked for a time as a waiter and model.

title: Regional Bloc
description: The New York metropolitan region, normally a hard Democratic core enclosed by a thick suburban peel of Republicanism, all but lost that outer tegument in Tuesday's elections. Nowhere was the G.O.P. rout more emphatic than in Suffolk County, that traditional bastion of Republicanism on the eastern end of Long Island.

title: Not a Republican Year, Sandman Says
description: OCEAN CITY, Nov. 6I have to keep pinching myself to believe that this has happened to me and that I'm going to have this opportunity, William, J. Hughes said this morning after receiving a congratulatory telephone call from Senator Henry M. Jackson, Democrat of Washington.

title: Democrats Take Over Bergen's Board
description: HACKENSACK, Nov. 6The national issues of Watergate and inflation helped the Democrats gain control of the Bergen County Board of Chosen Freeholders yesterday for the first time in seven, years and for only the second time in moa than half a century, leaders of both parties agreed today.

title: Miss Holtzman Will Seek To Set Up Panel on Tapes
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (UPI)  Representative Elizabeth Holtzman, Democrat of Brooklyn, told a Federal court today that she would ask Congress to create a special council to protect the Government's interest in former President Richard M. Nixon's tapes and papers.

title: Guide
description: CHEZ SIMONE A welcome new oasis of food and entertainment has quietly appeared on Bleecker Street, that colorful thoroughfare bisecting the heart of Greenwich Village, with the more raffish music taverns clustered toward the east and the more serene eating places toward the west end. Simone's at 277 Bleecker, stands alone at the center of the street (the corner of Jones), its beigebrick facade and bright lamp pleasantly blending with the famous surrounding Italian food marts.

title: New England States: Yankee Independence Tempers Sweep by Democrats
description: BOSTON, Nov. 6A Democratic electoral sweep through much of New England yesterday was tempered by Yankee independence.

title: Near the Carey Home. Gunfire Brings Arrest

description: NEWBURGH, N.Y., Nov. 6A bang of black youtns broke store windows and looted in downtown Newburgh tonight: following a series of fights tween black and white youths!a that began at a high school'be rock concert Monday night.

description: AMMAN, Jordan, Nov. 6Secretary of State Kissinger arrived tonight in Jordan after having received strong endorsements of his stepbystep negotiating approach in the Middle East from Egypt and Saudi Arabia.

But Mr. Ford will be unable to attend the game between his alma mater the University of Michigan, and Ohio State Uniiversity on Nov. 23 because he will be traveling in the Far East at that time.

Y., Nov. 7An American spokesman said today that the United States was considering housing representatives of the Palestine Liberation Organization at Governors Island or some other secluded area in or near New York during their forthcoming visit to the United Nations.

Would that they weren't but, despite a bigger budget and better production values, the basic product is depressingly familiar. On CBSTV tonight at 9, the first twohour effort offers the true tale of Alvin Karpis, a tale described as the full true story of the infamous KarpisBarker gang, the most elusive of the maddog bank robbers of the nineteenthirties.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: President Ford's economy proposals may have been a master stroke intended to prepare Americans for the rigors of government controls rather than to cure inflation by themselves. Voluntary controls, as the President probably knows, will almost certainly not work (last night I went to wash my laundry and found the water temperature selector on hot) so Americans will call for enforceable sorts of control. Saying that our economy is not in a recession, the President has left the American people to realize for themselves that, indeed, it is.

title: The Screen: 'Warehouse':Japanese Import Opens at Screening Room
description: A romance involving dismemberment may seem about as likely as a caper concerning castration, but the first half of Yasuzo Masumura's "Warehouse," which is playing today and tomorrow at the First Avenue Screening Room, sustains an eerie interest. In Tokyo, a blind sculptor and his mother kidnap a model. They keep her prisoner in a warehouse adorned with his sculptures of gigantic eyes, mouths, noses, breasts, arms, legs, and torsosall of which he re-created from the bodies that he handled as a professional masseur.This movie recalls "The Collector," especially when the kidnapper is enraged by the frantic victim's efforts to escape. He wants to sculpture her through touch; after infinite struggles, she capitulates, while taunting him for his virginity and for being his "mother's toy." The frightening sensitivity of the blind man is well conveyed, along with the claustrophobia induced by his huge darkened studio. And the respectable appearance of his portly motherwho abets his every lunacy  bestows a background of normalcy that strengthens the obsessions of the picture.However, the film turns clownish toward its conclusion, when the ill-mated pair become lovers, then take bites out of each other's shoulders and hack each other up with knives. (All this occurs on a 70-foot reclining rubber nude.) The woman becomes a raving pain buff, and the movie eventually suggests an Oriental parody of "The Night Porter." Subtitles enhance the action: "Listen, I have a dandy idea!", she exclaimsand then urges her rather reluctant admirer to chop off her arms and legs. He quite rationally says, "Why?"The camera is tactfully averted from the ensuing carpentry: we simply hear some heavy thumps and ecstatic howls as she's converted to a torso. He asks if she's happy, while in a voiceover narration, she praises "the world of the tactual sense," "Warehouse," which was called "Blind Beast" in Japan, may not grip your emotions, but it certainly clutches your attention. Still, it's a trifle hard to know just whom this movie will satisfyapart from sentimental surgeons.

title: Kissinger Assures the Israelis on Policy

description: CAMDEN, N. J., Nov. 7 (AP) A Superior court judge ruled today the New Jersey. Sports and Exposition Authority could hold its winterrace meeting at Garden State Park in Cherry Hill, but said the last race must start no later than 3:30 P.M. on weekdays.

title: Gold Price Opens Higher But Falls Off at Closing
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 7 (UPI)Gold opened higher today but lost ground later in the day to close below yesterday's figure. The dollar closed lower on European money markets.

title: N.B.A. Puts Gourdine 2d In Command
description: The National Basketball Association, a pioneer in promoting blacks to coaching and administrative positions, yesterday took a major step toward the election of the first black commissioner. The league owners, meeting at The Coliseum in Richfield, Ohio, filled the post of deputy commissioner with Simon P. Gourdine. In the absence of Walter Kennedy, the commissioner, the 34yearold Gourdine, who had been vice president of administration, would take over his duties.

title: About New York
description: A taxi driver was carrying a passenger up the Avenue of the Americas the other day, when, on reaching 34th Street, he came into the usual glut of traffic. The taxi driver saw a small opening in the traffic and made for it, but when he did, he banged into a bus, whose driver was making for it, too.

title: Advertising
description: A group of midwestern marketing people, including quite a number of packagedgoodi experts, got an inside look yesterday at a fairly new and extremely perishable productTime Inc.'s People magazine.

title: Giants Favored, but Not by Television
description: The Giants are favored by a touchdown over the Jets for their game Sunday at New Haven, where the Yale Bowl will not be filled. That is a break for television fans because the contest will therefore not be televised here. The Redskins against the Eagles, the more worthy replacement, will be seen on Channel 2, starting at 1 P.M. To complete the video doubleheader, Channel 4 will televise Pittsburgh at Cincinnati, 4 P.M. The Monday night game should be a good one matching probable playoff teams, Minnesota and St. Louis, Channel 7, 9 P.M. Here is a preview of all games with wonlosttied records in parentheses.

title: Recycled Tweed
description: One can hardly look for a bright side to New York's current fiscal crisis, but there are unexpected consolation prizes. One assumes Mayor Beame's commonsense directive to city agencies to repair and renovate the offices they have now rather than build new ones will be acted on first at homeat City Hall.

title: G.A.O. Report Says $1Billion System. May Delay Parcels
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 (UPI) Congressional auditors said today that the Postal Service was investing nearly $1billion in a mechanized, centralized system that will often result in slower delivery of parcels. The Postal Service denied the criticism.

title: High Tides Around New York
description: For high tide at Jones Inlet (Pt. Lookout), deduct 19 min, from Sandy Hook time.

title: FUTURES IN SUGAR RISE DAILY LIMIT
description: World sugar futures jumped the daily permissible limit of 2 cents a pound yesterday for the eighth session in a row, but for some desperate trade houses with short positions, there was a little respite.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming Passenger and Mail Ships Outgoing Passenger and Mail Ships

title: Water From Mississippi River Linked to Cancer Death Trends
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7An environmentalist group said today that cancercausing chemicals in the Mississippi may be a factor in the high cancer death rates in Louisiana communities that depend on the river for their water supply.

title: AUTO INSURANCE IN JERSEY TO RISE
description: TRENTON, Nov. 7State Insurance Commissioner James J. Sheeran announced today that he had authorized rate increases in car insurance averaging 3.3 per cent to 16.1 per cent statewide, beginning Nov. 27.

title: Egan and Young Leading In Alaska and in Dakota
description: Votes were still being counted last night in two major races, one for Governor and one for Senator, with no clear victors in sight.

title: Alexander M. Bickel Dies; Constitutional Law Expert
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 7Alexander M. Bickel, Yale's Sterling Professor of Law and one of the country's preeminent authorities on the Constitution, died today of cancer at his home. He was 49 years old.

title: NEW GAS BUSINESS BARRED BY P.U.C. Board Acts in Anticipation of Winter Shortage Promotion Prohibited
description: NEWARK, Nov. 7The State Board of Public Utility Commissioners, in an effort to deal with anticipated shortages of natural gas this winter, today prohibited naturalgas distribution companies from accepting any new customers or honoring verbal commitments to supply gas for new homes or businesses.

title: ACF DELIVERS FIRST OF NEW RAIL BOXCARS
description: The first of a fleet of 10,060 new standard 50foot railroad boxcars was delivered yesterday by ACF Industries, Inc., to the American Railroad Box Car Company, a newly formed subsidiary of the Trailer Train Company, a railroad industry cooperative.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Major Events of the Day International National Metropolitan The Other News Quotation of the Day CORRECTIONS

title: Sports News Briefs
description: ??? ??? of college football bowl teams grew yesterday when North Carolina State accepted an invitation to play in the AstroBluebonnet Bowl on Dec. 23 in Houston and Vanderbilt said it would play in the Peach Bowl Dec. 28 Atlanta. North Carolina State's opponent will be Houston, while Vanderbilt is expected to play Texas Tech, provided Tech defeats Texas Christian tomorrow.

title: Cardiologist Offers Meditation Exercise
description: Relax, relax, you'll have a heart attack. The admonition is common, but the suggestions on how to relax in an increasingly stressful world are often impractical or ineffective.

title: A ThirdParty Candidate Is Second, Republican 3d
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 7 (UPI) For the first time in its short history, a candidate of the leftleaning Peace and Freedom party finished ahead of a major party candidate. The candidate was Kayren Hudiburgh, who finished second in San Francisco's 16th Assembly District with 6,556 votes.

title: Molese Is Dismissed For Remark After Duet
description: Michele Molese, tenor of the New York City Opera, has been dismissed by the company. At a performance of Verdi's Un Ballo in Maschera last Friday night, he followed a duet by announcing to the audience that his pinched high C is for Mr. Schonberg. The allusion was to a comment by Harold C. Schonberg, music critic of The New York Times, that in a previous performance Mr. Molese's top tones were squeezed.
