description: Mayor Beanie led 600 mourners yesterday at a funeral service for Francis Marion Flynn, former president and publisher of The Daily News, at St. Bartholomew's Episcopal Church on Park Avenue.

title: Senators Charge Failure To Reform Nursing Homes
description: WASHINGTON:. Nov. 19Federal and state governments Were accused today of persistently failing to enforce the laws and administrative standards designed to end abuses in the nation's nursing homes.

title: RUSSELL L. GILBERT
description: Ritssell Lofton Gilbert, who held a seat on the New York Stock Exchange from 1929 to 1969, died yesterday at his home, 640 Park Avenue. He was 178 years old.

title: Massachusetts Deficit Seen
description: BOSTON, Nov. 19, (AP)Secretary of Administrationdesignate John R. Buckley said today that the state had a $36million budget deficit. Mr. Buckley said he believed the state could make it through another year without new taxes.

title: WATERGATE TAPE GIVES NIXON'S PLAN FOR FULL PARDONS
British Firm to End Auto Racing Ties
description: LONDON, Nov. 19 (AP)Yardleys, sponsor of Formula One racing cars that have won seven Grand Prix races since 1970, announced today it was pulling out of the sport at the end, of this year.

title: Saints Lose Moore
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 19 (AP)Jerry Moore, a safetyman, will be out for the rest of the year after playing against the Los Angeles Rams on a broken ankle, a spokesman for the New Orleans Saints said today.

title: Eutope Basketball Holds First Draft
description: The graildly named, Madrid Superstars took on life yesterday along Avith seven other teams as Alie Ettropeah Professional Basketball League draftee its first players.

title: FORD ASKS JAPAN TO HELP COMBAT ECONOMIC STRESS
Heart Recipient on Liquids
description: RICHMOND, Nov. 19, (UPI) Lennarth T. Bearnarth, the world's newest heart transplant recipient, began to take liquid nourishment today and was listed in satisfactory condition by a hospital spokesman. Bearnarth, a 40yearold men's clothing retailer from Potomac, Md., received his new heart Monday morning at the Medical College of Virginia in a four and one half hour operation directed by Dr. Richard Lower.

title: Notes on People
Gilhooley Spurns Racing Posts, Top Trotter Sold for $300,000
description: John J. Gilhooley, who was recruited for the presidency of the New York Racing Association by the country's top executivesearch agency, yesterday turned the job down. In a letter:to the the.chairman of the N.Y.R.A., Alfred G. Vanderhilt, Gilhooley said he prefernd to remain as president of Transport of New Jersey and be part of a massive breakthrough coming in the mass transit industry.

title: Chiefs Surge Shatters Broncos Hopes
description: DENVER, Nov. 19 (AP)A seemingly harmless safety opened the way for a 19point third quarter for Kansas City last night, leading the Chiefs to a National Football League victory over Denver and wrecking the Broncos', playoff hopes.

title: Whalers Defeat Cougars
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 19 (AP) Fred O'Donnell and Tom Webster sparked a New England comeback with two goals in the third period to,, night to lift the Whalers to a 5.4 victory over the Chicago Cougars in a World Hockey Association game.

title: JERSEY TAX STUDY ASKS HIGHER RATE
description: TRENTON, Nov. 19Additional ta,r calculations obtained here today show that a statewide property tax proposed to finance public. schools will cost New, Jersey property owners far more than originally cated. Acoording to legislative leaders, the data, have all but destroYed the chances of approval of the property tax.

title: 2 SIDES SUM UP IN PHILIPS TRIAL
description: William R. Phillips was portrayed yesterday in widely divergent roles as defense and prosecution summed up their cases in the retrial of the suspended police officer on murder charges in the slaying of a pimp and an 18yearold prostitute on Christmas Eve, 1968.

title: Arafat Arrives in Cairo And Meets With Sadat
description: CAIRO, Nov. 19 (Reuters)President Anward elSadat conferred here today with Yasir Arafat, head of the Palestine Liberation Organization, the Middle East News Agency reported.

title: A Dilemma for the South Africans on Race:  Both Change and Inertia Will Be Hazardous
MOTOROLA TO LET GO AN ADDITIONAL 1,500
description: SCOTTSDALE, Ariz., Nov. 19 (UPI)  Motorola, Inc., announced yesterday it would, lay off another 1,500. employes at its worldwide operations, in ad dition to 3,000 announced earlier.

title: Attendance Is Near Normal At West Virginia Schools
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Nov. 19. (UPI)  School attendance here was near normal today, but officials continued to serve truancy notices on parents who have refused to permit their children to return to classes because of textbooks they consider immoral and unpatriotic.

title: Terrorists Had Killed 4 Residents of a Village Near Jordan Border
Housing Plan Given
description: Mayor Beame announced a basic program that seeks to start the constraction or rehabilitation of over the next three years of up to 72,000 federally subsidized apartments for poor and moderateincome families. Page 50.

title: DELAY SUGGESTED FOR FEE SWITCH
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19The Midwest Stock Exchange told the Securities and Exchange Commission today it feared that an order to end fixed brokerage commission rates on May I or any other predetermined day might damage the nation's equity markets.

title: Blind Woman Alleges Bias
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 19 (AP) Judith Guntiankin, 31 years; old, filed a Federal court suit today charging that the Philadelphia Board of Edutation had refused to hire, her as a teacher because she is blind.

title: Senators Asked to Block Naming of Byrne Nominee
description: NEWARK Nov. 19  The coordinator of the newly formed Government Women's Coalition has asked the State Senate to block the nomination of Penelope L. Kuykendall, named by Governor Byrne to head the recently upgraded Division on Women.

title: Monday's Fights
description: Georgetown, GuyanaLennox Blackmore, Guyana, knocked out Ricardo Croquer, Venezuela, rounds, Iightweights.

title: Tax Relief
description: During a period when there appears to be no hope of any real relief from the burden of taxes imposed at any level of government, taxpayers must be content with modest blessings. One such blessingwould be Governorelect Hugh: L. Carey's campaign proposal, now picked up by Mayor Beame, to have the state take over the collection of city Income taxes.

title: CHANCE OF ATTACK ON OIL AREA STUDIED
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 19The possibility of greatpower military intervention over oil in the Middle East cannot be lightly dismissed, the Stockholm International Peace Research Institute said today.

title: A Triumph of Greek Reason
description: PARISSeven years ago, as a political exile in Paris, Constantine Caramanlis elaborated a specific sevenpoint program for the governance of Greece when, as he expected, he would ultimately return. Now in the wake of a surprisingly impressive victory in the first free Greek election for over a decade, Mr. Caramanlis may be expected to put his theory into practice. He possesses both; the personal will power and popular backing to achieve this. Summed up, the program is:

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Mayor Beame came across a visiting junior high school class in City Hall yesterday and took time to give a quick lesson in civics. He promptly found. that even seventhgraders have ,the city's budget on their minds.

title: Stars Beat Spirits As Boone Gets 30
description: ST.,LOUIS, Nov. 19 (AP)Ron Boone put in 30 points tonight as the Utah Stars posted a 9993 victory over the Spirits of St. Louis in the American Basketball Association.

title: House Votes Bill to Stiffen Antitrust Case Penalties
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19.The House of Representatives passed legislation today greatly increasing penalties that may be imposed on both corporations and their officers for criminal violations of.. the antitrust laws, such as fixing prices.

title: High Court Backs farmer Contracts
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19Farmers cannot break contracts for future delivery of commodities to outofstate buyers and then escape liability on the ground that the buyer is not qualified to do business in the state, the Supreme Court ruled today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: If we are to solve the problem of graft and corruption in the construction industry, then we must begin with the large and cumbersome city bureaucracy which has helped in many ways to perpetuate the scandal.,

title: Rutgers Gets $1Million For Law and Theater Studies
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Nov. 19 (UPI)Rutgers university has received a $1million gift for law scholarships and an experimental theater in memory of an alumnus and former trustee, the State University announced today.

title: Advertising
description: Judging by its popularity at the fifth annual media seminar sponsored yesterday by Media Decisions magazine, flexibility will be the big advertising word of 1975.

title: Radiation Hazards to Pioneer 11 Could Prevent Flight to Saturn
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19 (AP) Pioneer 11 will face a greater radiation danger than any previous spacecraft when it sweeps within 26,600 miles of Jupiter on Dec. 3, project officials report.

title: What Makes Jerry Run?
Equity Financing
description: Underwriters headed by Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., offered yesterday 2 million, common shares of San Diego Gas and Electric Company common stock at $11.625 a share. The utility plans to use the proceeds from the sale to retire a portion of its outstanding shortterm notes.

title: News Media Are Hostile To Business, Reagan Says
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Nov. 19 Gov. Ronald Reagan told some 400 journalists today that the news media had developed a hosility toward private enterprise while forgetting that it's part of free enterprise.

title: Felt Forum Bout Set
description: Eddie Gregory of New York will meet Mario Rosa of Paterson, N.J., in a schedWed 10round middleweight fight next Monday at the Felt Forum, Madison Square Garden boxing officials announced yesterday. Gregory has won nine pro fights against one loss and a draw and has scored six knockouts. Rosa has a 15.40 mark, with seven knockouts.

title: NO GROWTH SEEN FOR. O.E. C. D.U AREA
description: PARIS, Nov. 19  Officials of the 24 member nations of the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development, meeting here yesterday and today, heard a report that their overall economic growth this year would be approximately zero.

title: It's Time to Buy Christmas Toys but Carefully
description: Given no more than five minutes, the average child can rip open every carefully, lovingly wrapped present under the Christmas tree and spread the contents around in a glorious heap.

title: Republic Steele Declares Special Dividend of $1.40
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 19 (AP)The Republic Steel Corporation declared today a special $1.40 dividend and a 40cent quarterly dividend for the highest annual total per common share in seven years.

title: Bryant to Get Award.
description: MEMPHIS, Nov. 19 (AP)Paul (Bear) Bryant and athletic director, will receive the LIbery arty Bowl's third annual ?? Service Award preceding the Dec. 1.6 game in Memphis.

title: For One Convict Freedom Is Another Word for Fear
description: FORT MADISON, IowaTo Robert Ferguson, walls ate something special.

title: TAXFREE ISSUES DECLINE IN YIELD
Sugar Price Seen Dropping Sharply
College Graduates Vying With Poor for Jobs Here
description: The deepening recession is cutting employment opportunities so sharply, here that college graduates now are, competing with school dropouts and people on welfare for shrinking number of lowpaying entrylevel jobs, the New York Board of Trade. reported yesterday.

title: MEASURE ENDORSES MEDITATION METHOD
description: TRENTON, Nov. 19 (UPINew Jersey state government may follow the lead of the !Beatles, Mia Farrow, the as tress, and a host of other followers of Guru Maharishi Mahesh Yogi if an Assembly resolution is passed.

title: FRANCE DELIVERING MIRAGES TO EGYPT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19 (AP) France has started delivering Mirage fighter bombers to Egypt, a step regarded as the first hard evidence that Egypt is turning to France for new Weapons in an effort to broadmita source of arms.

title: BYRNE URGES U.S. TO BAR GAS CUTS
description: TRENTON, Nov. 19 (AP)Governor Byrne appealed to the Federal Power Commission today to reject a proposed reduction in natural gas supplies, saying it would cause disastrous additional unemployment in South Jersey.

title: CARRERAS CHEERED IN HIS DEBUT AT MET
description: It should come as no surprise to those who were vastly intpressed by Jose Carreras at the New York City Opera to learn that his Metropolitan Opera debut on Monday night was a resounding success. The role was Cavaradossi, in Puccini's Tosca, and except for a momentary bobble as he began the lastact duet, the young Spanish tenor was in complete vocal command. His tone. was clear, bright, totally without strain, his singing fluid and highly expressive.

title: Palestinian Says Raids Will Continue Until Foes Accept Talks
L.I. Couple Commandeers Car and Dies in Crash
description: A Long Island.couple was killed early yesterday when, the police said, a car they had stolen in Nassau County crashed at high speed on the Belt Parkway at Fourth Avenue, Brooklyn, striking a traffic sign, overturning twice and catching fire.

title: TRADE BUS FATE STILL UNCERTAIN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19The prospects for enactment of the Administration's trade reform bill took one step forward and one step back today.

title: Toronto Digs In for Baseball Pitch
description: TORONTO; Nov. 19 (AP)Ground was broken today for a, $15million expansion of the Canadian National Exhibition Stadium, which the city hopes will lead to a major league baseball franchise. The expansion will increase seating capacity from 33,135 to 46,000 for baseball. Parma applications for a franchise will be made by a city group to both leagues later this week before the winter meetings scheduled in New Orleans from Dec. 3 through 6 One of the group's backers is the Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce, one of the largest banks in Canada.

title: MURRAY WALDORF
description: Murray Waldorf, founder and president of Bayard Advertising Service, Inc., 401 Broadway; died yesterday at Parkway Hospital, Forest Hills, Queens. He was in his 70's.

title: South A frican Foe of Apartheid Criticizes U.N. Exciusion Ruling
description: A leader, of South Africa's antiapartheld Progressive party asserted yesterday that the United Nations ruling denying a seat in the General Assembly to South Africa may well prove counterproduCtive in forcing that nation to end Its restrictive racial policy.

title: Girl, 11, Killed, Brother Stabbed; Visitor to L.I. Home Is Accused
Subverting the I.R.S
description: The belated disclosure of the establishment in 1969 of a secret political investigation unit within, the Internal Revenue Service would be primarily of historic interest If It Were regarded merely as additional proof of abuse of power by the Nixon Administration. But although Donald C. Alexander, the pretent Commissioner Internal Revenue, ordered the illegal apparatus dismantled (est year, these clandestine operations over threeyear period underscore the vulnerability of Government agencies, in the absence of sufficient public and Congressional vigilance and of courage among high officials of the governmental bureaucracy.

title: March of Dimes Gets Wheels
description: PUEBLO, Colo. (AP)The PueblO County March of Dimes Chapter was richer by $4500 after 200 bicycle riders pedaled their way to Beulah, a motiriItain town, to earn pledges fin. the March of Nines. The riders in the 20Mlle pedaling event fanged frOM a 9Yearold boy to a 60yearold woman.

title: Ford Ends 2Week Layoff
description: EDISON, Nov. 19 (AP)The Ford Motor Company assembly dant here is back in full operation this week after a twoweek layoff of 3,200 workers that began Nov. 4. All but about 250 workers who had not been on the job a year qualified for company benefits. These, together with unemployment compensation, gave the most of those laid off about 95 per cent of their normal pay,

title: Aeros Rout. Racers, 100
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 19 (AP)  The Houston Aeros scored six goals in the second period, three of them by Mark Howe, and routed the Indianapolis Racers, 100, in al World Hockey Association game tonight.

title: Grim Housing Outlook
description: There are appalling facts and figures in the report Of the Mayor's Policy Committee on Housing Development and Rehabilitation in New York City;butthey, only confirm what most New. Yorkers already sense or know..

title: Accord on Strip Mining Likely But Morton Hints at Ford Veto
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19 (AP)Congresskonal conferees seemed close to resolving a threemonth stalemate on a strip mining bill today, but the Ford Administration warned that the measure Might be vetoed if major modifications were not Made.

title: Beacon Begins Curfew in Wake of Racial Clashes
Woodside Hunter Is, Killed In a Gun Accident Upstate
description: HALCOTT CENTER, N, Y., Nov. 19 (UPI) A Woodside, Queens; man was killed and anther man wounded yesterday in what the state police termed a hunting accident in this upstate Greene County town. A third man was arrested in the incident.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Governorelect Hugh L. Carey will press for extensive financial disclosure by legislative leaders as well as executive department officials, accordmg to Carey aides. The action could result in Mr. Carey's first clash with the Legislature.

title: Books Opened by A. &
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19 (AP) One of the nation's largest supermarket chains today disclosed its markups on the retail price of meat, to support its contention that the difference between what a farmer receives and a consumer pays is not attributable to profiteering by supermarket chains.

title: Disturbances Erupt Again Among Arabs in West Bank
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 19 (Reuters)Disturbances broke out in the Israelioccupied West Bank today for the fourth consecutive day when Arab youths in East Jerusalem tried to stage a demonstration and others set up a road block.

title: ROOMER VOTE OFF UNTIL FRIDAY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The Senate Rules Committee, due to vote today on the VicePresidential nomination of Nelson A. Rockefeller, delayed action until Friday because three of its members were unable to be present.

title: Hofstra Decides to Keep Major Collegiate Sports
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I. Nov. 20Hofstra University announced today that it had decided to retain all major intercollegiate sports as an integral part of a new athletic program that includes intramural and recreational programs.

title: 2 UNION OFFICERS
description: Two financial officers of Amalgamated Union Local 355 held positions in several interlocking corporations that received and exchanged funds from unionapproved loans the officers helped approve, according to testimony yesterday before the State Commission of Investigation.

title: Tape Shows Nixon Ordering a Line on Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 President Nixon directed in April, 1973, that his aides put out a line in which they would all say that they had indeed raised money for the seven original Watergate defendants but that the purpose was to keep the defendants from talking to the press, not to keep them from telling the truth to the authorities.

title: Boeing Workers Strike
description: EDDYSTONE, Pa., Nov. 20 (UPI)  Some 3,000 production and maintenance employes of the Boeing Vertol Company plant near here went on strile at midnight yesterday after negotiators failed to reach a agreement on a new contract A company spokesman salnegotiations continued through out the night with, a Federa mediator.

title: Council Absenteeism Balks Vote To Bring the City $17.5Million
description: A City Council committee was unable yesterday to vote on top priority legislation, which would permit the city to recoup $17.5million from landlords for emergency housing repairs, because only four of its 11 members showed up for scheduled meeting.

title: From the Strait of Singapore, The Wedding of Two Cuisines
description: SINGAPORE  The older one gets in the pursuit of national and ethnic tastes, the more solid the thought that man is indeed what he eats. Among the most intriguing aspects of exploring the foods of this and im maculately clean selfgoverned territory are the categofies into which the island dishes fallChinese, Malayan, Indian and Eurasian. And, yes, Virginia, they do sell hamburgers.

title: English Textbook Series Withdrawn by School Board
description: PIERCETON, Ind., Nov. 20 (UPI)  Community pressure has forced the local school board to outlaw an English textbook series containing profanity and selections from the writings of Eldridge Cleaver, Malcolm X and Woodie Guthrie.

title: WILSON BLAMES NATIONAL TIDE
Screen: The Klansman, a Deep South Melodrama
Lawyer Is Accused In Scheme to Fake Marriage for Aliens
description: A Manhattan lawyer who allegedly arranged sham marriages between illegal aliens and United States citizens so that the aliens might remain in this country as permanent residents was indicted yesterday, by a Federal grand jury.

title: Contract Awards
description: Concanal, Ltd., a venture formed earlier this year by five Canadian companies, has been awarded a contract by Sonatrach, the Algerian stateowned oil and gas agency. Under the contract, Concanal would design and engineer the Algerian portion of a 300mile natural gas transmission pipeline to supply gas from the Hassi R Mel natural gas field in Algeria to Italy. The value of the contract was not disclosed.

title: Strip Party Proves to Be A Real Surprise to Guests
description: LOS GATOS, Calif. (AP)The acceptances were 100 per cent when Ethel Plant, manager of a nudist camp here, sent friends invitations to come to a strip party.

title: Remaining Original Tenants Recall Start of Public Housing 40 Years Ago
description: It was on a raw, blustery afternoon in 1935 that Frank LiCausi, a 21yearold clerk at Lower East Side welfare office, moved with his wife and infant daughter into the trim brick apartment house that was being dedicated that day.

title: Senate Backs Cut in Nixon Fund To $200,000 as Voted in House
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (UPI)The Senate voted today to deny all but $200,000 of the $850,000 recommended. by President Ford to help, Richard M. Nixon return to private life.

title: U.N. Unit Backs Pakistani Plan For South Asia AtomFree Zone
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 20The General Assembly's Political Committee voted 82 to 2 today to approve proposal by Pakistan that zone free of nuclear weapons be established in South Asia.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Attorney General William F. Hyland ruled yesterday that the state could participate in a Federal home mortgage program that allocates $47million to New Jersey. Approval of particpation in the plan had been held up because of the question of whether it was legal to charge percentage points above what is paid for interest on the loan.

title: Rangers Set Back Wings, 54; Islanders, Hawks Play 44 Tie
description: DETROIT, Nov. 20  With the momentum of their 10goal walloping of California carrying over into tonight's game, the New York Rangers jumped off to a threegoal lead against Detroit. They had to hang on for dear life, however, before gaining a 54 victory over the Red Wings.

title: United Parcel Strike Ended After 87 Days
People Are Gloomy On Future of Area
747 CRASH KILLS 59
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Nov. 20Fiftynine persons on a West German jumbo jetliner died here today but the 98 others aboard survived when the plane gashed and burned shortly after takeoff.

title: School Board Sets Up Auditing Office to Monitor Management Of Districts
description: The Board of Education voted last night to establish a powerful now office of auditorgeneral with a broad mandate backed up by a $1.5million annual budget  to audit not only. the fiscal transactions of local school districts, but the economy,, efficiency and effec, tiveness of their management operations as well..

title: HeatingFuel Cost Here Tops Average in U.S.
description: The prices of the mast common forms of energy or heatingnatural gas and fuel Oilare higher in the Nev YorkNortheastern New Jersey area than in most of the rest of the United States, the Federal Bureau of Labor Statistics, reported yesterday.

title: U.S. AIDE CLARIFIES STAND ON SUGAR
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (UPI)The head of the Agriculture Department's sugar di vision said today, retail sugar prices eventually could decline to 20 cents a pound.

title: Advertising
description: At 9 o'clock Tuesday night, Patrick J. McGrath, president of Case & McGrath, was in his office wondering aloud why he had not heard from his mother. By 9:05 she had. called.

title: State's MentalHealth Program Assailed at Legislative Hearing
description: A joint state legislative committee yesterday became a sounding board for a series of attacks on the state's mentalhealth program and the State Department of Mental Hygiene.

title: Notes on People
description: Betty Ford yesterday chose a meeting of 200 leaders of women's organizations for he first public speech since she underwent surgery for cancer last month. The women leaders were taking part in a oneday cooference on economic problems at the EXecutive Office Building, in Whshington.

title: Jury Starts Deliberations
description: An allmale jury began deliberations yesterday afternoon in the eightweek trial of William R, Phillips, the suspended police officer accused of killing a pimp and an 18yearold prostitute and of the attempted fatal shooting of a customer on Christmas Eve, 1968.

title: Dance: Sri Lanka Style
description: Heen Baha and his Dance and Drum Ensemble made their local debut Tuesday night at Carnegie Hall. If the name of the group does not set any chimes ringing, it is because this is the first time the beauties of the classical dance of Sri Lanka have received such prominent exposure here.

title: Recess in Nuclear Talks Is Reported
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 20Reliable sources disclosed today that American, and Soviet negotiators had recessed talks on an agreement to limit underground nuclear tests without resolving a deadlock over the inclusion of regulations on peaceful nuclear explosions.

title: 5th Black Muslim Convicted
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (UPI)A Superior Court jury convicted a fifth Philadelphia Black Muslim today for the murder of seven Hanafi Moslems here last year. The jury convicted Ronald Harvey, 37 years old, who is also accused of murdering Major Coxon, a former Camden, N. J. mayoral candidate, and his neice shortly after the Hanafi murders; on 21 counts of conspiracy, murder, robbetry and assault. Mr. Harvey faces life imprisonment on the Hanafi murder charges.

title: Statement by A.T.&T. Chairman on Suit
description: The following is the text of a statement issued, yesterday. by John D. deButts, chairman of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company, after announcement of the Justice Department antitrust suit charging the company with monopolizing telecommunications service and equipment in the United States:

title: Tax Anticipation Notes Sold by U.S. Treasury
Swiss Impose Annual 12% Tax On Foreigners Funds in Banks
description: GENEVA, Nov. 20In a move to halt the headlong rush of foreignheld funds into Swiss francs, the Government imposed today a 12 per cent annual tax on such funds deposited in Swiss accounts after Oct. 31.

title: CAREY PICKS PANEL ON COURT SYSTEM
Editor Dies of Car Injuries
description: ABSECON, N.J., Nov. 20 (AP) The editor of a Camden County weekly newspaper, critically injured in an automobile accident here last week, died yesterday at Atlantic City Medical Center, the police said. Fred Lorsbach, 68 years old, editor of The Record Breeze of Lindenwold, was admitted to the hospital last Friday suffering from severe head and internal injuries.

title: Business Briefs
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 20 (UPI) A Chilean copper corporation official announced today that the country's fifth, largest copper mine would cease operations for six months beginning Dec. 1

title: Macy's Executive Named Transit Safety Supervisor
description: Frederick D. Wilkinson Jr., a vice president of Macy's, was appointed yesterday to a newly created $50,000ayear position to oversee bus and subway passenger safety and comfort.

title: Personal Finance
description: Bankruptcies, involvencies and simply poor financial management brought grief and suffering in recent years to thousands who thought that they were assured of pensions in their golden years.

title: Telephone Strike Ending
description: WEST FRANKFORD, Ill., Nov. 20 (UPI)About 2,900 striking workers have voted to end a widespread walkout against the General Telephone Cornpany, a union official annoonced today. John Boswell, busi,ness representative for Local 702, International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers, said the workers would return to ::their jobs Monday unless notified by the company to report back sooner. Contract terms were not disclosed.

title: Recital
description: Fritz Jahoda, a faculty member at City College, put together a most civilized program for his piano recital Tuesday night at Carnegie Recital Hall. It consisted first of a chronologically sequence of seven capriccios of, one sort or another by composers from Frescobaldi through J. S. and W. F. Bach to Haydn, Beethoven, Mendelssohn and, finally, Luigi Dallapiccola.

title: FULL DISCLOSURE URGED IN TRADING
description: RILL DISCLOSURE URGED IN TRADING Step Termed Necessary to Give Brokerage Customer Best Deal PossibleWASHINGTON, Nov. 20A Cornell University economics professor urged the Securities and Exchange Commission today to require full disclosure", of brokerage transactions to assure that customers received the best execution. of buy or sell orders.

title: Dartmouth to Save Fuel
description: HANOVER, N.H., Nov. 20 (AP) Dartmouth College has announced a fiveday administrative shutdown from Dec. 20 through Christmas as a way of keeping down costs and conserving fuel.

title: Nets Halt Spirited Effort
AMTRAK PRESIDENT WILL QUIT POST SOON
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (UPI)  Roger Lewis, who served as president of Amtrak during the stormy threeyear revival of the United States passenger train system, will resign as soon as a successor can be found, Amtrak said today.

title: Scoring Is Hectic in 2d Period
Ford Aide Told to Yield Tapes On Handling of 71 War Protest
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20A Federal judge ordered the Ford Administration today to surrender by next week any White House tape recordings involving the Government's con troversial handling of the Mayday antiwar demonstrations here in the spring of 1971.

title: CHARLES EDWARDS
description: Charles Edwards, a longtime radio newsman, died yesterday at University Hospital. He was 54 years old and lived in Glen Rock, N.J.

title: People in Sports
description: Harold Ballard, the president of the Toronto Maple Leafs, is an angry man. The 70yearold Ballard said of his losing hockey team they should be ashamed to walk the face of the city and face the people. The Leafs, regarded earlier in the season as one of the better teams in the National Hockey League, have won only five of their first 16 games. It's a stinking exhibition, Ballard exclaimed. I'm taking money from the people of Toronto,. and it's tough to take it when the team is putting on a show like that."

title: FRENCH AIDES FIGHT A NEW AREA CAPITAL
description: PARIS, Nov. 20 (Reuters)Four hundred fifty French mayors and deputy mayors broke through a police cordon here today, noisily protesting a Government decree transferring a regional capitala move without precedent since the days of Napalm HI.

title: Ballet: Royal Swedish Swan Lake
description: Thought for the day: Although Tchaikovsky's Swan Lake". was first produced in Russia in 1877, it was not known in its complete stage version in the West until 1934. (If we are being exact, it is precisely 40 years ago net Sunday that it was originally staged by Britain's Royal Ballet with a cast led by Alicia Markova and Robert Helpmann.) Today there is scarcely a large company in the world that does not have the comple a Swan Lake in its repertory. Of the important large troupes (companies such as the Joffrey Ballet are too small for the venture) only the New York City Ballet is the holdout, and now that it is putting Coppelia into the repertory can the complete Swan Lake be far behind?

title: 4 Killed as Plane Crashes In Woods Near Westchester
description: NORTH CASTLE, N. Y., Nov. 20 (UPI)Four persons were killed tonight when a singeengine plane making its landing approach to Westchester County Airport crashed into a heavily wooded area here about two miles north of the runway.

title: GEORGE F. HULL, 65, GARDEN COLUMNIST
description: CHATTANOOGA, Nov. 20 (AP)George F. Hull, chief photographer and garden editor of The Chattanooga Times, died Wednesday in a hospital here. He was 65 years old.

title: Seabee Faces Trial for PieThrowing
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 20The Navy has ordered a special courtmartial for a Seabee who threw a chocolate cream pie in a warrant'officer's face.

title: Hofstra Decides to Keep Major College Sports
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Nov. 20Hofstra University announced today that it had decided to retain all major intercollegiate sports as an integral part of a new athletic program that includes intramural and recreational programs.

title: Nation's No. 1 Utility An Investor Favorite
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company, the nation's largest privately owned corporation, is a longtime darling of investors.

title: Delivery Strike Leader
description: Roland Robert Carey, president of Local 804 of the Teamsters Union, has been a part of the parcel delivery.,, business, for as long as he can remember. His first job  which lasted until he became president of the union nearly gev en years ago was driving a truck and delivering packages for United Parcel Service,

title: Race for Grades Revives Among College Students
description: Only a few years after grades and academic success seemed to score somewhere below haircuts on a college student's scale of values, campuses across the country are worrying about a growing and often fearful obsession with grades.

title: Court Limits College Curb On Teacher Moonlighting
description: TRENTON, Nov. 20 (AP)The New Jersey Supreme Court ruled today that the State Board of Higher Education had only limited authority to regulate outside employment by faculties of the state and county colleges.

title: George T. Kinley, 69, Dies; Veneer and Lumber Leader
description: George T. Kinley, a hardwood merchant, died yesterday in Doctors Hospital. He was 69 years old and lived at 275 Central Park West.

title: No Transit Bailout
description: The overwhelming 64to17 vote for a sixyear $11.8billion mass transit bill in the Senate conclusively demonstrates that the constituency for increased Federal aid for public transportation is nationwide and not just confined to New York and a few other large cities: That message and the sense of urgency it conveys was apparently not lost on the House Rules Committee, which, after stalling for months, cleared companion legislation yesterday.

title: NAACP FUND'S SUIT ALLEGES NASA BIAS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (AP)The NAACP Legal Defense and Educational Fund, Inc., filed suit today charging the National Aeronautics and Space Administration and the Civil Service Commission with employment discrimination against blacks and women.

title: PRICES SLIP AGAIN IN AMEX TRADING
GOING OUT Guide
description: CLOTHES MAKE THE MET A calvacade of more than 100 costumes worn by movie queens of nineteenthirties, forties and fifties is spread through the Costume Institute of the Metropolitan Museum starting today as a goldendays reminder of Hollywood luxury and extraordinary craftsmanship. The glitter, tinsel and chic are the real McCoy the same dresses, some immediately recognize able, that Made the actressses often the film, part of American mythology. Old timers and young screen buffs should have.little trouble supplying identities to many of the faceless mannequins.

title: Rising Paper Cost Reshaping Newspapers
description: In the next decade, American newspapers will probably be come smaller, easier to read and carry fewer advertise ments, not necessarily because their publishers want it that way, but because they will cost more to produce, The.rising cost of newsprint, newspaper executives say, is changing theft business more than any other factor.,

title: Shannon, Joined by Bricktop, Sings at the Piano
description: Hugh Shannon, whose normal circuit for singing his choice collection stings by Cole Porter, Non Coward, Rodgers and Hart and their contemporaries.; in the musical theater includes the Riviera, the Virgin Islands, Hong Kong and the Hatnptons, is making one of his occasional detours to New york. He has settled in behind the piano? at Soerabaja, Lexington Avenue at 74th Street, where he has been joined by Bricktop, the legendary nightclub hostess in Paris in the nineteentwenties and thirties.

title: Israelis Bury Four Victims Amid Grief, Anger, Shame
description: BEIT SHEAN, Israel, Nov. 20In grief Mingled with Inger and shame, the people of this Israeli town today bured the four civilians slain yesterday by three Palestinian infiltrators from Jordan.

title: Court Panel Voids 2 Sections of Law On Miners Safety
description: FRANKFORT, Ky., Nov. 20 (AP)  A threejudge Federal panel has struck down as unconstitutional sections of the law providing benefits to miners with black lung. The ruling could make it more difficult for some coal miners or relatives of deceased miners to obtain benefits.

title: De Inflatione
description: EDITORI: Multi tibi de inflatione nequiquarn anglice scripserunt. Fortasse scribere latine proderit.

title: Louise Fitzhugh Is Dead at 46;
description: Louise Perkins Fitzhugh, author and illustrator of Harriet the Spy and other children's books, died Tuesday evening at a hospital in New Milford, Conn. She was 46 years old and lived in Bridgewater, Conn.

title: Tax Bill
description: The liberal members of the House Ways and Means Committee have scored a narrow victory in approving a tax bill that would end the 22 per cent oil and gas depletion allowance for large companies next year and grant some tax relief to at least 40 million individuals with incomes of less than $15,000. While the bill does not go far enough toward tax reform or toward providing relief for lowincome families, it is a constructive measure that deserves passage before the end of the current session.

title: Beanie Duns U.S. and State for Costs
description: New York City has reached the fiscal breaking point in paying for things that should: be the responsibility of Albany, and Washington, Mayor Beame said last night.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Mayor Robert Cahill of Beacon, N.Y., said a curfew imposed Tuesday would remain in effect at least through this morning as a precautionary measure against further racial disturbances. Meanwhile, officials said about a third of the students were absent after schools reopened. They were closed Tuesday following racial disturbances. Eight perzons have been injured in incidents that started last Friday. No new disturbances were reported. The curfew requires that youths aged 18 or under on the streets between 7 P.M. and 6 A.M. be accompanied by a parent.

title: COAL UNION SEEKS NEW CONCESSIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The leadership of the United Mine Workers Union disclosed tonight that it had failed to win the first step in approval of the tentative labormanagement contract negotiated last week with the coal industry and would seek to return to the bargaining table.

title: CBS Drops Planet of Apes
description: CBSTV announced yesterday that the Planet of the Apes series has been canceled and that it will he replaced Feb. 7 by Khan, a new onehour series about an Oriental detective based in San Francisco. Khan, which will he produced by the network rather than by an outside firm, will star nigh Dhiegh, who has been a fea t ured player in Hawaii FiveO.

title: FORD AND TANAKA NOTE JOINT TASKS
description: KYOTO, Japan, Thursday, Nov. 21President Ford arrived here in Japan's ancient capital today after concluding his talks with Japanese officials on a note of amity and with a broad, general agreement that the two countries would seek to strengthen their cooperation on economic matters.

title: Fungicide Snarls Traffic
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 20 (UPI)Sacks of powdered fungicide spilled on the San FranciscoOakland Bay Bridge yesterday, causing a big traffic snarl. Westbound traffic was halted a half hour and motorists were warned to close their windows because the powderalthough nontoxiccould cause eye irritation.

title: RAISER ALUMINUM JAMAICA IN ACCORD
description: The Kaiser Aluminum and Chemical Corporation acknowlledged yesterday, that it had reached a settlement with the Government of Jamaica on its problems with bauxite operations in that country.

title: Trade Reforms Approved By Finance Unit of Senate
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 After nearly a year's deliberations the Senate Finance Com mittee voted today to approve the many sided trade reform bill, but the bill's final outcome in this Congress remained in doubt.

title: Transit Bill Cleared
description: In an action that may augur well for ultimate passage, the $11.8billion masstransit bill that would help preserve New York City's 35cent fare was cleared yesterday by the House Rules Committee for consideration on the House floor. Page 93.

title: State Seeks to Curb Brooklyn Carters
description: State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz yesterday announced that he had filed an action in State Supreme Court in Brooklyn against the Brooklyn Trade Waste Association, Inc., tasking the court to dissolve the association and bar its members from doing business as, private carters in Brooklyn.

title: SUGAR PRICE REES 7C HERE IN A WEEK
description: The price of sugar went up 7 cents a pound last week in the New York area's retail food markets, raising its cost in the last 15 months from 18 cents a pound to an average of 71 cents, according to the city's Department of Consumer Affairs.

title: Arizona Supreme Court Orders Kleindienst Censure
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov. 20 (AP)The Arizona Supreme Court has ordered former United States Attorney General Richard. G. Kleindienst censured for a misdemeanor committed in Washington.

title: HOUSE OVERRIDES
MINING BILL STALLED BY JACKSON DEMAND
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (UPI) Final work on a Federal strip mining bill stalled today over a surprise demand by Senator Henry M. Jackson, Democrat of Washington, that HouseSenate conferees drop a key compromise on surface owners rights.

title: Fireman Wins Back Pay
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 20 (UPI)The City Council voted today to restore the hack pay of a fireman suspended for 10 days last year for referring to former Mayor Louie Welch as Screwy Louie. The fireman, William E. Love, 25 years old, used the projorative in a letter he wrote a councilman complaining that police officers received a bigger pay raise than firemen.

title: COMPANIES POST PLANS ON LAYOFFS
Rehabilitation for Harlem: 10Year Program Is Issued, With New Housing and jobs
description: A 10year proposal for discussion to build or rehabilitate 51,200 apartments in Harlem  as much as onefourth of its present supply  and to develop sources there for 12,667 new jobs was made public yesterday by state and city officials.

title: 2 NEWSPAPERS WIN A.P. EDITORS AWARDS
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Nov. 20 AP) The Associated Press Managing Editors Association presented its 1974 Freedom. pf.Information Award today to The Honolulu Star Bulletin for protecting and ad vancing the free flow of information from governmental bodies to the American public through,. three legal actions within a year.

title: ATOM UNIT DELAYS INSURANCE VOTE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20In what was regarded as a setback for the nuclear industry and electric utilities, the Congressional Joint Atomic Energy Committee announced today that it had decided to postpone consideration of a bill extending the Federal nuclear insurance law.

title: Some Examples of Mrs. Lee's Lore
description: PONG TAUHU

title: Suspect Seeks Deportation
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 20 (UPI) Muharem Kurbegovic, the accused alphabet bomber, wants to be deported to his native Yugoslavia, his attorney said today, Mr. Kurbegovic, who is 31 years old, is scheduled to undergo a sanity trial starting Dec. 16. He is being held on murder charges in the deaths of three persons, killed in an explosion at Los Angeles International Airport last August.

title: Restoring Central Park
description: While fun and games were being promoted in Central Park for the past eight years, the Parks Department has been sinking deeper into administrative and operational chaos. In spite of efforts at improvement made by earlier administratOrs, there is now a crisis situation that has the current regime on the ropes.

title: Peruvian Regime Closes 2 Magazines and Exiles 10 journalists
description: LIMA, Peru, Nov. 20The military Government virtually swept away what was left of an independent press in Peru last night by closing two magazines, exiling 10 journalists and ordering the detention of five leading lawyers.

title: Boston Students Scuffle At Desegregated School
description: BOSTON, Nov. 20 (AP)Five or six separate scuffles broke out today at South Boston High Schoolthe first time fighting has occurred in several weeks in the desegregation of Boston schools.

title: Rehabilitation for Harlerm: 10Year Program Is Issued, With New Housing and Jobs
description: A 10year proposal for discussion to build or rehabiltate 51,200 apartments in Harlem  as much as onefourth of its present supply  and to develop sources there for 12,667 new jobs was made public yesterday by state and city officials.

title: Ford Urged to Ask Companies To Push LowTar Cigarettes
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The National Cancer Advisory Board proposed today that President Ford make a personal public appeal to tobacco companies to market more lowtar and lownicotine cigarettes.

title: Connors, Ashe Gain In S. Africa
Miss Hearst Search Fails
description: NASHVILLE, Nov. 20 (AP)Acting on a grocery boy's tip, the police raided a house here last night in search of Patricia Hearst. She was not found and a detective expressed doubt that she had ever been there.

title: Public Urged to Fast Today To Help Curb World Famine
description: Americans are being urged to fast today as a practical and symbolic gesture of concern over starvation that threatens more than 500 million persons in more than 30 countries.

title: Burroughs American League's M.V.P.
Sports News Briefs
Ford Quietly Raises Car Prices by Average of 2%
description: DETROIT, Nov. 20 The Ford Motor Company has in creased the price of its average car by about $75, or 2 per cent, through a private letter sent to dealers. The increase is in additidn to the average of approximately $900 added to new car Prices since the 1974 model year began.

title: Books of The Times
description: HOT TO TROT. By John Lahr. 241 pages. Knopf. $6.95.

title: C.A.B. Moves to Curb KLM Flights
description: In the first test of a new Utinited States policy aimed at curbing excess flights to this country by foreign airlines, the Civil Aeronautics Board yesterday ordered KLM Royal Dutch Airlines to submit its transAtlantic schedules for approval by the board within seven days.

title: Slump in Textiles Adds to South's Woes
description: C HARLOTTE, N.C., Nov. 20The serious slump in textiles is causing wide spread unemployment in the South's bellwether industry. Several thousand workers have been laid off and more thousands are expected to be furloughed as textile and re lated plants producing apparel and synthetic fibers cut production.

title: Bridge: 400 Charity Events on Nov. 29 Will Benefit Cancer Society
description: The American Contract Bridge League has been outstandingly successful in raising money for major charitable causes. In the last decade its charity foundation has contributed about $1,200,000 to the advancement of medical science and to social welfare.

title: BREZHNEV EXPANDS TOUR IN MIDEAST
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 20Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist party chief, has expanded his coming trip to Egypt early next year to include two other Arab countries.

title: Federal Ban Urged on SprayCan Propellants Suspected in Ozone Depletion and Possible Cancer Rise
description: The Federal Government has been petitioned by the Natural Resources Defense Council to outlaw spray cans using propellants suspected. of breaking down the earth's, protective ozone layer.

title: No War Seen By Mrs. King
description: Billie Jean King, president of the Women's International Tennis Aisociation, said yesterday that she would not fight the decision of the British Women Players Association to compete at Wimbledon next year, but indicated that without the participation of the W.T.A. the tournament would carry very little importance.

title: Leonard Koppett
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Nov. 20Like their cotenants the Alameda County Coliseum complexthe Oakland A's, three times champions of the baseball worldthe Oakland Raiders of the National Football League do an awful lot of winning in proportion to the recognition they get. Over the last eight years they have won more games than any other pro football team, and this year, having won nine straight after an openinggame loss, they are the first team to clinch a playoff spot. Yet their players and ,organization are generally less known than those of many inferior teams, and even here in the Bay Area their activities get less attention than the tribulations of the older San Francisco 49ers. When and if the Raiders do reach the Super Bowl, elements of their success will become the belated subject of nationwide analysis, and instant historians will rediscover the limitations imposed on a team by the Oakland label. A Gertrude Stein line about Oakland"There's no there there"was unearthed when the A's began playing in the World Series, It will quoted again as various masters of the media grope for way to explain why they weren't on the Raider bandwagon sooner.

title: HOUSE SURVEY HINTS MOVE TO CURB MILLS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (AP) A survey of the newly elected House shows that a big majority of Representatives are in favor of key reforms, including a move to strip the Ways and Means Committee chairman, Wilbur D. Mills of Arkansas, of control over committee assignments.

title: Saxbe Urges Legalization Of State Lottery Publicity
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20, (UPI)Attorney General William B. Saxbe asked Congress today to legalize the publication and broadcasting of information about statesanctioned lotteries.

title: Superb Display on Richardson Buildings
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  It would not be exactly correct to say that Henry Hobson Richardson, who died in 1886, has never gotten the recognition he deserves. There is a growing body of scholarship about him, and architectural pilgrims frequently journey to the Boston area to see the large number of surviving Richardson buildings near. here.

title: F.B.I. Seeks 4 in L.I. Man's Kidnapping
description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation searched yesterday for four kidnappers who kept a Long Island man chained in an apartment closet for a week until his family paid a $750,000 ransom for his release Tuesday night.

title: Harlech's Son Ruled Suicide
description: LONDON, Nov. 20 (AP)A coroner's court ruled today that Julian Ormsby Gore, 33yearold on and heir of Lord. Harlech, the former British ambassador to the United States, took his own life by shooting himself on Nov. 5. He had been found dead in his apartment.

title: TERMS CHANGING FOR PHONE OFFER
BITTMAN DISPUTED OVER HUNT MEMO
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20A former law partner and close associate of William O. Bittman contradicted Mr. Bittman today and testified that the lawyer did, in fact, see a controversial memorandum from their former client, E. Howard Hunt Jr., shortly after it was written.

title: Health Department Lists 10 Food Spots As Code Volators
ENERGY AIDE SEES DROP IN OIL PRICE
description: A Federal energy expert said yesterday that based on historical experience, oil prices should significantly decline within the next one to three years,

title: COAL UNION SEEKS NEW CONCESSIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The leadership of the United Mine Workers Union disclosed tonight that it had failed to win the frst step in approval of the tentative labormanagement contract negotiated last week with the coal industry and would seek to return to the bargaining table.

title: 4 Egyptian Vessels Complete Suez Canal Passage
description: CAIRO, Nov, 20  Four Egyptian vessels today completed the journey through the Suez Canal from Port Said to Suez, the first craft to do so since. 1967, naval. sources in. Suez reported tonight.

title: Ruth V. Matheney, Directed Nursing Curriculum at City
description: Ruth V. Matheney, director of curriculum, department of nursing, City College, died yesterday at Lydia E. Hall Hospital, Freeport, L. I. She was 63 years old and lived at 9815 Horace Harding Expressway, Rego Park, Queens.

title: SIDNEY C. MOODY, 79, CYANAMID OFFICIAL
description: Sidney C. moody, a retired executive in the chemical industry died yesterday at his home, 63 Leland :Avenue Plainfield, N. J. He was 79 years old.

title: Goldstein Urges Lawyers to Endeavor To Clean Up Their Hired Gun Image
description: NEWARK, Nov. 20 (AP)Jonathan L. Goldstein, the United States Attorney for New Jersey, said the legal profession was responsible for much of the atmosphere of corruption in the United States, and he urged lawyers to clean up their hired gun image.

title: LOU FRANKEL DIES; PUBLICITY MAN, 63
description: Lou Frankel, a publicrelations executive with Doremus & Co., died Tuesday of, cancer the Memorial SloanKettermg Cancer Center. He was 63 years old and lived in Fresh Meadows, Queens.

title: Israelis Bury Four Victims Amid Grief, Anger, Shame
Sale of Florida Blazers In W.F.L. Consummated
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Nov. 20 (AP)The sale of the World Football League's Florida Blazers has been consummated and the new owners will deliver a partial payment of $2million before halftime of tomorrow night's playoff game against Philadelphia, a team spokesman said today.

title: Shavelson's Mixed Company
UNESCO Adopts Resolution to Deny Israel Cultural Aid
description: PARIS, Nov. 20The general conference of the United Na1 lions Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization adopted a resolution today to withhold aid from Israel because of what it called her persistence in altering the historical feature's of Jerusalem by undertaking excavations which constitute a danger to its monuments.

title: India Disturbed by curb on Legal Rights
description: NEW DELHI; Nov. 20An angry Civil liberties debate has erupted here Over a Governnient order to suspend the legal rights of smugglers.

title: State Says Teachers Can Go Tieless in Cass
description: TRENTON, Nov. 20 (AP)  State Education Commission Fred G. Burke ruled today that school teachers could not be required to wear neckties in class.

title: F.B.I. Seeks 4 in L.I. Man's Kidnapping
description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation searched yesterday for four kidnappers who kept a Long Island man chained in an apartment closet for a week until his family paid a $750,000 ransom for his release Tuesday night.

title: U.S. IN EXERCISE IN IRAN OCEAN
description: Ships from the United States, pritain, Iran, Pakistan and turkey, including the 60,000ton American carrier Constellation, are participating in the largest naval exercise ever held in the Indian Ocean.

title: Philippine Embassy Raider Is Reunited With His Son
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (AP) Napoleon Bayago Lechoco realized his dream of seeing his eldest son in America today. But first the youth apologized to the ambassador his father had threatened to kill.

title: KILLED IN ACCIDENT ON L.I. EXPRESSWAY
description: Two persons were killed on the LongIsland Expressway yesterday in two accidents, involving five cars. Traffic was disrupted for nearly three hours.

title: Going to Pot ESSAY
Court Upholds Right Of Parents to Sue Son
description: TRENTON, Nov. 20 (AP)  The New Jersey Supreme Court upheld today a lower court ruling that permitted parents to sue their son for injuries in an automobile accident.

title: Gen.Roger J. Browne Dies at 68; Purchase Cheif Under Wagner
description: Maj. Gen. Roger J. Browne U.S.A.F., retired, a former highranking city official, died Tuesday at Womack Army Hospital, Fort Bragg, N.C. He was 68 years old and lived at Southern Pines, N.C.

title: HOUSE UNIT FREES TRANSITAID BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The House Rules Committee, with :'Presidential intervention, re:versed itself today. and cleared the way for a sixyear, $11.8billion transit bill to reach the :floor of the HOuse of.Representatives.

title: Market Place Dancing in the Rain
description: The shell corporation that holds all the stock of the bankrupt Penn Central Transportation Company will hold its annual meeting in the Franklin Suite of Philadelphia's Benjamin Franklin Hotel at 11 A.M. Dec. 19.

title: St. Paul's Chapel to Hold Service for Childers Today
description: A requiem eucharist for President Erskine Childers of Ireland will be conducted today at noon at St. Paul's Chapel of Trinity Parish, Braodway at Vesey Street.

title: Soviet Launches Satellite
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 20 (UPI)The Soviet Union launched an earth satellite, Cosmos 695, today to explore space, Tass the Soviet press agency, said. Equipment aboard the Cosmos 695 was functioning normally, Tass said. It was the second Cosmos launching this week. Tass announced the earlier one two days ago.

title: Damascus Remailns Calm Despite Its Military Mood
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Nov. 20As. children hurry to school here in the chilly mornings, Syrian Air Force jets whine in swift flight over this capital.

title: Richard H. Crowe, 63, Dies; C.I.A. Aide From 46 to 60
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 Richard H. Crowe, a Central Intelligence Agency official for nearly 15 years, died today. He was 63 years old.

title: One Unbeaten Is Unimpressed by Bowls
description: Michigan, undefeated and untied, has to get by Ohio State Saturday for the big Rose Bowl berth. Alabama, undefeated and united, long ago accepted the Orange Bowl spot oppo site Notre Dame. Oklahoma, un beaten and un tied, can't go to a bowl as a penalty for recruiting violations, but the Sooners eagerly await next year when a bowl bid will again be the prize for a good season.

title: U.S Signs Pact With Syria For Wheat and Rice Sale
description: DAMASCUS, Syria Nov. 20 The United States signed an agreement today to sell wheat and rice valued at about $22million to Syria as a step toward economic cooperation.

title: U.S. FUNDS IN DISPUTE FOR 5 NURSING HOMES
description: A Queens Congressman an nounced in Washington yesterday that the Federal Government had decided to deny Medicaid payments to five nursing homes in New York State that had violated the fire safety code. But the Department of Health, Education, and Welfare said it had not yet made up its mind.

title: People and Business
description: Two large corporations yesterday announced the addition of women directors to their boards of directors. Avon Products, Inc., said that Mrs. Ernesta G. Procope, president of the E. G. Bowman Company, Inc., Brooklyn, would join its board on Dec. 1. American Airlines announced that Mary Gardiner Jones, a former member of the Federal Trade Commission, had been elected to its board.

title: City Clerk Resigns As Inquiry Is Held
description: The office of the City Clerk is under investigation, city officials said last night. They said that Herman Katz, who has held the post since 1958, resigned last week.

title: Pennsylvania School Strike
description: LANCASTER, Pa., Nov. 20 (AP)Teachers struck the Warwick School District in Lancaster County today in a eon tract dispute. Classes for 3,600 pupils were canceled. The teachers had been Working Without a contract since September. They voted last sight to walk off the job after talks broke down.

title: A. MILLER CORWEN
description: A. Miller Corwen, president of John Mullins & Sons, Inc., Brooklyn furniture dealers, died Tuesday at Brooklyn Hospital, He was 80 years old and lived at 35 Prospect Park West in Brooklyn.

title: The South Bronx: Making the Concert Bloom
description: The South Bronx was once a lush green area. It was first settled by a few influential families with significant land holdings. In the area of Melrose, Mott Haven and Port Morris, Jonas Bronic in 1,641 purchaded 500 acres which he then subdivided and leased to individual farmers on a threeyear basis. This estate changed hands several times until it was purchased by the Morris brothers in 1670 and

title: The LowHeeled Shoe Comfort With Chic
description: No, it is not necessary to totter around on heels 5 inches high to keep in the swing of fashion. In the last few weeks, many.fashion designers showing their spring collections in both Paris and New York have resurrected comfortable looking low heel shoes for their mannequins to wear even with longer skirts.

title: BATHURST ENTERS BID FOR PRICE CO.
description: Consolidated Bathurat, Ltd., of Montreal, Canada's fifth largest newsprint manufacturer, has entered a competing bid to acquire the Price Company, Ltd., Canada's third largest newsprint producer. Consoli dated revealed yesterday that it had purchased a 17 per cent interest In Price from the Associated Newspaper Group, Ltd., of London through an exchange of shares, and now sought to buy an additional 4 million shares at $20 a share.
