title: Favored Group Plan Is First at Aqueduct
description: When he returned to the winner's circle after having guided the Hobeau Farm's Group Plan to convincing victory in the feature event at Aqueduct yesterday, AngelCorderd exclaimed: That guy is a genius. He was referring to Alien Jerkens, the consistentlysuccessful trainer for the Hobeau interests of Jack Dreyfus.

title: MANSFIELD SEEKS PAYPRICE CURBS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (AP) Mike Mansfield, the Senate majority leader, proposed legisation today to reinstate standby authority to control wages, prices, profits, dividends and Interest rates.

title: E.P.A. Wins Clean Air Case
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mo., Nov, 20 (AP)The Independent Stave Company of Lebanon, ,Mo., which manufactures charcoaled barrels for whisky distillers, was convicted today on criminal charges of violatingothe Clean Air Act and facespossible fines of $3.9million,; A Federal court jury convicted the company of failing to,comply with an administrative order issued more than anyear ago by the Environmental Protection Agency.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: CLOSING OF JAIL UPHELD BY JUDGE
description: A judge in Federal District Court gave, conditional approval last night to plans by the city's Department of Correction to close its Branch Queens House of Detention today.

title: Population, Housing And jobs Declining
description: Once one of America's most vibrant communities, Harlem now finds its growth and development in peril.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: Chess: Korchnoi Gets a Postponement Of Final Moment of Reckoning
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 20Viktor Korchnoi was granted a postponement today of the 24th and laSt game of his final Candidates match for the world championship with Anatol!, Karpov. The, game, which was scheduled for 5 o'clock this afternoon in Tchaikowsky. Hall, has been reset for the same time Friday in Estrada Theater, where the two title matthes between Boris Spassky and Petrosian held.

title: Cruel Trade
description: Nearly a year ago the Department of the Interior announced its intention to curb the dangerously increasing importation of exotic pets. The instrument was to be the Lacey Act, which empowers the Secretary to ban the admission of animals considered harmful to this country's agriculture, forestry, wildlife or people. The sooner the department takes action to this effect, the better, because with every passing month the number of these imports goes up, the opposition of the pet industry grows more vehement and its selfserving propaganda becomes more blatant.

title: Long Shots Victors At Florida Opening
description: MIAMI, Nov. 20It was a great day for longshot players today as the Florida win ter racing season got under way at Calder Race Course in bright, mild weather.

title: EUROPEANS URGE PACT PROTECTING ISRAEL AS NATION
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 20Britain, France and Italy announced today their support of a Middle East settlement that would enable Israel to live peacefully within the frontiers she had before the 1967 war.

title: Population, Housing And Jobs Declining
Chief of Police and Councilman Indicted in Carteret Inquiry
COMPANY REPLIES
A DELBELLO AIDE
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 20County Executive Alfred B. DelBello disclosed today that Joseph R. Schmitt, a highranking aide in charge of welfare fraud investigations, resigned last week because of his alleged involvement in a Yonkers taxassessment controversy.

title: The Rockefeller Way
description: BOSTON, Nov. 20Prime Minister Nehru of India visited the United, States in 1961. When he was m New York on Nov. 9, Governor Rockefeller called on him for a private talk. AfterWard K. Galbraith, the U.S. Ambassador to India, asked Nehru how the., meeting had gone.

title: Giants Plan To Start McQuay
New Jersey Sports
description: With little exception, schoolboy football conference and sectional championships are settled in the final games of the season. So the customary interest is escalating for the 1974 windup, which takes form in a small schedule this weekend and a bigger one Thanksgiving Day.

title: Ford Raises Prices
description: The Ford Motor Company has increased the price of its average car by about $75, or 2 per cent, through a private letter sent to dealers. The rise is in addition to the average of approximately $900 added to newcar prices since the 1974 model year began. Details on Page 77.

title: Recession Here Is Found Easy to Document, but Hard to Explain
description: New York City, with its huge and diversified economy, used to think of itself as recessionresistant, protected against, the worst downsWings of the national economy. But in this recession of 1974; New York, with News its high unemployAnalysis ment rate of 7.4 per cent. locikn more vulnerable than the suburbs, than the state as a whole, than the nation as a whole, and than manythough. not allmaij ori American cities. Why this should be so is a question of overwhelming importance that is causing deep puzzlement among economists, businessmen, trade union leaders, public officials and ordinary citizens. They, all find that it is easier to list the concrete signs of New York's vulnerability than it is to it.

title: FertilizerMakers See Costs Climbing
description: BORDENTOWN, Nov. 20Experts in the field of farm fertilizers warned here today that rising costs, unless eased, would cause lower crop yields next year, increasing farmers expenses and consequently resulting in higher prIces for food.

title: EUROPEANS URGE PACT PROTECTING ISRAEL AS NATION
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 20Britain, France and Italy announced today their support of a Middle East settlement that would enable Israel to live peacefully within the frontiers she had before the 1967 war.

title: Ford in Conflict With Aides on Higher Gasoline Tax
description: WASINGTON, Nov. 20 President Ford's latest expression of opposition to increase the Federal gasoline tax has disrupted energy policy, planning at a critical moment. It also appears to be a rejection by the President of the thinking of four of li is most, Senior advisers  Interior Secretary C. B. Morton, Treasury Secretary William E. Simon, Secretary of State Kissinger and Alan Greenspan, chairman of the Council of Economic Advisers. They and the Federal Reserve Board chairman, Dr. Arthur F. Burns, who is influential even though not a member of the Cabinet, are all understood to believe that the President should ask Congress to add at least 10 cents to the 4centagallon Federal tax.

title: SUGAR FUTURES UP: BRAZIL DEAL CITED
description: World sugar prices soared again yesterday, to new high levels.

title: TV: Sly, Amusing Benjamin Franklin
description: American television may finally be learning how to deal With American history. Tonight at 9:30 on CBS, a series of four 90minute dramas about Benjamin Franklin is begun smoothly and impressively with The Ambassador, written by Howard Fast. The costumes and sets are splendid. The acting is quite solid. But, most of all, the content is gently entertaining and rewardingly informative.

title: People Are. Gloomy On Future of Area
description: Most people who live in Harlem see their neighborhood declining amid crime, drugs, poor housing, unclean streets and unemployment. Convinced that community services are inadequate and that they have little or no influence over what happens in Harlem, residents conclude they are trapped.

title: Court Seeks Woman Who Feigned Illness To Dodge Sentence
description: Judge Irving Lang issued a warrant in Criminal Court yesterday for a Queens woman who has dodged her sentence on a grand larceny conviction for two years by pretending to be terminally ill.

title: Pan Am and Eastern Holding Exploratory Merger Talks
description: Pan American World Airways and Eastern Airlines disclosed yesterday that they had been holding exploratory talks on a merger. But they emphasized that the talks, paralleling others Pan American has been holding with Trans World Airlines, were still in an early stage. Pan American's chairman, William T. Seawell, also disclosed that his company was conducting studies of possible mergers with other airlines besides Eastern and T.W.A. He would not specify which ones.

title: Consumer Notes
description: Never let it be said that the softdrink industry is not responsive to consumers. Stung by public criticism that the prices of diet sodas haVe been climbing right along with the prices of sugared sodas, one major bottler has finally decided to give consumers a onecent break on some diet drinks.

title: Race for Grades Revives Among College Students
Voluntary Hospital League Installs Solivan as leader
description: Jess Solivan, vice president of the New York University Medical Center, was inaugurated last night as president of the League of Voluntary Hospitals and Homes of New York; collective bargaining agent for 36 voluntary nonprofit hospitals and nursing homes in New York.

title: SETTLEMENT DATA ON NORTHROP SET
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 20The Northrop Corporation and public interest law firm based here released today preliminary details of a settlement of a classaction shareholder lawsuit filed in Federal Court against Northrop for its illegal campaign contributions.

title: Marriages Without Children: They're Happy, Study Fihds
Delivery Strike Leader RonaldRobert Carey
description: Ronald Robert Carey, president of Local 804 of the Teamsters Union; has been a part of the parcel delivery business for as long as he can remember. His first job which lasted until he became president of the union nearly.seven years ago was driving atruck and delivering packages for United Parcel Service.

title: Britain Wins Slim Points On Beef and Sugar Issues
description: Britain Wins Slim Points On Bed and Sugar IssuesBRUSSELS, Nov 20Britain won only minor concessions from the Common Market part ners on complex beef and sugar issues at a marathon meeting of the community's agricultural ministers that ended here at 6:30 this morning.

title: Market Declines Slowly In Indifferent Trading
Test for Brazil
description: President Ernesto Geisel's commitment to lead Brazil in gradual but sure progress toward democracy will be put to its most severe test to date by his Government party's unexpectedly heavy losses in this week's congressional and state elections.

title: Transit Bill Cleared
description: In an action that may augur well for ultimate passage, the $11.8billion masstransit bill that would help preserve New York City's 35cent fare was cleared yesterday by the House Rules Committee for consideration on the House floor. Page 93.

title: Nation's No. 1 Utility An Investor Favorite
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company, the nation's largest privately owned corporation, is a longtime darling of investors.

title: State and College Strikers at impasse; Parley Fails to Bing Fast Settlement
description: TRENTON, Nov. 20  Hope for a quick end to the strike by faculty members of eight state colleges was abandoned abruptly today when both sides to the dispute acknolwdged that a long informal meeting requested by the state had resulted in no progress.

title: Tax Agents Are Syspects as Nadjari Moves Against Cigarette Bootlegging
description: A state grand jury is expected to begin hearing evidence this week into charges that taxcollection agents of the Special Investigations Bureau of the State Department of Taxation and Finance had connived with cigarette bootleggers to smuggle untaxed cigarettes into the state.

title: Storms Injure 16 in Georgia
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 20 (AP)A line of heavy thunderstorms swept across Georgia today, spawning at least four tornadoes that injured 16 persons. and caused extensive damage, the authorities said.

title: Efficiency Is Mark of Western Electric
Oil Nations Diversify Surplus Funds
description: PARIS, Nov. 20 Within the last eight to 10 days, in which time tensions in, the Middle East have, increased, the oil exporting countries have diversified the flow of their surplus funds into strong European currencies, according to an analysis at a meeting of.monetary experts here.

title: BinghamtontoGeneva Bus Run Is Set Up in Greyhound Walkout
description: The New York Department of Transportation said yesterday that it had arranged for an emergency bus service to run the 98 miles between Binghamton and Geneva, N.Y., one of several upstate routes that have lost all public transportation because of a. nationwide strike against Greyhound Bus Lines.

title: Minnesota to Sue Army Over Dredging Pollution
description: ST. PAUL, Nov. 20 (UPI)The Minnesota pollution agency decided yesterday to authorize a lawsuit,against the Army Corps of Engineers to force a court to determinewhether the corps must. meet state water quality laws.

title: Strike Idles Louisiana Port
description: LAKE CHARLES, La., Nov. 20 (UPI)  Longshoremen's picket lines idled the Port of Lake Charles today in a dispute over job assignments. Dock workers refused to load rice exports or unload a shipment of 900 foreign cars. They are demanding that port officials give their union jurisdiction over seven of 11 jobs at a newly converted bulk terminal.

title: Sons of Bluegrass Here Promote Old Kentucky Home
description: This is a week for New Yorkers.to think warm and wonderful thoughts about Kentucky. A gioup of 56 Kentuckians'55 men and one womanled by the state's next Governor, Julian M. Carroll, have come to the city to do everything they can to see to that.

title: 9 Soviet Jews Write to Ford Complaining of New Exit Curt
Sports News Briefs
description: LONDON, Nov. 21 (AP)European track and field officials are launching an allout war against anabolic steriods, drugs used to build muscle. Athletes will be tested at all major European meets in 1975 and disqualified if the tests prove positive, the European Athletic Association announced yesterday.

title: Slayer in a Street Holdup Is Given 25 Years to Life
description: Justice Arnold G. Freiman sentenced Luis Benitez to life in prison Wednesday for the murder of Thomas Berman, killed after he left a bank on Broadway and 102d Street on April 24, 1973.

title: Vote in UNESCO Keeps Israel Out Of European Unit
Senegalese Troupe Cast Dance Spells At the Felt. Forum
description: Relentless energy, pretty women, bright costumes, bounding men and a corps of superb percussionists are the elements in the National Dance Company of Senegal's pleasing appearance at the Felt Forum, The formula has provided the company with 15 years of successful international touring. To judge from the current season, which opened yesterday, this will carry it through comfortably to the end of the century.

title: Barnes May Not Rejoin Spirits
description: DAYTON, Oh Nov. 21 (AP)  The elusive Marvin Barnes, missing, since, last night from the Spirits of St. Louis, was found tonight in a Dayton pool hall, apparently with no intention of ever returning to the American Basketball Association club.

title: S. EVERETT GLEASON, HISTORIAN, 69, DIES
description: S. Everett Gleason, a former State Departinent official who shared the Bancroft Prize in History in 1954, died Wednesday of lung cancer at his home in Washington. He was 69 Years old.

title: Trustees Are Seeking a Buyer For New York Cultural Center
description: The trustees of the New York Cultural Center at Columbus Circle are actively seeking a buyer ,for the opulent marble building, erected in 1964 by Huntington Hartford.

title: 2 Charged With Slaying of 6 in Bakery
description: NEW BRITAIN, Conn., Nov. 21Two members of a local motorcycle gang were arrested today and charged with the murder of six persons in a bakery here last month.

title: New National Interests
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass There is some evidence that during the last several years the national interest of the United States has been changing.

title: Saturday Sunday A Slice of Salami
BOARD OF EDUCATION SCORED BY NYQUIST
description: The State Education Commissioner criticized the Board of Education yesterday for not having stepped in sooner to deal with fiscal irregularities that have recently come to light in several of the city's 32 community school districts.

title: DR. JARVIS HADLEY
description: Dr. Jarvis B. Hadley, a research geologist of the United States Geological Survey, was found dead Sunday in a mountainous area nee Frederick, Md. He had 13een making a geologic study in the Catoctin Mountains and apparently died Nov. 14. He was 65 years old and lived in Chevy Chase, Md.

title: IRISH HOLD FUNERAL OF 4TH PRESIDENT
description: DUBLIN, Nov. 21Erskine Hamiltan Childers, the fourth President of the Irish Republic, was buried today in the village churchyard of Derralossary in the depths of the Wicklow Hills.

title: Buchanan Wins In Second Round
description: COPENHAGEN, Nov. 21 (Reuters)Ken Buchanan of Scotland, the European Lightweight champion, stopped Winston Noel of New York in the second round of a scheduled 10round bout tonight.

title: Sawhill Sees Oil Embargo If Mideast Tensions Rise
description: John C. Sawhill, outgoing director. of the Federal Energy Administration, said yesterday that another Arab oil embargo was probable if tensions continued to build up in the Middle East.

title: Amex Prices Decline in Light Trading
3 Countries Tie at 137 in World Golf
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Nov. 21 (UPI)South Africa, England and Japan shared the lead after the opening round today of the 22d World Cup golf championship with scores of 137.

title: Jury Convicts Phillips of 2 Brothel Murders in 1968
description: William R. Phillips, the rogue cop who was a star witness at the Knapp COmMission hearings into police corruption here, was convicted yesterday in his second trial of slaying a pimp and a young prostitute and of attempting to murder a customer on Christmas Eve, 1968.

title: Adelphi 10 Victor in Soccer
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I., Nov. 21  Ade1phi University, ranked eighth nationally, defeated Springfield College, 10, today in the quarterfinals of the. National Collegiate Athletic Association college division soccer tournament. The score came at 19 minutes 4 seconds of the first half when Zvi Sharf's 50yard floater was misjudged by Springfield's goalkeeper, Lou LaPenna and bounced into the goal.

title: Aqueduct Bans Trainer on Drug. Charge
description: Wilfred J. Lewis, a trainer whose main racing activity takes place in New Jersey, received a 30day suspension yesterday by the stewards at Aqueduct for a violation of drug rules. Lewis became the first of his profession to be penalized by. the state's drugtesting procedure that went into effect on Nov 1 At the Race Tracks

title: EXConvicts Anonymous
description: CINCINNATI (UPI)  The National Seventh Step Foundation, headquartered here, has set a goal of becoming the total crime prevention program in America. Members are exconvicts who work to keep themselves and others out of jail.

title: City University Prepares Plans to Trim Its Budget
description: The 18 undergraduate campuses of the City University have drawn up plans to save as much as $21.8million from the university's current budget if formally requested to by Mayor Beame under his austerity program.

title: BLIND TRUST  SET FOR ROCKEFELLER
U.S. PRESSES U.N. TO ENABLE ISRAEL TO LIVE SECURELY
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 21  The United States reaffirmed in the General Assembly today that Israel has a right to exist as a sovereign, independent state within secure and recognized boundaries.

title: Move by 6th Fleet Reported Suggested By Former Entoy
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (AP) The American Ambassador to Greece suggested consideration of using the 6th Fleet to forcibly prevent the Turkish invasion of Cyprus last summer, it was learned today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To theEditor:

title: Music: Serkin Interprets Schoenberg
description: Peter Serkin and Seiji Ozawa began playing the Schoenberg Piano Concerto together at least 10 years ago and by now have it well in hand, not to mention in heart, presumably. Mr. Serkin was the soloist with the Boston Symphony Orchestra at Avery Fisher Hall on Wednesday night, with Mr. Ozawa conducting, in a program that began with an early Haydn symphony and ended with Beethoven's Eroica Symphony.

title: Bethlehem Will Lay Off 2,600 Workers
description: The Bethlehem Steel Corporation, the nation's second largest steel producer; will lay off 2,600 employes next week, move prompted by the company's diminishing coal stockpile and uncertainty over the length of the nationwide coal strike.

title: President Tours Old Kyoto and Samples Some of Its Elegance
description: KYOTO, Japan, Friday, Nov. 22President Ford visited the elegant Golden Pavilion, tried his hand at an ancient Japanese stringed instrument and dined with geisha yesterday in this ancient Japanese imperial capital.

title: Burns Probable As Jet Starter
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Nov. 21 John Riggins has been working out at fullback despite his sore shoulder, but it looks as if Bob Burns, the rookie 10th round draft choice, will be the Jets starter against Miami on Sunday in Shea Stadium unless Riggins reports at game time he can play. He is listed as questionable.

title: N.L.R.B. REPORT ON WALL ST. DUE
description: The National Labor Relations Board Alisclosed yesterday, after a lengthy review, that it would shortly announce the terms under which it would perna Wall Street clerical workets to organize.

title: Faster Than a Speeding BallotMayor Superman
Notes on People
Anna Xydis, Pianist, In Carnegie Recital
description: Since Anna Xydis made her New York piano debut in 1941, she has given many recitals here, and the energy and musicality of her playing seem, to have made interesting experiences of all of them.

title: A.T.&T. Will Fight U.S. Suit to the End
Suspect in Coast Bombing Asks Court to Be Deported
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 21 (UPI)  Muharem Kurbegovic, accused of being the alphabet bomber who set off the deadliest explosion ever to strike a United States civil air terminal, asked yesterday to be deported.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Deer Display
description: Every fall and winter, nonhunters are exposed to a spectacle many of them find offensive: a constant parade of disemboweled deer going by on the roofs of vehicles.

title: Half of $4.3Million Stolen Last Month Is Found in Chicago
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 21 (UPI)Federal agents have recovered $2.2million of the$4.3million stolen last Oct. 20 from the Amored Express Company in the nation's largest cash theft, the Federal Bureau of Investigation said tonight.

title: Concluding My Lai
description: With the release last week of portions or the Pent gon report on the My Lai coverup, Army ,Secretark Howard FL Callriway announced that a dark chapter in the Army's history had been concluded. There is Milt question that the whole episode, from the inception of the operation to the extremely belated release of the report, was an abysmal performance.

title: Miami Heroin Smuggler Is Convicted in Absentia
description: A 42year old expatriate Cuban from Miami described by Federal authorities as a major international narcotics smuggler has been convicted in absentia by a Brooklyn trial jury. He disappeared in the middle of the trial.

title: BUSINESS LOANS CLIMB SLIGHTLY
description: Business loans at New York City banks rose this, week for the seventh time In the last eight but only slightly, the Fedleral Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday.

title: Strip Mining Bill Fails
description: Senate and House conferees Were unable to reach a compromise on a strip mining bill last night, apparently dooming passage of.a measure this year. Page 18.

title: STALL IS SUSPECTED IN JUMBO JET CRASH
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Nov. 21 (Reuters)Officials were trying to determine today if the West German jumbo jetliner that crashed here, yesterday, killing 59 people, had stalled on takeoff, the airline's former chief pilot said today.

title: CANADA TO REDUCE OIL EXPORTS TO U.S.
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 21  A new Canadian energy policy, to be announced by, the Government tomorrow, is expected to bring about a gradual, reduction of oil exports to the United States.

title: S.M.U. Appeal Rejected
description: DALLAS, Nov. 21 (AP)The National Collegiate Athletic Association has denied an appeal to its eligibility committee on behalf of Ira Terrell, Southern Methodist basketball center, Athletic Director Dick Davis said today. Terrell was ruled ineligible for allegedly accepting $50 on two occasions from an assistant coach in violation of NCAA rules.

title: Jersey Passes Bill To Enable Citizens To Sue on Pollution
description: TRENTON, Nov. 21A controversial measure enabling New Jersey residents to take alleged environmental polluters into court was given its final legislative approval in the State Senate today, despite broad opposition by industry and organized labor.

title: Advertising
Tax Bill Cledied by Mills Panel; Oil Depletion Phaseout Retained
description: WASHINGTON,. Nov. 21The House Ways and Means Committee stood off today a lastditch attempt by oilindustry supporters to preserve the depletion allowance and gave its final approval to a tax bill phasing out the allowance and providing a small tax cut for nearly 40 million low and niddleintome taxpayers.

title: G.M. to Lay Off 30,000; Ford Cuts Pinto Price$66
description: DETROIT, Nov. 21The General Motors Corporation announced further layoffs today and the Ford Motor Company reduced the price of its subcompact by $66 in moves to fight the slump in car sales and reduce large inventories of unsold cars.

title: U.S. Mail Stations Set Up for Strike Being Phased Out
description: The six parcel post terminals that were opened in the metropolitan area by the United States Postal Service to handle the increased volume during the 87day strike against the United Parcel Service will be phased out, beginning today with the closing of the facility that opened last Monday in Long Island City, Queens.

title: HOUSE APPROVES $17%BILLION AID FOR MASS TRANSIT
Stuff of Tinsel Dreams: Silver Screen Costumes
Man Subdued After Seizing Aide in an Embassy in Paris
description: PARIS, Nov. 21 (Reuters)A man with a toy pistol held a senior official of the Mexican Embassy hostage for one hour here today before being overpowered by policemen, a police spokesman said.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The City University's 18 undergraduate campuses have drawn up plans to save as much as $21.8million from the university's current budget if formally requested to do so by Mayor Beame under his austerity program. This could cause a sharp reduction in faculty positions, increase faculty work loads, and eliminate numerous courses in the colleges.

title: Former City Clerk May Face No Charges in Inquiry on Payroll Irregularities
description: An investigation into alleged payroll irregularities inthe office of the City. Clerk has centered on the activities of several subordinates of Herinan Katz, who resigned from the office last week. But the inquiry is unlikely to lead to criminal charges against Mr. Katz himself, persons close to the case said yesterday.

title: KODAK DECLARES EXTRA DIVIDEND
description: Increased and extra dividends were voted yesterday by companies in a variety of businesses,

title: The U.S.Canada Beef
description: The one certainty abotit the complicated dispute between the United States and Canada over restrictions on the.twoway trade in meat and meat animals is that it never should have happened. It involves the kind of problem that two friendly neighbors and mature trading partners ought long ,ago to have established effective machinery for resolving.

title: Price Rises Here Highest Since 1947
description: The Bureau of Labor Statistics office for the New YorkNortheastern New Jersey area said, yesterday that the rise in the prices of consumer goods here in the last 12 months was the largest since the postWorld War II inflation.

title: 17 Die as Bombs Destroy 2 British Pubs
Met Opera Names Bliss To a Post Above Chapin
description: Anthony A. Bliss, a forme president of the Metropolitai Opera Association, has bees named to a new post with th, company that places him a step abOve Schuyler G. Chapin, the general manager, in the corn mand structure. Mr. Bliss wil serve as executive director o the company and chairman o the administration committed of the board of directors of the association.

title: Bill to Let Citizens Sue Jersey Polluters Passes
description: TRENTON, Nov. 21A controversial measure enabling New Jersey residents to take alleged environmental polluters into court was given its final legislative approval in the State Senate today, despite broad opposition by industry and organized labor.

title: Met Names Bliss to New Post Above Chapin
description: Anthony A. Bliss, a former president of the Metropolitan Opera Association, has been named to a new post with the company that places him a step above Schuyler G. Chapin, the general manager, in the command structure. Mr. Bliss will serve as executive director and chairman of the administration committee of the board of directors of the association.

title: US. PRESSES U.N. TO ENABLE ISRAEL TO LIVE SECURELY
JAZZ PIANO QUARTET SWIRLS WITH STYLE
description: Four of the most versatile jazz pianists in townRoland Hanna, Hank Jones, Dick Hyman and Marian McPartlandput their eight hands together in a set of performances at Michael's Pub on Wednesday evening that marked the first public appearance of the Jazz Piano Quartet.

title: 2 Charged With Slaying of 6 in Bakery
description: NEW BRITAIN, Conn., Nov. 21Two members of a local motorcycle gang were arrested today and charged with the murder of six persons in a bakery here last month.

title: A Hoboken Detective Held in LoanSharking
description: NEWARK, Nov. 21 (AP)The Federal Bureau of Investigation announced today the arrest of a Hoboken police detective on loansharking charges.

title: Phnom Penh: Uneasy Hope for Future
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Nov. 21The Cambodian Government, weary from its nearly fiveyear war with Communistled insurgents, today expressed hope about, but not confidence in its ability to survive in the coming months.

title: People in. sports
description: The Boson Celtics placed Dave Cowens on the active list yesterday and said there was a possibility the 6foot9inch center might play tonight in Boston against the Phoenix Suns.

title: Net Mutual Fund Sales Set Record in October
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (UPI)The mutual fund industry had record net sales of $505.7million in October, the Investment Company In stitute said today.

title: Phillips Convicted
description: William R. Phillips, the policeman who was a star witness at the Knapp Commission hearings into police corruption here, was convicted of slaying a pimp and a prostitute. Page 22.

title: MONDALE GIVES UP PRESIDENCY RACE;
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21Senator Walter F. Mondale of Minnesota withdrew today from the crowded field of Democratic Icampaigners for the Presidential nomination in 1976.

title: 17 Die as Bombs Destroy 2 British Pubs
description: LONDON, Nov. 21  Bombs destroyed two crowded pubs in the heart of Birmingham tonight, killing 17 persons and injuring about 120. Many of them were teenagers.

title: Lacking a Lottery Winner, Jersey Picks 2d Number
description: WAYNE, N. J., Nov, 21 (UPI) The winning number in the New Jersey weekly lottery was routinely picked today, but for the first time in its fouryear history no ticketholder won the lottery's $50,000 top prize.

title: A Record ShortInterest Position On Nov. 15 Listed by Big Board
Weekly Retail Sales Up 2%
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales In the latest week totaled an estimated $1.26 billion, up 1 per cent from the yearedrlier $1.25billion. Total retail store sales were about $10.24billion, up 2 per cent from last year's $10.03billion.

title: A.T.&T. Slumps 3 Points As Market Closes Mixed
CHEMIST IS GUILTY OF TAINTING DRUG
description: NEWARK, Nov. 21  A 65,yearold Hackensack chemist land the corporation he heads pleaded guilty today to Federal (charges of introducing into interstate commerce adulterated ipecac, the country's most widely used emetic in the emergency treatment of poison victims.

title: What the Tapes Reveal: Nixon Hid Truth
Griffith in Garden Ring For 28th Time Tonight
description: Vita Antuofermo was 15 years old when he first saw Emile Griffith fight. Antuo fermo saw Griffith on the television screen in his Bari, Italy, home. Tonight the transplanted Italian will get a firsthand look at Griffith when the two square off for a 10 round middleweight match in Madison Square Garden.

title: L.I. Track Saved by $14 Milion Loan
LongStagnant Burmese Economy Appears on the Brink of Collapse
CITY IS LIMITING CLINTON BUILDING
description: After hearing five hours of argument from residents and property owners in the Clinton neighborhood on the West Side of Manhattan, the Board of Estimate voted yesterday evening to enact special zoning controls intended to protect the area from runaway development.

title: ATOM AIDE'S DEATH RULED ACCIDENTAL
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Nov. 21 (AP)A laboratory worker at a nuclear plant died of traffic injuries, the state medical examiner said today. He rejected a union suggestion that her car had been forced off the road.

title: City to Sell Schoolhouse
description: A shabby old brick schoolhouse built in 1867 will be auctioned off by the city on Dec. 3. The former Public School, 62 at 163 Bradford Street, Brcioklyn, is listed at a minimum, price of $40,000 in the announcement by Real Estate Commissioner Ira Duchan of the year's ninth auction of city real estate. Two hundred one properies are on the offering list for the auction, which starts at 9:30 A.M. in the Hotel Commodore.

title: Rail Freight Traffic Off
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads during the latest week in which the nationwide coal strike begantotaled an estimated 15.9 billion tonmiles, 8.8 per cent below the corresponding week last year. Carloadings in the same week totaled 482,850 cars, 12.6 per cent below last year. The American Trucking Associations Inc., reported intercity truck tonnage was 12.4 per cent below last year.

title: Byrne Names Woman For Consumer Chief
description: TRENTON, Nov. 21 (AP)Governor Byrne sent to the Senate today an important nomination of a woman. Another woman's nomination he had made earlier ran into delay.

title: Abitibi Is the Apparent Victor in Battle for Price Co.
description: The Abitibi Paper Company Ltd., appeared yesterday to be the victor in the, fight to acquire the Price Company Ltd., the third largest newsprint company in Canada for $125

title: ORDERS IN DECLINE FOR DURABLE GOODS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21New orders for durable goods declined again in October and the backlog of unfilled orders fell for the first time since mid1971, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Bicentennial Planners In Error on Madison
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (AP)The American Revoludon Bicentennial Administra tion, assigned to see that the nation's 200th birthday is properly celebrated, is apologizing for an embarrassing dissemination of historical misinformation.

title: Flag of Michigan Adorns Ohio Pole
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Nov. 21 (AP)A blue Michigan flag flapped ih the crisp, lateautumn lireeze above the Ohio House of Representatives today signaling some early arrivals from the North for the Ohio StateMichigan football game saturday.

title: Spain. Gives Three Basques Long Terms for Terrorism
description: MADRID, Nov. 21A courtmartial in the northern city of Burgos has sentenced three Basque separatists to long prison terms for terrorism, it was announced here today.

title: Leafs Lose Salming
description: TORONTO, Nov. 21 (AP)Borje Salming, a Toronto Maple Leaf defenseman, will be out of action for at least three weeks with a bone fracture in his heel, a spokesman for the National Hockey League said today. Salming suffered the injury during the Leafs 85 loss to Pittsburgh last night.

title: 10 NATIONS SPEED TALKS ON OIL FUND
John B. Gambling. Dead at 77; Conducted Early Radio Shows
description: John B, Gambling, a pioneer of earlymoriiing chattertype radio; died,.yesterday :.at, his home in Palm Beach, Fla. He was 77 years old.

title: Hawaiians Romp, Reach Semifinals
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Nov. 21 (AP)Al Davis burst for two touchdowns and Randy Johnson passed for two more tonight as the Hawaiians whpped the Southern California Sun, 3214,

title: PROPERTYTAX8111. IS FACING DEATH
description: TRENTON, Nov. 21Plans f,d impose a statewide propertf tax to resolve New Jersey'l school financing problem floun dered at a conference of the Senate Democratic majority to day as legislative leaders pre: dicted that it would be rejected: decisively in an informal vote. on Monday.

title: Beame Style Keeps Budget Woe in Low Key
description: During his early months in City Hall, Mayor Beame won some attentionand a considerable measure of public affectionfor his unpretentious personal style. A modest man who lunched on tuna fish sandwiches at his desk. An oldfashioned gentleman who fretfully advised women staff members to get home safely. A respite from the glamour of the predecessor administration of John V. Lindsay.

title: Msgr. Arthur J. Scanlan, Long a Pastor in Bronx
description: Msgr. Arthur J. Scanlan, pastor of St. Helena's Roman Catholic Church, near Unionport Road and Olmstead Avenue in the Bronx, from 1940 to 1969, died yesterday at the Mary Manning Walsh Home. He was 93 years old.

title: Peter L. Schaeffer Weds Marion Morris
description: Marion Ellen Morris, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William T. Morris of Jackson Heights, Queens, was married yesterday afternoon to Peter Langer Schaeffer, son of Mr. and Mrs. J. Peter Schaeffer of Rye. Canon Wendell W. Phillips performed the Episcopal ceremony in the chapel of the Italian liner Michelangelo.

title: Changes Due in Textron Pact To Bring Funds to Lockheed
description: Significant revisions have been agreed to in principle on the projected massive deal to restructure the deeply troubled Lockheed Aircraft Corporation with funds from Textron, Inc., according to industry sources.

title: MRS. JOHN ZINSSER
description: Isabella Wadsworth Zinsser, widow of John Sharman Zinsser, a Philadelphia manufacturer, died Monday at her home in Sweet Briar, Va. She was 80 years old.

title: Talks on a Strip Mane Bill Recessed Without Accord
Auto Workers to Share Big. LivingCost Raise
description: DETROIT, Nov. 21 (UPI)The increase in the consumer price index announced by the Labor Department today means the nation's 665,000 auto workers will share in a record $4millionaweek pay raise beginning next month.

title: Aqueduct Bans Trainer on Drug Charge

The rises, will be on bar bases and on extras for grades containing less than. per cent tungsten or cobalt. MacMillan Bloedel, Ltct., announced that ef4 fective Jan. 1, its price for 30pound standard newsprint would be raised in the western United States by $35 a ton to $280. The increase was made necessary by a sharp increase in wood costs, the company said, adding that even with the increase, the price of newsprint still won't be adequate to provide a return on investment which would justify the installation of new production capacity.

title: Dave Anderson
description: If the World Football League could afford a coat of arms, the symbols would be obvious  empty seats, free tickets and a blob of red ink on a taxlien form. But behind the debtors and, the creditors and the club owners who went broke are the coaches and players who were victimized and yet survived, There is, in particular, Jack Pardee, once a learned linebacker with the Washington Redskins and the Los Angeles Rams, now the Coach of the Florida Blazers, a team that won the Eastern Division title with 14.6 wonlost record. Many of the Blazer players hadn't received a paycheck since late August but somehow Jack Pardee kept them together. He did it by doing something that not every coach does. He told his players the truth. For that alone, Jack Pardee is the coach of the year.

title: Escort Service Set Up to Halt Assaults on Princeton Coeds

title: $1Billion in Strip Bills Sold by the Treasury
Books of The Times
description: Here is a book that doesn't try to make us feel guilty about the American Indian. And for that one must be profoundly grateful, because one. paradoxical result of the keening and handwringing and cries of mea culpa that throughout the last century or po have been expended over imperialism's westward expansion is that the Indian has been robbed of his dignity. By assigning blame  and by designating oppressors and victims, we diminish the tragedy to melodrama (true tragedy is never cowboys and Indians). And by reducing the settlement of the West to melodrama, we shrink the Indian in stature. No, T. R. Fehrenbach doesn't make us feel guilty about the Indian. He grants him his dignity. Grants him his dignity, first of all, by choosing to write about those tribes collectively known to themselves as Nermernuh (or True People: each Indian tribe considered itself the true people, apparently) and to European settlers as Comanches (from the Ute phrase Kohmahts, or Those Who Are Always Against Us"each Indian tribe considered the other tribes the enemies, apparentlywhich the Spanish wrote down as Komdntcia, which in turn became conventionalized as ComanChe). Not that Mr. Fehrenbach regards the Comanches as superior to other tribes, or anything. It just hap pened to be the Comanches who most proficiently exploited the horse once the Spaniards had introduced it, who most, successfully took up the hunting way of life in the great plains to, the east of the Rockies, who most ferociously resisted the imperial expansion of the Spaniards and AngloAmericans and who thus most decisively affected the course of American history.

title: Books of The Times
description: Stanley Marcus, the personification of the Dallas specialty store, NeimanMarcus, is undoubtedly one of America's great merchants. description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (UPI) Chief Judge George L. Hart Jr. of the United States District court here denied today motions for Dismissal of four of five criminal counts against formar Treasury Secretary John B.Connally in connection with a milk price scandal.

title: Ford Arrives for Talk With Brezhnev
description: VLADIVOSTOK, U.S.S.R., Saturday, Nov. 23 (AP) President Ford arrived at this city in the Soviet Far East today for a weekend summit meeting with the Soviet Communist party leader Leonid I. Brezhnev.

title: Carey Panels on Health Planning Meet
State Public Health Unit Votes Curbs on Sale of Nursing Homes
description: The State Public Health Council voted yesterday to block the sale of nursing homes when the sale is merely a devise to raise Medicaid rates.

title: Business Briefs
description: PARIS, Nov. 22 (AP)On behalf of American interests, the El Paso Company of Houston and the Occidental Petroleum Corporation of Los Angeles signed today with the Soviet Union and Japanese businessmen a twoyear agreement for joint exploration for natural gas in Siberia, the American companies announced here.

title: Consumer Bill Advances
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (AP) The Senate Appropriations Committee approved a bill today that would provide $13.6billion for farm, consumer and environment programs. The amount is $176million less than was contained in a bill that President Nixon called inflationary and vetoed the day before he resigned.

title: Sirica Suggests He Will Throw Out 2 of 11 Counts Against Mitchell and Ehrlichman in CoverUp Trial
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22Federal District Judge John J. Sirica strongly suggested today that he would throw'out two of the total of 11 counts against two defendants in the. Watergate coverup trial.

title: Dinosaurs In the Jungle
description: PARISIn Europe, the fourth estate in which Western concepts of derrtocracy are firmly rootedis sick. Such, at least, is the conclusion of an extensive series of articles published by Le Monde, most influential French daily. And the illness analyzed by its correspondents is obviously prevalent elsewhere.

title: StripMine AntiClimax
description: A proposed compromise that would have released the stripmine control bill from a HouseSenate conference committee Thursday failed by one vote. If it were left that, it would be an intolerable conclusion to three years of exhaustive work and argurnent on legislation that desperately needed if large areas of the West are escape the desolation that for decades was allowed accompany the stripmining of Appalachia.

title: J.&L. STEEL HOLDERS BACK A SHIFT TO LTV
description: Shareholders of the Jones & Laughlin Steel Corporation voted yesterday to become a wholly owned subsidiary of LTV, Industries, Dallas. LTV earlier had purchased 81 per cent of Jones & Laughlin and proceeded to buy the remaining 19 per cent at $29 a share.

title: Graphic V.D. Exhibit in Newark Is Aimed at the Young
description: NEWARK, Nov. 22In an effort to combat the fear and misunderstanding surrounding venereal disease, the Venereal Disease Service Organization today opened at Newark Museum here a multimedia exhibit on the subject.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: SCREEN RITES The Elgin Cinema, at Eighth Avenue and 19th Street (6750935), is a movie house that seems never to run out of ideas about keeping its premises profitably dark. Starting tomorrow, the Elgin begins a new series, consisting of films made of works that started out as live theater. A, different film will be shown each Sunday at noon, with Jean Genet's The Balcony (1963) as tomorrow's opener, starring Peter Falk and Shelley Winters under direction.

title: AMEY E. BARDENS
description: Amey E. Bardens, a publichealth nurse specializing in obstetrics, formerly with the Nursing and Operation Maternity Consultation Service here, died Thursday in Glastonury, Conn., where she lived. Her age was 81.

title: Inquiry Begun on Concern That Employed Monserrat
description: The city's Department of Investigation and the Board of Ethics yesterday began looking into whether there were any improprieties in the 1971 award by the Board of Education of a $211,660 contract to a manpower training company that had employed a board member, Joseph Monserrat, as a consultant.

title: Dairylea's Woes Hit Its Members Hard
description: MILLERTON, N.. Y., Nov. 22John Brusie, a young dairy farmer here in the upper Harlem Valley, tried to resign from the Dairylea Cooperative, Inc., recently when he learned that it planned to assess its 8,000 farmermembers a total of $18.6million to make up its accumulated deficit.

title: Major New Demands Stall Coal Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22The weeklong deadlOck in efforts to end the national coal miners strike, now in its 11th day, was ended temporarily tonight with brief, exploratory talks on the union's steeply increased demands.

title: CITY ECONOMIZING JOLTED AGENCIES
description: The meeting of top city officials two weeks ago was called so abruptly by Mayor Beame that some of them arrived at Gracie Mansion without knowing what the meeting was about.

title: U.S. Lowers Interest Rate On Home Mortgages to 9%
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22The Government announced today reduction from 9 to 9 per cent in the interest rate on home mortgages it insures or guarantees.

title: Recipes for thh Rits and Pieces
description: CroqueMonsieur

title: Jobless Rate Down Here, but Dip Is Only Seasonal
description: Unemployment fell in the city and in the rest of the state from September through October, but the improvement was seasonal,reflecting the usual fall startup of the school systems, the State Department of Labor reported yesterday.

title: 6 N.F.L. Games Sold Out
description: The National Football League said yesterday that six of its games tomorrow were sold out 72 hours in advance and are available far local televising by network affiliates, The sellouts are Dallas at Houston, Denver at Oakland, Kansas City at Cincinnati, Miami at the New York. Jets, Philadelphia at Washington and San Diego at Green Bay.

title: Three Former Elite Detectives Indicted in Shakedown Scheme
description: Three former detectives of the Slice Department's Special Investigations Unit were indicted yesterday by a Federal grand jury in Brooklyn on charges that they installed illegal wiretaps on the telephones of three narcoticsdealing suspects and later illegally took nearly $100,000 from them and from other suspects.

title: Peking Says Moscow Plans To Seize Chinese Territory
description: PEKING, Nov, 22 (Reuters)The Chinese accused the Soviet leadership today of planning to seize areas of western China.

title: Economic Deadweight
description: Unemployment is already too high, without having thousands of innocent bystanders needlessly forced onto the jobless lists by footdragging within the United Mine Workers hierarchy over ratification of the strike settlement negotiated by the union's top leaders.

title: BERME CUTS 1,510 WORKERS AND IMPOSES A JOB FREEZE TO SAVE CITY $100MILLION
CARES STILL FIRM ON CUNNINGHAM
description: Governorelect Hugh L. Carey stuck to his choice of Patrick Cunningham, the Bronx Democratic leader, as the new Democratic state chairman yesterday, in the face of widespread criticism by liberal and upstate Democrats.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALLKnicks vs. milwaukee Bucks, at Madison Square Garden, Eighth Aierine and 33d Street,

title: British Football
description: Second Division Meadowbrook Thisile 2, East Fife 1. RUGBY LEAGUE First Division Castleford 15, Bramley 11.

title: Students Get Shots To Stem Meningitis At Trenton State
description: TRENTON, Nov. 22 Thousands of students, faculty members and employes at Trenton State College lined up in chilling winds outside a temporarily converted dining hall today to be vaccinated against meningitis, which has already taken the life of one undergraduate.

title: DDay: Michigan vs. Ohio State; Unbeaten Yale Meets Harvard
description: Despite contrasting philosophies about intercollegiate athletics and football in particular both the Big Ten and the Ivy League managed to pack much of the interest and excitement of an entire, season'.into one final game for the respective league championships today.

title: For the Sake Frugality, the metamorphosis of Holiday Leftovers
description: Guests will be invited into the kitchen at. Laura Odell's SundayafterThanksgiving partynot to cook but to help themselves to soup baked in a pumpkin; Canadianstyle meat pie and a luscious cranberry. dessert.

title: Photojournalism Gets Triple Exposure at New City Museum
description: Whatever else New York may be Missing in the way of cultural attractions these days, it certainly cannot be said to be lacking in museums that uphold a serious commitment to the achievements f photography. The Museum of Modern Art, in addition to its regular program of new acquisitions and temporary exhibitions, maintains a permanent gallery devoted to masterworks of the medium.

title: Dolphins' Stanfill Jet Headache
description: Not one quarterback sent Bill Stanfill a getwell card in the hospital this week.

title: PRICES ON AMEX SHOW MIXED TONE
Cowens Sparks Celtics
Drive on Nazi Suspects a Year Later: No U.S. LegalSteps Have Been Taken
description: Nearly a year after immigration authorities announced a new countrywide drive to resolve longdormant cases of suspected Nazi war criminals living in America, no legal proceedings have yet been brought and controversy continues to surround the effort.

title: Yugoslavia Charges Croatians In Exile Foment Terrorist Acts
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 22  Yugoslav prosecutors have charged at a trial of 16 accused terrorists that exile groups in West Germany, France and Canada are supporting a campaign for arson, bombing and assassinations in Yugoslavia.

title: Trustee Sues Former HomeStake Executives
description: TULSA, Okla., Nov. 22 (UPI) The trustee for the HomeStake Production Company, the concern accused of swindling 2,000 investors of more than, $100million, is seeking $164.7million in damages from former company officers, more than half of it from the former president of the company, Robert S. Trippet.

title: Contract Awards
description: The Lockheed Shipbuilding and Construction Company received a $252.9million Navy contract for construction two submarine tenders.

title: Path Cleared for Textron To Rescue Ailing Lockheed
description: The biggest obstacles in the plan for financially overhauling the troubled Lockheed Aircraft Corporation with a massive infusion of funds from Textron, Inc., were removed yesterday.

title: Sabres Tie Flames, 44, OnLate Goal
Antiques: Rare Watches
description: Long before time could be precisely measured in seconds or even minutes, watchmakers devised miniature mechanical wonders that designated the hour more or less, but were cherished by their aristocratic owners mostly for the extraordinary craft skills of metal, enamel and stone work that they

title: KARPOV IS WINNER OF CHESS MATCH
description: Anatoly Karpov, a 23yearold Russian politicalscience student, won the final Candidate's Match against Viktor korchnoi in Moscow yesterday, thus becoming the official challenger for the world chess championship.

title: Citibank Cuts Prime Rate To 10%, Low Since April
description: The First National City Bank, leading, the banking industry for the seventh consecutive week, reduced yesterday its prime rate on corporate loans to 10 per cent, lowest since midApril. The new rate will be put into effect Monday.

title: Janet Lynn's SkatesEtchilig $ Signs on Ice
description: Here's a skater who can't sling a puck into an empty net, yet earns more than Brad Park and Gordie Howe combined  about a halfmillion dollars a year. This skater happero to be a 21yearold woman, and she doesn't need to worry about scoring goals on the rinks where she skates.

title: Vow to Kill Hostages
description: TUNIS, Tunisia, Saturday, Nov. 23Three Palestinian guerrillas who hijacked a British airliner with 47 persons aboard Thursday night in the Persian Gulf shiekdom of Dubai landed here yesterday and demanded the release of 13 terrorists in Cairo.

title: JOHN H. MALONEY
description: John H. Maloney, president of the Middlebury (Vt.) Hotel Corporation and vice president of the Basin Harbor Club in Ferrisburg Vt., died Thursday in Ferrisburg, where he lived. His age was 59.

title: Steep Dip in New Housing Is Seen Here
description: State housing officials predieted yesterday that new housing construction in the city this year would be at least 50 per cent less than last year's totalwhich was sharply lest than the year before.

title: TEACHERS STAND IN STRIKE SCORED
description: TRENTON, Nov. 22  The state's chief negotiator in the strike of state college teachers charged that the American Federation of Teachers was apparently attempting to use the walkout as a springboard for its recently announced national campaign to organize faculty members. Teachers at the eight colleges went on strike Monday, demanding a costofliving raise and fringe benefits.

title: INTELSAT 4'S SHIFT IN ORBIT SCHEDULED
description: A rocketfiring has been scheduled for approximately 7 P.M. Eastern standard time today, 22,300 miles above the Pacific, to put the sixth Intelsat 4 transoceanic communications satellite into a stationary orbit. The craft was sent into a preparatory orbit Thursday night from Cape Canaveral, Fla.

title: Major New Demands Stall Coal Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22The weeklong deadlock in efknts to end the national coal miners strike, now in its 11th lay, was ended temporarily tolight with brief, exploratory alks on the union's steeply ncreased demands.

title: BERNARD LEVANTHAL
description: Bernard Leventhal, president of Berne. & Bob Leventhal, Inc., sales engineers, Massapequa, L.I., died Thursday. He was 61 years old and lived at 317 Clearview Lane, Massapequa.

title: Insurance Claims Against Gateway To Be Paid Soon
description: TRENTON, Nov. 22 (UPI)Insurance Commissioner James J. Sheeran said today that claim payments arising from auto insurance policies of the bankrupt Gateway Insurance company of Philadelphia were expected to begin next month.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A Federal jury acquitted two reputed organizedcrirne figures of extortionconspiracy charges. The jury deliberated for four hours before returning the Verdicts in the sixweek trial of the two men, John Cigilio of Paramus and Eugene Sangillo of Lakewood.

title: SENATE PANEL,90, BACKS ROEMER FOR CONFIRMATION
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22The Senate Rules Committee voted unanimously today to recommend to the full Senate the confirmation of Nelson A. Rockefeller as Vice President, The vote was taken as Mr. Rockefeller began to undergo a second day of questioning before the House Judiciary Committee.

title: Miss Culliton Wed in Capital
description: Barbara J. Culliton and Wallace K. Waterfall, both of Washington, were married there yesterday afternoon. The Rev. Peter G. Winterble performed the ceremony in St. JOhn's Episcopal Church in the GeOrgetown section.

title: Yale Rallies to Tie Harvard in Soccer
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 22The Yale soccer team fought back today to tie Harvard, 11, in a physical match that marked the season's end for both teams. The Crimson broke on top late in the first, period on a fastbreak goal by John Challenger.

title: Hemmeter Named Head Of W.F.L.
The U.N's Resolutions on Palestine
W T. Grant's Loss Tripled; Quarter Dividend Is Omitted
Bankers Acceptance Limit
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (Reuters)  The Federal Reserve Board raised today the limit on the outright holdings of bankers acceptances that may be held by the system to $1billion from $500million. The Fed said its board of governors also ended the practice of guaranteeing the bankers acceptances purchased for foreign official accounts. This guarantee was suspended eariller this month.

title: Events Today
AMNESTY EFFORT BEING PRESSED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 Secretary of Defense James R. Schlesinger announced toddy that the department would send letters to the relatiires of all Vietnam War deserters in an effort to step up the lagging response to the President's amnesty program.

title: U.N. Committee Approves AtomFree Mideast Plan
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 22The United Nations General Assembly's political committee adopted a resolution tonight approving the idea of a nuclear weaponfree zone in the Middle East. The vote was 103 to 0.

title: CANADA REDUCING OIL GOING TO U.S
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 22Canada, the largest single supplier of foreign oil to the United States, announced today that exports of crude oil to the United States market would be reduced by 100,000 barrels a day, effective Jan. 1.

title: DR. RICHARD LEVINE, EDUCATIONAL TESTER
description: Dr. Richard S. Levine, a vice president of the Educational Testing Service, Princeton, N.J., died Thursday at his home in Princeton, after a long illness. He was 49 years old.

title: The Vladivostok Region
description: The Siberian health resort of Okeanskaya, the site of talks between President Ford and Leonid I. Brezhnev, is on the northern outskirts of Vladivostok 12 miles, from the City Center

title: CAVETT TO QUIT ABC; HAS TALKS WITH CBS
description: While taping a program videotaped yesterday for broadcast Jan. 1, Dick Cavett announced to the studio audience that he was ending his association with ABCTV. He said he would be working for a different network, although he did not specify which.

title: Challenge to Arafat
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 22The hijacking of a British airliner from Dubai to Tunis was regarded here today as a.challenge to the authority of Yasir Arafat, chairman of the Pales tine Liberation Organization.

title: RITA S. SAUNDERS
description: Rita Schacht Saunders. vice chairman of the board of trustees of the Waterford (Conn.) Country School for emotionally disturbed and handicapped children, died Thursday of cancer at Lawrence Memorial Hospital, New London, Conn. She was 59 years old and lived in Waterford.

title: ASSEMBLY ADOPTS 2 U.N.RESOLUTIONS AIDING P.L.O. AIMS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N: Y., Nov. 22The General Assembly approved two resolutions tonight declaring that the Palestinian people have the right to independence and sovereignty and giving the Palestine Liberation Organization observer status in United Nations affairs.

title: Woman Scared by ChiMpanzee In Restaurant Loses a Lawsuit
description: FREEHOLD, Nov. 22 (UPI)A chimpanzee accused, of scaring the wits out of a woman was cleared today after a jury ruled that its owner was not negligent when he, led the animal, dressed as a Boy Scout, into a restaurant.

title: People in Sports
description: After 38 Years the job Sam Snead will leave his post as golf pro at the Greenbrier in White Sulphur Springs, W. Va. John Lanahan, president of the resort, said the Greenbrier wanted a fulltime pro and that the 62yearold Snead, desired more time for tournament play.

title: Rockefeller Admits Making a Serious Mistake in Role on Attica
description: Former Gov. Nelson A. Rockefeller said yesterday for the first time that he had made a serious mistake in his handling of the Attica inmate uprising that led to the deaths of 43 men in September, 1971.

title: Stage: King of the U.S.
1,062 Were Dismissed In 34 Austerity Move
description: Mayor Beame's austerity program, disclosed yesterday, was the first massive dismissal of city employes since April 30, 1934, when the Board of Estimate abruptly abolished 1,062 jobs to save $2,275,945.27 for the remainder of the fiscal year.

title: Trial of Briton Who Spanked Girls Amuses Public
description: LONDON, Nov. 22,The British love their eccentrics, and despite their outward.reserve they enjoy a lewd giggle. This week they have had ample opportunity to indulge both.

title: Last Draftees Are Discharged, Making the Army All Volunteer
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22By the time the final notes of retreat faded this evening, the last draftee serving in the Army had been discharged.

title: Hester Leaving N.Y.U. to Head New U.N. University in Japan
description: James M. Hester will leave the presidency of New York University next summer to become the first head of the newly, formed United Nations University, an international research and training institution that will have its headquarters in Tokyo, it was announced yesterday.

title: AUTO MAKERS SET WIDENED LAYOFFS
description: DETROIT, Nov. 22Three of the four major United States auto makers the Ford Motor Company, the Chrysler Corporation and the American Motors Corporationannounced today further layoffs affecting a total of about 39,000 production workers and almost 12,000 whitecollar workers.

title: Murray Chass
description: When the musical Oklahoma! opened on Broadway in 1943, it didn't win any awards.. If it were up to the nation's college football coaches, Oklahomathe football team, that iswouldn't win any awards this year either. No one in the theater world could shed any tears for Oklahoma! because it ran for five years and two months. No tears are needed for Oklahoma either because the Sooners committed a grave sin and were duly punishedthey were caught in the act of violating recruiting rules and placed on a twoyear probation (it wasn't the violations so much that represented crime, as many other schools undoubtedly could attest, but it was in getting caught at the game that Oklahoma went awry.)

title: Unhorsed as a Space Cowboy
description: BOLINAS, Calif.I am an ArmenianJewish American and the combination of these two cultures, both the victims of genocide within the twentieth century, has given me a restless nature.

title: WHOLESALE PRICE OF SUGAR UP 12%
description: A 12 per cent increase in the wholesale price of sugar, the largest of seven rises in, the last five weeks, was announced yesterday by three of the country's biggest refiners. The wholesale price advance is expected to add at least 10 cents to the current price of 65 cents a pound at groceries.

title: Saigon Opposition Eases to a Standoff With Thieu
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 22For the moment, the antiGovernment protest movements that burst dramatically into public view last September have lost their momentum and have slid into a quiet standoff with President Nguyen Van Thieu.

title: Scores on WQXR
Hockey, Basketball Standings
Extradition Ordered Here In 2 Connecticut Murders
description: A Queens stockbroker was ordered extradited to Connecticut yesterday to face two murder charges connected with the slaying on Sept. 26 of his former wife's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Irving Pasternack.

title: Students End Cornell SitIn; Meeting Will Be Arranged
description: ITHACA, N.Y., Nov. 22About 40 Cornell University students ended their 31hour occupation of a portion of the offices of the university president, last night and today won their demand to have an.open meeting with five trustees familiar with the university's finances.

title: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

description: World sugar futures declined again here yesterday by the 2centapound permissible limit in terms of the key March contract, the most actively traded on the New York Coffee and Sugar Exchange.

title: Cigarette Cargo Hijacked
description: UINCY, Mass., Nov. 22 (AP) A tractortrailer truck containing cigarettes valued at $60,000 to $70,000 was hijacked today. The state police said that the driver was abducted, but released unharmed by two men with handguns who approached the driver while he was in the cab of the truck at restaurant on the Southeast Expressway.

title: WINE TALK
description: PRINCETON, N. J.Country restaurants with good food are rare enough, but pountry restaurants with good wine lists are truly hard to find. Maybe Lahiere's. at 11 Witherspoon Street here isn't really a country restaurant. Maybe Princeton really isn't the country any more. But the restaurant sure has quite a wine list.

title: Ramirez Defeats Rosewall
description: JOHANNESBURG, Smith Africa, Nov. 22 (AP)Raul Ramirez of Mexico upset Ken Rosewall today and joined Jimmy Connors, Arthur Ashe and Harold Solomon, all Of the United States, in the semifinals of the South African open tennis championships.

title: Italy's Payments Deficit Up
description: ROME, Nov. 22 (Reuters) Italy's balanceofpayments deficit for the first eight months of this year was more than seven times as high as in the same period last year, accordling to figures released by the Bank of Italy today. The defiicit totaled $4.18billion, compared with last year's $571.55million. The provisional figure for the September deficit is $133.151million, bringing the provisional deficit for the first nine months of the year to $4.32billion.

title: She Watches Them Dance, Then Captures Performance in Clay
description: Although ballet dancers are considered neverfail subjects for photography and have inspired a good many paintings, especially by Degas, they somehow have never caught on when it comes to sculpture. Even Degas, seemingly fascinated by tutus and Pointe shoes, never showed much interest in them for threedimensional works with his later years when his eyesight was failing.

title: Jane Henderson Swords Married
description: Jane Henderson Swords was married here yesterday afternoon to Walter Maynard Jr., first vice president of White, Weld & Co.,Inc., investment bankers. The civil ceremony took place at the Municipal Building.

description: Jury to Hear BuildingGraft Case

title: ROBERT MGREGOR OF THEATRE ARTS
description: Robert M. MacGregor, a director and editor of Theatre Arts Books, a publishing company, and editor, director and vice president of The New Directions Publishing Corporation, died of cancer in his sleep yesterday. He was 63 years old and lived at 77 Washington Place.

title: ExWatergate Counsel Guilty on Tax Charge
description: RALEIGH, N.C., Nov. 22 (UPI)Rufus L. Edmisten, North Carolina attorney generalelect who was deputy counsel of the Senate Watergate committee, was convicted today of failing to file 1972 and 1973 North Carolina income tax returns on time.

title: Civilian Defense Jobs Cut To Aid Combat Strength
U.S. AIRLINE PLAN WORRYING DUTCH
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22A high dutch official expressed today his country's great concern about United States moves aimed at reducing the flights of KLM Royal Dutch Airlines to the United States and called the step economic protectionism.

title: OIL LEASING DELAY ON COAST WEIGHED
description: Washington, Nov. 22Secretary of the Interior. Rogers C. B. Morton agreed today to meet early next week with California's two Senators and the. Los Angeles City Attorney to discuss a delay in his planned accelerated leasing of potential oil fields on the continental shelf off Southern California.

title: Virginia Court to Hear Colson Disbarment Case
description: RICHMOND, Nov. 22 (AP)The Virginia Supreme Court will hear arguments Dec. 2 on a request for the disbarment of Charles W. Colson, former special counsel to President Nixon.

title: Key Process Is Devised for New Electronic Switch
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22A process patented this week is regarded as a. key step toward a new type of electronic switch with performance far exceeding that of the transistor. Patent 3,849,276, assigned to the International Busi ness Machines Corporation, was granted James H., Greiner of the company's Thomas J. Watson Research Center, Yorktown Heights, N. Y. In the process, an ultrathin insulating layeronly 10 to 30 atoms thick  is created over a metallic base. Because electrons behave like waves as well as particles, they can penetrate or tunnel through such a thin insulator. The patented process is aimed at providing such penetrable insulating layers, creating switches that require very little energy. Mr. Greiner uses a glow discharge somewhat like that of a fluorescent light.

title: JET MAKER FACING A $670MILLION SUIT
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 22 (Reuters)The mother of young woman killed in the March 3 crash of a DC10 jumbo jet near Paris filed today a $670million damage suit on behalf of relatives of the 335 passengers killed in the crash.

title: Challenge to Arafat
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 22The hijacking of a British airliner from Dubai to Tunis was regarded here today as a challenge to the authority of Yasir Arafat, chairman of the Palestine Liberation Organization.

title: 2D ATOM PARTICLE FOUND IN A WEEK
description: STANFORD, Caltf., Nov. 22 (AP)A second uew and Mysterious nuclear particle has been found deep within the atom just days after the. first discovery was announced, physicists said today.

title: Nuptials in Jersey For Susan D. Guidi
description: Susan Dry Guidi of PottersIille, N. J., and Charles H.Boynton, a vice president of Cyrus J. Lawrence, Inc., investment brokers in New York, were married yesterday afternoon at the home of the bride's father, Morris E. Dry in Blairstown, N. J. Judge Carroll A. Boynton of the Municipal Court in Bernardsville, N. J., an uncle of the bridegroom, performed the ceremony.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22Productivity in the United States economy declined again in the third quarter of this year and unit labor costs again showed a large increase, the Labor Department reported today.

title: C. Maurice Holland, Producer In TVs Live Drama Era, Dies
description: C. Maurice Holland, a major producer in the early days of television, died Nov. 14, apparently of a heart attack, at his home on Byram Rock Road in Greenwich, Conn.

description: FAIR LAWN, Nov. 22Reggie Weir? Don't tell me he's still playing tennis? That's the reaction of many people when they see Dr. Reginald Weir's name in a tournament draw.

Islanders 60 Victors As Fail to Jell
