description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27(UPI) Senator George McGovern, Democrat of South Dakota, accused President Ford today of refusing to ask Americans to make the sacrifices necessary to halt recession In a Thanksgiving statement; he said that the nation's needy were making the greatest sacrifice through reduced food stamp benefits and higher unemployment.

title: Tonti Released From Prison
description: ALLENWOOD, Pa., Nov. 27 (UPI)D. Louis Tonti, former executive director of the Garden State Parkway, was released from a Federal prison camp today after serving 20 months for his role in an alleged extortion plot. Mr. Tonti, 56 years old, who had been fined $10,000 and sentenced to threeyears in prison, was released on parole for good behavior, according to prison officials.

title: Prosecutor Says Mitchell Stonewalled on CoverUp
OILPRICING PLAN TO AID EAST COM
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 Yielding to pressure from New England members of Congress, the Administration has agreed to include in a new oilpricing plan features that officials calculate will lower East Coast electricity and heating bills from Maine to Florida by $500million a year.

title: PERQUETA COURTNEY
description: Perqueta Courtney, a former musicalcomedy actress, died Tuesday in the De Witt Nursing Home. She was 80 years old. Miss Courtney, the widow of Reggie Childs, the band leader, had leading roles in Tumble Tumble, Merry Merry and other Broadway musicals of the nineteentwenties and thirties.

title: People in Sports
description: Ferguson Jenkins, who went to Texas, and Jim Wynn, who left. the state, were voted by their peers as baseball's comeback players of the year.

title: Dispute Over Rents
description: What is a fair, apartmentrent increase? This questionwhich has been bitterly battled over for years in New York City and to a growing degree elsewhere was brought into sharp focus Tuesday by a court decision that called into question the rent rises permitted in 700,000 rentstabilized apartments here.

title: Consumer Notes
Hunger, 1974
description: On the day after Thanksgiving, the principal food exporters will get together in Rome with the world's hungriest countries to try to solve the problem of the six to elevenmillionton food deficit the poor countries face this crop year.

title: James McGuire, Realty Leader At Cushman & Wakefield, Dies
description: James P. McGuire, senior vice president of Cushman & Wakefield, the realestate manageMent concern, did Tuesday. He was 64 years old and lived at 31 Dunhill Road, New Hyde Park, L.I.

title: LONGEST SURVIVOR OF IMPLANT DEAD
description: Louis B. Russell, an Indianapolis schoolteacher, who underwent heart transplant surgery more than six years ago and who has been the world's longest surviving heart recipient since 1970, died yesterday in Richmond. He was 49 years old.

title: White Stars AsCeltics Win, 10499
Free Turkey Dinners a Hit in Valatie
description: VALATIE, N.Y., Nov. 27Laguesse, owner of the Ranch Restaurant on Main Street, distributed free Thanksgiving dinners today, just as she said she would, and promised to do it again next year if I can afford it.

title: TV Sex and Violence: New Move Highlights Problems
description: Congress has directed the Federal Communications Commission to report by Dec. 31 specific actions the agency is taking, or planning to take, to protect children from television programs containing violent, obscene or indecent materials. The assignment is fraught with complications, because the television industry is not homogeneous, standards for programs that are suitable for children are elusive and the power of the F.C.C. to enforce discretion is limited.

title: CRITICISM MOUNTS ON THE ARMS PACT
McBride Named N.L '74 Rookie
The Wild East
description: Contrary to a popular misconception, there are stretches of genuine wilderness east of the Mississippi. None is of the size of the mountain and desert wilderness of the West. Some were scarred by lumbering early in the century and are only now returning to their natural condition. But each has its unique qualities, some are spectacularly beautiful, and all are worth saving as population densities increase and the manmade environment sprawls ever outward.

title: Thanom to Visit Thailand
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 27 (AP)  Leaders of Thailand's civilian Government have agreed to let former Premier Thanom Kittikachorn return from exile in Boston to visit his ailing father, a high Thai police official said today.

title: Rural Black Activist Becomes Folk Hero
Experience as a Nurse Proves Boon to Judge
description: Rushing from a hospital to a dog show was not an unusual occurrence for Mrs. Mildred Heald. I'd be on duty, recalled the registered nurse, and I'd try and work a shift so I could get to the ring in time. My. professign has been a great boon to my judging. With a knowledge of anatomy, one quickly recognizes balance and movement.

title: Schools Offer Trims
State Upgrades Standards on Waier Pollution
description: TRENTON, Nov. 27 (Ap)The Department of Environmental Protection announced today upgraded standards to protect the state's waterways from thermal pollution and to safeguard ocean bathing areas from bacterial pollution caused primarily by sewage dumping.

title: Ban on Contraceptive Sales In Wisconsin Struck Down
description: MADISON, Wis., Nov. 27 (UPI)  Wisconsin's law banning the sale of contraceptives to unmarried persons has been struck down by a threejudge Federal panel.

title: AGNES de LIMA
description: Agnes de Lima, a writer on education, died yesterday at Woodcliff Lake Manor, Woodcliff Lake, N. J, She was 87 years old.

title: Ethiopia Is Said to Move Army Units Into Eritrea
Gallagher's Return From Prison Is Festive
House Unit Approves Bill On StateRun Lotteries
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (UPI) The House Judiciary Committee approved today a bill to exempt stateoperated lotteries from Federal antigambling laws.

title: Cold Snap Stirs Run on Ski Apparel
MOSCOW REPLACES ARMENIAN LEADER
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 27  The Communist party leader in the Armenian republic, where a series of nationalist trials has been staged lately, has been removed from his post.

title: Two Salvation Army Aides Robbed of Donations in Tulsa
description: TULSA, Okla., Nov. 27 (UPI) Two young Salvation Army kettle attendants were robbed, and one was beaten, in separate thefts yesterday.

title: A Negative Growth Rate for Japan in 1974
description: TOKYO, Nov. 27A senior Japanese economic official said this week that Japan's economic activity would decline by 1 to 2 per cent, the poorest performance in more than two decades, and that accurate forecasts for next year are impossible to make.

title: TOWER APPROVED for LINCOLN SQ.
description: While two dissenting members contended that the Planning Commission was approving a fiction, the commission approved yesterday by a vote of 4 to 2 plans for a controversial 30story mixeduse tower in the Lincoln Square Special District.

title: $8.3Million Savings Due
GISCARD IS TARGET OF NEWSMEN'S IRE
description: PARIS, Nov. 27The strains between the Government of President Valry Giscard d'Estaing and the news media grew today when Premier Jacques Chirac said he had ordered the police to oust striking newsmen from the national radiotelevision system's headquarters.

title: Rodino Voices Hope Hearings on Rockfeller Will End Next Week
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27Representative Peter W. Rodino Jr., chairman of the House judiciary Committee, said today he hoped that the committee's hearings on Nelson A. Rockefeller's nomination to be Vice President would be completed by the end of next week and than the nomination would come to a vote in the House the week of Dec. 16.

title: French Assembly Votes Today on Bill to Allow Abortion
N.A.A.C.P TO PRESS SCHOOLS IN NORTH
description: TOPEKA, Kan., Nov. 27The National Association for the Advancement of Colored People vowed at a conference that ended here yesterday to concentrate on Northern school segregation, with a goal of complete desegregation in five years.

title: Ship Sinks Off Okinawa
description: TOKYO, Nov. 27 (UPI)Four of the 24 crewmen were reported missing when a Panamanian freighter sank off Okinawa today. The other crewmen, all Chinese from Taiwan, were rescued by a Japanese patrol ship, the Maritime Safety Agency reported. The vessei, the 3,002ton Green Hill, was on the way from the Philippines to Japan with a cargo of lumber.

title: Sports Today
description: Tape of St. John's vs. St. Mary's (Nova Scotia) game. (TelevisionChannel 67, 9 P.M.

title: SUGAR FUTURES CLOSE OFF LIMIT
description: Unsuccessful in attempts during the morning to recover from the past four sessions of losses, sugar futures prices closed down the permissible limit of 2 cents a pound again yesterday on the Coffee and Sugar Exchange here. Allocation orders totaling 239 sell orders were unfilled at the close.

title: Bridge:
STATE DRUG LAWS RULED NOT CRUEL
description: ALBANY, Nov. 27The Appellate Division upheld today the stringent drug Jaw pushed through the Legislature in 1973 by Gov. Nelson A. Rockefeller. The court said the law did not violate the cruel and unusual punishment provisions of the Eighth Amentment to the Federal Constitution.

title: Jobless Insurance Roster Shows a Rise in 46 States
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (UPI) The Labor Department said today that unemployment insurance rolls lengthened in 46, states in the first week in November.

title: PACT BY TWO PAPERS APPROVED BY SAXBE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (AP) Attorney General William B. Saxbe has approved the first joint operating agreement between separately owned newspapers permitted under the fouryearold Newspaper Preservation Act, the Justice Department said yesterday.

title: Landlord Gets Life In Arson Fatal to 4
description: PATERSON, Nov. 27Joseph Satkin, the Passaic landlord convicted in September of killing a woman and three children in a fire last year at three of his buildings, was sentenced today to life in prison by Judge Edward F. Johnson in Superior Court.

title: KUH AND ROBERTS IN A COURT CLASH
Presidential Vote in Ireland Is Likely in MidDecember
description: DUBLIN, Nov. 27 (Reuters)An election for the presidency of the Irish Republic seemed likely tonight after former Prime Minister John Lynch announced that he would not seek the office, left vacant by the death of Erskine Childers 10 days ago.

title: AUSTERITY ON OIL IS URGED BY BURNS TO SPUR PRICE CUT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 Arthur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, warned Congress today of a permanent decline of our nation's economic and political power unless world oil prices could be forced down, mainly through a major new oil conservation effort of austerity proportions in the United States.

title: Steinbrenner Suspended for 2 Years
LOTTERY NUMBERS Nov. 27, 1974
description: Tickets matching only the last number become eligible for the Millionaire semifinal drawing.

title: BID TO CURB HUNTS BARRED BY COURT
description: Federal Judge William M. Taylor Jr. denied yesterday a motion for an injunction to keep Nelson Bunker Hunt and his brother W. Herbert Hunt from buying an additional 910,000 common shares of the Great Western United Corporation that would give them effective control of the company. The suit was, originally filed in the United States District Court here.

title: Nets Win By 109100 Erving: 32
description: UNIONDALE, L.I. Nov. 27 Julius Erving put on one of his normal, fantastic performances, scoring a game high of 32 points in the New York Nets 109.100 victory over the Virginia Squires in the Nassau Coliseum tonight.

title: MOTHER IS ACCUSED OF KIDNAPPING GIRL
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 27 (AP) A Collingswood, N.J., woman who last week lost custody of her 6yearold daughter to foster parents has been charged with kidnaping the girl from a Philadelphia schoolyard.

title: CAMBODIAKEEPS HER SEAT IN U.N. BY 2VOTE MARGIN
description: UNITED NATIONS, Nov. 27 The General Assembly decided tonight that the Cambodian Government of President Lon Nol should keep its seat in the United Nations.

title: Vladivostok Agreement May Stir a Fight in congress Kissinger Briefings Due
2 Slayers Decline Chance to Choose Means of Execution
Tunnel Diggers Questioned on Costs
description: A monthslong controversy over huge cost overruns on the first stage of the city's Third Water Tunnel was discussed publicly for the first time yesterday, and all sides acknowledged that the project, originally budgeted at $223million, would cost $350million to $500million.

title: Valenti Picked for Public TV
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (UPI)President Ford nominated Jack J. Valenti, president of the Motion Picture Association of America, to be a difector of the Corporation for Public Broadcasting. Mr. Valenti, who Served as special assistant to President Johnson, would succeed Irving Kritol, whose term expires March 26, 1976.

title: Theodore V. Bihler, 65, Of Journal of Commerce
description: Theodore V. Bihler, retired business manager of the Journal of Commerce, died Tuesday at Carefree, Ariz. He was 65 years old.

title: People in Sports
description: Ferguson Jenkins, who went to Texas, and Jim Wynn, who left the state, were voted by their peers as baseball's comeback players of the year.

title: 3 THUGS GET $20,000 FROM GIMBELS EAST
description: Three armed men wearing stocking masks overpowered two security guards and a cashier at the Gimbels East department store last night and escaped with $20,000 from the day's sales receipts.

title: Senators Want Study Of Sugar Price Rises
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27. (UPI)  More than a third of the Senate today called on three Government agencies to investigate the sharp rise in the price of Sugar.

title: Rabbi to Help Ease Catholic Five's Trip
description: Why is a group of Catholic school basketball players going to spend Christmas in Israel? Partly to play basketball; mostly to learn. Bishop Fordof Brooklyn will leave for Israel Dec. 23 with three other high school teams and will play Israeli natinal teams before returning Jan. 1. To prepare for the trip, Ford is bringing parents and athletes together with a Brooklyn rabbi next Monday to discuss Israeli customs and the people.

title: Payroll Savings Gains
description: John D. deButts, chairman of the United States Industrial Payroll Savings Committee, has announced that the 1974 campaign has exceed its goal of 2.4 million new or increased savers. Mr. deButts, chairman of American Telephone & Telegraph Company, reported that available figures show that 2,438,171 United States industrial workers enrolled this year in the payroll savings plan as new savers or by increasing their savings allotments. This is 101.6 per cent of the goal.

title: 2 Slayers Decline Chance to Choose Means of Execution
description: OGDEN, Utah, Nov. 27 (UPI) Two young airmen convicted of murder refused today to select the manner of their executionguns or the ropeand were sentenced by a judge to be shot at sunrise, Jan. 21.

title: Mexico's Break With Chile A Natural Death, Aide Says
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 27 (AP) Foreign Minister Emilio O. Rabasa said today that Mexico's decision to sever diplomatic ties with the Chilean military Government, announced suddenly last night, had been made because relations between the two countries had died a natural death since the overthrow last year of President Salvador Allende Gossens.

title: Baltimore Engineer Faces Charge on Federal Tax
Sports News Briefs
Dividend Is Omitted
description: The McCrory Corporation omitted its regular dividend of 30 cents a share for its fourth quarter, it was reported yesterday after the board's action late Tuesday.

title: Holiday Closings
description: All United States securities and commodities markets will be closed today, Thanksgiving Day. Banks in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut and all Government offices will also be closed.

title: Sales Down Sharply
description: The Bohack Corporation, the New York supermarket chain now operating under the Chapter XI provisions of the Federal Bankruptcy Act, yesterday reported a sharply higher loss of $45million in the 26 weeks ended July 29, against a loss of $711,000 in the same 1973 period. Sales in the 26 weeks declined to $157.7million from $164.7million.

title: Life Deteriorates as Cambodian Capital Struggles On and On to Cope With Warfare
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia Nov. 27The fabric of life in Cambodia continues to unravel. With each passing month of brutal civil war, living conditions deteriorate and the gentle code of Khmer society shows a few more cracks.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: A trio of Newark police detectives learned a great deal about rules and regulations when they were members of the Barringer High football team in Newark about 25 years ago.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given ln. Eastern Standard Time

title: Delay in Peruvian Copper Project Underlines Pragmatic Limits of Revolution
State Investigators Widen SchoolBoard Inquiry
description: The State Commission of Investigation is checking into whether any political influence was exercised in behalf of a payroll processing company that it has accused of illegally giving money gifts and the services of call girls to Board of Education employes.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Phone Expert Settles TrickandTreat Debt
100 Hurt as Punjab Police Clash With 6,000 Students
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 27 (Reuters)About 100 policemen, a magistrate and seven students were injured today in India's northern state of Punjab when the Police clashed with 6,000 student demonstrators, the Press Trust of India news agency reported.

title: Flyers Beat Wings On 3 Leach Goals
Briefs On The Arts
description: Terrence McNally and Miguel Pinero, the playwrights, have been selected by the Dramatists Guild to share the 197374 Elizabeth HullKate Warriner award. The cash prize of $7,000 will be divided equally between them for their plays, Short Eyes by Mr. Pinero, and Bad Habits by Mr. McNally. The award, is given to a playwright whose work deals with a controversial subject involving the fields of political, religious or social mores of the time.

title: Breitel Gets Lawyer Medal For Distinguished Service
description: Chief Judge Charles D. Brei tel of the state Court of Ap peals received yesterday the Emory Buckner Medal for distinguished public service from the Federal Bar Council, a grout of lawyers who practice in the Federal courts. The late Mr. Buckner was United States Attorney here from 1925 to 1927

title: Good News at Fairfield
description: FAIRFIELD, Conn., Nov. 27 (UPI)A Fairfield University junior guard, Danny Odums, was declared eligible for the basketball season today by the Eastern College Athletic Conference. Odums transferred this year from Austin Peay in Clarksville, Tenn after that school was penalized.

title: Barnard Is Eager to Try 2dHeart Surgery Again
description: Dr. Christiaan N. Barnard said yesterday that he was so encouraged by the early results shown by the patient in whom he implanted a second heart that, despite criticism from some surgeons, he was eager to do the same operation on a waiting patient today, tomorrow or as soon as a suitable donor was found.

title: 32 Debutantes Are Presented at Junior League Ball
description: The Junior League of the City of New York honored 32 debutante provisional members at its annual ball in the Plaza's Grand Ballroom last night. The yonng women were presented to Mrs. Christopher H. Clutz president of the league. Mrs. Thomas H. Barton wits chairman for the event, which benefits the league's Community, Services Trust Fund.

title: 2 Law Students Lose Plea On a Moot Court Contest
SECURITIES BILL MAY BE REVOTED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27The House Rules Committee was summoned today to meet next Tuesday to reconsider its 8to6 vote yesterday refusing to send to the floor of the House the omnibus securities industry reform bill.

title: Slayer Seeks Damages
MICHAEL C. LIANA
Green Hornet, From Bruce Lee Series
description: The Green Hornet, which opened yesterday at the New Amsterdam and other theaters, is three installments of the midsixties TV series stitched together and prefaced with footage from the late Bruce Lee's screen test.

title: LOTTERY NUMBERS
Good Evening and Mack To End Runs on Broadway
description: Two musicals will end their Broadway runs on Saturday, Good evening, after 438 performances at the LuntFontanne Theater, and Mack & Mabel, after 65 performances at the Majestic Theater.

title: Navy Coach Has Problem Selecting a Quarterback
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Nov. 27 Navy is going to play Army in football for the 75th time Saturday, which is enough to send chills of excitement through all hands on board the Naval Academy base or to make an old swabby skip a heartbeat even if the rest of the world does not care very much this year. But George Welsh, Navy's imperturable coach, faced one of football's more serious prob lems with his usual approach a ho hum and a quiet explanation.

title: NBC Switches a Film After Children's Shwa
Television
3,300 IN LAYOFFS AT CELANESE UNIT
Nevada Backs Speed Limit
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Nov. 27 (Reuters)  Nevada's Attorney General, Robert List, ruled today that the nationwide speed limit of 55 miles an hour was legal in the state. His ruling followed the refusal of a Las Vegas justice of the peace to fine a driver for exceeding the limit, which was imposed because of the energy crisis.

title: Edward Silver, ExProsecutor, Dies
description: Edward S. Silver, a member of the State Commission of Investigation and a former Brooklyn District Attorney, died yesterday at Mahnonides Hospital, Brooklyn. He was 76 years old and lived at 222 East 17th Street in Brooklyn.

title: Fiscal Hemorrhage
description: In calling for massive monetary blood transfusions from the state and Federal Governments to restore the city's fiscal health, Senator Roy M. Goodman of Manhattan, a member of the Senate's Republican majority, urges the state move promptly to take over programs in higher education, welfare, corrections and courts which now place a heavy drain on New York City's resources. He believes that Albany might even be persuaded to vote the higher taxes necessary to meet the challengebut only if the city first demonstrates its willingness to make every possible effort to help itself.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Shafiq alHout, who heads the Palestine Liberation Organization's office in Beirut, announced yesterday that the organization had arrested 26 persons in Lebanon and other Arab countries on suspicion of involvement in the hijacking of a British airliner to Tunis last weekend. He said at a news conference that they would be tried in open court and that such incidents harmed the Palestine cause. [Page 1, Columns 12.]

title: G.O.P. Loses Senate Seat by 10 Votes
description: CONCORD, N. H., Nov. 27A recount of votes cast on Nov. 5 in the United States Senate race in New Hampshire showed today that the Democrat, John A. Durkin, bad won by 10 votes over the Republican, Representative Louis C. Wyman.

title: KISSINGER CONTINUES TALKS WITH CHINESE
description: PEKING, Nov. 27 (Reuters)Secretary of State Kissinger today resumed talks with Chinese leaders. Spokesmen said the fivehour discussion was held in a very good atmosphere.

title: Lord Lichfield to Wed Duke's Daughter
description: LONDON, Nov. 27 The engagement of Lady Leonora Grosvenor, elder daughter of the Duke and Duchess of Westminster, to the fifth Earl of Lichfield, also known as the photographer Patrick Lichfield, was announced today.

title: VENEZUELA SETS TAKEOVER ON ORE
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Nov. 27The Venezuelan Govern ment announced late yesterday that Americanowned iron ore companies operating here would be nationalized on Jan. 1.

title: Excerpts From Ruling
description: Following are excerpts from the ruling yesterday by Baseball Commissioner Bowie Kuhn suspending George M. Steinbrenner 3d, principal owner of the New York Yankees, from taking part in the team's affairs for two years:

title: SHOWERS LIKELY for PARADE TODAY
description: Snoopy, Mickey Mouse and Scores of thousands of children and their parents might think about wearing their raincoats this morning, because it just might rain on their parade.

title: DEVELOPER FACES BUYERS' LAWSUIT
description: CLIFFSIDE PARK, Nov. 27The owners of 614 of the 632 luxury apartments in the yearold Winston Tower 200 condominium on the Palisades in Bergen County overlooking the Hudson River here last night voted to assess themselves in excess of $5,000 to finance a lawsuit against the builders and sellers of the highrise apartment units.

title: Frank Martin Zeroes In on Trainer Record Today
description: Through a day of early frustration with highly, regarded horses, Frank Martin saddled a Winner at Aqueduct yesterday with what he considered the least likely to succeed. After seeing such wellplayed charges of his such as Princess M. L., Rube the Great and Accipiter failing to win, Martin watched Syrian Star take the last race on the card.

title: Du Pont Increases Sodium Perborate By 2 Cents a Pound
description: Prices of sodium perborate tetrahydrate were raised two cents a pound yesterday by E. I. du Pont de Nemours. The chemical, which is used in home and industrial bleaches, plastic dishware cleaners and dentifrices, will now cost 18 cents a pound in bulk and 20 cents a pound in bags, f.o.b. du Pont's Woodstock, Tenn., plant.

title: MINERS PRESSED TO VOTE FOR PACT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27Arnold R. Miller, the president of the United Mine Workers of America, flew home to the West Virginia coal fields today to join in the union leadership's campaign for a favorable membership vote on a tentative contract with the coal industry.

title: New Jersey Briefs
HALT IS INDICATED IN DROP OF PRIME
description: A variety of money market rates worked higher yesterday, raising the possibility, that the twomonth decline in prime lending rates may grind to a temporary halt. The test will come at 10 A.M. tomorrow when the First National City Bank regularly announces any change in its interest charge to topquality corporate clients.

title: Panel Votes Limit In Funds for Home Of the President
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (AP) A bill limiting the Secret Service to providing fulltime security at only one private residence of a President or Vice President was approved on a voice vote today by the House Judiciary Committee.

title: ISSUE AND DEBATE
Parley Scores the Denial of Jobs to Persons Who Have Had Cancer Treatment
description: Last April Mrs. Joyce Arkhurst had breast cancer surgery. The news from her doctor was extremely hopeful. Her tumor, a tiny, very early cancer detectable only by Xray, was among the most curable, and no further treatment was deemed necessary.

title: EARL M. SMITH
description: Earl M. Smith, who retired in 1970 as president of the New Canaan (Conn.) Fuel and Lumber Company, died Saturday in St. Thomas, The Virgin Islands, where he had been on vacation. He was 71 years old and lived on Frogtown Road in New Canaan.

title: McQuay's Right Knee Bruised More Than 2 Giants' Feelings
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N. Y., Nov. 27Fists flew again at a New York Giants' practice, but the chief concern today was a bruised right knee that may sideline Leon McQuay for Sunday's game against the Bears in Chicago.

title: Newcombe, Miss Evert Gain Finals
description: OSAKA, Japan, Nov. 27 (AP)John Newcombe and Chris Evert won semifinal matches today in a $100,000 professional tennis tournament.

title: Postman's Attic Yields 1,200 Sacks of Mail
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 27 (UPI)More than 12 tons of undelivered mail, some dating to 1967 and most of it advertising material, have been found in a postman's attic.

title: Wilson's Efficiency Panel Having Met Once, Resigns
description: ALBANY, Nov. 27, (AP),The Little Hoover Commission which had been appointed by Governor Wilson to make an efficiency study of state government, resigned today without making any recommendations.

title: Dance: Taras's Scenes at City Ballet
description: There are now only six more shopping performances before The Nutcracker. In other words the New York City. Ballet is coming to the end of its third week of repertory before the Christmas spate of 40 performances of The Nutcracker. On Tuesday night John Taras's Soenes de Ballet reentered the repertory, and Violette Verdy and the company's new Danish principal, Peter Schaufuss, made their debuts in George Balanchine's Raymonda Variationa.

title: Schools Offer Trims
description: James F. Regan, president of the Board of Education, said yesterday that the board was willing to trim $45million from its $1billion budget as its share of Mayor Beame's efforts to reduce the city's huge budget deficit.

title: COMMONS RECEIVES BILL TO CURB TERROR
description: LONDON, Nov, 27Legislation to ban the Irish Republican Army and curb the spread of terrorism from Northern Ireland to Britain began its passage through Parliament today.

title: British Living Longer; Drinking, Divorces Up
ExCongressman Hailed on Jail Release
description: BAYONNE  Passersby would have thought there was a wedding reception or anniversary celebration at the Gallagher's last weekend, but the party was just a gathering of neighbors welcoming their former Representative home from prison.

title: Chestnut Tree Too fruitful
description: LUTON England (Canadian Press)Municipal officials here are trying to stop an extrafertile tree froth producing so many chestnuts. Neighbors complain that children, stoning the tree to bring down the nuts handy for playground jousts cause damage to surrounding property.

title: Pioneer 11 Enters Area of Magnetism On Jupiter Flight
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif., Nov. 27 (UPI)  Pioneer 11 plunged into and out of Jupiter's magnetic field today.

title: Chess:
Report on Inflation Impact Ordered by Ford for Plans
Another Possibility: Traditional Donations to Overseas Relief Organizations
HARRY LOURIE, AIDE IN ALCOHOL CONTROL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27Harry L. Lourie, a leader in the enforcement of the Food and Drug Act and former longtime executive with the Beverage Importers Association, died yesterday in Chevy Chase, Md. He was 87 years old.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Shafiq alHout, who heads the Palestine Liberation Organization's office in Beirut, announced yesterday that the organization had arrested 26 persons in Lebanon and other Arab countries on suspicion of involvement in the hijacking of a British airliner to Tunis last weekend. He said at a news conference that they would be tried in open court and that such incidents harmed the Palestine cause. [Page 1, Columns 12.]

title: MANTON B. METCALF JR.
description: Manton B. Metcalf Jr., senior partner of Metcalf Bros. & Co., a woolen and worsted concern, died Tuesday. He was 81 years old and lived here and in Rumson, N. J.

title: A. & P. Plans a Freeze On Prices of Its Items
NIGERIA DEBATES EDUCATION PLAN
Personal Finance: CreditCard Costs
City's West Side Highway Plan Criticized by Community Boards
Steirnbrenner Suspended for 2 Years
description: George M. Steinbrenner 3d, principal owner of the New York Yankees, was suspended for two years yesterday by Baseball Commissioner Bowie Kuhn because of his Federal conviction for illegal contributions to political campaigns.

title: Firemen Express Concern for Safety
description: The people are the ones that are going to be losing, said Fireman Richard Driscoll of Engine Company 912, yesterday, as he leaned against a fire truck in the East Harlem station his company shares with Engine 911. The city, he added is playing with their lives.

title: Here's Good News for Thanksgiving Rice Price is Down
description: New Yorkers for whom rice is a dietary staple got some relief last week from high costs when the price dropped 3 cents a pound, the New York City Consumer Affairs Department announced yesterday.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: SWEET SOUNDS On such a day as thisin fact, any evening from 7 to 11thanks are in order for the Music Room (8662018), a charmingly informal and tuneful restaurant at 2871 Broadway (just south of 111th Street). Every night, young professional musicians take over, near the center piano of this pleasantly appointed place, with candlelit tables and red tablecloths, a beautiful, oldfashioned bar at one side (a good whisky sour at $1.50) and an effortless, unspoken dedication to classical music.

title: Cleveland Paper Talks Off
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 27 (UPI) No resumption of contract negotiations was expected this week in the fourweek Newspaper Guild strike against The Cleveland Plain Dealer and the subsequent cessation of publication by The Cleveland Press. Jack Weir, executive secretary of the guild, said today that he expected the Thanksgiving holiday to rule out talks for the rest of the week.

title: Woman Married to ExLawyer Who Hired Thugs to Blind Her
description: Thirteen years ago Burton N. Pugach was convicted of hiring three thugs to blind his girlfriend, Linda Riss, so that no one else will want you.

title: CHARLES WALKER, EXYALE OFFICIAL
description: Charles Rumford Walker, a retired Yale University official, died Tuesday at his home in Wellfleet, Mass. He was 81 years old.

title: Ford Recalls 36,000 Cars
description: DEARBORN, Mich., Nov. 27 (Reuters)  The Ford Motor Company said today it was recalling 36,000 new Granada and Monarch automobiles because of a possible steering defect. Ford said 1.2 per cent of the vehicles could have been manufactured from steel below acceptable fitness.

title: Newcombe, Miss Evert Gain Finals
description: OSAKA, Japan, Nov. 27 (AP)John Newcombe and Chris Evert won semifinal matches today in a $100,000 professional tennis tournament.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 35

title: Saigon Blocks Catholic March; Protesters Fight With Police
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam Thursday, Nov. 28Hundreds of riot policemen smothered attempts by antiGovernment Roman Catholic demonstrators to march from outlying parishes to downtown Saigon early today.

title: Crucial Vote in Coal
description: Obstructionist elements in the United Mine Workers leadership have finally stopped blocking the contract negotiated by the union's top officers to end the coal strikea strike that threatpns to idle hundreds of thousands of workers in coaldependent industries and to drag the whole economy much deeper into recession.

title: HANOI WILL SEEK U.S. REPARATIONS
description: PARIS, Nov. 27Le Duc Tho, who was North Vietnam's chief negotiator in the Vietnam peace talks, said here today that his Government would press successive American Presidents for the debt due for U.S.inflicted war wounds.

title: AUSTERITY ON OIL IS URGED BY BURNS TO SPUR PRICE CUT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 Arthur F. Barns, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, warned Congress today of a permanent decline of our nation's economic and political power unless world oil prices could be forced down, mainly through a major new oil conservation effort of austerity proportions in the United States.

title: Business Records
description: Petition tiled by; LEATRICE FLEISCHER, 480 Riverdale Ave., Yonkers, N.Y. Liabilities $8,564; assets $361. MICHAEL FLEISCHER 480 Riverdale Ave., Yonkers, N.Y. Liabilities $11,001; assets $191. RALPH J. DE MICCO, 1871 While Plains Road, Bronx, N.Y. Liabilities $10,619; assets $150. JOHN HUGHES, 569 W. 185th St., N.Y. Liabilities $7,700; assets $500.

title: POOR MAIN TARGET OF VIOLENT CRIME
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27Poor people, both white and black, are more likely to be the victims of violent attack than those with more money, according to a Federal survey.

title: N.F.L. Draws Up Playoff Plans
description: Commissioner Pete Rozelle announced yesterday that the National Football League's divisional playoffs would begin at the home of the National Conference Central Division champion on Dec. 21. Minnesota, Green Bay or Detroit will be host to the N.F.C. Eastern champion (St. Louis or Washington) in that opener. The second game in the divisional playoffs will start three hours later, with Oakland playing host to the American Conference East champion (Miami, Buffalo or New England) or the wildcard team if the wildcard representative is from the Central Division.

title: Lobster Tails to Be Sold
description: BOSTON, Nov. 27 (AP) Some 330,000 pounds of foreign lobster tails will be auctioned Tuesday after sitting frozen for two years in a Boston warehouse. The tails were seized by the Customs Service when agents contended that they had been caught off the Bahamas and South America, not the coast of Spain, as the shippers stated in their customs declaration.

title: Cards' McBride Named N.L.'s Rookie of Year
description: Bake McBride, the wingfooted center fielder of the St. Louis Cardinals, was named yesterday as the National League rookie of the year by the Baseball Writers Association of America.

title: Watergate Aftermath
description: WASHINGTONWhatever our difficulties, and they are many, Americans have one overwhelming reason to be thankful this year: Richard Nixon is out of the White House. The new tapes played at the Watergate coverup trial have added chilling depths to the knowledge of what we escaped. It was not just deception and abuse of power but conscious criminality. It was that rarity in high office, genuine evil.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Patrolmen's Benevolent Association asked yesterday for an impasse panel to make binding recommendations on their contract dispute with the city. The, dispute centers on P.B.A. efforts to end the parity system that links the pay of firemen and sanitationmen to that of the policemen. John Burnell, the city Labor Relations Director, said that the city was not ready to accept an impasse panel until it felt that it could agree on the issues to be resolved.

title: Excerpts From Ruling
description: Following are excerpts from the ruling yesterday by Baseball Commissioner Bowie Kuhn suspending George M. Steinbrenner 3d, principal owner of the New York Yankees, from taking part in the team's affairs for two years:

title: Ford to Lay Off an Additional 25,200
description: DETROIT, Nov. 27The Ford Motor Company today announced layoffs for 25,200 more workers next week because of the sale slump. At the same time the Chrysler Corporation, as previously announced, closed three more of its car assembly plants until Jan. 6.

title: Americans Down Hawaiians 2219
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Nov. 27 (AP)Al Jenkins's daring catch of a punt and Joe Profit's running sparked Birmingham to a 2219 World Football League victory over Hawaii tonight, putting the winners in the first World Bowl.

title: Paralyzed Agent Given Home in Jersey
description: MONTCLAIR, Nov. 27 A Federal drug  enforcement agent who was paralyzed from the armpits down in a shootout during an abortive drug purchase in New York City two years ago received title to a custombuilt home near here today.

title: Blessings Countdown
3 Obscenity Convictions Upheld by Illinois Court
P.L.O. Reports Detaining 26 for a Trail in Hijacking
JEANNETTE FIELDS
description: Jeannette Fields, who, with Jack Fields her late husband, operated resorts in Ferndale, N. Y., and Lakewood, N. J., died yesterday in Los Angeles. She was 84 years old.

title: Peking Opens New Air Link
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 27 (Reuters)A new Chinese air route to the Middle East and Eastern Europe was inaugurated in Peking today. Two Government delegations left on the inaugural flight to Teheran, Tirana, the capital of Albania, and Bucharest, the Rumanian capital.

title: G.O.P. SENAT LOST BY 10 VOTES IN NEW HAMPSHIRE
McQuay's Right Knee Bruised More Than 2 Giants Feelings
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N. Y., Nov. 27Fists flew again at a New York Giants' practice, but the chief concern today was a bruised right knee that may sideline Leon McQuay for Sunday's game against the Bears in Chicago.

title: Jersey College Teachers End Strike, Agree to Talks
Snoopy and Snail Fly High at Parade Here
description: Bullwinkle dragged his feet and the caterpillar wriggled too long in Times Square but no one seemed to notice as Macy's 48th annual Thanksgiving Day parade made its traditional and colorful way from the Museum of Natural History to Herald Square yesterday.

title: Adm. Joseph Farley, 85, ExHead of coast guard
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (AP) Adm. Joseph F. Farley, Commandant of the Coast Guard from 1946 to 1950, died Monday of cancer. He was 85 years old.

title: Austerity at Rutgers Is Called Harmful to Education
description: NEW BRUNSWICKBattling so close the biggest budget gap in its historya projected deficit of $7.2millionRutgers University has put into effect an austerity program that both faculty and administration officals say is seriously hurting the quality of education at the state unviersity of New Jersey.

title: Common Market Budget Set
description: Brussels, Nov. 28 (UPI)European Common Market ministers approved a budget of $6.98billion for 1975 today, cutting out provisions for increating food, aid to developing countries.

title: 287 VOTES UNSEAT ALASKA'S GOVERNOR
description: JUNEAU, Alaska, Nov. 28 (UPI)Jay Hammond, the Republican challenger, has unseated Gov. William Egan by 287 votes, a recount of ballots cast in the Nov. 5 general election showed today.

title: Jesuits Head Sees a Need for Reexamination of Goals
description: ROME, Nov. 28The Rev. Pedro Arrupe, superior general of the Society of Jesus, said today that his order needed to undergo a profound, objective, open examination of its situation.

title: Aims of 20Nation Bloc In Sugar Set in Mexico
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 28 (UPI)Led by Mexico, 20 Latin American nations, including Cuba, have agreed on establishing a cartel to set the price of sugar on the world market, according to Francisco Cano Escalante, executive secretary of Mexico's Sugar Industry Commission.

title: BRAZILIANS FEAR BACKLASH TO VOTE
Metropolitan Briefs
description: A Troy, N. Y., man jailed on murder charges in the death last Feb. 2 of his 8monthold son was freed after his wife admitted to the police that she had falsely accused him of placing the infant in a bathtub of scalding water. The accused man, 26yearold Menir Abdelshahid, maintained that the boy had slipped beneath the water when he was left unattended briefly.

title: Adelphi Gains Final In Soccer
description: T. LOUIS, Nov. 28Ron Atanasio scored after 10 seconds of play today as Adelphi University advanced to the National Collegiate Division II soccer final with a 30 victory over Federal City College of Washington.

title: HIGHER BILLS SEEN for AUTO POLICIES
Pinball Machines Compete With Books for Attention of Group at City College
PrimatetoCat Gene Shift Laid to Virus of Long Ago
Utility Loses Its Appeal On 60Cent Pension Cut
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Nov. 28 (UPI)A 63yearold woman on a pension has won a battle to prevent the East Bay Municipal Utilities District from cutting her check by 60 cents a month.

title: OPEC UNIT URGES NEW OIL PRICING
description: VIENNA, Nov. 28 (AP)An economic commission of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries recommended today a new oil pricing system that would tie the cost of petroleum to world inflation.

title: Jets, Giants Listed As Choices Sunday
description: In the National Football League some teams are tired, some are hurt, some are getting better, some worse and some going nowhere as the season comes down to the last three weekends. Unpredictability is the common theme as so many single plays can determine which teams qualify for the added riches of the playoffs and which will not. Unbelievably both New York teams, far from playoff contention, are favored this week, the Jets by 9 points over the San Diego Chargers at Shea Stadium and the Giants by 7 over the Bears in Chicago. Both games will be televised here, Channel 4 for the Jet game at 1 P.M. and Channel 2 for the Giants at 2 P.M. Here is a preview of all games with wonlost records in parentheses:

title: Red Smith
description: As an admitted felon, George M. Steinbrenner 3d remains the principal owner of the New York Yankees entitled to share in all profits, if any, and take bows from the royal box in Shea Stadium, if he has the crust. UnlessBowie Kuhn has the telephones bugged, there will be nothing to prevent him from consulting with Gabe Paul president of the club, every hour on the hour. Though he will not be welcome in the locker room, he can make a pep talk into a recording machine and have the record played in the clubhouse, as he did last September after promising to remain aloof from club affairs. Giving him a twoyear suspension that costs him nothing is like sending a naughty boy home from school for the Christmas holidays.

title: EXPANSION OF BUSING IN BOSTON PREDICTED
description: BOSTON, Nov. 28 (UPI)Boston's top educational planner has told school officials that mandatory busing under a final desegregation plan to be implemented next fall may be almost twice the extent as that ordered under a temporary Federg plan.

title: ExJapanese Soldier Unhappy After Years in Philippine Jungle
WALDHEIM FEARS MIDEAST IMPASSE WILL LEAD TO WAR
description: CAIRO, Nov. 28Secretary General Waldheim is convinced that a new ArabIsraeli war may well break out by next spring or early summer unless a breakthrough in Middle East negotiations is achieved.

title: Italians Buy Bantam
description: Bantam Books, a major American paperback publishing house, has been sold for $70million to an Italian holding company that also has a major interest in the Fiat automobile company. Page 50.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Police in Piscataway arrested two suspects in the Wednesdaynight shooting and attempted robbery of a Green Brook man. They gave this account:

title: G.M. No Big Price Rises Near
U.M.W. Speeds Propoled Pact To Locals for a Prompt Decision
description: CHARLESTOWN, W. Va., Nov. 28 (UPI)Idle coal miners began receiving copies today of a proposed new contract that is expected to end the nationwide strike by the 120,000member United Mine Workers union.

title: Penn St. Wallops Pitt, 3110
WALDHEIM FEARS MIDEAST IMPASSE WILL LEAD TO WAR
description: CAIRO, Nov. 28Secretary General Waldheim is convinced that a new ArabIsraeli war may well break out by next spring or early summer unless a breakthrough in Middle East negotiations is achieved.

title: Letters to Soviet Editor: Safety Valve, Sounding Board
PAINFUL CUTBACKS FORCED ON CITIES BY U.S. ECONOMY
Recital
description: Michael Lorimer, one of the guitar's bright young evangelists, returned to Alice Tully Hall on Wednesday night in furtherance of his mission. At the age of 29, the lanky Californian has reached an impressive stand ard of musicianship and technical command. But, as his recital suggested, he has arrived at a rather dangerous level in his career.

title: Strike Called Off in Texas
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 28 (AP)Ground employes of Texas International Airlines called off a strike that had been set for tonight at midnight.

title: Fire Damages Tire Plant
description: MERIDEN, Conn., Nov. 28 (AP)Fire heavily damaged the Silver City Tire Company's retreading plant here today, causing an estimated $200,000 in damage, according to William Malerba, the owner. More than 30,000 pounds of rubber and all the retreading machinery was destroyed by the fire.

title: Owner of Lions To Keep Forzano
description: DETROIT, Nov. 28 (AP)William Clay Ford, owner of the Detroit Lions, ended speculation today by announcing that Coach Rick Forzano would be retained for the 1975 season.

title: FELIX A. BONAMI
description: Felix A. Bonami, a retired electrical engineer, died yesterday at Phelps Memorial Hospital, North Tarrytown, N.Y. He was 85 years old and lived at 131 Deer Track Lane, Irvington, N.Y.

title: KISSINGER GIVES PLEDGE IN PEKING
description: PEKING, Nov. 28Secretary of State Kissinger told his Chinese hosts tonight that he had achieved a better understanding of their viewpoint on his visit here and would take it seriously into account in conducting our foreign policy.

title: Siamese Twins Leave Hospital in Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHlA, Nov. 28 (AP)Two girls from the Dominican Republic, born joined at the pelvis, were discharged from Children's Hospital today.

title: Mrs. Rockefeller Leaves Hospital in High Spirits
description: Margaretta Rockefeller left the hospital yesterday, three days after undergoing surgery for the removal of her right breast following the discovery of cancer.

title: GOING OUT Guide
Population Growth of U.S. Approaching the Zero Level
description: Population growth in the United States is now below 1 per cent a year and approaching zero, according to a United Nations report.

title: ROBERT L. GAUDINO
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass., Nov. 28 (AP)  Robert L. Gaudino, a professer of political science at Williams College since 1971, died today. He was 49 years old.

title: College, School Results BASKETBALL
description: Colleges

title: Italians Buy Bantam
description: Bantam Books, a major American paperback publishing house, has been sold for $70million to an Italian holding company that also has a major interest in the Fiat automobile company. Page 50.

title: Advertising
description: Four years ago in a speech to his fellow members of the American Association of Advertising Agencies, Norman B. Norman, chairman of Norman, Craig & Kummel, suggested that since the big management counseling concerns were increasingly nudging into the agencies' sphere of influence, perhaps they should join the association.

title: Head of Oceanic Agency Cited for Public Service
description: Dr. Robert M. White, the head of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, has been selected to receive the 1974 Rockefeller Public Service Award for the Development and Protection of Physical Resources.

title: Ancestor's Bones Sought
description: PLYMOUTH, Mass., Nov. 28, (AP)The site of the first Thanksgiving dinner was the scene of a peaceful protest today by a group of Wampanoag Indians demanding the return of an ancestor's bones from the Pilgrim Museum to a sacred burial ground. The bones of a 16yearold Wampanoag girl were dug up on Cape Cod in 1863.

title: Ford's Dealings With Congres: An Uncertain Course
Rockefeller Likely to Keep Top Role in State's G.O.P.
Ontario Energy Corp. Set
description: TORONTO, Nov. 28 (UPI)The Ontario Government introduced legislation today to set up an Ontario Energy Corporation with initial capital of $100million to ensure adequate supplies of oil, gas and other forms of energy for the province. Eventually private investors may be able to buy shares in the corporation, but the Government will remain the majority stockholder.

title: Stuart J. Stein Marries Ina P. Isenberg
Homebuilder Adapting To Trends in Rockland
description: CLARKSTOWN, N. Y.Forget Westchester, said James Iarrobino. Rockland County is where the market is.

title: Rumanian Communists Reelect Ceausescu as Chief for 5 Years
description: BUCHAREST, Nov. 28President Nicolae Ceausescu was reelected tonight to a new fiveyear term as Secretary General of the Rumanian Communist party, a post equivalent to absolute ruler.

title: College for Puerto Ricans Focuses on Job Training
description: To Wilma (Cookie) Quiles, a 23yearold high school dropout, Boricua means my second home as well as a place to study for her equivalency diploma and take college courses at the same time.

title: Eastern Report Omits Snow Depths
description: The Eastern ski season, off to an early start because sub  freezing temperatures have produced limited skiable terrain at areas with snowmaking machines, has started on an abbreviated note.

title: St. Clair to Screen Lawyers
description: BOSTON, Nov. 28 (AP) James D. St. Clair who served as special counsel to President Nixon, is one of 11 lawyers chosen by Massachusetts's Attorney Generalelect, Francis X. Bellotti, to screen candidates for the 116 legal jobs in the Attorney General's office.

title: Body of L.I. Student, 17, Is Found on Upstate Farm
description: RICHMONDVILLE, N. Y., Nov. 28 (AP)The body of a young woman found today near this Schoharie County community was identified this evening as that of a college student from Long Island who was last seen on Nov. 2.

title: Ceiling but No Floor
Cyclone Hits Bangladesh; Fate of Thousands in Doubt
Lethal Mistakes at Attica
description: Nelson Rockefeller has been unanimously approved for the VicePresidency by the Senate Rules Committee, and his nomination appears to be sailing easily through the House Judiciary Committee, Yet, Mr. Rockefeller admitted to the Senate committee that he made one major, error in the handling of the prison revolt at Attica in 1971. He admitted to the House committee that he made second major error during that revolt. Those two errors opened the way to the deaths of 39 men, including ten corrections officers and prison employes.

title: Sports News Briefs
PorkBelry Case Set

title: Libya, First to Lift Price, Cuts Output of Oil Sharply
description: Libya, the North African nation that in 1970 was the first petroleumexporting state to expose the vulnerability of oil companies and consuming countries to price and production pressure, is now producing only slightly more than 1 million barrels of oil a day compared with 3.7 million in 1970.

title: East Meadow Defeats Uniondale, 1815

Fire Routs Queens Families
description: A threealarm fire yesterday in a sevenstory luxury apartment complex in Forest Hills, queens, caused about 180 families to leave Thanksiving dinner to escape the flames authorities said, A Fire Department spokesman said four firemen were slightly injured in the blaze, at the Meadow Lake Apartments, 7261 113th Avenue.

Haile Selassie's Life
description: Is it conceivable that despite official denials the young officers who direct Ethiopia's revolution intend to add former Emperor Haile Selassie to some sixty victims already dispatched by firing squads? At 82, the dethroned Negus cannot pose a threat to the military regime. What will provoke civil strife and build a formidable longrun threat to the ruling Provisional Military Council is a continuation of the bloodbath.

title: Lafayette Serves 177 Loss to Utes
description: Frenchmen serving up lasagna to Utes on Thanksgiving? Well, almost.

title: FORD, IN A SHIFT, VIEWS RECESSION AS KEY PROBLEM
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 President Ford, in a shift of economic perspective with major policy implications, now believes the Widespread concern about a recession requires the same top priority he had previously reserved for the problem of inflation, ranking aides indicated today.

title: Miss Mills Bride Of john Freeman.
description: Suzanne Robin Mills, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward E. Mills of Landing, N.J., was married yesterday afternoon to John Blacker Freeman. The ceremony was performed at the home of the bridegroom's Parents, Dr. and Mrs. Iri M. Freeman, in Bound Brook, N.J. by Judge Robert E. Hendricks of the Municipal Court of Bound Brook.

title: Drinking Drivers Punished
description: BOSTON, Nov. 28, (AP)More than 6,000 Massachusetts drivers have lost their licenses this year for driving under the influence of liquor. This was nearly a fifth of all the license suspensions or revocations for the year.

title: Court Summons Strikers
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Nov. 28 (UPI)  Officials of the striking Amalgamated Transit Union must go to court Monday for ignoring a temporary restraining order to end the 15day walkout. The union unanimously rejected management's latest offer yesterday, sending the city's bus strike into the Thanksgiving weekend and making it the longest transit walkout in San Antonio history.

title: BEETHOVEN'S SIXTH IS LED BY LEINSDORF
description: There was an English composercritic who insisted that the evennumbered Beethoven symphonies were better than the more famous oddnumbered ones. This may have been a perversity occasioned by the fact that Nos. 2, 4, 6 and 8 are heard less often, even the lovely No. 6, or Pastoral Symphony.

description: Hours Given In Eastern Standard Time

title: FORD, IN A SHIFT, VIEWS RECESSION AS KEY PROBLEM

description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 28Arab diplomatic sources here said today that President Ford and Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet leader, worked out a formula at their meeting at Vladivostok last weekend to break a deadlock in Middle East negotiations.

title: Theater: Air Robbery
description: The San Francisco Mime Troupe, now at the Westside Theater on 43d Street as part of Chelsea's Westside World Serles, is offering in reportory its praised production of Bertolt Brecht's The Mother with a completely original work, The Great Air Robbery, which is written, directed and performed by the troupe itself. It was on view Wednesday night.

title: Militant Seoul Rally By Veterans Backs Park's Government
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 28 About 2,000 veterans staged a demonstration here today in support of the present Constitution, which has recently come under increasing criticism.

title: Soviet Joins Geneva Accord to Ease Emigration
description: GENEVA, Nov. 28The Soviet Union has joined in a tentative agreement to facilitate emigration to help reunite families separated by frontiers.

description: PARIS, Friday, Nov. 29The French National Assembly early this morning passed a bill legalizing abortion through the 10th week of pregnancy.

title: The School Scandals
description: New indications of irregularities in the fiscal management of the city's schools emerge almost daily. The most disturbing aspect of this composite of sloppiness and scandal is the absence of any determined corrective action. The plaint by Board of Education president James F. Regan that he faces each day apprehensive that a new bombshell may explode in the headlines is symptomatic of a bad situation with nobody clearly in charge.

title: Free Hand Wins at Aqueduct; Martin Sets Trainers' Record
description: The ownertrainer team of Sigmtind Sommer and Frank (Pancho) Martin contributed the chief item of entertainment at Aqueduct yesterday. Free hand, running under their sponsorship, won the $56,300 Qeens County Handicap in a surprising result.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (UPI)President and Mrs. Ford celebrated their first Thanksgiving in the White House with a reunion of the president's Grand Rapids high school football teammates.

title: A CAMBODIAN PLANE CRASHES IN VIETNAM
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 28 (AP)  propellerdriven cargo plane of the Cambodian airline Air Cambodge crashed today in territory controlled by the Vietcong about 60 miles north of Saigon, the control tower at Saigon's Tan Son Nhute Airport reported.

description: It is a pity that Gilbert Becaud does not make more New York appearances; his Carnegie Hall concert Wednesday was the French singercomposer's first in five years. Mr. Becaud is not locked into any particular style or formatas happens occasionally with European cabaret entertainersand he has been well served over the years in the translation of his songs. His compositions such as What Now, My Love and Let It Be Me are staples in the repertory of the socalled quality singers.

title: Japanese Sink a Ship, First Since the War
Fire Destroys Transmitter
description: ROCHESTER Nov. 28 (UPI) A fire destroyed the 50,000watt transmitter of radio station WHFM in Rochester and knocked it and its sister station, WMAH, off the air for several hours early today. A spokesman for the stations said that WHFM would not be able to resume broadcasting for an indefinite period. WHAM, which shares facilities at a transmitter in suburban Chili, resumed operations. The cause of the fire is under investigation.

title: Shot Officer Still Critical
description: EDISON, Nov. 28 (AP)Patrolman Thomas Kohut, who was shot in the head and leg while investigating a bank robbery Monday, remained in critical condition today. No one has been arrested his shooting, although three persons are in custody on related charges

description: MADRID, Nov. 20 (UPI)Spanish soldiers exchanged gunfire with rebels in Spanish West Africa yesterday, officials said today. They said a Spanish soldier and a Saharan guide were wounded in the brief clash near the Moroccan border Morocco has claimed the phosphaterich territory.

title: Chicago Mercantile Exchange Being Accused on Pork Bellies
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (AP) The Commodity Exchange Commission has accused the Chicago Mercantile Exchange and its officers of failing to act quickly to prevent an attempted cornering of the frozen park belly futures market four and a half years ago. The Agriculture Department disclosed today that the complaint now subject to a hearing, was filed Nov. 15 against the exchange and its officers, including Everette B. Harris, president.

title: Ireland Supports Britain's Moves to Curb Terror
description: LONDON, Nov. 28The Irish Government has expressed its shock over the growing Irish Republican Army bombing campaign in Britain. It supports new British measures aimed at combating terrorisni, and it has announced that it will take stiffer measures against the I.R.A. itself.

Irish Bomb Suspects Beaten
description: BIRMINGHAM, England, Nov. 28 (Reuters)Five of the six Irishmen accused of murder after last Thursday's bombings here in which 20 persons died have been beaten up by their fellow prisoners in a Birmingham's Winson Green Prison, according to unofficial reports. The reports followed the men's appearance in court with cut and briused faces. The Home Office refused to comment on the Injuries.

title: Steingut Faces Pressure for Reforms

Soviet Reports Big Gas Find
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 28 (UPI)Soviet geologists have discovered a new large gasbearing area in the south of the Karakumy, the country's biggest desert, the Tass Press Agency said today. Prospectors are continuing to explore the Central Asian area, which they believe holds both oil and gas.

title: 3 Drown in Pennsylvania
description: COSTELLO, Pa. Nov. 28, (UPI)Three children visiting their grandparents for the Thanksgiving holiday drowned today when they walked out on an abandoned, icecovered gravel pit near here and the ice gave way. The state police identified the victims as Stacy Bauman, 7 years bid; her sister, Jody, 5, and their brother, Harry, 3, children of Mr. and Mrs. Harry Bauman Sr. of Lock Haven, Pa.

description: VINKOVCI, Yugoslavia, Nov. 28 (AP)  An express train bound from Belgrade to the Adriatic port of Split struck a freight train today near this town in Croatia. An assistant engineer and 15 passengers were injured, the police reported.

description: NEWARK, Calif., Nov. 28 (UPI)  Raymond A. DeGroat, a 48yearold teacher who permitted a visiting poet to recite spicy poetry before 350 pupils in five English classes, has been dismissed by the Newark High School. The poet Mr. DeGroat had invited to the classes was identified only as Poet John.

description: ATHENS, Nov. 28 (Renters), Archbishop Makarios of Cypros arrives here tomorrow for talks with the Greek Government on the Cyprus issue, before his first return to the island since last summer, when he was ousted as President in an abortive coup.

description: The Brooklyn District Attorney Eugene Gold, has decided to join an investigation into conflictofintetest allegations against Joseph Monserrat, a member of the Board of Education, actording to aides of Mr. Gold.

title: Inventive Medleys In Shapeless Show By Fifth Dimension
description: The Fifth Dimension is a black quintet that has enjoyed a good deal of popularity chewing up hits from all fields of pop music and presenting them for the delectation of toothless middleoftheroad audiences. Actually, the group's arrangements have often been cleverly inventive, capitalizing on the blend of three men's anti two women's voices, and those arrangements still sounded effective enough Wednesday night, when the group opened a two week stand at the Uris Theater.

title: Man With an Arrest Record Found Slain in Garage Here
description: A 35yearold man with a record of arrests was found shot to death early yesterday in the basement garage of the apartment house where he lived, at 6145 98th Street, Rego Park, Queens.

description: TEL AVIV, Friday, Nov. 29, (Reuters) Israeli forces killed five Arab guerrillas in a clash in northern Galilee near the Lebanese border, an army spokesman announced today.

title: Broncos Send Lions to 3127 Setback
description: DETROIT, Nov. 28 (UPI) Trick plays set up three thirdquarter touchdowns today and lifted the Denver Broncos to a 3127 National Football League victory over the Detroit Lions that virtually destroyed Detroit's playoff hopes. The loss was only the second in the last eight games for the Lions but dropped their wonlost record to 66.

title: Cabinet Is Realigned in South Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 28The Cabinet of South Vietnam was realigned today with the addition of littleknown members while teenage Roman Catholic demonstrators clashed fitfully with the police.

description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Nov. 28 (AP)Brazil has contracted to supply China with up to 200,000 tons of raw sugar until 1980, starting next year, the Brazilian Sugar and Alcohol Institute reported. Brazilian sugar officials predict that record international sugar prices will bring Brazil $1billion in export revenues.

title: Kit Carson 3d Dies

title: Remembering Winston
description: The tributes, whether in print or on screen, bring it all back with a rush: that voice, rolling, volleying, thundering, drawing richly on the richest language of all, hurling defiance at Hitler and the Naahzis, summoning his countrymen from defeat and despair to their finest hour, lifting around the world the hearts of free men and those struggling to be free.

title: Reuss Asks Heroic Bids By All Nations to Save Oil
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29A leading Congressional expert on world financial issues warned today that Congress would not approve the KissingerSimon plan for a new $25billion international oilfinancing facility unless heroic measures of oil conservation were in place and operating in other industrial countries as well as in the United States.

title: Bank to Buy Exxon Share Of Spanish Oil Company
description: MADRID, Nov. 29 (Renters)  Banco Espanol de Credito will buy the entire private stock that the Exxon Corporation owns in Esso Petroleos Espanoles, S.A., before the end of 1974, a bank spokesman said today. Exxon owns 40 per cent and the bank holds the remaining 60 per cent, he added.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: The Niagara Mohawk Power Corporation yesterday filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission 3 million common shares for sale through underwriters headed by Merrill Lynch and Salomon Brothers. The utility will use proceeds of the sale to reduce short term debt.

title: Business Briefs
description: The Federal Government is arranging to give the Penn Central Railroad up to another $30million so that it can continue providing passengers and shippers essential service, a spokesman for the United States Railway Association reported yesterday.

title: I.C.I. Profit Sets Record
Hospital Abandons Plans For Center in New Yorker
description: The FrenchPolyclinic Medical School and Health Center has disclosed that it has abandoned its plan to convert the 2,000room New Yorker Hotel into a medical center and that the building has been put up for sale again.

title: Eight Trains on L.I.R.R. Delayed by Bomb Scare
Mediator Is Chosen To Aid Negotiations At State's Colleges
description: UNION, Nov. 29 (UPI)A spokesman for teachers at eight state colleges, who plan to return to work next week following a 10day strike, said today that a Federal mediator had been chosen and would begin negotiations between teachers and state officials next week.

title: Rabin Dubious on U.S.Soviet Formula
Events Today
Bridge:
Antiques: Twain's Taste
Bridge Revenue Off, Pay Up
description: NEW CASTLE, Del., Nov. 29 (UPI)Despite a drop in toll revenues from bridges, the Delaware River and Bay Authority said today that it had increased its employes pay by 10 per cent. It also promised no rise in tolls and a decrease in operating costs in 1975.

title: BUSINESS LOANS INCREASE SHARPLY

description: BURLINGTON, Vt., Nov. 29 (AP)  Prof. Elmer L. Gaden Jr., of Columbia University's School of Engineering and Applied Science, has been named dean of the College of Engineering, Mathematics and Business Administration at the University of Vermont.

title: Dg. Kenneth M. Lynch, 87, ExHead of Medical School
description: SUMMERVILLE, S.C., Nov. 29 (AP)  Dr. Kenneth M. Lynch, chancellor and former president of the Medical Unitersity of South Carolina, died today at his home. He was 87 years old.

In Puerto Rico, Live and Let Live
Lure of Government Jobs Rises With Recession Here
description: A sluggish economy and rising unemployment have added new luster to job markets in which recruiters as recently as a few months ago were having a hard time drawing all the applicants they wantedthe Civil Service and the armed forces.

title: Alumni Magazines Seek More Readers
WINE TALK
description: The wine enthusiast has a decided advantage over his philistine friends when it comes to holiday gifts. The possibilities for interesting presents are almost endless. They range from the hokey appurtenances that some people feel are a part of wine drinking, to the wine itself, which, in the tong run, is the best gift of all.

title: The CheckUp on Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29The confidentiality of the medical records of former President Richard M. Nixon placed in doubt today the method by which the panel of three doctors determined Mr. Nixon's inability to appear at the Watergate cover  up trial now. The doctors, whom Judge John J. Sirica appointed to examine Mr. Nixon, made an explicit point of protecting the confidentiality of his medical records when they reported that he was not well enough to testify at the trial, even in a

title: Ethiopia Shifts Women Relatives Of Selassie to Army Compound
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Nov. 29Female relatives of deposed Emperor Haile Selassie were moved from a small palace today into a military compound, witnesses said.

title: BONN AND MOSCOW EASE BERLIN ISSUE
Mother Gets Temporary Custody of 2 in Dispute
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 29 (AP)A Collingswood, N. J., mother charged with taking her 6yearold daughter away from foster parents here last week was given temporary custody of the girl today in Family Court here.

title: Coretta King to March For Basing in Boston
description: BOSTON, Nov. 29 (UPI)Coretta Scott King, widow of the assassinated civil rights leader the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., said today that she would participate in a rally and march tomorrow to show support for a Federal order to bus 18,000 students to desegregate the city's schools.

title: ARSHALUYS SAROYAN
description: MOSCOW. Nov. 29 (UPI)Arshaluys Saroyan, an Armenian poet and writer, has died at the age of 51, the Armenian newspaper Kommunist said today.

title: Santas Told: Heavy on the Jolly, Light on Ho, Ho, Ho!
description: Don't eat garlic, onions or heavily spiced food. Don't smoke, eat or drink on duty. Don't overdo the Ho ho, ho! bit . Be jolly with taste.

title: India's Perennially Dominant Party Is Divided by the Challenge of Anticorruption Leader
Thursday's Fight
description: By The Associated Press

title: OutofState Subscription Ended by Jersey Lottery
description: GLEN RIDGE, Nov. 29 (AP)  Outofstate subscriptions to the New Jersey lottery will be abolished Monday, its director said in a ratio interview broadcast today.

title: Basketball Tonight
description: AT GARDEN, 8 P.M.

title: Strike of U.N. Geneva Staff Backs Financial Demands
description: GENEVA, Nov. 29Most of the 7,000 staff members of the United Nations and its specialized agencies here staged a half day strike this morning in support of their pension and wage demands.

title: Regents Meet Last Time With Reagan a Member
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif. Nov. 29 Gov. Ronald, Reagan recently made his last appearante here as a member of the University of California's goyerning Board of Regents and said the school had not been hurt in any way during his eight years in office.

title: Mideast Nation Purchases 14.6% of Mercedes Maker
27BILLION INVESTED BY OIL COUNTRIES
description: GENEVA, Nov. 29 (UPI)Arab and other oil producing nations have invested $27billion of their surplus funds in the United States, Britain and Western Europe in the first nine months of this year, an international monetary conference was told today.

title: Charles Barron Otis Dies; American Banker Publisher
description: Charles Barron Otis, publisher of The American Banker, died Thursday in Bay Shore, L.I., where he made his home at 5 Country Road. He was 68 years old.

title: Vocational Schools And Job Promises Drawing Protests
description: Lured by television ads, or ads in matchbooks, on subway placards or in newspapers and magazines, more than two million people each year enroll in private vocational schools that seem to be the means to better jobs and higher pay in fields like tractor  trailer driving, computer programing and plant security.

title: Sports Today
description: Columbia at C.C.N.Y., 8 P.M. (Radio  WKCR, 7:45 P.M.) New York Tech at L.I.U., 8 P.M.; Marist at Iona, 8 P.M. Wayne State at St. John's, 8:30 P.M. (Radio  WGBB, 8:20 P.M.)

title: CONRAD G. M'COWN
description: Conrad Grove McCown, a partner in the Philadelphia law firm of Pepper, Hamilton & Scheetz, died Thursday of cancer at his home in Rosemont, Pa. His age was 53.

title: NoSmoking Bill Passed
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 29 (UPI)The City Council unanimously passed today a bill banning smoking in elevators, but could not decide whether to extend the restriction to food markets, theaters, hospitals and public meetings. The elevator bill must be signed by Mayor Tom Bradley and go through a 30day waiting period before becoming law. Smokers who defy the ban are subject to a $500 fine and six months in jail.

title: CUTS CALLED BLOW TO CITY HOSPITALS
description: The city's 19 municipal hospitals stand to lose at least $35million a year under President Ford's austerity plan, which would reduce Federal aid in Medicare and Medicaid, deepening the city's already critical financial situation, the president of the Health and Hospitals Corporation said yesterday.

title: Doctors' View on Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29Following are the texts of a letter and a report of a panel of physicians appointed by Federal District Judge John J. Sirica to determine whether former President Richard M. Nixon is physically able to testify in the Watergate coverup trial:

title: KUH AGAIN SCORES COURT CASE DELAY
description: The conflict between District Attorney Richard H. Kuh of Manhattan and Justice Burton B. Roberts of the State Supreme Court over .how to resolve a pending criminal case erupted again yesterday as Mr. Kuh renewed his attack on the judge.

Linda Smith Wins College Pace
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Nov. 29 Linda Smith, a resident of Great River, L. I, and a college student at Stony Brook, L. I., gave a fine exhibition of driving at Roosevelt Raceway tonight. Competing in the first CanadianAmerican college student driving championship, Miss Smith guided Nightly Soott to a smashing triumph in the onemile pace.

description: TORONTO (NHL)Recalled Clair Alexander, defenseman, from Oklahoma City in Central League.
