Food Stamp Program Is Delayed In Hiring by City's Lack of Cash
description: The food stamp program here has encountered delays in its effort to hire 65 employes with Federal money because of a shortage of ready cash in the city's budget, a spokesman for the program said yesterday.

title: Sports Today
The Pleasures of Fine Dining Are Still There in Singapore
description: SINGAPORE  Most legends die hard. Singapore is a place of such beauty and good will it is difficult to reconcile it with that yeasty, adolescent, long  fancied image of a city with dark alleys and dark shadows, opium, silk brocade, heavy breathing and a lusty traffic in human bodies.

title: A Pedestrian Mall Along Mulberry St. Is Opening Today
description: A threeblock stretch of Mulberry Street from Canal Street north to Broome Street will be closed to vehicular traffic from noon to midnight today and tomorrow and every weekend thereafter as the first step toward the creation of a pedestrian mall in what is commonly known as Little Italy.

title: To Father Bob and the Hawks, Tomorrow's Bowl Is Biggest
description: FARMINGDALE, L. I., Nov. 29Thirteenyearold Alfred Mininni, a 124pound middle linebacker who plays with the Farmingdale Hawks, was in trouble with his coaches even, before this afternoon's practice began. The 35boy squad had just run laps in its regular predrill routine.

title: A Hijacker's Notes Studied In Inquiry on Police Graft
description: JERSEY CITY  A former policeman turned hijacker who was shot to death last July left a notebook whose contents law enforcement officials are studying for leads in an investigation of possible police corruption here.

title: City Studying Whether Tenants Should Pay Share of Fuel Costs
description: Top officials of the Beame administration have undertaken a study to determine whether part of the landlords' fuelcost increases this winter should be passed along to tenants in possibly hundreds of thousands of apartments here, the city's top housing official Roger Starr, said yesterday.

title: Dublin May be Metropolis, but Pull of Rural Life Remains Strong
Post Offices to Bar Photos of Presidents
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29The Postal Service has ordered an end to the traditional display of photographs of Presidents and Postmasters General in the lobbies of the 40,000 post offices in the country.

title: Television
PIONEER SCANS SITE FOR JOVIAN MISSION
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif., Nov. 29 (UPI)Speeding closer to Jupiter, Pioneer 11 searched today for a possible landing place for an astronaut.

title: People in Sports
description: In what was believed to be the first sale of a National Hockey League player to a rival World Hockey Association team, Butch Deadmarsh of the Kansas City Scouts of the N.H.L. was sold yesterday to the Vancouver Blazers of the W.H.A.

title: JOSEPH W. HAWLEY
description: Joseph Wayne Hawley, vice dean of the New York University Law School, died Thursday at his summer home in Carmel, N. Y. He was 56 years old and lived at 33 Washington Square West.

title: Records for I.C.I.
description: Imperial Chemical Industries, Ltd., one of the world's largest chemical enterprises, reported yesterday record sales and earnings for the third quarter and first nine months of this year Details on Page 46.

title: Alison Bowen Becomes Bride
description: Alison Hayward Bowen, a research technician at the State University College at Albany, was married yesterday afternoon in Philadelphia to David Arthur Leopold, president of Audio Design, a high  fidelity business in Pittsfield, Mass. Both are graduates of Bennington College, and they will use BowenLeopold as their surname.

title: Southwestern Bell Faces New Inquiries on Operations
IRON TAKEN OVER BY MAURITANIA
U.C.L.A. Wins Opener
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 29 (UPI)Ralph Drollinger, taking over for the graduated Bill Walton scored 21 points tonight as U.C.L.A. posted an 8574 seasonopening basketball victory over Wichita State. Drollinger hit 8 of 11 shots from the floor and had 17 rebounds.

title: SNOWY WINTER WAITED BY CITY
description: In his large corner office with a small attached bedroom at Sanitation Department headquarters, 125 Worth Street, Commissioner Robert T. Groh looked over meteorological reports yesterday predicting, heavy snow this winter.

title: Braddock, Who Beat Baer for Title, Dies
description: NORTH BERGEN, N. J., Nov. 29 (AP)James J. Braddock, who won the world heavyweight championship in 1935 by outpointing Max Baer in one of boxing's biggest upsets, died today at his home here. He was 68 years old.

title: Pop Music: Elton John at the Garden
description: Elton John, perhaps the most successful individual figure of nineteenseventies rock n roll, charmed a capacity audience Thursday night at Madison Square Garden with a smoothly paced, professionally performed and produced showthe first of four in this area. But John Lennon's appearance onstage to sing three songs had the effect of putting the rest of the show in perspective.

title: Record $8.8Billion Gained in '73 Taxes On Alcohol Drinks
J. R. Ackerman Weds Dana Lowenthal
description: Dana Kay Lowenthal was married here yesterday noon to Jack Rossin Ackerman, a senior vice president of Bache & Co. and its underwriting affiliate, Halsey, Stuart & Co. Rabbi S. Michael Gelber performed the ceremony in the bridegroom's apartment.

title: U.N. Extends Term of Golan Heights Buffer Force
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 29The Security Council today renewed for six months the mandate for the United Nations force, serving as a buffer between Israeli and Syrian troops in the Golan Heights.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: District Attorney Eugene Gold of Brooklyn announced the indictmemnts of 15 persons, including an assistant counselor at a methadone clinic, on charges involving the illegal sale of heroin, cocaine and methadone. Mr. Gold said that Kathleen Fowler, 27 years old, of 2163 Brown Street, Brooklyn, a counselor at St. Mary's Hospital Methadone Center, at 229 Powell Street, in the East New York section, was among the defendants arrested after an investigation conducted by police and Mr. Gold's narcotics squad.

title: Last of $27Million In Debts to Be Paid By U. of Pittsburgh
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 29The University of Pittsburgh, which faced a financial crisis in the midnineteensixties, has accumulated enough funds to pay off $27.7million in debts.

title: COMPANIES OFFER ARAMCO TO SAUDIS
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia, Nov. 29The American partners in the Arabian American Oil Company, the world's largest producer, have made what Saudi officials call a serious offer to sell complete ownership to the national oil company here.

title: Pro Transactions HOCKEY
description: TORONTO (NHL)Recalled Clair Alexander, defenseman, from Oklahoma City In Central League.

title: Deaths
Rome Meeting Plans Urgent Food Aid
description: ROME, Nov. 29The United States and other major grainexporting countries met here today with hardhit grainimporting countries and drew up some outlines for an emergency foodaid plan.

title: Taming the F.B.I.
description: A fairly stiff exchange between Attorney General William B. Saxbe and Federal Bureau of Investigation Director Clarence M. Kelley a few days ago demonstrated that the ghost of J. Edgar Hoover had not yet been completely exorcised from the halls of justice in Washington, D. C. The disagreement between the two officials surfaced when they commented on a report prepared jointly by the F.B.I. and the Department of Justice on a counterintelligence program which the F.B.I. conducted from 1956 to 1971.

title: British Enact Laws To Outlaw the I.R.A. And Bolster Police
description: LONDON, Nov. 29Legislation outlawing the Irish Republican Army and giving the police unprecedented power to fight terrorism in Britain became law today.

title: Mideast Nation Purchases 14.6% of Mercedes Maker
description: BONN, Nov. 29A Middle or for how much. Eastern oilproducing country, probably Iran, has acquired a substantial amount of the shares of the prosperous DaimlerBenz Company of West Germany, manufacturer of Mercedes  Benz automobiles and trucks.

title: News Summary and Index
$60MILLION ISSUE SLATED IN FRANCE
description: PARIS, Nov. 29French savers are being asked to put 275 million francs or the equivalent of $60million into steel industry bonds with a floating rate in a fresh effort to stimulate the moribund French capital market.

title: Overstretched Budget
description: The double problem of inflationswollen expenses and recessionshrunk revenues is forcing drastic budget economies in every major city, a survey by The Times discloses. But the same survey underscores how disproportionately hard hit New York City is by the fallout from this nationwide economic squeeze.

title: Penn Five Wins
description: CLEMSON, S. C., Nov. 29 (AP)  Pennsylvania scored 14 consecutive points in the early going and went on to rout Middle Tennessee, 10174, tonight in the opening round of a twoday holiday basketball tournament at Clemson University.

title: PRESIDENT PLANS A VISIT TO CHINA IN 2D HALF OF 75
description: TOKYO, Saturday, Nov. 30President Ford will visit China next year, it was announced here early today after Secretary of State Kissinger arrived from Shanghai.

description: DACCA, Bangladesh, Nov. 29 (UPI)A cyclone that swept in from the Bay of Bengal yesterday and hit the coast of Bangladesh may not have caused nearly as much damage and loss of life as originally feared, Government officials said today.

title: Market Summit, Urged by Paris, Accepted by Bonn and London
West German Ports Bar Icelandic Fishing Boats
description: BONN, Nov. 29 (Reuters) Icelandic fishing boats have been banned from landing fish at West German coastal ports in retaliation for the seizure of a West German trawler off Iceland last Monday, the Mayor of Bremen said today.

description: ANKARA, Turkey, Nov. 29Premier Sadi Irmak resigned today after only 12 days in office following his Government's defeat in a vote of confidence in Parliament.

title: Ford Gives Full Pardons To 8 Convicted War Foes
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29President Ford granted full pardons today to eight civilians convicted for their resistance to the Vietnam war and gave conditional clemency to 10 others who will receive full pardons after completing periods of alternative service ranging from three months to one year.

description: HIRAKATA, Japan. Nov. 29 (UPI)Chris Evert lost only two games ia defeating. Rosie Casals today but John Newcombe stood within 2 points of defeat against Cliff Drysdale in the finals of their divisions of the $100,000 Gunze open tennis tournament.

description: Mary Elilabeth Biggs was married yesterday evening to John Maury Allin Jr., assistant director of admissions at the University ;or the South in Sewanee, Tenn.

Commander Cody and His Men Reaffirm Status as a Cult Band
description: Commander Cody and his Lost Planet Airmen seem to be a cult band wherever they go. They came together at the University of Michigan and were a cult band there. Then they moved to Berkeley and were a cult band there. And Thursday night they appeared for two shows at the Academy of Music and reaffirmed their status as a cult band especially appealing to punks. Which merely proves that punks recognize class when they see it like everybody else.

title: ExChief Judge Chosen To Be Irish President
description: DUBLIN, Nov. 29 (Reuters) Ireland's three main political parties announced tonight they had unanimously approved former Chief Justice Cearbhaill O'Dalaigh as the republic's new President.

title: Art: Cubist Thoughtin Sculpture
description: Not every one of the 50 works included in the Masters of Modern Sculpture exhibition at the Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum, Fifth Avenue at 88th Street, can be said to belong to the sculpture of cubismworks as different as Maillol's and Yves Klem's lie firmly outsaid the parameters of the cubist ethetic  but the show as a whole is an interesting survey of the influence of cubism on modern sculptural thought.

title: LOTTERY NUMBERS
Four From Ohio Die in Plane
description: ERIE, Pa., Nov. 29 (UPI)  A small airplane crashed in snowy weather into a wooded area last night just after it took off, killing all four persons aboard. The State Police identified the victims as Lawrence A. Gloekler, 27 years old, the pilot, and his brother, Robert, 20, both of Asbtabula, Ohio; Kathy A. Dean, 17 of Conneaut, Ohio; and Debra Young of Kent, Ohio.

title: Blow at Gambling Reported With Westchester Arrests
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., Nov. 29 (UPI)  The Westchester County police announced today that a $6millionayear, countywide gambling operation had been broken up with the arrest of two New Rochelle men and a resident of Valhalla.

title: Airport Aides Skeptical About Amin's Charges
description: PARIS, Nov. 29 (Reuters)  Officials at Orly Airport expressed doubts today that Elizabeth Bagaya, dismissed as Uganda's Foreign Minister, could have made love in an airport restroom.

title: NBCTV Yields to Homosexuals Over Episode of Police Woman

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29Department of Agriculture officials said today that there was much less American grain available for food aid to hungry nations than they estimated in September.

description: SAIGON, South VietnamThe urbanization of Vietnamese society is proving to be one of the most durable products of the American involvement in the Vietnam war, and one that contains acute political and economic liabilities for the South Vietnamese Government.

title: Bowl Victory To Pace, 2012
description: MOUNT VERNON, Nov. 29Pace University defeated St. John's, 2012, in the Metropolitan Bowl tonight, led by its swift little running back, Bob Pasquale, who rushed for 128 yards. St. John's threatened near the end of the game but a pass interception by Allan Robinson with 48 seconds remaining assured the victory for Pace.

title: No Profit for Chargers in 1974
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 29 (AP)In a notice to stockholders, Eugene Klein, owner of the San Diego Chargers, revealed that no profit would be made by the National Football League team in 1974. The exhibition games lost about $500,000 as a principal result of the players' strike, Klein said, and our attendance reflects the 10 per cent unemployment factor in the San Diego area.

title: 100 Volunteer Mounties Ride Herd on Park Crime
Mitchell Absent From Trial To Testify in Another Case
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (AP)  Former Attorney General John N. Mitchell took time out today from his Watergate coverup defense to testify for the Government in a narcotics conspiracy case.

title: 3 Designrs, One Objective: Avboid Cliches
description: She's as American as apple pie, but Adri, the fashion designer, sometimes wonders whether she oughtn't to be plying her trade in Paris.

description: A threeblock stretch of Mulberry Street from Canal Street north to Broome Street will be closed to vehicular traffic from noon to midnight today and tomorrow and every weekend thereafter as the first step toward the creation of a pedestrian mail in what is commonly known as Little Italy.

title: Woman Survives After 44 Hours In Wrecked Auto
description: A 19yearold Hartford woman who survived two subfreezing nights alone in the wreckage of her car, which had plunged doWn a wooded embankment hidden from passing rural traffic, was recovering in a hospital yesterday and reported to be in stable condition.

description: SAN BRUNO, Calif., Nov. 29 (AP)Five sheriff's deputies who ate Thanksgiving dinner at the San Francisco County Jail here were given stomach tranquilizers after a prison cook inadvertently used an industrial cleaner to season the turkey gravy.

description: Charles Aikin, who had been chairman of the political science department at the University of California, Berkeley, and had been on the teaching staff for more than four decades, died last Sunday in Berkeley after a long illness. He was 73 years old.

title: The Greatest Hatred in Human History
Understretched Unions
description: The measure of the Mayor's failure thus far to impart to the civil service unions any sense of either urgency or credibility about the need for belttightening is the strike threat  now deferred until next week  by the city's civilian firealarm dispatchers. Not content with assurance that they would get the 8 per cent pay increase the city has established as a pattern for this year, they insist on being brought up to parity with uniformed firefighters  at onethird more pay than they now receive.

title: Texas Wins
Bengal Equipment Sacked by Vandals
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 29 (AP) Vandals broke into the locker rooms and offices of the Cincinnati Bengals practice field building yesterday and ransacked the place, the team reported today.

title: 58 Injured in Ulster As Bombs Explode In Bars in 2 Towns
SINGAPORE CONVICTS THREE OVER ARTICLE
description: SINGAPORE, Nov. 29 (AP)Pang Cheng Lian, the parttime correspondent here for the American magazine Newsweek, was found guilty of contempt of court by the High Court today.

title: Agency Head Resigns
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (AP)  William S. Whitehead resigned today as a member and chairman of the Renegotiation Board, and President Ford named Rex M. Mattingly as acting chairman In accepting Mr. Whitehead's resignation, effective Sunday, Mr. Ford expressed sincere thanks and deep appreciation for your years of service to our nation.

title: REBUKED BY FORD, BUTZ APOLOGIZES
Sports News Briefs
description: National Basketball Association fans apparently are in love with Bob Love, Kareem AbdulJabbar and Dave Cowens. Love, Chicago's high scorer last season, has yet to play a game with the Bulls this season because of a contract dispute but he is third in fan balloting for a starting forward berth on the Western Conference team for the N.B.A. AllStar game at Phoenix next Jan. 14.

title: LIVELY SONGS BUILD NEW DONOVAN IMAGE
description: Donovan, one of the poets of the flower children a few years back, has not gone to seed. In his concert at Avery Fisher Hall on Thursdayhis first here in more than two yearsthe singer and composer was backed by a controlled electric quartet and dwarfed by a large scenic backdrop designed to illustrate various Donovan compositions. Long gone was the Donovan who sat crosslegged on stage, in white robe, serene and quiet.

title: News Summary and Index
Nuptials Are Held For Julle Kristeller
description: Julie Kristeller, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George Kristeller of Durham, N. C., was married yesterday morning to Miehael Antin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Antin of New York. The nondenominational ceremony was performed in the Abbey Memorial Chapel at Mount Holyoke College by the Rev. J. W. Fiegenbaum, professor of religion at Mount Holyoke, where the bride is a student.

title: People and Business
description: Inflation, not depression, remains the main economic problem, according to John Kenneth Galbraith, the Harvard economist. The cause of inflation, he said, lies in a breakdown of the class saystem and the consequent aspiration of the poor to consume as much as the rich.

title: Carey Beats Division for Island Title
description: BROOKVILLE, L.I., Nov. 29Carey High School's defense, which had shut out seven consecutive opponents, came up with its biggest play of the season today when it stopped Levittown Division in the closing moments of a 127 victory in the Nassau County Conference 56 playoff game at C.W. Post. Earlier, Port Washington and Wantagh battled to an 88 tie and a share of the conference 34 crown.

title: The Frustrated Voter
description: A recent Times editorial critical of the 62 per cent of the electorate who failed to vote in the recent midterm election has provoked a strong reaction from some readers who protest that frustration, not apathy, is turning Americans away from the polls. They argue that nonvoting is a legitimate form of protest against slates of candidates that offer no attractive choices. Besides, many letterwriters aver, one vote doesn't make any difference in races which have already been predetermined by public opinion polls.

title: NATION'S MUSEUMS CUTTING SERVICES
description: The major problem The Brooklyn Museum is currently having is not in acquiring new works but in acquiring coal, which has risen in cost from $35 a ton to $75 a ton.

title: Canadian Stewardess Hurt As Man Tries to Hijack Jet
description: SASKATOON, Sask., Nov. 29 (UPI)A man with a knife forced a Canadian Pacific Airlines 737 jetliner to land here today after wounding a stewardess and demanding to be taken to a foreign country.

title: Christmas Retail Picture Is Clouded
Top Pacer, Jug Victor, Is Stolen
description: In a bizarre case with grisly overtones reminiscent of The Godfather, a $500,000 harness horse was stolen yesterday from his stall at an Ohio breeding farm.

title: New Election Set for Jan. 7 In Louisiana Congress Race
Lure of Government Jobs Rises With Recession Here
CHARLES RADICE, 83, A DEVELOPER HERE
description: Charles Radice, who retired in 1972 as chairman of the Radice Realty and Construction Corporation, developers of apartment and commercial properties here and in Florida, died Thursday in Fort Lauderdale, Fla, where he lived.

title: Berlin court Sentences Woman Said to Lead Urban Terrorists
description: BERLIN, Nov. 29The woman who was considered the ringleader of a group of German urban guerrillas was sentenced today to eight years in prison by a West Berlin court for her role in helping another terrorist escape from jail four and onehalf years ago.

title: Anker Orders Inquiry Into a 2d Conflict Cage
SUGAR FUTURES DROP THE LIMIT
Phelps Dodge to Halt Mining At Its Lavender Facility
description: The Phelps Dodge Corporation annouced yesterday that because of falling copper prices and rising costs, it would halt copper mining and concentrating operations at its Lavender pit in Arizona beginning Dec. 14.

title: Radio
Store Sales Increase
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales in the latest week totaled an estimated $1.32billion, up 7 per cent from the year earlier $1.23billion. Total retail store sales were about $10.46billion, up 7 per cent from last year's $9.73billion.

title: Letters to the Editor
Dave Anderson
ALITALIA SETTING SHARP CUTBACK
GERALD WATLAND, 69, ARCHITECT, IS DEAD
Junior Assembly Is Held at Plaza
Blasts at Da Nang Air Base Kill 8 and Injure 100
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 29 (AP)  Explosions ripped through a large ammunition dump at the Da Nang air base toddy, killing at least eight students and injuring more than 100 civilians, reports from the base said.

title: Glory of ArmyNavy Game Fades, but Pride, Tradition Remain
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 29President Ford is one of about 85,000 persons who are expected to attend the 75th ArmyNavy football game in John F. Kennedy Memorial Stadium tomorrow. If predictions of crowd size are realized, it will be the smallest attendance for the game since the 45th ArmyNavy contest was held in Baltimore Stadium in 1944.

title: Art: Mapping the Human Face
description: In terms of art, the Wall Street area is barren ground. Take away a piece or two of monumental sculpture, close down an enlightened lobby here and there, seal up the office of the chairman of the board, and what would there be? A desert. That is why the downtown branch of the Whitney Museum of American Art at 55 Water street has an importance out of all proportion to its size, which is modest, and its location, which is discreet to the point of invisibility. (It is, in fact, on the second floor of the Uris Building, which is unlikely to make, architectural history even in an area most notably disfavored in that respect.)

title: Proxmire Is Concerned
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (AP) The vice chairman of the SenateHouse Economic Commitee said today any further price increase by the steel industry in the near future would be unjustified.

title: Blazers Win, Gain W.F.L. Final
description: MEMPHIS, Nov. 29 (AP)Richard James ran 4 yards with 1 minute 13 seconds left to give the Florida Blazers an 1815 victory over the Memphis Southmen tonight. The victory put the Blazers in the World Football League's first World Bowl on Thursday against Birmingham.

title: Briefs on the Arts
Assembly in France Backs Abortion Bill After Bitter Debate
Eight Die in Alabama Crash
description: LEEDS, Ala., Nov. 29 (AP) Six men and two women, all of Talladega, were killed early yesteyday when their car smashed into a bridge on Interstate 20 here. The authorities identified the dead as Thomas J. Williams, 20 years old; Linton A. Eason, 22; Joey K. Smith, Lou Ann Otwell and Michael T. Miller, all 24; Hillman Cox and his wife, Mary H. Stewart Cox, 22, and Frederick D. McBrier, 27.

title: General Dynamics to Buy NaturalGas Tank Facility
description: To facilitate the delivery of a number of liquified naturalgas tanks it had ordered some time ago, the General Dynamics Corporation has agreed to buy the plant at Quincy, Mass where they are made by they PittsburghDes Moines Steel Corporation, it was announced yesterday.

title: Now Jersey Sports
description: PRINCETON, Nov. 29In field hockey, women have usually worn the cleats and carried the sticks. But at Princeton University, the tables may have turned as men have started taking up everything but the traditional jumper and knee socks.

title: Health Minister Who Champions Abortion Bill Simone Jacob Veil
New Jersey Briefs
description: Fineral services were held for four members of the John Macaluso family of Wharton, who died Tuesday when carbonmonoxide fumes from a running automobile seeped into their home from a basement garage. The Rev. Thomas J. Boyle, pastor of St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church, was principal celebrant of a Mass of the Resurrection for Mr. Macaluso, 54 years old; his wife Frances, 46, and two sons, John Jr., 16, and Joseph, 11.

title: Ceremony in City Hall Marks Powell Birthday
description: City officials held a ceremony yesterday to mark the 66th anniversary of the birthof the late Adam Clayton Powell Jr., the Harlem Representative.

title: Stock Index Dips 0.63 in Slow Trading
